Open Position: Product Owner Reports to: Group Product Manager Location: Remote About Us HST Pathways is on a mission to transform healthcare with innovative software technology that enables surgery centers to provide more cost-efficient patient care and better outcomes. Our suite of solutions spans the entire case lifecycle, including scheduling, care coordination, clinical documentation, and revenue cycle. Backed by Bain Capital, we are the fastest growing ASC software company and serve over 1,600 clients, but we’re just getting started and have plans to 10X the value we offer. However, our big ambitions are only as strong as the team behind them, which is why we’re looking to build our team with the best. What we’re looking for: You are inspiring, authentic, intuitive, highly motivated, results-driven, and a fast learner. You want to work for a company with a positive work culture that is fast-paced and evolving. You believe that working for a diverse and inclusive organization is best and holds the values of One Team, Inclusion, Transparency, Agility, Empathy, Growth Mindset and Proactivity - and you’re ready to be an ambassador that exemplifies these qualities. You are data driven and comfortable with a high-volume workload (“roll up your sleeves” approach) and adept at dealing with a dynamic work setting. Responsibilities: The Product Owner is accountable for effective product backlog management, which includes: Managing and Prioritizing the backlog - Through managing the backlog and assisting the Product Manager in story refinement, a Product Owner not only prioritizes items according to business objectives and overall strategy but also ensures the delivered product is on time and meets customer expectations. They also consider the project dependencies that will affect the sequence of development while laying out the contents of future sprints. Communications - Product Owners must be the primary communicators between internal stakeholders and development teams. They should serve as liaisons between product and development. This ensures there is buy-in from the former group on all major decisions, giving clear instructions and priorities to the developers. Managing Software Development Life Cycle - product owner should spend a significant amount of time overseeing the actual development of the product. They are a key player throughout each event, including planning, refinement, review, and sprint. The Product Owner remains accountable for the work being accomplished and for the value delivered. They are a key partner with the Product Manager and other department leads and help to ensure development efforts are as efficient as possible. The Product Owner will work with all facets of the organization and is an important player in the ultimate success of each release. At a high level the product owner acts as an assistant to the Product Manager with most of their focus on being a Product Owner while advancing their skills in Product Management and Product Strategy. Become immersed in the company’s existing Agile software development. Translating product managers’ strategies to tasks for development - ensuring epics created by the product manager are appropriately broken down to user stories for development. Coordinate with the engineering department to deliver functional solutions. Consistently and explicitly communicate the Product Goal. Creating and clearly communicating Product Backlog Items and ordering Product Backlog Items. Managing sprints in alignment with established goals and backlog prioritizations. Assist with monitoring and reporting on users’ feedback after launching. Gather product data, including key statistics and user trends. Prioritize the implementation of new features, resolving bugs, manage expectations of timelines and evaluate progress at each stage of development. Alongside the Product Manager understands and anticipates the client’s needs to manage the development process more effectively. Assist with the creation of Support and Training documents for internal and external users. Qualifications: Exceptional work ethic and strong time management skills Excellent communication skills and capable of effectively collaborating with cross functional teams. Ability to build and maintain strong customer relationships. Experience in gathering and interpreting qualitative product data and consumer feedback. Hands-on experience with web technologies. BS in Business, Nursing, Technology, Marketing, or similar field. Working knowledge in project/product management tools such as: JIRA Rally Pendo Scrum Certification and Pragmatic Product Marketing Methodology exposure preferred but not required. Behaviors: You are scrappy and driven: you can take an ambiguous problem, roll up your sleeves and get the job done. Talk is cheap! You love to get things done! You’re a strong communicator: you know how to explain technical concepts to both technical & non-technical audiences. You appreciate the value of documentation & love sharing your knowledge with others. You are adaptable: you are a quick learner and love diving in to explore new opportunities. You can navigate both internal and external hurdles to deliver a great product. You are inquisitive: you are hungry to learn and are always asking the right questions. You are quantitative: you like numbers and being able to leverage numbers to bolster and justify your arguments and positions. Team Culture: We go beyond the expected. We strive to be the difference in everything we do and look for ways to innovate and deliver beyond expectations. We thrive through collaboration. We invest in our team and take pride in the success of others. We strive to make a positive impact. We are passionate about our work and leverage our collective creativity and industriousness to make big things happen We sharpen and share our expertise. We aspire to learn, grow, and share knowledge. We love the journey. We never lose sight of the fact that we’re contributing to building a new model of healthcare delivery. Perks & Benefits: Remote work environment Health benefits paid for employee Flexible Paid Time Off Policy 11 company holidays per year Paid parental leave 401K with matching contributions Learning and development allowance A diverse, inclusive, and fun team! HST Pathways celebrates diversity and is steadfast in fostering an inclusive work environment where employees feel valued, respected, and engaged. We champion and nurture a culture where inclusiveness is instinctive and fuels innovation, connection, and a strong sense of “One Team”. HST is deeply committed to representing and reflecting the unique experiences, perspectives and viewpoints of our employees, customers, and the communities we serve. QaOrqxBOHf

Remote: New Orleans, LA 70130 (Central Business District area)
column7: About Us: We live at the intersection of parking and technology. We pride ourselves on pushing the boundaries of what's possible and delivering exceptional value to our customers. As we continue to grow, we're seeking a Junior Product Manager to join our team and contribute to the success of our products. Responsibilities: Assist in Product Development: Collaborate with the product team in conceptualizing and developing new products from ideation to launch. Market Research and Analysis: Conduct market research, competitor analysis, and customer surveys to gather insights for product enhancement and development. Feature Prioritization: Assist in prioritizing product features based on customer feedback, market trends, and business goals. Requirements Documentation: Create detailed product requirements documents (PRDs) outlining feature specifications, user stories, and acceptance criteria. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams to ensure successful product development and launch. User Testing and Feedback: Coordinate user testing sessions, gather feedback, and iterate on product improvements. Product Launch Support: Assist in creating go-to-market strategies, marketing materials, and product documentation for successful product launches. Performance Monitoring: Track product performance metrics, conduct data analysis, and generate reports to evaluate product success and identify areas for improvement. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies. Proven ability to work in a cross-functional team environment. Passion for technology and a keen interest in delivering solutions. Benefits: Competitive salary Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage 401(k) retirement plan Professional development opportunities and training programs Vibrant and collaborative work culture Join us in shaping the future of Parking and be part of a dynamic team dedicated to innovation and excellence

January AI:    Founded by veteran business executive, Noosheen Hashemi, and Director of Genomics and Personalized Medicine at Stanford University, Dr. Michael Snyder, January AI is the first “precision health” company that combines continuous glucose monitoring along with heart rate, sleep, activity and food tracking, to enable you to see the impact of your diet and exercise on your body in real-time.   We help you understand your personal metabolic health, i.e. how your body metabolizes food, and make simple changes to avoid serious health issues down the road. The need for this has never been greater: 1 in 3 adults in the US are now pre-diabetic, and 80% are not even aware of it. January’s app and continuous glucose monitor gives you immediate insights on your diet and blood sugar levels, and provides personalized recommendations on how to adjust your diet and activity to improve your overall metabolic wellbeing. We help you build better habits in just 30 days.   At January AI, we believe that every day is January 1st, that every day is a fresh start. We believe that health isn’t a place you reach, but the simple process of understanding your body and doing just a little better than yesterday.   January AI is backed by Marc Benioff (CEO and founder of Salesforce), Jerry Yang (founder of Yahoo), and Steve Chen (founder of YouTube), among others.   Recent coverage: STAT, TechCrunch, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, and VentureBeat.   Position Overview January AI is seeking a Product Manager to help us build products from concept through launch. You’ll own the January App, website and web purchase flow.   The ideal candidate enjoys working in a fast-paced environment building new to market products. You are innovative, and enjoy working with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to deliver product experiences. You are customer obsessed and look for feedback, both qualitative and quantitative, in order to better understand your customers. You enjoy building projects of large and small scale and can take small ideas and turn them into features that will delight customers. You are fluent in product strategy, roadmap planning, and agile development.  Roles and Responsibilities: Work closely with our Product Lead to spearhead the product roadmap for particular feature areas, collaborating with Engineering, Design, and Marketing to take the roadmap from concept to reality Partner with the engineering team to help find optimal technical implementation methods as well as reasonable implementation schedules for product releases Iterate on existing products based on customer feedback and user insights Serve as the voice of January’s customers, identifying customer needs and product features in partnership with Customer Success Identify market opportunities for January AI and define a product vision and strategy to capitalize on these opportunitiesQualifications: 1-3 years experience in product management, preferably working at high growth startups in the health space Scrum Master experience using Agile methodologies Prior consumer-facing product development experience, ideally with mobile Apps Demonstrated track record of success building, shipping, and iterating on high-value products in an agile software development environment Can understand complex business problems and craft effective strategies to tackle them Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Well organized with the ability to balance multiple concurrent priorities in a fast-paced and dynamic startup environment BS in Biology, Medicine, Computer Science, or another related technical discipline preferred   $90,000 - $150,000 a year     We'd love to hear from you!   January is an equal-opportunity employer.      We are a diverse team committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.   Our HQ office is in sunny and beautiful downtown Menlo Park, CA, within walking distance to Caltrain and local cafes and restaurants.   Our team collaborates in real-time during standard working hours Pacific Time.   Local or West Coast-based candidates are preferred.   Benefits and Perks of working Full-time at January include: Competitive salary and equity packages; 401k with corporate matching; Health, dental, vision, life and AD&D insurance; Commuter benefits.   Base salary will depend on skills, qualifications, experience, and location.   We do not accept third-party solicitation for employment.

IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 14 million students worldwide, is seeking strong analytical thinkers and creative problem solvers to join IXL's Associate Product Manager program. This role is designed to offer new grads the opportunity to engage deeply with multiple product areas and to help them develop robust skill-sets around product design and project management, while executing at a high level to ship features to millions of learners and educators. At IXL Learning, we are dedicated to creating first-of-their-kind products that leverage cutting-edge technologies to solve seemingly intractable problems in education. Millions of users count on us to make learning as effective as can be, so we're looking for exceptional people who are committed to solving the real-world challenges faced by students and teachers around the world. Product management at IXL starts with a passion for making a lasting impact on education. Team members take products from initial brainstorm to final launch and beyond, putting our users first in all that we do, and working collaboratively across many teams including Engineering, Visual Design, Marketing, and more! Our creative solutions, clean designs, and commitment to quality allow us to deliver effective, compelling products that tackle some of the biggest problems in education today. Launch your product management career at IXL with strong mentorship, executive visibility, and ample opportunities to learn and grow, while making your mark on a product that is beloved by teachers and learners. This is a full-time position in our San Mateo, CA office. #LI-TL1 WHAT YOU'LL BE DOINGDeeply understand and advocate for the needs of our student, teacher, and parent usersGather requirements and clarify goals for new projectsConsider user needs and product strategy to make feature design decisionsProduce clear written specifications for all feature functionality and user flowsCollaborate with visual designers to create innovative, clean user interfacesWork with engineers to align technical designs and decisions with product needsDo whatever it takes to develop features and deliver value to our usersWHAT WE'RE LOOKING FORBachelor's degree in STEM or a related fieldDemonstrated technical abilities; some coursework or experience in computer programming and web technologies is preferredHighly developed analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills, with proven success applying them independentlyStrong written and spoken communication skills, with an eye to clarity and concisenessStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work across teams to make things happenEnthusiasm for tackling tough problems independently, from assessing high-level goals through to perfecting every detailExceptionally organized self-starter, efficient and thrives under pressureCuriosity, open-mindedness, and an unfailingly positive attitudeInterest in design thinking; some coursework or experience in UI/UX design is helpfulInterest in K-12 education! Classroom/teaching experience is a plusWHAT TO INCLUDE IN YOUR APPLICATIONYour resumeA cover letter under 600 words, so that we can get to know you betterOur pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The base salary range for this full-time position is $95,000 - $120,000 + equity + benefits. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire pay for the position. Individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for your preferred location during the hiring process. ABOUT IXL LEARNING IXL Learning is the country's largest edtech company. We reach millions of learners through our diverse range of products. For example:1 in 4 students in the United States uses IXL.comRosetta Stone provides an immersive learning experience for 25 languagesWyzant is the nation's largest community of tutors, covering 300+ subjectsTeachers Pay Teachers (TPT) is a comprehensive marketplace for millions of educator-created resourcesOur mission is to create innovative products that will make a real, positive difference for learners and educators and we're looking for passionate, mission-minded people to join us in achieving this goal. We have a unique culture at IXL that fosters collaboration and the open exchange of ideas. We value our team and treat one another with kindness and respect. We approach our work with passion, tenacity, and authenticity. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions and we are eager to have you join our team. At IXL, we value diversity in age, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, political and religious beliefs, and life experience, and we are proud to promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. IXL Learning is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About User Interviews At User Interviews, we believe that the best companies in the world consistently deliver products and experiences that their customers love. We also believe that the only way to consistently build those products and experiences is to talk to your customers. Watch what they do. Understand why they do what they do. Figure out why they do things that seem irrational. And once you've done that once, do it again. Start having continuous customer conversations. In short, make customers your #1 priority through user research. That's why we exist. We help teams set up those conversations, that research, allowing them to discover and embrace user insights. We work with hundreds of companies every month, including user-centric organizations like Atlassian, Amazon, and Spotify. About The Role You will lead a cross-functional product squad focused on helping teams collaborate together in research. We believe that research is a team sport and this squad makes that collaboration possible. What is a product squad? Each squad is made up of a Product Manager (you), a Tech Lead, a Product Designer, an embedded Data Analyst, and 4+ engineers. Each squad owns an outcome and everything from the discovery of opportunities in that area through the delivery of solutions. Our baseline for this role is someone who is smart, self-motivated, and an awesome teammate (but specifics are below!). ResponsibilitiesLead the discovery to figure out what opportunities to prioritize for your squadShape those opportunities into a high-level solutions and hypothesesLead a cross-functional team to keep all relevant stakeholders up to speedMake the call on day-to-day prioritization and trade-off decisions in a way that balances user needs, product vision, and company goals.Track the performance of recently shipped items and report the key takeaways to the full team.Establish and maintain a high bar for the quality of work you oversee.✨ Who will be successful in this role?You have led efforts from initial ideation all the way to delivery.You enjoy switching back and forth between creative problem solving and analytical thinking.You are a clear and effective communicator that knows how to tailor your style to the audience.You are pragmatic and have a knack for navigating through ambiguity and uncertainty.You have an entrepreneurial spirit – you are always learning something new or tinkering on a project.You incorporate user feedback into all aspects of your work and use it to drive your thinking but supplement it with your own ideas as well.You are comfortable making decisions. You know when to seek consensus vs. when to make a call. You know when to prioritize speed vs. when to prioritize accuracy. Qualifications1-3 years in a Product Management roleExperience generating user insights, including user research and analyticsClear and effective communicator (written and verbal)Effective decision makerEnough technical understanding to have effective conversations with technical teammates to understand complexity, sizing, trade offs, etc BenefitsCompetitive Salary ($115k+)Annual Bonus100% premium covered medical + dental employee coverageAnnual membership to One Medical Group & Talkspace401k + employer contribution4 weeks of PTO to start + accrue an additional day per year of employmentUnlimited wellness days - Sick? Doctors appointment? Mental health day? We've got you covered.Flexible, paid parental leaveStock options for every employee$250 Office setup budget$50/month Work From Home stipendPerformance-based incentive plansAwards for 360-degree recognition, work anniversaries, & birthdays Why Join UsWe're a team of doers. You'll be fully supported by your manager and team, but there won't be anyone peering over your shoulder. You'll be expected and trusted to take ownership of your work, and to communicate clearly and transparently with your distributed teammates.User Interviews is a fully remote team and always has been. We are proactive about staying connected to each other despite not sharing the same physical space. Remote culture is real and we care about it—a lot.On a related note, we're very pro-feedback. From our users, of course. But also from each other. From individual contributors right up to the CEO, this is a team that is genuinely committed to continuous improvement.We embrace what makes you, you! We are committed to accessibility, equity, diversity, and inclusion. We build products for and welcome participants, researchers, and employees from a diverse set of backgrounds. These backgrounds include—but are not limited to—varied socioeconomic status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, race, ethnicity, age, neurodivergence, disability, and citizenship. As we grow, we are aware that this work is continuous. We will not settle for how things are, but rather strive for how they could be.

Summary    Description    Purpose of Role   As the Technical Product Owner, you will play a crucial role in shaping the future of our language access services application, Martti. We are looking for an individual with a strong technical background to guide the development of our platform, ensuring the flow of features, critical updates, and customer communications are delivered on schedule. While experience in Language Access Services is not mandatory, you will work closely with a team of experts in the field.   Core Responsibilities:      Product Vision: Collaborate with stakeholders and leadership to define and prioritize the product roadmap, aligning it with the company's strategic objectives.        Requirements Gathering: Collect, analyze, and document detailed requirements from various stakeholders, including customers, end-users, and internal teams.        Feature Prioritization: Make informed decisions on feature prioritization and trade-offs based on user needs, technical constraints, and business impact.        Product Development: Serve as a bridge between technical and non-technical teams, translating business requirements into technical specifications for the development team.        Sprint Planning: Work closely with development teams to plan and execute Agile development sprints, ensuring that features and critical updates are delivered on time.        Quality Assurance: Collaborate with QA teams to define testing criteria and ensure that product releases meet high-quality standards.        User Experience: Advocate for an exceptional user experience, considering usability and accessibility throughout the product development lifecycle.        Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies, providing insights and recommendations for innovation.        Communication: Maintain open and clear communication channels with all stakeholders and keep them informed of progress, changes, and potential roadblocks.    Professional Experience, Essential Skills, and Knowledge      Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical field (Computer Science, Engineering, etc.).        Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role, preferably in a Healthcare technology-driven environment.        Strong technical background, with a deep understanding of software development processes and principles.        Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.        Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions.        Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.      Nice to have, but not required      A passion for learning and staying current with industry trends and technologies.        Language Access Services experience is a plus but not required.        SAFe Agile Certification such as SSM, POPM, or CSM with CSPO is highly desired.    UpHealth Core Values      Accountability        Integrity        Innovation        Performance        Respect

column7: About CSI Works: CSI Works is a dynamic fintech company dedicated to empowering small businesses worldwide with cutting-edge point-of-sale solutions. We specialize in streamlining transactional sales processes, reducing friction, and enhancing the overall customer experience. Our innovative products have gained significant popularity and profitability in the market, propelling us into a period of rapid growth. Join our team at the management level and help us sustainably scale our business to even greater heights.Position Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled Customer Experience Manager to not only excel in delivering exceptional customer service but also to lead the establishment and management of a high-performing customer support team. In the startup environment that CSI Works offers, this role encompasses a diverse array of responsibilities. Your primary objective is to ensure our customers receive unparalleled support and receive products that effectively address their needs. You'll begin by immersing yourself in the role, evaluating and enhancing our processes, and subsequently building a team capable of growing alongside our customer base. Your responsibilities will also include overseeing product updates and their readiness for deployment.Key Responsibilities:Provide outstanding customer support by building trust, demonstrating empathy, and communicating effectively through Zoom, email, case updates, and phone.Gain in-depth knowledge of CSI Works products and their core functions.Utilize various tools to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues, seeking assistance from other teams when necessary.Exhibit creativity, collaboration, and flexibility in your work, offering insights to improve processes and products based on your customer support experience.Build and manage customer-facing technical support teams and projects.Troubleshoot and resolve challenging technical issues in demanding situations.Clearly and effectively communicate both in writing and verbally.Prioritize multiple requests in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.Employ excellent listening and problem-solving skills, drawing from your experience in providing technical support to customers.Display enthusiasm for learning and growth, taking ownership of impactful projects.Demonstrate strong initiative in anticipating challenges, identifying opportunities, and crafting innovative solutions.Maintain a positive attitude and collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.Preferred Qualifications (Bonus Points for):Previous experience in Point of Sale or FinTech related products.Experience in startup environments, particularly in building company teams and processes.First 90 Days:Handle support calls from merchants and agents.Assist with implementation and presale issues.Escalate calls to Support Development when necessary.Keep customers informed about escalated issues.Test new applications or updates from Developers and document results.Collaborate with developers to enhance product delivery.Document all functionality requests in the wish list.Create content for the knowledge base, including how-to videos.First 6 Months:Develop and implement processes and procedures to expand the capacity of the support and product QA teams.Formulate and gain buy-in for the action plan for the next 6 months.CSI Works is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply.To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter to hr@csiworks.net. For more information about CSI Works, visit our websites at www.csiworks.netand your video channel at www.pointofinteraction.net.Job Types: Contract, Full-timePay: $61,892.34 - $74,537.02 per yearBenefits:Flexible schedulePaid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayWork Location: Hybrid remote in San Diego, CA 92121

Overview:   Company Summary   If you are searching for a fulfilling place to develop your career and an opportunity to make a difference in helping others, then keep reading on. Here at AAC, we have a progressive culture; we listen to your ideas, value a work/life balance, invest in education, and we foster trust and respect for all individuals. Our exceptional comp and strong benefits include, medical, dental, vision and life insurance. We are looking for our future leaders, who are not only going to fill the qualifications for this job description, but who are going to exceed expectations. Be a part of a team whose mission is to provide quality, compassionate, and innovative care to adults struggling with addiction and co-occurring mental health disorders. Our purpose and passion are to empower patients, their families, and our communities by helping individuals achieve recovery and optimal wellness of the mind, body, and spirit.  **REMOTE APPLICANTS ENCOURAGED TO APPLY**  Responsibilities:   Duties and Responsibilities: Be a leader - orchestrate the work of a cross-functional team of developers, designers, SEO, optimization, content and brand development team members to build the best-in-class experience for driving traffic, engagement and revenue Partner with SEO / Content team to drive domain authority and derive high intent traffic acquisition actions for portfolio of sites Work with the PPMO to ensure resources are assigned and allocated, day to day activities are done in a timely manner, and proper reports are provided Leverage insights to highlight product gaps, identify growth opportunities, and drive execution of growth initiatives Incubate new initiatives to expand our ability to reach and bring people into our recovery programs Ensure that new ideas are prototyped and done in an iterative approach Work with all groups to find efficiencies to better grow revenue Make bottom line contributions for all sites under purview Make sure all growth efforts are documented and available to the entire staff Communicate to Senior Leadership and Technology Leads learnings and how they translate to project performance, and acquisition and conversion rate improvement opportunities Manage an idea generation program within the organization to collect ideas for site / portfolio enhancements from all teams (Tech, Design, UX, QA, Marketing, Call Center and others) Identify cross-role/cross-functional collaboration opportunities to expand knowledge across the team and the organization Find gaps in our existing portfolio and suggest methods to improve our product offerings and reach Qualifications:   Education/Experience: Entrepreneurial spirit and passion for learning Problem solving and analysis skills with ability to solve business problems, individually or in a group setting Experience growing new or existing products to record numbers Understanding of organizational dynamics, and operating experience with cross-functional organizations Well accustomed to data-driven, experimentation approaches in a fast paced, agile environment People and team leadership skills coupled with project management experience Ability to learn and shift priorities while maintaining organization and control Solid understanding of web and mobile technologies, integrating with other applications and products and scaling user growth Demonstrated growth in Product Management Physical Requirements   AAC is committed to principles of equal opportunities for all employees. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations that are necessary to comply with State and Federal disability discrimination laws  Prolonged sitting at a desk Must be able to lift 15 pounds at a time   American Addiction Centers is an equal opportunity employer. American Addiction Centers prohibits employment practices that discriminate against individuals or groups of employees on the basis of age, color disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other category deemed protected by state and/or federal law.

The Product Portfolio Manager Level 1 is a junior position within the product Portfolio Management team and will serve as an introductory role/function within the team in which the role will focus on fundamental task development. Work closely with Product Management at other Kontron entities such as Kontron Europe, Kontron Asia and Kontron Iskratel Support assigned products with support from Product Management at the Kontron entity managing the design and development of the specified products. Competitive analysis of other companies offering similar and or identical product solutions. Identification of target industries and market research Improve processes for product lifecycle management including automating the EOL notification process Ensure that pricing and road maps are available to North America sales Maintain a local evaluation stock for quick customer sampling of products Monitor product line performance and market trends across assigned products Collect requirements for future products based on, but not limited to market research, win/loss analaysis and customer feedback Plan and execute product trainings and technical trainings Product Positioning and Product Messaging Ensure that product presentations are up to date and available to North America sales & marketing teams Ensure that the Kontron website accurately reflects the KAI portfolio of products and highlights focus products Serve as a key spokesperson for your products for webinars, videos, tradeshows and other lead generating activities Work with Distribution Management to support the sales of products through distribution Work with Marketing to develop the annual marketing plan and provide input on target customers, user personas and buyer personas Work with marketing communication and product marketing to execute product launches Ensure sales tools are available and developed in a cohesive way Set up local integration of products All other related tasks as assigned. Requirements Bachelors / Masters of Science in Engineering or equivalent years experience desired 1-3 years Product Management, Product Marketing or similar experince desired Proven ability to influence cross-functional and multi cultural teams Experience in driving improvement projects Excellent written, presentation and communication skills. Ability to set objectives and drive strategic initiatives Proven strong negotiation skills and ability to work under pressure Travel domestically and internationally as needed

Position: Product Manager [Startup]Who you are:You are a Product Manager that takes the lead in projects and keeps everyone organized. In groups, you are more likely to do more than your fair share of the work to ensure it goes well. You are internally motivated to get to the bottom of things, get things done, and make it clear and simple for others. It’s easy for you to write a description of or sketch a diagram of your thinking.Our mission:The world is full of problems. We fight those problems with startup companies. We believe a single company or entrepreneur can impact hundreds or even millions of lives. At Resonary (www.resonary.org), we’re on a mission to find and empower those who put mission first.Position DetailsType: Full timePay: Depends on experienceLocation: 100% RemoteExpectations: Flexible schedule, normal business hours, Eastern time zone,Must be attend 3x/ wk meetings at 10am ET/ 7am PTBenefits: Healthcare, home office benefits, unlimited paid time off, no meeting daysWhat you’ll do:Note: our team is flexible and takes pride in accomplishing what others cannot. The following is the expected task list, while occasional tasks will fall outside of it.Discover how to solve a problem by creating new products or servicesStay curious and relentless on your pursuit to solve problemsTalk with many stakeholders, customers, markets to understand their painsRecord, organize, and present findingsCreate rapid prototypes to test and confirm your understandingFinal deliverable: users using a prototype of your best solution to the given problemResearch, design & test solutions to problemsCustomer interviews to discover most painful problemDiagramming out a process or workflow to find ways to simplify inBrainstorm designs for software, apps, features, etc that solve the problemDesign your ideas in Figma and create working prototypesLead, manage, and hold a team accountableManage day-to-day tasks for a team of 1-3 people that will build your solutionsProject management (timelines, budgets, milestones)Measure and report on results (# of users, customer insights, etc)Design, develop, and deploy prototypesUse low or no code tools like Bubble.io to rapidly create prototypesDeploy, or launch software prototypes to test user interaction and get feedbackSkills you bring:The main requirement is that you show up to consistently perform and improve your role. You will encounter unknowns and must be familiar with personally solving challenges. You should have relevant experience and confidence in your ability.Ability to lead a small group with clear, critical thinking & communicationThis is the most important skill. If you don't believe this is one of your core strengths, you likely won't be the right fit.Ability to clarify themes and trends after listening to multiple perspectivesAble to communicate insights via writing, simple diagrams, and rough sketchesCuriosity and ability to unpack issues in order to find & solve the root causesSniff out a problemGet curious about itGo talk to peopleTry it yourselfPropose a fix for itGet feedback on your ideasProject management or basic organizational habitsYou will be accountable for your team’s resultsYou will lead projects from start to finish, sometimes multiple projects at onceComfortable managing 1-4 teammates (flexibility to add/ remove teammates to hit your goals)TechAble to use and quickly learn to new software toolsAble to use excel to create basic financial models, projections, dashboards, etc (or learn how to use them)Soft SkillsDrive to work hard on worthwhile workPositive, optimistic, growth mentalityDesire to produce and take personal pride in quality workExceptional time management, organizational, and communication skillsRelated ExperienceSome experience in business and startupsFamiliarity with accounting, HR and project managementHow to Apply:Apply through our online application form: https://forms.monday.com/forms/9e2e545dc825b69297ce5298dd99903e?r=use1Please include a link to your portfolio or references to previous work.Applications submitted through Indeed, email, or LinkedIn will not be considered.Closing thoughts:The startup world is full of unknowns. If you’re like us, that’s an exciting way to live. We’re 100% dedicated to our mission and looking for teammates who want to work hard on meaningful projects with us. We’re looking for people with an experimental mindset and friendly attitude to join a new, motivated team. If you're ready to take on a challenge and put in the hard work, we encourage you to apply. Remember, great things rarely come from comfort zones.Looking forward to working with you,Scott-All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status. Resonary, LLC is a Drug Free Workplace/ EO employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:Flexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Location: Remote

Position: Assistant Product Manager Location: Hampton, NH Ardent Concepts, an Amphenol company, is a leading designer and manufacturer of high performance multicoax and coaxial assemblies, connectors, and sockets used in the development of next generation quantum computing, semiconductors and electronics systems. Our core technology is the smallest, fastest, and most electrically efficient compression mount connector technology worldwide. As data rate requirements increase and devices and systems shrink, Ardent’s products deliver superior signal integrity in a dense footprint that can be reusable across programs to maximize cost savings. Our focus is on helping bring next generation computing to market through novel connector designs for test & measurement, OEM applications, and specialized military applications. Ardent’s patented contact technologies are well suited for advanced multi-GHz applications such as board stack connectors, coaxial connectors, FPGA sockets, flex circuit connectors, probe interfaces, and mezzanine card connectors. We have a complete line of high-performance test socket solutions for the most advanced chipsets such as RF devices, ASICS, switches, processors, and MEMS devices. We support chip to chip, chip to board, board to board, and flex to board applications. We are currently seeking an Assistant Product Manager to join our team. This position is located out of our Hampton, NH office. SUMMARY: Are you passionate about gathering and analyzing customer data to drive product innovation? Are you skilled in writing comprehensive product requirements and translating them into impactful product roadmaps? We are seeking an Assistant Product Manager who thrives on managing product budgets, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring successful product launches. Join our team and help shape the future of our products by working on key responsibilities aligned with customer-centric product management. RESPONSIBILITIES: Gather and Analyze Customer Data: Observe and participate in meetings across various target markets and with customers Compile and share insightful trip reports on Application Trends, Buzz Words, and the unique value proposition of our products Identify technical gaps and opportunities for product enhancements and refinements. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to input valuable insights into the New Product Request Tracker Assist in the creation and reporting of Application/Market research via Salesforce Cases/Opportunities, working closely with Inside Sales, Applications, and Product Management teams Write Product Requirements: Craft detailed and clear product requirements documents that outline the features and functionalities of new products Collaborate effectively with different teams to ensure alignment with the product vision Create Product Roadmaps: Develop comprehensive product roadmaps that outline the timeline for product development and release Strategically plan for successful product launches based on organizational goals Manage Product Budgets: Oversee product budgets, closely tracking expenses and ensuring efficient resource utilization Ensure that projects are executed within allocated resources while meeting quality standards Work with Engineers and Designers: Collaborate closely with engineering and design teams to ensure the development of products in line with specified requirements Bridge the gap between technical teams and the broader product vision Gather User Feedback: Actively collect user feedback to drive iterative improvements and refinements Integrate user insights into the product development process Product Documentation: Craft comprehensive product documentation, including user guides and release notes Empower users to effectively utilize products and understand their features Market Products: Collaborate with Marketing teams to market products effectively to potential customers Contribute to product messaging, positioning, and go-to-market strategies QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, or related field Proven ability to gather and analyze customer data for valuable insights Strong aptitude for writing detailed and effective product requirements Experience in creating and managing product roadmaps Proficient in budget management and expense tracking Effective collaboration with engineering and design teams Detail-oriented approach to product quality assurance and testing Excellent user feedback collection and integration skills Exceptional written communication skills for product documentation Familiarity with product marketing strategies (a plus) SKILLS: Amphenol Corporation is proud of our reputation as an excellent employer. Our main focus is to provide the highest level of support and responsiveness to both our employees and our customers, the world's largest technology companies. Amphenol Corporation offers the opportunity for career growth within a global organization. We believe that Amphenol Corporation is unique in that every employee, regardless of his or her position, has the ability to positively impact the business. Amphenol is an “Equal Opportunity Employer” - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin For additional company information please visit our website at https://www.amphenol-cs.com/

About User Interviews At User Interviews, we believe that the best companies in the world consistently deliver products and experiences that their customers love. We also believe that the only way to consistently build those products and experiences is to talk to your customers. Watch what they do. Understand why they do what they do. Figure out why they do things that seem irrational. And once you've done that once, do it again. Start having continuous customer conversations. In short, make customers your #1 priority through user research. That's why we exist. We help teams set up those conversations, that research, allowing them to discover and embrace user insights. We work with hundreds of companies every month, including user-centric organizations like Atlassian, Amazon, and Spotify. About The Role You will lead a cross-functional product squad focused on helping teams collaborate together in research. We believe that research is a team sport and this squad makes that collaboration possible. What is a product squad? Each squad is made up of a Product Manager (you), a Tech Lead, a Product Designer, an embedded Data Analyst, and 4+ engineers. Each squad owns an outcome and everything from the discovery of opportunities in that area through the delivery of solutions. Our baseline for this role is someone who is smart, self-motivated, and an awesome teammate (but specifics are below!). ResponsibilitiesLead the discovery to figure out what opportunities to prioritize for your squadShape those opportunities into a high-level solutions and hypothesesLead a cross-functional team to keep all relevant stakeholders up to speedMake the call on day-to-day prioritization and trade-off decisions in a way that balances user needs, product vision, and company goals.Track the performance of recently shipped items and report the key takeaways to the full team.Establish and maintain a high bar for the quality of work you oversee.✨ Who will be successful in this role?You have led efforts from initial ideation all the way to delivery.You enjoy switching back and forth between creative problem solving and analytical thinking.You are a clear and effective communicator that knows how to tailor your style to the audience.You are pragmatic and have a knack for navigating through ambiguity and uncertainty.You have an entrepreneurial spirit – you are always learning something new or tinkering on a project.You incorporate user feedback into all aspects of your work and use it to drive your thinking but supplement it with your own ideas as well.You are comfortable making decisions. You know when to seek consensus vs. when to make a call. You know when to prioritize speed vs. when to prioritize accuracy. Qualifications1-3 years in a Product Management roleExperience generating user insights, including user research and analyticsClear and effective communicator (written and verbal)Effective decision makerEnough technical understanding to have effective conversations with technical teammates to understand complexity, sizing, trade offs, etc BenefitsCompetitive Salary ($115k+)Annual Bonus100% premium covered medical + dental employee coverageAnnual membership to One Medical Group & Talkspace401k + employer contribution4 weeks of PTO to start + accrue an additional day per year of employmentUnlimited wellness days - Sick? Doctors appointment? Mental health day? We've got you covered.Flexible, paid parental leaveStock options for every employee$250 Office setup budget$50/month Work From Home stipendPerformance-based incentive plansAwards for 360-degree recognition, work anniversaries, & birthdays Why Join UsWe're a team of doers. You'll be fully supported by your manager and team, but there won't be anyone peering over your shoulder. You'll be expected and trusted to take ownership of your work, and to communicate clearly and transparently with your distributed teammates.User Interviews is a fully remote team and always has been. We are proactive about staying connected to each other despite not sharing the same physical space. Remote culture is real and we care about it—a lot.On a related note, we're very pro-feedback. From our users, of course. But also from each other. From individual contributors right up to the CEO, this is a team that is genuinely committed to continuous improvement.We embrace what makes you, you! We are committed to accessibility, equity, diversity, and inclusion. We build products for and welcome participants, researchers, and employees from a diverse set of backgrounds. These backgrounds include—but are not limited to—varied socioeconomic status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, race, ethnicity, age, neurodivergence, disability, and citizenship. As we grow, we are aware that this work is continuous. We will not settle for how things are, but rather strive for how they could be.

Assistant Product Manager SUMMARY OF POSITION The Consumer Product division of Riddell is focused on developing and marketing licensed products sold to collectors and fans. Riddell is licensed by the NFL and more than 120 colleges to produce souvenir and collectible products. Riddell is proud to be the Exclusive Licensee for Collectibles Helmets to the NFL. The Assistant Product Manager will support Product Managers and Sales Personnel by being an integral part of the product management lifecycle. Attention to detail, problem solving, project management, and communication are key to the success of this role. The position is an entry level role based in Des Plaines, IL. The person in this position will be a vital part of the idea generation process, including having a thorough understanding of manufacturing capabilities, vendor capabilities, and sampling lead times. The candidate must be able to establish, track, and follow-through on timelines. The ideal candidate must be able to identify new product opportunities, target price points, perform margin analysis, and estimate market potential. This person should be able to recognize consumer and collector market trends, organize and oversee the timeline to develop the product, and evaluate the product’s success post-production. The candidate must be able to work with various disciplinary teams within the company including Production, Distribution, Quality Control, Finance and Marketing. The candidate will develop strong working relationships with key vendors and suppliers. The candidate must be eager to learn, a creative thinker, self-motivated, and capable of working independently while showing a strong sense of teamwork. The position requires the ability to pursue information that may not be readily available, by developing and utilizing various sources, within and outside the company. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (other duties as assigned) Primary responsibilities will include:Photography, Photo Editing, Image ManagementMock-Ups of Potential ProductsSell Sheet GenerationDetailed Product Spec SheetsHands-on Prototype DevelopmentLicensor Approval and CommunicationLiaison with Production on Quality and Remediation Issues QUALIFICATIONS4 year college degree1-3 years relevant work experience JOB REQUIREMENTSAuthorized to work in the U.S. SKILLS The ideal candidate should have working experience with the following:Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerpointAdobe Illustrator and PhotoshopDigital Photography and Image ManipulationSAP experience In addition, a detailed eye for football helmet decoration and familiarity with the sports collectible industry is a plus. Interest in the sport of football is a must!

expires on: November 30, 2023 LOCATION: Golden Vallery,MN-hybrid JOB #: 102167 JOB TYPE: Consulting CATEGORY: Business Analysis DURATION: 12+ months CLIENT: Insurance   Project overview: We are in the process of building out and delivering on a backlog comprised of features for the Inforce Annuity operations teams. The work spans across multiple areas and requires coordination across delivery teams (product configuration, integrations, digital for example). Inforce is defined as everything occurring post-issue on an annuity contract; policy administrations, benefit payout, death claim, accounting, tax forms and feeds, and customer communications.  Examples of work include: Correspondence and other customer communication output Changes to the system User Interface (business or production configuration requires partnership and coordination with other delivery teams and external vendor) Production support triage and fixes for defects and production incidents Tax features – tax testing, tax form build out and test (requires partnership and coordination with other delivery teams) Feature delivery – partial Roth conversion solution, UI (User Interface,) role changes for AML (Anti Money Laundering), Secure Act changes, Inherited IRA solution for example Business-related enhancements – could require product or business configuration or changes to base code Finance and accounting related configuration and validations BPM tool updates for task routing Team Methodology: Agile / Scrum Team Makeup: Product Manager, Product Owner, Scrum Master, Enterprise Architects, Developers across multiple capabilities, Quality Assurance, Business Analysts, Business Process Analysts, Product Calculation Analysts, and external vendor partners.  Product Owner: The Product Owner is a member of the Agile team who serves as the customer proxy responsible for working with the delivery team, Product Management, and other stakeholders - including other POs (Product Owner) - to ensure stories are defined and prioritized in the team backlog. You will articulate and determine the vision, benefits, and roadmap for the Inforce Annuity product. You will oversee and approve the work throughout the entire development life cycle including design of the product life cycle. You will collaborate with prospective users, and across multiple delivery teams to understand needs and translate them into product requirements, user stories, and sprint/iteration plans. You will be a leader and liaison between the product team and end-users for risks, issues, feedback, and improvement. Accountable for overall project delivery.  Team Delivery: Empowers the team to determine flow of work in alignment with team level priorities Creates and verifies stories are in line with the program vision and scope; accepts or rejects completed stories in partnership with the team Ensures the team is aligned to the Program Increment Objectives, and Iteration goals are clearly defined and communicated Helps remove or escalate obstacles to Product Management (tactical) Meets regularly with Product Management to keep stakeholders informed on how much incremental value has been generated Works closely with Product Management to plan and manage Program Increments Collaborates with Product Owners across other Agile/Scrum teams to ensure system integrations, configuration, and testing across multiple teams is considered and validated Works across teams to identify and understand dependencies and ensures tight sequencing of work Engages appropriate business partners to ensure the team has direct understanding for story development Works closely with external vendor to manage timelines and deliverables Refines team features and user stories in the backlog, ensuring estimates and story points are understood and accurate ahead of PI planning Understands impacts and trade-offs related to dynamic and ever-changing priorities Customer Voice & Product Expertise: Works closely with teams to refine stories and acceptance criteria to ensure they deliver a complete product to market Answers the team’s questions during development and testing, serving as a proxy for the customer Responsible for involving appropriate partners to ensure acceptance criteria has been met Provides deep product expertise and ensures the product is built in alignment with the product vision Critical Skills and Experience: Strong soft skills, can communicate effectively at all levels Proactive Negotiation skills Stakeholder management Decision making Able to influence without authority Self-motivator / driver Self-organizer Maintains a solution focus, facilitating “here’s how we can” versus “here’s why we can’t” mindset

What if the work you did every day could impact the lives of people you know? Or all of humanity?  At Illumina, we are expanding access to genomic technology to realize health equity for billions of people around the world. Our efforts enable life-changing discoveries that are transforming human health through the early detection and diagnosis of diseases and new treatment options for patients.  Working at Illumina means being part of something bigger than yourself. Every person, in every role, has the opportunity to make a difference. Surrounded by extraordinary people, inspiring leaders, and world changing projects, you will do more and become more than you ever thought possible.    Position Summary:    Join the Illumina Clinical and IVD Product Management group as an Associate Product Manager to support our Reproductive Health NGS portfolio. This is an entry-level role where you will learn all aspects of Product Management, while supporting on-market products. As a member of this team, you will work cross-functionally with development, sales and marketing, and product support teams to ensure customer success with ILMN clinical NGS products.    Responsibilities:  Serve as business representative for assigned products during product quality investigations Responsible for updating product documentation and keeping content current Responsible for drafting customer communications Collaborate with field sales teams to develop quarterly forecasts Support financial analysis of the business Collaborate with Segment Marketing teams to develop market knowledge and manage competitive intelligence Collaborate with Product support teams to manage open issues and product improvements   Requirements:  Ability to communicate effectively with both internal stakeholders and with external customers. Includes clear and concise written communication skills, as well as ability to present material in small/ medium sized groups Familiarity with financial modeling, working with spreadsheets Excellent time management, organizational, and interpersonal skills Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities at once Ability to collaborate with colleagues across functions and geographies   Experience/Education:  Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences, Biology, or related field, MBA a plus Prefer 1-2 years of experience in product management or in molecular diagnostics marketing, sales, or a related area The estimated base salary range for the Associate Product Manager, RH role based in the United States of America is: $60,500 - $90,700. Should the level or location of the role change during the hiring process, the applicable base pay range may be updated accordingly. Compensation decisions are dependent on several factors including, but not limited to, an individual’s qualifications, location where the role is to be performed, internal equity, and alignment with market data. Additionally, all employees are eligible for one of our variable cash programs (bonus or commission) and eligible roles may receive equity as part of the compensation package. We offer a wide range of benefits as innovative as our work, including access to genomics sequencing, family planning, health/dental/vision, retirement benefits, and paid time off.  At Illumina, we strive to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace by cultivating an environment in which everyone contributes to our mission. Built on a strong foundation, Illumina has always been rooted in openness, collaboration, and seeking alternative views and perspectives to propel innovation in genomics. We are proud to confirm a zero-net gap in pay, regardless of gender, ethnicity, or race. We also have several Employee Resource Groups (ERG) that deliver career development experiences, increase cultural awareness, and demonstrate our collective commitment to diversity and inclusion in the communities we live and work. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information. If you require accommodation to complete the application or interview process, please contact accommodations@illumina.com. To learn more, visit: https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

column7: About the Role We are seeking an Associate Product Manager to spearhead the development of our groundbreaking AI-driven video production platform. We will be implementing innovative approach the video production using AI technology. As a crucial member of our dynamic team, you will play a pivotal role in driving the growth of our product, managing its lifecycle, and ensuring it not only meets but exceeds market needs and expectations. Your expertise will be instrumental in orchestrating the entire product planning lifecycle, from the exhilaration of new product development to strategic go-to-market initiatives and the creation of impactful sales strategies. This role is designed for someone who is passionate about harnessing the latest in technology, thrives on challenges, and is eager to make a significant impact in the evolving world of AI video production. If you're ready to join an ambitious journey and lead the charge in redefining the future of video production through AI innovation, we warmly invite you to apply. About Lemonlight Lemonlight is a full-service content studio and leading provider of on-demand video production services. Established in 2014, they have become one of the largest branded content providers globally, working with top brands like Amazon, Google, and Airbnb. Their exceptional achievements include 25 prestigious awards, such as being recognized as an Inc. 500 company for five consecutive years and being named one of BuiltIn's Best Places to Work in 2023. We are a tightly bonded group of visionaries and achievers, wholeheartedly embracing the influence and illumination brought forth by narratives, serving as a means to safeguard heritage, ignite societal transformation, or merely ensure our voices are acknowledged. Key Responsibilities:Product Narrative: Effectively articulate a compelling narrative about the product, communicating its value and generating excitement among internal and external audiences.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with marketing, design, engineering, and other teams to define product requirements, set priorities, and oversee products throughout their lifecycle.Market Research: Conduct thorough research to identify unmet needs in the point of care ultrasound sector, analyze competitive landscapes, and keep abreast of emerging trends in healthcare to guide product decisions.Product Lifecycle Management: Manage the End-Of-Life (EOL) process for all products, coordinating with stakeholders, managing EOL meetings, and disseminating EOL notices.Project Management: Oversee project timelines, key milestones, and address potential challenges to ensure on-time and successful project delivery.Analytics and Metrics: Engage in sales forecasting and define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for product performance analysis, utilizing data-driven insights for decision-making.User Feedback: Gather and analyze user feedback to enhance and refine product features.Competitive Analysis: Monitor competitors' products and marketing strategies, identifying opportunities for differentiation and enhancement.Stakeholder Communication: Build and maintain trust through effective communication of product updates, progress, and strategy with stakeholders.Product Quality and Reliability: Ensure products adhere to quality and reliability standards.Quality System Compliance: Be accountable for compliance with the company's quality system.Product Marketing: Work with Marketing Communications to develop sales support materials, including literature, launch packages, sales tools, and web content. Engage with sales teams and customers for product commercialization.Solutions Architect: Act as a solutions architect, devising and delivering innovative product solutions tailored to customer needs and market demands.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.1-3 years of experience in product management, marketing, video production or a related area.Agile and SCRUM MethodologyStrong understanding of technology, software engineering cycle and AI space.Knowledge of marketing strategies and consumer behavior.Excellent communication and storytelling skills.Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams.Excellent organizational skills with the capability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.Preferred Skills:Experience in a technology or high-growth environment.Demonstrated ability to develop product strategies and effectively communicate them to management.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.SCRUM Certified.Work Perks:Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life401KUnlimited Paid Time OffFlexible work hoursHybrid work modelCompany sponsored events and happy hoursCasual dressOffice snacks and drinksSome meals providedWork anniversaries and birthday celebrationsEmployee of the month

General information All posting locations: Chicago, Illinois, United States of America Job Function: 05 - Marketing Date Published: 31-Jul-2023 Ref #: R-72926 Description & Requirements The Product Management team will own end to end outcomes for digital products that are intended to drive consumer engagement and deliver outstanding consumer experiences. They unite design- marketing- engineering- and data to deliver on the expected outcomes. Primary Responsibilities Build and implement product strategies consistent with company vision Lead a cross-functional squad of design- engineering- and marketing Gather and synthesize market- customer- technology- and competitive research to identify product enhancements and new opportunities for innovation Experience with the complete product development lifecycle in an agile environment- write product briefs and user stories- handle priorities- and actively develop and complete a data-driven product roadmap Identify the biggest problems to solve. Drive new feature development from start to finish Run user research- usability studies- data-driven experiments to inform product direction Establish- monitor- and measure success metrics. Consistently integrate behavior data and user feedback into key product decisions. Communicate product plans- benefits and results to all audiences Qualifications Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to excel in a collaborative- dynamic- and results-driven environment A passion for user design and the impact it can have on user experiences Knowledge of microservice architectures and platforms Proven ability to leverage data and insights to make informed product decisions while maintaining a user focusAbout UsKraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company. Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.  Why UsWe grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food. Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz. Office Collaboration & Hybrid Work EnvironmentWe believe our office environment fuels our collaboration, connection & community as an organization and allows our employees to grow toward greatness. We also believe providing a more flexible and agile model is essential in today’s workplace. A majority of our office-based employees will be able to work remotely for up to two days each week. Additionally, employees who are subject to this hybrid model will be eligible to work from anywhere for up to six weeks in a rolling 12-month period (in maximum two-week increments and according to benefits and tax guidelines). Some jobs may be required to be performed fully in office depending on the role’s responsibilities and requirements.Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
