column7: Education.com is the web's largest resource for worksheets, games, lesson plans, and other types of printables and online activities. We're looking to expand our subscriber base of teachers and parents from the hundreds of thousands to the millions. As part of this, we'd like to expand our offerings to cover an even wider array of tools and services that are useful to educators. As the product leader for Education.com, you'll oversee the product's evolution, determining which developments will make the greatest impact and seeing them through to completion. You'll be the primary problem solver and point of contact. You will achieve results by collaborating across the organization. You will work closely with engineers on detailed requirements, and you will discuss large themes and identify problem areas with the VP of Product. Success in this role will be measured by the growth in subscribers. Does this sound like an initiative you would enjoy leading? If so, we'd like to hear from you! This is a full-time position with a hybrid schedule in our San Mateo, CA office. #li-hybrid #LI-CC1 Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The base salary range for this full-time position is $125,000 to $180,000 + equity + benefits. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire pay for the position. Individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for your preferred location during the hiring process. ABOUT IXL LEARNING IXL Learning is the country's largest edtech company. We reach millions of learners through our diverse range of products. For example:1 in 4 students in the United States uses IXL.comRosetta Stone provides an immersive learning experience for 25 languagesWyzant is the nation's largest community of tutors, covering 300+ subjectsTeachers Pay Teachers (TPT) is a comprehensive marketplace for millions of educator-created resourcesOur mission is to create innovative products that will make a real, positive difference for learners and educators and we're looking for passionate, mission-minded people to join us in achieving this goal. We have a unique culture at IXL that fosters collaboration and the open exchange of ideas. We value our team and treat one another with kindness and respect. We approach our work with passion, tenacity, and authenticity. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions and we are eager to have you join our team. At IXL, we value diversity in age, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, political and religious beliefs, and life experience, and we are proud to promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. IXL Learning is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Our Purpose    We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a      culture of inclusion   for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.    Title and Summary  Global SME Loyalty Product Manager  Manager, Global SME Loyalty  Overview:  In virtually every country around the world, Micro, Small, and Medium Businesses (SMEs) are the lifeblood of economic vitality. They represent 90% of the global workforce and 55% of GDP in emerging markets. The Covid-19 pandemic only emphasized the importance of SMEs to economic recovery and growth.  Mastercard is dedicated to enabling businesses to survive and thrive, stronger than before. Our rallying cry is Empowering Every Business Everywhere. This segment is central to Mastercard’s growth strategy - not only because of their global impact but also because of the large role SMEs play in the payments ecosystem as both payers and acceptors of electronic payments.  As a SME Loyalty Manager on the global small business team, you will be responsible for the Easy Savings platform operations. The Manager will partner across the business to ensure flawless execution of the platform, manage, and grow merchant relationships, and deliver on product enhancements. The Manager will report into the SME Loyalty Director and will be closely aligned with regional product partners.  Role: Manage Easy Savings operational functions, partner cross functionally to ensure platform is working as intended (e.g. back-end systems and website)Manage and execute operational processes for partners (e.g. onboarding, billing and customer service)Own and manage product documentation that is used with partners (e.g. sales materials and contracting)Develop relationships and manage on-going communication with Easy Savings partnersImplement partner strategy to retain and grow merchant relationships (e.g. develop partner reporting and case studies)Create awareness for Easy Savings by working with Marketing, Issuers and Regional Product teams to develop best practices and implementPartner with account management teams in sales discussion to secure offers for the program with a focus on digital services and capabilitiesEnhance user experience through data driven decisions that encourage usage and localize platform All About You: Experience performing product operations and navigating complex systemsStrong execution and project management skillsAbility to troubleshoot issues through collaboration and influenceExperience developing partner strategies, presentations and building relationshipsAbility to partner effectively with cross functional teams and across different levels of an organizationExperience leveraging data to create meaningful insightsKnowledge of loyalty programs and digital customer experience In the US, Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable_accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.    Corporate Security Responsibility  All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:      Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;        Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;        Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and        Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.    In line with Mastercard’s total compensation philosophy and assuming that the job will be performed in the US, the successful candidate will be offered a competitive base salary based on location, experience and other qualifications for the role and may be eligible for an annual bonus or commissions depending on the role. Mastercard benefits for full time (and certain part time) employees generally include: insurance (including medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, disability, life insurance), flexible spending account and health savings account, paid leaves (including 16 weeks new parent leave, up to 20 paid days bereavement leave), 10 annual paid sick days, 10 or more annual paid vacation days based on level, 5 personal days, 10 annual paid U.S. observed holidays, 401k with a best-in-class company match, deferred compensation for eligible roles, fitness reimbursement or on-site fitness facilities, eligibility for tuition reimbursement, gender-inclusive benefits and many more.    Pay Ranges  O'Fallon, Missouri: $118,000 - $183,000 USD

The Product Analyst provides support to assigned manager and Occasion Team.      In this role, your main responsibility is the merchandising of assigned occasion across multiple product categories for multiple retailers to maximize the productivity of retail sales.      ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:    Assist manager in all aspects of the occasion planning process and execution.Assist manager to help achieve key performance indicators or metrics (KPIs). Position: Product Manager [Startup]Who you are:You are a Product Manager that takes the lead in projects and keeps everyone organized. In groups, you are more likely to do more than your fair share of the work to ensure it goes well. You are internally motivated to get to the bottom of things, get things done, and make it clear and simple for others. It’s easy for you to write a description of or sketch a diagram of your thinking.Our mission:The world is full of problems. We fight those problems with startup companies. We believe a single company or entrepreneur can impact hundreds or even millions of lives. At Resonary (www.resonary.org), we’re on a mission to find and empower those who put mission first.Position DetailsType: Full timePay: Depends on experienceLocation: 100% RemoteExpectations: Flexible schedule, normal business hours, Eastern time zone,Must be attend 3x/ wk meetings at 10am ET/ 7am PTBenefits: Healthcare, home office benefits, unlimited paid time off, no meeting daysWhat you’ll do:Note: our team is flexible and takes pride in accomplishing what others cannot. The following is the expected task list, while occasional tasks will fall outside of it.Discover how to solve a problem by creating new products or servicesStay curious and relentless on your pursuit to solve problemsTalk with many stakeholders, customers, markets to understand their painsRecord, organize, and present findingsCreate rapid prototypes to test and confirm your understandingFinal deliverable: users using a prototype of your best solution to the given problemResearch, design & test solutions to problemsCustomer interviews to discover most painful problemDiagramming out a process or workflow to find ways to simplify inBrainstorm designs for software, apps, features, etc that solve the problemDesign your ideas in Figma and create working prototypesLead, manage, and hold a team accountableManage day-to-day tasks for a team of 1-3 people that will build your solutionsProject management (timelines, budgets, milestones)Measure and report on results (# of users, customer insights, etc)Design, develop, and deploy prototypesUse low or no code tools like Bubble.io to rapidly create prototypesDeploy, or launch software prototypes to test user interaction and get feedbackSkills you bring:The main requirement is that you show up to consistently perform and improve your role. You will encounter unknowns and must be familiar with personally solving challenges. You should have relevant experience and confidence in your ability.Ability to lead a small group with clear, critical thinking & communicationThis is the most important skill. If you don't believe this is one of your core strengths, you likely won't be the right fit.Ability to clarify themes and trends after listening to multiple perspectivesAble to communicate insights via writing, simple diagrams, and rough sketchesCuriosity and ability to unpack issues in order to find & solve the root causesSniff out a problemGet curious about itGo talk to peopleTry it yourselfPropose a fix for itGet feedback on your ideasProject management or basic organizational habitsYou will be accountable for your team’s resultsYou will lead projects from start to finish, sometimes multiple projects at onceComfortable managing 1-4 teammates (flexibility to add/ remove teammates to hit your goals)TechAble to use and quickly learn to new software toolsAble to use excel to create basic financial models, projections, dashboards, etc (or learn how to use them)Soft SkillsDrive to work hard on worthwhile workPositive, optimistic, growth mentalityDesire to produce and take personal pride in quality workExceptional time management, organizational, and communication skillsRelated ExperienceSome experience in business and startupsFamiliarity with accounting, HR and project managementHow to Apply:Apply through our online application form: https://forms.monday.com/forms/9e2e545dc825b69297ce5298dd99903e?r=use1Please include a link to your portfolio or references to previous work.Applications submitted through Indeed, email, or LinkedIn will not be considered.Closing thoughts:The startup world is full of unknowns. If you’re like us, that’s an exciting way to live. We’re 100% dedicated to our mission and looking for teammates who want to work hard on meaningful projects with us. We’re looking for people with an experimental mindset and friendly attitude to join a new, motivated team. If you're ready to take on a challenge and put in the hard work, we encourage you to apply. Remember, great things rarely come from comfort zones.Looking forward to working with you,Scott-All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status. Resonary, LLC is a Drug Free Workplace/ EO employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:Flexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Location: Remote

Sock Club is seeking a Product Manager to work with our Development team to build features, tools, and processes for internal teams and SC-Custom clients. They will be working with a number of existing and new products that make up the software ecosystem for our organization. We’re looking for a data driven product manager with an ability to creatively solve problems and has experience managing projects and product development cycles. This role requires at least 1-2 years of project/product management experience. We are looking for an individual who has the following qualities and, more importantly, is excited to work for our rapidly growing company in Austin, TX. We are a team of multitaskers and hard workers. We seek team-oriented people who are professional, eager to take on a challenge, and are a joy to work with. Responsibilities & Requirements: Work cross-functionally to guide internal/external products from conception to launch by connecting business problems with technology. Work collaboratively with internal teams to build roadmaps and plan releases. Ability to identify pain points and bottlenecks both technically and within the customer journey. Ability to simplify complex challenges and technologies into simpler outcomes and stories to drive shared understandings throughout the organization. Own the product roadmap. Analyze, interpret, and make product decisions based on data and statistics. Prioritize development activities to continuously deliver value to customers. Achieve successful customer adoption, value realization, satisfaction and overall solution health. Write product initiatives including supporting financials and cost analysis. Engage with clients and contribute to customer success and account growth by encouraging increasing levels of product utilization among prospective and existing customers. Able to confidently demonstrate products, and influence senior management, and other internal or external stakeholders. Ability to balance many projects at one time and work independently. 1-2 years of Product experience required. Previous B2B experience is a plus! Previous promotional product experience is a plus! General Sock Club Team Member requirements: Work collaboratively and cross-functionally to gather specifications and requirements based on business and technical needs. Gain a strong understanding of the user experience, workflow and customer needs. Be solution-oriented, and work to identify problems before they arise. Always be helpful and friendly! Detail oriented. Self-directed with an intrinsic drive for growth. Work in a fast-paced environment. Why Work at Sock Club: Friendly people and a casual culture! High growth company full of opportunity & professional development. Great benefits (401k, quarterly bonus incentives, strong healthcare). Unlimited PTO. Innovative work environment, develop cutting-edge solutions. Competitive compensation and incentive structure. Flexible hybrid work structure. Unsure about your qualifications?You should apply anyway!LinkedIn examined their users' job search behavior and found that women are less likely to apply for a job that they aren't fully qualified for, while men will apply if they meet only some of the desired qualities.Whether you fit into these two categories, or somewhere else on the spectrum, take a chance on that application. You may just be the perfect fit! UXVYSNx91t

column7: Workfully is the decentralized hiring & upskilling marketplace. The world's fastest-growing and most innovative companies use Workfully to hire & develop talent globally. The Company Our client is a cutting-edge software company, headquartered in Chicago, specializing in global payments, payroll, and Employer of Record (EOR) solutions. Our client's software empowers global organizations to efficiently manage their workforce across multiple countries while seamlessly executing payroll processes. The Role Our client is seeking a skilled and innovative Product Owner to join their dynamic team either in Chicago or in other locations. As a Head of Product at our client's organization, you will play a pivotal role in the ongoing development and enhancement, of a groundbreaking software solution that revolutionizes global workforce management. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and stakeholders, to define and prioritize product features, ensuring the company remains at the forefront of the industry. If you are passionate about driving software excellence and have a keen understanding of global payroll and workforce management, we invite you to be a part of this exciting journey. The Candidate  Collaboration: Work directly with 3rd party developers to bring our cutting-edge software solution, to life. Collaborate on a daily basis, ensuring alignment with project goals and timelines.  Requirement Definition: You will be the driving force behind defining and documenting project requirements. Your meticulous attention to detail will help guide the development process.  Relationship Ownership: Take ownership of the relationship with the provider, nurturing a strong and productive partnership that fosters innovation and timely project delivery.  The must-haves  Product Ownership/Management: Proven experience as a Product Manager, Director or Head in HR tech, payroll, or payment/fintech products. Your background in these industries will be a valuable asset in this role.  Developer Interaction: Previous experience working directly with 3rd party developers, facilitating daily standup meetings, and translating technical requirements into actionable tasks.  Communication Skills: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills are essential, as you'll be responsible for documenting requirements and collaborating with diverse teams.  Location: Ideally based in Chicago, IL, where our headquarters is located. However, we are open to considering candidates in Canada who meet the qualifications and are willing to work remotely.Why Join Us Join our dynamic team in shaping the future of global workforce management. As a Product Owner, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our innovative software solution, while working in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment.  If you're a Product Owner, or Manager ready to take on an exciting challenge in the HR tech, payroll, or fintech industry, apply today and be a key player in our journey to redefine global workforce management.

THE COMPANY The Design Group Creative Play and Toy division operates under the name Anker Play Products. The creative play and toy line has been a steady and growing category of product within the DG business and has an incredible portfolio of toys, kids crafts and games for mass market and value channel customers. Our extensive product line offers a wide range of creative play products for all children and all seasons.  Design Group is recruiting for an Assistant Product Manager to work onsite in our newly renovated top floor office in Miami Beach, FL. Our team operates in an open concept workspace allowing your creativity to flourish and grow. In addition, we offer a two day per week work from home option.  WHAT WILL I DO IN THIS ROLE? We will look to you to coordinate and maintain the day-to-day development procedures for both current and new items under the direction of Product Development Managers. You will work with the team to keep all system data current, collaborate with merchandising and design teams, and communicate with our factories.  Duties and Responsibilities:Work with PD Managers to review incoming initial development samples from factories before providing to the studio for artwork.Manage sample tracking sheet.Assist PD Manager with creation of new item sourcing/spec sheet for fty’s as needed.Update Category Presentations – adding new item pages; deleting and updating as needed.Manage Sales Quote Request process with suppliers. Duties include setting up, sending, and updating key documents. PD Associate will determine completeness; resolve issues with suppliers and make recommendations to PD Managers.Set up MQ documents and send to fty’s and update documents with selected fty quote.Manage HTS process by adding needed projects to HTS master document and sending to compliance team, copying back all acquired information to PD team.Manage UPC process by assigning UPC numbers to all newly sourced items.Review pre-production and production samples by providing comments and suggestions on functionality and adherence to specs and present findings to studio Team and PD Managers.Perform competitive shopping both in store and on-line for new product ideas; recommend viable items to be developed by the company. WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or other related field or equivalent level of on-the-job training.1-3 years of experience in a product development, marketing, procurement, retail management, or other relevant role.Proficient in Microsoft Office programs, particularly Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams.Strong administrative skills including close attention to detail, organizational skills, and excellent oral and written communication abilities.Flexible and adept at managing multiple responsibilities with varying deadlines in a fast-paced environment. WHAT DOES DESIGN GROUP OFFER ME? We offer a comprehensive employee benefits package including medical insurance and 401k with matching program as well as a paid time off plan including family leave options.

Excel and Word.Strong organization and time management skills.Effective and clear communication both written and verbal.Must be at least 18 years old.Fluency in both written and spoken English.POP Fit Clothing is an Equal Opportunity EmployerJob Type: Full-timePay: From $70,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee discountHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayWork Location: In person

At TDW we put people first - that means working everyday to ensure the pipelines that run through our communities are operating safely and reliably. What sets us apart is our expertise, experience and commitment.  Each day we dedicate ourselves to treating each other, our customers and our community with care and respect.     Overview:        The Product Owner (PO) is a member of our Agile Team responsible for defining Stories and prioritizing the Team Backlog to streamline the execution of the Product vision. The PO has a significant role in maximizing the value produced by the team and ensuring Stories meet the user’s needs and comply with the Definition of Done. This role has significant relationships and responsibilities outside the local team, including working with Product Management, Customers and other stakeholders.        The PO is the member of the Agile team who serves as the customer proxy responsible for working with Product Management and other stakeholders—including other POs—to define and prioritize Stories in the team’s backlog.        Product Owner is a professional responsible for setting, prioritizing, and accepting the work generated by a team in order to ensure the most valuable and proper functionality of the product.        As Product Owner, you will gather feature requests, schedule releases, and coordinate sprints. You should be able to identify user needs, help a customer understand a business value and work with cross-functional teams to manage product releases.        Your effort is important for the company as you will need to deliver products not just according to user’s needs, but the product that helps make our company vision a reality.        Responsibilities    Maintaining and owning the team’s backlog. The PO’s primary responsibility is grooming and prioritizing the team backlog. Working with other PO and stakeholders to organize and prioritize work across teams. Serve as the voice of the stakeholders. Work with internal and external stakeholders to analyze the needs and align product roadmap to strategic goals. Defining user stories and acceptance criteria and accepting completed user stories before they are deployed to production. Contribute to Vision and Roadmap. Work with internal and external customers to analyze the needs and align product roadmap to strategic goals. Act as an ambassador for the product internally and externally and as the primary contact for questions related to the product. Represents team in front of stakeholders, clients or users. Develop appropriately detailed Functional Specifications for the product features so they are clearly understood by the development teams. Work closely with Product Management and senior management in order to create a product that fits the company portfolio. Required Qualifications/Skills    Quick learner to become knowledgeable about our products and services, and user needs. Strong business analysis, requirements gathering, and writing skills. Self-starter attitude and ability to work well within ambiguity. Creative and Strategic thinking. Skilled at working with stakeholders to drive decision points and resolutions and managing of their expectations. Ability to work with cross-functional teams to deliver on a common goal. Interpersonal skills and developing relationships with team members and customers. Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills. Organizational and time management skills.     Nice to have Qualifications/Skills          Experience as an Agile Product Owner.            Deep understanding and experience with Agile methodologies.            Extensive experience customizing Jira.

Wellspring is the leading provider of software tools to manage R&D and technology commercialization. Our suite of web-based software manages the transformation of scientific discoveries into real world products. We work with clients to accelerate the pace of innovation at premier research universities, Government Agencies, R&D groups at Fortune 500 companies, and leading medical institutions. Wellspring also operates Flintbox®, the largest online marketplace for inventions emerging from research labs around the world. Job Summary: We are seeking a dynamic Product Owner to spearhead the development of our Intellectual Property Patent Renewals software-enabled service offering. The ideal candidate will be adept in overseeing the end-to-end product lifecycle, ensuring that our solution not only meets but surpasses customer expectations. You will be the key liaison between cross-functional teams, translating complex business needs into robust and scalable product features. With a focus on streamlining the renewal process for intellectual property rights management, you will drive innovation and maintain the highest standards of product quality. Essential Functions:Craft and clearly communicate Product Backlog Items, ordering and refining them to ensure value maximization.Facilitate transparency, ensuring the Product Backlog is visible and understood by all stakeholders.Engage with the Product Manager, representing the market and business needs within the Product Backlog.Translate business objectives into detailed product requirements and user stories that align with our strategic vision.Manage the product backlog, refining and prioritizing features to ensure timely delivery of product enhancements.Lead agile rituals related to backlog grooming, prioritization, and demos, fostering a collaborative environment that encourages ownership and accountability.Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of the product and iterate accordingly.Serve as the primary point of contact for stakeholders, providing clear communication and aligning product vision with business goals.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business, IT, or related field; or equivalent practical experience.Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role in enterprise software development, it’s a bonus if there is prior experience with patent renewals or Intellectual Property management systems.Strong understanding of agile methodologies and the ability to adapt in a fast-paced, evolving environment.Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as part of a collaborative team.Critical thinker with a focus on problem-solving and continuous improvement.Passion for delivering high-quality products that meet the nuanced needs of intellectual property management.Certifications in Product Ownership a plus.Are you our next team member? We invite interested and qualified applicants to send a resume, a cover letter, and salary expectations to careers@wellspring.com. Please include the title of this role in the subject line. Wellspring is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Position Purpose: The Product Manager (PM) position is responsible for delivering business value to drive sales, improve efficiency, and improve customer satisfaction through the production of quality products. Within their designated enterprise product line, PMs focus on delivering incremental value by driving product changes and working closely with a team of developers, designers, and business partners. They support in-depth business reviews, communicate and present across all levels of the organization, and support cross-functional product teams. Key Responsibilities: 40% Strategy & Planning: Gains a thorough understanding of customer and associate needs, both existing and potential, and uses that knowledge to help deliver enterprise products that provide Home Depot customers and associates with an unparalleled shopping experience Translates business goals and end user needs into product strategy; communicates direction and product priorities to the development team, other matrixed teams, and third-party partners Identifies goals, metrics, and analytics to determine product value; continually making recommendations and refinements to the product backlog based on learnings Conduct end user research to help identify user stories and help determine Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Partners with Finance to understand financial needs and assists in the creation of business plans for new opportunities Monitors research as well as the competitive landscape to recommend the best solutions and ensure that products remain or become best in class Evaluates research and market analysis on industry innovations and technology platforms to recommend the best possible solution 30% Delivery & Execution: Ensure product is aligned with company, stakeholder and end-user priorities to drive sales, improve efficiency, and improve customer satisfaction Documents, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met Formulates, tests and refines assumptions and hypotheses through user research and testing Creates, prioritizes and accepts user stories; incorporate them into release planning Makes product decisions that drive value on a daily basis Identifies pros, cons, issues, obstacles, dependencies and value associated with features and enhancements Participates in standups, iteration planning sessions, product demos and retrospectives Condenses complex technical concepts into non-technical language for stakeholders 30% People: Fosters collaboration with team members (Engineering, User Experience Designers, etc.) to drive value and collectively identify and resolve impediments Acts as a proponent of modern software development practices Advocates for the end user and stakeholder by empathizing with and understanding user needs and becoming the domain expert Regularly works with the product team to continuously assess progress, disseminate lessons learned, and understand next steps Manages cross functional team and stakeholder expectations to execute on product strategy; provides education to requestors to determine prioritization based on tangible benefits and/or user experience Exhibit active listening, facilitate sessions, and clearly communicate at all levels (Executive Leadership Team, store associates, etc.) and in all formats the product's long term strategy which is used to prioritize short-term action Direct Manager/Direct Reports: Typically reports to the Product Management Manager or Sr. Manager. Travel Requirements: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Working Conditions: Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Minimum Qualifications: Must be eighteen years of age or older. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States Preferred Qualifications: 1-3 years of relevant work experience Experience working as a Product Manager in a modern software development based enterprise environment Demonstrated experience with modern software development product management practices and agile methodologies, specifically the extreme programming (XP) principles of paired programming, test driven development, and continuous deployment Experience working in a fast paced, fluid environment where priorities shift on a regular basis Experience communicating with and influencing functional and technical team members at all levels in the organization Experience working as part of a collaborative, cross-functional, modern software design and development team Experience creating, prioritizing and accepting user stories Experience conducting user research and testing to understand needs Experience identifying goals, metrics and analytics to measure product value Experience conducting competitive research and analysis Minimum Education: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diploma and/or GED. Preferred Education: No additional education Minimum Years of Work Experience: 1 Preferred Years of Work Experience: No additional years of experience Minimum Leadership Experience: None Preferred Leadership Experience: None Certifications: None Competencies: Business Insight: Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives Communicates Effectively: Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences Cultivates Innovation: Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful Customer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions Drives Results: Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstances Interpersonal Savvy: Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people Manages Ambiguity: Operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear Nimble Learning: Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder Organizational Savvy: Maneuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics Situational Adaptability: Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations Empathy: Understands the needs of multiple stakeholders and is responsive in meeting their needs with the most optimal resolution Plans and Aligns: Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals

column7: Workfully is the decentralized hiring & upskilling marketplace. The world's fastest-growing and most innovative companies use Workfully to hire & develop talent globally. The Company Our client is a cutting-edge software company, headquartered in Chicago, specializing in global payments, payroll, and Employer of Record (EOR) solutions. Our client's software empowers global organizations to efficiently manage their workforce across multiple countries while seamlessly executing payroll processes. The Role Our client is seeking a skilled and innovative Product Owner to join their dynamic team either in Chicago or in other locations. As a Head of Product at our client's organization, you will play a pivotal role in the ongoing development and enhancement, of a groundbreaking software solution that revolutionizes global workforce management. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and stakeholders, to define and prioritize product features, ensuring the company remains at the forefront of the industry. If you are passionate about driving software excellence and have a keen understanding of global payroll and workforce management, we invite you to be a part of this exciting journey. The Candidate  Collaboration: Work directly with 3rd party developers to bring our cutting-edge software solution, to life. Collaborate on a daily basis, ensuring alignment with project goals and timelines.  Requirement Definition: You will be the driving force behind defining and documenting project requirements. Your meticulous attention to detail will help guide the development process.  Relationship Ownership: Take ownership of the relationship with the provider, nurturing a strong and productive partnership that fosters innovation and timely project delivery.  The must-haves  Product Ownership/Management: Proven experience as a Product Manager, Director or Head in HR tech, payroll, or payment/fintech products. Your background in these industries will be a valuable asset in this role.  Developer Interaction: Previous experience working directly with 3rd party developers, facilitating daily standup meetings, and translating technical requirements into actionable tasks.  Communication Skills: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills are essential, as you'll be responsible for documenting requirements and collaborating with diverse teams.  Location: Ideally based in Chicago, IL, where our headquarters is located. However, we are open to considering candidates in Canada who meet the qualifications and are willing to work remotely.Why Join Us Join our dynamic team in shaping the future of global workforce management. As a Product Owner, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our innovative software solution, while working in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment.  If you're a Product Owner, or Manager ready to take on an exciting challenge in the HR tech, payroll, or fintech industry, apply today and be a key player in our journey to redefine global workforce management.

Product Manager, New Features Usable Machines is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make AI accessible to all. We are looking for a PM to explore a new product opportunity related to our human-centered AI product. As the PM leading this area, you will be responsible for working with the research team to understand the gaps in how people use our product today. You will flesh out and refine the overall product hypothesis, and validate this hypothesis with customers. You will also be responsible for iterating on the implementation until we have a product that customers truly love. You will become an expert in how the average enterprise works today, as well as some of the unaddressed needs of their existing workflows, and you will bring that learning back to the team. You will advocate for big changes and additions to our core product that have the potential to change how the industry works in the future. This is a full time role based in Los Angeles. What you'll do at Usable Machines:Along with leadership, help develop and build alignment around a product strategy for a new product opportunity.Along with research, you will do many rounds of in-depth customer research to validate and refine the product idea.Work with design to determine how to best integrate this product idea into the core offering.Help your team do all the things you'd expect from a PM org, like driving planning and prioritization, defining and tracking key metrics, collaborating on marketing, messaging, positioning, and go-to-market plansWe'd love to hear from you if you:Have experience with the ambiguity associated with 0 to 1 projects.Can take customer learnings and turn them into a cohesive product vision and drive internal alignment.Can think about systems-oriented solutions to complex authoring problems.Have deep user empathy and are able to understand complex product spaces.Have a design, AI, or psychology background, or if you have a love of tools in general.Love creating the environment for a happy, successful team.Are unafraid to do whatever it takes to make your team successful, whether that's sweating the small details, doing IC work, or going back and forth with execs to find the right way forward.Have an affinity for the fast-paced, changing environment of a start-up, a sense of humor and get-it-done personalityAt Usable Machines, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

column7: Education.com is the web's largest resource for worksheets, games, lesson plans, and other types of printables and online activities. We're looking to expand our subscriber base of teachers and parents from the hundreds of thousands to the millions. As part of this, we'd like to expand our offerings to cover an even wider array of tools and services that are useful to educators. As the product leader for Education.com, you'll oversee the product's evolution, determining which developments will make the greatest impact and seeing them through to completion. You'll be the primary problem solver and point of contact. You will achieve results by collaborating across the organization. You will work closely with engineers on detailed requirements, and you will discuss large themes and identify problem areas with the VP of Product. Success in this role will be measured by the growth in subscribers. Does this sound like an initiative you would enjoy leading? If so, we'd like to hear from you! This is a full-time position with a hybrid schedule in our San Mateo, CA office. #li-hybrid #LI-CC1 Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The base salary range for this full-time position is $125,000 to $180,000 + equity + benefits. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire pay for the position. Individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for your preferred location during the hiring process. ABOUT IXL LEARNING IXL Learning is the country's largest edtech company. We reach millions of learners through our diverse range of products. For example:1 in 4 students in the United States uses IXL.comRosetta Stone provides an immersive learning experience for 25 languagesWyzant is the nation's largest community of tutors, covering 300+ subjectsTeachers Pay Teachers (TPT) is a comprehensive marketplace for millions of educator-created resourcesOur mission is to create innovative products that will make a real, positive difference for learners and educators and we're looking for passionate, mission-minded people to join us in achieving this goal. We have a unique culture at IXL that fosters collaboration and the open exchange of ideas. We value our team and treat one another with kindness and respect. We approach our work with passion, tenacity, and authenticity. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions and we are eager to have you join our team. At IXL, we value diversity in age, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, political and religious beliefs, and life experience, and we are proud to promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. IXL Learning is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

expires on: November 30, 2023 LOCATION: Golden Vallery,MN-hybrid JOB #: 102167 JOB TYPE: Consulting CATEGORY: Business Analysis DURATION: 12+ months CLIENT: Insurance   Project overview: We are in the process of building out and delivering on a backlog comprised of features for the Inforce Annuity operations teams. The work spans across multiple areas and requires coordination across delivery teams (product configuration, integrations, digital for example). Inforce is defined as everything occurring post-issue on an annuity contract; policy administrations, benefit payout, death claim, accounting, tax forms and feeds, and customer communications.  Examples of work include: Correspondence and other customer communication output Changes to the system User Interface (business or production configuration requires partnership and coordination with other delivery teams and external vendor) Production support triage and fixes for defects and production incidents Tax features – tax testing, tax form build out and test (requires partnership and coordination with other delivery teams) Feature delivery – partial Roth conversion solution, UI (User Interface,) role changes for AML (Anti Money Laundering), Secure Act changes, Inherited IRA solution for example Business-related enhancements – could require product or business configuration or changes to base code Finance and accounting related configuration and validations BPM tool updates for task routing Team Methodology: Agile / Scrum Team Makeup: Product Manager, Product Owner, Scrum Master, Enterprise Architects, Developers across multiple capabilities, Quality Assurance, Business Analysts, Business Process Analysts, Product Calculation Analysts, and external vendor partners.  Product Owner: The Product Owner is a member of the Agile team who serves as the customer proxy responsible for working with the delivery team, Product Management, and other stakeholders - including other POs (Product Owner) - to ensure stories are defined and prioritized in the team backlog. You will articulate and determine the vision, benefits, and roadmap for the Inforce Annuity product. You will oversee and approve the work throughout the entire development life cycle including design of the product life cycle. You will collaborate with prospective users, and across multiple delivery teams to understand needs and translate them into product requirements, user stories, and sprint/iteration plans. You will be a leader and liaison between the product team and end-users for risks, issues, feedback, and improvement. Accountable for overall project delivery.  Team Delivery: Empowers the team to determine flow of work in alignment with team level priorities Creates and verifies stories are in line with the program vision and scope; accepts or rejects completed stories in partnership with the team Ensures the team is aligned to the Program Increment Objectives, and Iteration goals are clearly defined and communicated Helps remove or escalate obstacles to Product Management (tactical) Meets regularly with Product Management to keep stakeholders informed on how much incremental value has been generated Works closely with Product Management to plan and manage Program Increments Collaborates with Product Owners across other Agile/Scrum teams to ensure system integrations, configuration, and testing across multiple teams is considered and validated Works across teams to identify and understand dependencies and ensures tight sequencing of work Engages appropriate business partners to ensure the team has direct understanding for story development Works closely with external vendor to manage timelines and deliverables Refines team features and user stories in the backlog, ensuring estimates and story points are understood and accurate ahead of PI planning Understands impacts and trade-offs related to dynamic and ever-changing priorities Customer Voice & Product Expertise: Works closely with teams to refine stories and acceptance criteria to ensure they deliver a complete product to market Answers the team’s questions during development and testing, serving as a proxy for the customer Responsible for involving appropriate partners to ensure acceptance criteria has been met Provides deep product expertise and ensures the product is built in alignment with the product vision Critical Skills and Experience: Strong soft skills, can communicate effectively at all levels Proactive Negotiation skills Stakeholder management Decision making Able to influence without authority Self-motivator / driver Self-organizer Maintains a solution focus, facilitating “here’s how we can” versus “here’s why we can’t” mindset

Description:   Job Overview: As an Associate Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the product management team to deliver outstanding products that meet customer needs and drive business growth. This position offers a unique opportunity to gain valuable experience in product development, from ideation to launch, while collaborating with cross-functional teams. Requirements:   Key Responsibilities and Duties: Collaborate with sales or marketing representatives to fully understand product and communication needs. Conduct market research to identify customer pain points, trends, and opportunities. Analyze competitors and industry best practices to inform product strategy. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document product requirements and user stories. Assist in defining product features and functionality. Assist in creating and maintaining the product roadmap, ensuring alignment with company goals and customer feedback. Help prioritize features and enhancements based on business impact. Work closely with engineering, design, marketing, and other teams to ensure successful product development. Facilitate communication and ensure everyone is aligned on project goals. Provide input on usability and design improvements. Participate in testing and quality assurance processes to ensure product functionality and performance meet quality standards. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and user analytics to assess product performance. Assist in data analysis to identify trends and opportunities for product enhancements. Create and maintain product documentation, including user guides and release notes. Ensure that documentation is up-to-date and accessible to relevant stakeholders. Perform other duties as assigned. Required Skills/Abilities: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams. Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills. Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field (Master's degree a plus). Prior experience in marketing, product management, or related roles is a plus but not required. Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times. Occasional lifting and carrying of light to moderate objects. Willing to travel up to 25% of the time.

At TDW we put people first - that means working everyday to ensure the pipelines that run through our communities are operating safely and reliably. What sets us apart is our expertise, experience and commitment.  Each day we dedicate ourselves to treating each other, our customers and our community with care and respect.     Overview:        The Product Owner (PO) is a member of our Agile Team responsible for defining Stories and prioritizing the Team Backlog to streamline the execution of the Product vision. The PO has a significant role in maximizing the value produced by the team and ensuring Stories meet the user’s needs and comply with the Definition of Done. This role has significant relationships and responsibilities outside the local team, including working with Product Management, Customers and other stakeholders.        The PO is the member of the Agile team who serves as the customer proxy responsible for working with Product Management and other stakeholders—including other POs—to define and prioritize Stories in the team’s backlog.        Product Owner is a professional responsible for setting, prioritizing, and accepting the work generated by a team in order to ensure the most valuable and proper functionality of the product.        As Product Owner, you will gather feature requests, schedule releases, and coordinate sprints. You should be able to identify user needs, help a customer understand a business value and work with cross-functional teams to manage product releases.        Your effort is important for the company as you will need to deliver products not just according to user’s needs, but the product that helps make our company vision a reality.        Responsibilities    Maintaining and owning the team’s backlog. The PO’s primary responsibility is grooming and prioritizing the team backlog. Working with other PO and stakeholders to organize and prioritize work across teams. Serve as the voice of the stakeholders. Work with internal and external stakeholders to analyze the needs and align product roadmap to strategic goals. Defining user stories and acceptance criteria and accepting completed user stories before they are deployed to production. Contribute to Vision and Roadmap. Work with internal and external customers to analyze the needs and align product roadmap to strategic goals. Act as an ambassador for the product internally and externally and as the primary contact for questions related to the product. Represents team in front of stakeholders, clients or users. Develop appropriately detailed Functional Specifications for the product features so they are clearly understood by the development teams. Work closely with Product Management and senior management in order to create a product that fits the company portfolio. Required Qualifications/Skills    Quick learner to become knowledgeable about our products and services, and user needs. Strong business analysis, requirements gathering, and writing skills. Self-starter attitude and ability to work well within ambiguity. Creative and Strategic thinking. Skilled at working with stakeholders to drive decision points and resolutions and managing of their expectations. Ability to work with cross-functional teams to deliver on a common goal. Interpersonal skills and developing relationships with team members and customers. Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills. Organizational and time management skills.     Nice to have Qualifications/Skills          Experience as an Agile Product Owner.            Deep understanding and experience with Agile methodologies.            Extensive experience customizing Jira.

TrellisWare launched in 2000 with an innovative culture striving to push technological boundaries in the area of wireless communications. We are now a worldwide leader in highly advanced algorithms, waveforms, and communications systems that range from small form factor radio products to fully integrated solutions. At TrellisWare, we connect passion with purpose and together we make an impact- on our careers, our company, and the world. And you can too. If you love to innovate and collaborate in a dynamic environment where boundaries are being pushed, you belong at TrellisWare. Where the opportunity to serve is not a challenge but a gift. Where you're never going alone. Because there's too much at stake to go solo. Our people are our primary asset, and we believe that strong, cohesive teams are the key to leveraging brilliant individual contributions to even greater achievements. Our Product Management Team is seeking a hybrid Product Manager for Waveforms/Software. This position is responsible to define, develop and market tactical waveforms, software, and associated user applications. Enhancing cohesiveness and maintaining team morale is a responsibility of all our team members, as is the ambition for self-improvement and talent development. Through this dedication to unity and professional advancement, each team member is directly impacting the successful outcome of TrellisWare's deliverables and setting the tone for our core values of delivering excellence, pushing boundaries, and empowering people. The essential duties and responsibilities include: Define the products: Collect and synthesize information from customers, partners, competitors, and internal organizations such as engineering and business development teams as inputs to product concept development and product planning Perform market analysis for current and future products and technologies Develop and refine product strategy and roadmap with clear product positioning and rigorous business case support Perform technical and business trade-offs of various product concepts and features Develop and manage detailed executable product requirements-based product strategy and roadmap Define product price target based on market analysis and product positioning Develop the products: Owner of product's technical and business performance Working with program management, engineering, business development and production teams to ensure successful execution of product development and release Ensure that products meet all key criteria, such as specified functionality, performance, manufacturability, reliability, marketability, cost targets, and sustainability Perform product/software life-cycle management Market the products: Support business development team in marketing product and technologies to potential customers and markets. TrellisWare's products target the military, public safety and industrial sectors. As the key technical interface with customers, serve as the technology evangelist in promoting innovative mobile ad-hoc networking (MANET) product and technologies Gain deep understanding of customer and market needs and issues, and develop the right solution with the right products to solve customer's problems Support product related Bid and Proposal (B&P) efforts Write whitepapers and proposals to support marketing and B&P efforts Develops relationships with team members built on trust and respect. Education and work experience requirements are: Bachelor's degree in electrical or software engineering or related field of study required. Master's degree or higher preferred Past product management, product system engineering, waveform design/implementation, or technical management experience Strong product development background in tactical waveforms and/or wireless communication software is a plus To be considered for this position, you would need to meet, at a minimum, the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed here: Critical thinking in both technical and business domains Quick learner in both technical and business domains Capable of both strategic and tactical thinking Strong technical understanding of wireless communication technologies, including PHY, MAC and networking layer technologies Strong understanding of tactical waveforms and radio systems/software is required    Understanding of competitive landscape of tactical waveform and radio market, user experience, and user applications is required Experience in waveform/software development life-cycle management Experience working with both internal and external software development teams to develop, release, and maintain waveform and software products from conception through long-term sustainment Experience with tactical user-facing software systems/applications Experience with software defined radio (SDR) architectures and products Ability to explain complex technical information to technical AND non-technical audiences in an accurate but understandable way Strong presentation and verbal/written communication skills Ability to collect and synthesize information from domain experts, including external customers and internal experts. Understanding requirement management and risk management Ability to build personal and professional bridges across various organizations and to lead without authority Works independently, demonstrates initiative and interacts with a variety of technical and business teams. Demonstrates strong documentation skills and proficient with PC office applications. Strong collaborative drive and interpersonal skills. Strong initiative, proactive work ethic and prioritization skills. Trustable judgement and analytical problem-solving skills. Effective execution and decision making. Champion of change and promotes innovation. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Regularly required to sit for extended periods of time; frequently required to use office equipment such as PC, printer, telephone, etc. Able to regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Who We Are    Vermeer equips customers doing important work around the world. We are global, driven by innovation and growing. The equipment we make manages natural resources, connects people and feeds and fuels communities. We live out a caring culture, we demonstrate agility, we keep a focus on customers and are stewards of our resources. These beliefs drive our culture, determine how we treat others and steer our business.    Job Summary    Work Shift  1 - First Shift  Are you the type of person who wants to solve problems for customers and has a passion for digital products? In this role, you will create and maintain a vision for digital products and provide iterative value to the organization through software delivery methods. We’re looking for a curious and collaborative advocate to drive key business outcomes through digital products.      What You’ll Do        1. Maintain and prioritize a product backlog.        2. Establish the characteristics that define a minimally viable product delivering rapid value to the organization.        3. Identify business problems by leading continuous discovery activities contributing to the data value with key stakeholders and customers.        4. Demonstrate how software solutions meet strategic outcomes and support product adoption.        5. Develop, track and document key metrics for market share, return on investment (ROI), customer satisfaction and user adoption.    What We’re Looking For   Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Communication, Computer Science, Engineering, or other related field with one year relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Working knowledge of refinement and product vision related to ROI using software development lifecycles (agile, lean, waterfall).Ability to work in a highly technical, cross-functional, and cross-cultural team environment, with a strong orientation toward results. Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation due to a disability at any stage of the employment application process should contact Team Member Solutions at (641) 621-8767 or at      hr@vermeer.com  .    Interested? We’d love to get to know you.

The Product Owner in Claims Optimization & Transformation will be responsible for creating, shaping, and owning the digital vision and roadmap for claims products, prioritizing for agent and customer impact and business value to deliver Chubb’s promise digitally. Main responsibilities include managing stakeholder expectations, leading the product to success through representing the voice of the customer, defining and prioritizing team efforts, collaborating with team members, including the development team and Agile Practitioner to develop, design, build, launch, and enhance the product while also interfacing with other Product Owners across different digital transformation domains to ensure overall alignment. This position will work out of our Jersey City or Whitehouse Station NJ, Chesapeake, VA, O'Fallon, MS, Wilmington, DE, or Philadelphia, PA offices on a 3/2 Hybrid model. Key Responsibilities:   Product Planning and Strategy  Work closely with stakeholders to define product vision, roadmap, and release plans. Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, industry trends, and opportunities for innovation. Prioritize and manage product backlog based on business value and impact. Define user stories, acceptance criteria, and product requirements for development teams. Work with cross-functional teams to ensure product features are delivered on time, within budget, and meeting quality standards. Conduct data analysis to measure product performance and identify opportunities for improvement. 2. Stakeholder Management Build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, vendors, and partners. Provide regular updates to stakeholders on product progress, changes, dependencies, and enhancements. Manage stakeholder expectations and ensure alignment with product goals and timelines. Represent the product team in cross-functional meetings and present product updates to executive leadership. 3. Product Execution and Delivery Work closely with development teams to ensure product specifications are understood and implemented correctly. Conduct acceptance testing and ensure product quality meets user expectations. Ensure timely delivery of product releases according to the agreed-upon schedule. Monitor and track product performance, user feedback, and issues reported by customers. Make necessary adjustments to product strategy and plans based on feedback and data analysis.

TLDR; We're on the lookout for a dynamic and strategic thinker to steer our product development ship. This is a full-time position with flexible in-office or hybrid work options. But you must be based in/around the greater Phoenix area.  Intrigued? Here's a Glimpse into Our World   Before you dive in, get to know who WE are and see if it resonates with who YOU are. Apply only if it truly aligns with your aspirations, not just if you wish it did. And if you decide to come aboard, study this posting closely—perhaps more than once. Take notes, challenge yourself, just... make it a part of you.   Our Vibes We're a young, agile, and rapidly growing team.   Get ready for a fast-paced ride! Diversity thrives in our culture, and our passion unites us.   Our Core Values United Teams over Star Players Quality First, not Hasty Results Customer-Centric over Short-Term Gains Action & Experimentation over Endless Debate Wellness & Balance over Burnout Frank Feedback over Surface-Level Peace What We Seek in a Product Manager   You're a restless spirit who challenges the status quo and thrives on innovation. You're a dreamer, but you're also a doer. Your convictions are firm, grounded in logic, not whims. Resilience is your middle name, especially when faced with setbacks. You're hands-on, ready to delve into the intricate details of product development.  You're driven by metrics and can eloquently convey their significance to your team. Independence is your forte, and you excel at organization and strategy. Adaptability is second nature; you're always ready to pivot when needed. You acknowledge your flaws and welcome feedback, no matter how it's delivered. Outside of work, you're passionate about something, and you thrive when sharing that zeal.   Your Track Record   You've gone beyond the ordinary and pursued the extraordinary. You've managed projects that resonate louder than mere academic credentials or buzzwords. If you can provide evidence of your exceptional digital/product management footprint, that's a significant plus.   Your Knowledge and Skills Product Vision: You can define and communicate a clear product vision aligned with the company's strategic goals. User Needs Assessment: You excel at conducting research to understand customer needs, pain points, and market trends, translating them into actionable insights. Requirements and User Stories: Crafting detailed product requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria is second nature. Roadmap Development: You're adept at creating and maintaining a product roadmap that prioritizes features based on business value and user impact. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Working closely with engineering, design, and other teams to drive product development is your forte. Milestone Tracking: Establishing and monitoring project milestones and timelines is part of your skill set. User Testing and Feedback: You're skilled at coordinating user testing and gathering feedback to iterate on product features. Market Analysis: Staying informed about industry trends and competitors is a habit. Stakeholder Communication: Maintaining transparent and effective communication with stakeholders is your standard practice. The Role in a Nutshell Define and communicate the product vision. Gather and document user needs, requirements, and acceptance criteria. Develop and maintain the product roadmap. Collaborate with cross-functional teams for successful product delivery. Monitor project milestones and timelines. Coordinate user testing and feedback loops. Keep an eye on industry trends and competition. Maintain open communication with stakeholders. The Hiring Process Step 1: Application Submission  Step 2: Showcase Your Product Management Excellence  Step 3: 30-Minute Chat Over The Phone  Step 4: In-depth Conversation (90 minutes, Video/Physical meet-up)  Step 5: The Verdict  Final Thoughts   Potential, dedication, and mettle shine brighter than conventional credentials in our world. We're on a long journey, not a sprint.     Join us if you share our vision of creating products that make a real difference. We're not just navigating the waters; we're scaling the peaks!
