Innovative Chemical Products Group (ICP Group) is a leading formulator and manufacturer of specialty coatings, adhesives, and sealants serving the construction and industrial end markets. ICP Group is comprised of market leading brands known for innovation, quality, and performance. Founded in 2015 and supported by a lean corporate team, ICP Group has scaled rapidly through organic and acquisition growth into one of the largest coatings, adhesives, and sealants companies in North America. ICP Group is headquartered in Andover, MA and has manufacturing and distribution sites throughout North America, Latin America, UK, Europe and the Asia Pacific region. ICP Group is looking to identify a Junior Product Manager to join our team. This position can be based in Andover MA or Tampa FL. As a Junior Product Manager at ICP Group, you will play a crucial role in the development and management of our asphalt and silicone roof coatings product line. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including R&D, marketing, sales, and production, to drive the success and growth of our products. This role offers a unique opportunity to learn and contribute to the product management process while gaining valuable experience in the manufacturing and roofing industry. Responsibilities: Market Research and Analysis: Conduct market research to identify customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape. Analyze data to make informed product decisions and develop strategies for product improvement. Product Development Support: Collaborate with the R&D team to develop and enhance roofing coating products. Assist in defining product specifications, features, and pricing strategies. Product Lifecycle Management: Monitor the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to end-of-life, ensuring products meet or exceed quality and performance standards. Propose and implement product improvements and updates as necessary. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing to develop marketing collateral, including product brochures, web content, and sales materials. Collaborate with the sales team to provide product training and support in achieving sales goals. Quality Assurance: Participate in quality control processes to maintain high product standards. Address any product-related issues and work on continuous improvement initiatives. Inventory and Supply Chain Management: Assist in maintaining optimal inventory levels and managing supply chain relationships to ensure product availability. Experience needed Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, engineering, or a related field. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and teamwork abilities. Eagerness to learn about the roofing and manufacturing industry. Attention to detail and a commitment to quality. Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines. ICP Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or religion or other legally protected status. etdlamnhNl

Position Purpose: The Product Manager (PM) position is responsible for delivering business value to drive sales, improve efficiency, and improve customer satisfaction through the production of quality products. Within their designated enterprise product line, PMs focus on delivering incremental value by driving product changes and working closely with a team of developers, designers, and business partners. They support in-depth business reviews, communicate and present across all levels of the organization, and support cross-functional product teams. Key Responsibilities: 40% Strategy & Planning: Gains a thorough understanding of customer and associate needs, both existing and potential, and uses that knowledge to help deliver enterprise products that provide Home Depot customers and associates with an unparalleled shopping experience Translates business goals and end user needs into product strategy; communicates direction and product priorities to the development team, other matrixed teams, and third-party partners Identifies goals, metrics, and analytics to determine product value; continually making recommendations and refinements to the product backlog based on learnings Conduct end user research to help identify user stories and help determine Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Partners with Finance to understand financial needs and assists in the creation of business plans for new opportunities Monitors research as well as the competitive landscape to recommend the best solutions and ensure that products remain or become best in class Evaluates research and market analysis on industry innovations and technology platforms to recommend the best possible solution 30% Delivery & Execution: Ensure product is aligned with company, stakeholder and end-user priorities to drive sales, improve efficiency, and improve customer satisfaction Documents, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met Formulates, tests and refines assumptions and hypotheses through user research and testing Creates, prioritizes and accepts user stories; incorporate them into release planning Makes product decisions that drive value on a daily basis Identifies pros, cons, issues, obstacles, dependencies and value associated with features and enhancements Participates in standups, iteration planning sessions, product demos and retrospectives Condenses complex technical concepts into non-technical language for stakeholders 30% People: Fosters collaboration with team members (Engineering, User Experience Designers, etc.) to drive value and collectively identify and resolve impediments Acts as a proponent of modern software development practices Advocates for the end user and stakeholder by empathizing with and understanding user needs and becoming the domain expert Regularly works with the product team to continuously assess progress, disseminate lessons learned, and understand next steps Manages cross functional team and stakeholder expectations to execute on product strategy; provides education to requestors to determine prioritization based on tangible benefits and/or user experience Exhibit active listening, facilitate sessions, and clearly communicate at all levels (Executive Leadership Team, store associates, etc.) and in all formats the product's long term strategy which is used to prioritize short-term action Direct Manager/Direct Reports: Typically reports to the Product Management Manager or Sr. Manager. Travel Requirements: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Working Conditions: Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Minimum Qualifications: Must be eighteen years of age or older. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States Preferred Qualifications: 1-3 years of relevant work experience Experience working as a Product Manager in a modern software development based enterprise environment Demonstrated experience with modern software development product management practices and agile methodologies, specifically the extreme programming (XP) principles of paired programming, test driven development, and continuous deployment Experience working in a fast paced, fluid environment where priorities shift on a regular basis Experience communicating with and influencing functional and technical team members at all levels in the organization Experience working as part of a collaborative, cross-functional, modern software design and development team Experience creating, prioritizing and accepting user stories Experience conducting user research and testing to understand needs Experience identifying goals, metrics and analytics to measure product value Experience conducting competitive research and analysis Minimum Education: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diploma and/or GED. Preferred Education: No additional education Minimum Years of Work Experience: 1 Preferred Years of Work Experience: No additional years of experience Minimum Leadership Experience: None Preferred Leadership Experience: None Certifications: None Competencies: Business Insight: Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives Communicates Effectively: Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences Cultivates Innovation: Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful Customer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions Drives Results: Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstances Interpersonal Savvy: Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people Manages Ambiguity: Operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear Nimble Learning: Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder Organizational Savvy: Maneuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics Situational Adaptability: Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations Empathy: Understands the needs of multiple stakeholders and is responsive in meeting their needs with the most optimal resolution Plans and Aligns: Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals

Flex   is building a finance super app for business owners — reimagining every single aspect of the financial workflow and financial services for any entrepreneur. Flex is focused on the long tail of the market, especially undigitized industries like construction and logistics, with >$1.2T in card spend annually still up for grabs. 90% of its customers come from incumbents like BofA and AmEx.  Flex is a fully remote company and this role can be performed from anywhere.  The Role  We are looking for   product owners who are excited to be part of our early story and help us build a diverse and vibrant company. You will have the opportunity to learn and drive the creation of financial products and experiences to help our customers reach their full potential. You should have a strong sense of ownership and enjoy taking projects from inception to release. As an early employee, you’ll be working with a nimble team of committed and talented employees and having a large, long-term impact on Flex products and culture.  We are open to candidates from Canada, Mexico, the United States, and Colombia. What you'll do Drive the enhancement of financial services and products, including mobile apps, online account management tools, and virtual payment solutions. Continuously improve the user experience and add features to meet changing customer needs. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify opportunities within the organization's operational processes. Develop internal financial solutions, such as automated reporting tools, data analytics platforms, and workflow optimization systems, to increase efficiency and streamline operations. Work closely with compliance and legal to ensure that all products adhere to relevant financial regulations and industry standards. Mitigate potential risks through robust product design and implementation. Stay up-to-date with changes in industry regulations and security protocols. Conduct user research and market analysis to understand customer preferences, pain points, and emerging trends. Utilize these insights to inform product development decisions. Partner with engineering throughout the development lifecycle. Provide clear and detailed product requirements, prioritize features, and ensure the timely delivery of high-quality solutions. Implement necessary measures to safeguard customer data and ensure compliance with relevant laws. Utilize data analytics and performance metrics to assess product performance, identify areas for improvement, and make data-driven decisions to optimize products. Work closely with customer support teams to address customer inquiries, feedback, and issues related to products. Continuously strive to improve customer satisfaction and retention. Develop and communicate a clear product roadmap and strategy. Align the product vision with the Flex's overall objectives. Ideally you have background on personal or business accounting or spending tools, integrations with accounting tools.  What you'll need Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role at a startup with a focus on financial products. Solid knowledge of credit risk assessment, lending processes, and banking operations. Familiarity with compliance standards, regulations, and security protocols relevant to the credit and banking sectors. Excellent communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills. Analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data and market insights to inform product decisions. Proficiency in using product management tools and platforms to manage the product backlog and track progress. Passion for innovation, customer-centricity, and continuous improvement in product development. What we offer A visionary founding team with elite backgrounds and substantial industry experience. A substantial Series A round, providing ample growth and opportunities. A culture that supports remote work and values connection through semi-annual offsites. Support from leading Silicon Valley venture capitalists and industry insiders. An attractive compensation package, including comprehensive benefits and perks. Interested? We'd love to hear from you   At Flex, we value passion, determination, and honesty. Even if you don't fully match the job specifics, we encourage you to apply. Unusual career paths and unique skills can help you stand out. We believe diversity drives our success.

Order of Importance Strong comm Strong BG working with SW Development Team Biomentrics, authentication is nice to have Agile/Scrum team management as PO Preference for previous Wells, but not requirement. Primary responsibilities for this role may include but are not limited to:  Provide consulting, facilitation and support to the managers and process owners to identify opportunities to simplify and streamline business deliverables and processes  Support team's proactive activities and structured early engagement initiatives to ease burden of high-demand, short response time program requirements  Evaluate critically the effectiveness of processes, inputs, activities and time lines related to strategic planning and performance management and drive for improvements  Manage the processes to ensure the Authentication team is making progress on all self-directed proactive and formalized BPM (Business Process) and SAA (Audit) activities  Lead efforts to ensure accurate and robust weekly and monthly updates are submitted on time

We ❤ making a difference in the world. We’re a FTSE 100 engineering company with a difference. Be part of a diverse, inclusive and supportive team on an international scale with a friendly, family culture.At IMI, we make the world a better place through new thinking and technology. We design, manufacture and service products that control the precise movement of fluids. We apply our expertise across a huge range of industries, from industrial automation to life sciences to green energy to indoor climate control.Join our Industrial Automation sector, on the IMI Graduate Programme in the USA, University Park, Illinois, and gain unique product management experience.In this role you will learn key skills and processes to plan, develop, launch and manage our products through their entire lifecycle in a way that will deliver real value to our customers today and tomorrow. You will collaborate with Engineering, Marketing, and Sales to ensure that the health of the product portfolio is optimal and the value in our products is being translated to an outstanding customer experience. You will also use market research and interface with our customers to drive market-led innovation.By the end of the programme, you’ll have all the skills needed to grow in your product management career. You’ll spend two years running and supporting in several areas, on tasks including:Market research to identify market needs, including voice of the customer activities, competitor research, win/loss analysis, data mining to validate market segmentation understanding, and analyzing and synthesizing customer researchSupport development of product strategies and roadmaps, including defining a product vision, goals, and high-level themes that are tied with the broader business objectives, creating a product roadmap, and developing pricing strategyMargin improvement and 3C analysis for product lines (including 9 block analysis)Create and update go-to-market strategies by working with the rest of the commercial team (sales, marketing, and commercial leadership)Support execution of product rationalization strategy and obsolescence projects.Support projects to improve the P&L Performance and customer experience for the product line(s)What you needYou will need a bachelor’s or master’s degree (or equivalent) in Marketing, Business Management, or Engineering. We’d also like to see some key qualities in our candidates, including:A fresh, innovative approachOpen to new and varied experiencesExcellent organisation with the ability to work efficiently in fast-paced environmentsPositive approach and drive to developFluent in written and spoken local language.We believe that the more diverse we are as a company, the better representation and difference we can make for the communities we serve. It’s important that candidates looking to apply can reflect our safe, inclusive culture that celebrates difference.What we offerWe want you to feel proud and rewarded for the work that you’ll do each day. That’s why we’ll offer a highly competitive salary from the first day you join us at IMI. On top of that, you’ll also have access to a great benefits package. During your time at IMI, you will uncover and apply your strengths through supported and actionable learning. You will be empowered to own your own development, be a valued member of our One Big Team, and help us solve industry problems, capture growth quickly and continually improve.Our programme offers the opportunity to work across multiple locations, dependent upon business need, which means you may need to relocate. This could be within the country you’re applying for, sometimes it may be to another country.Code of Ethics:IMI requires the highest standard of ethics in all business dealings, particularly with customers, suppliers, advisors, employees, and the authorities. In accordance with the IMI Way: Our Code of Responsible Business.Changes to This Job Description:IMI may amend this job description in whole or part at any time.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $81,250.00 per yearWork Location: In person

ABOUT US We’re like-minded, curious, excitable people here at Chiliz who work well in teams, spread across the globe. Chiliz is a global blockchain company, which powers Socios.com - the creators of Fan Tokens, and the popular fan rewards platform. Socios has partnered with some of the world’s best teams, including Paris Saint-Germain, Juventus, FC Barcelona, Atlético de Madrid, UFC, Galatasaray, Manchester City FC, Davis Cup, and many more. The curious nature of a Chilizen is what drives this company forward, and since we’re looking to grow even more, apply for your dream role today. OUR BRANDS & CHANNELS Chiliz ($CHZ) is our digital currency for blockchain-backed platforms and products, as well as mainstream users, which powers Socios.com. Socios.com is the world's first fan voting and rewards platform. We produce digital assets called Fan Tokens for our partner teams, which fans use to vote in team-specific polls to earn rewards and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Chiliz.net is a first-of-its-kind mobile and desktop crypto exchange for sports & entertainment products. THE ROLE  Due to continued growth, we’re now looking to recruit a highly motivated, intelligent, and energetic Product Owner to guide the development of our Platforms. Passion and knowledge of sports and crypto industries are great assets that will help you excel in this role. Reporting to our Senior Product Owner, you will be working closely with our development teams to ensure that business, quality and functional goals are met with each product release. The PO is responsible for the design, usability, quality and delivery of a product or feature, and as the key decision maker of priorities, design, and works, you will ensure that all stakeholders are aligned to each stage of the development lifecycle. Finally, you understand both the engineering and business side of the product release and ultimately are responsible for representing the end user’s needs. Spirit As emphasized in the Agile manifesto, the Product Owner must master the “art of simplicity and prioritization” to optimize the per hour spent on each of the user-stories by a Scrum team and minimize the amount of work not done.Passionate about sports and/or crypto industries. Strong understanding and interest in the technology trends, exciting new features, and innovative ideas within the mobile development world.Well aware of the phases of development. Capable to share and communicate feedback effectively leading the team to a successful path.Full understanding of Agile methodology, with the capability to implement changes in a timely manner. Must attend Team-Agile rituals from Sprint planning or daily Scrum to Refinement and Retrospective meetings.Enjoys building strong relationships with stakeholders and the team to achieve the best outcome possibleProduct owner’s duty is to facilitate and make achievable go-to-market goals done at marketing or sales level. Responsibilities & Duties Collaborate with Technical lead to translate business requirements into user stories, that are granular enough to be achieved in a single sprint, for the development teams to implement.Develop appropriately detailed specifications for product features so that they are clearly understood by the development team.Make sure to gather all the materials required by the development team to proceed (wireframes/designs/assets/documentation) from the different stakeholders and to deliver those along with specifications.Maintain the Product Backlog due to the on-going nature of the job.Assess value, develop cases, and prioritize stories and epics to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy.Inspire and motivate the development team to deliver innovative and exciting solutions with an appropriate sense of urgency.Ensure that the development team always has an adequate amount of prior prepared tasks to work on.Must continuously engage the customer and stakeholders to ensure the Team is building the right product and therefore delivering the ROI expected.Act as an ambassador for the product internally and externally, and as the primary technical contact for queries related to the product. Daily Duties Writing new user stories.Splitting user stories which are too big.Specifying acceptance criteria for each user story.Refining the product backlog.Keeping in touch with every stakeholder of the product regularly.Giving feedback to the development team.Participating in Scrum meetings.Helping the team to continuously improve their process.Continuing to learn about everything Agile.Playing with the product.Measuring progress. WHAT WE OFFER We offer you the chance to grow, to learn, to flex your creative muscles and to work for a project that is providing excitement to thousands of users. Our interview phase is a 3-step process where you’ll be able to ask us anything and get to know your team too. From HR right through to your team lead, we need this process to work both ways: It's not just about you fitting in, but about us being the right fit for you too. Are you ready to work with the world’s best teams? Are you happy to try, fail and bounce back? Are you excited to keep pushing the boundaries of technology? We’ve got offices across the world, over 30 nationalities in our ranks and the most important superpower of all - flexibility. Our competitive salaries, wellness allowance, healthcare and pension plan are just the tip of the iceberg. You’ll gain friends, experience and a good challenge, we’ll gain you. Are you ready?

column7: About Us First Horizon Corp. (NYSE: FHN), with $89.1 billion in assets as of December 31, 2021, is a leading regional financial services company, dedicated to helping our clients, communities and associates unlock their full potential with capital and counsel. Headquartered in Memphis, TN, the banking subsidiary First Horizon Bank operates in 12 states across the southern U.S. The Company and its subsidiaries offer commercial, private banking, consumer, small business, wealth and trust management, retail brokerage, capital markets, fixed income, mortgage, and title insurance services. First Horizon has been recognized as one of the nation's best employers by Fortune and Forbes magazines and a Top 10 Most Reputable U.S. Bank.SUMMARY The Product Manager is responsible for the management of the proactive development, implementation, on-going enhancement, and analysis of retail and small business products and pricing, as well as, setting goals and strategies to achieve corporate objectives within the retail and small business line of business. The manager will also participate in merger related activities as it relates to the mapping, pricing, operational conversion, training, and client communication of products. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESManages the development and execution of the product development, pricing, acquisition, activation, cross-sell, profitability, and retention through on-going analysis, and provides recommendation for continuous improvementRecommends product and campaign performance, competitive analysis, and financial landscape to recommend pricing strategies to grow the portfolios to achieve corporate growth goalsRecommends product enhancements, consolidation, or elimination of existing products based on product need, profitability, competitive nature, etc.Manages approved product launches, modifications, and pricing changesServes as subject matter expert delivering product, target audience, competition expertise and sales support to sales teams and other support areasKnowledge of competitive products, fees, and ratesKeeps current on all regulatory changes affecting deposit products, and coordinate required changesProficiently proof-reads all marketing, client communications, etc. for accuracyDevelops professional rapport with all operational, management, and regional market areas of the bankManages external vendor relationships including managing and tracking vendor service levels, product training, and overall profitabilityAll other duties as assignedFollow Us Facebook - facebook.com/FirstHorizonBank Twitter - twitter.com/FirstHorizonBnk LinkedIn - linkedin.com/company/first-horizon-bank Instagram - instagram.com/first_horizon YouTube - youtube.com/channel/UCEVs5OMj-b0H9Dr5Q209_-QCorporate Diversity Commitment: We remain committed to creating a more equitable society, and that starts with our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. We do this by elevating equity, providing capital and counsel, and committing to excellence in everything we do. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

We are seeking a Product Manager who will be charged with creating and implementing strategic plans for development, improvement, and distribution of assigned product lines across multiple ACE Markets. Responsibilities: You will manage and coordinate all activities in the enhancement of existing products and/or the development of new products.  This role will monitor profitability, productivity and growth targets of assigned product lines and make recommendations/corrections to improve attainment of Club’s goals and objectives.  You will conduct market and competitive research to effectively evaluate marketing plans and goals, and to develop optimum sales/service effectiveness.  Represents the Club when negotiating with outside vendors and business partners.  You will be tasked with developing detailed strategy for product distribution channels, determine and direct how strategy fits with overall distribution strategy of the Club. Qualifications: Four-year college degree in marketing, business, management, or equivalent combination of education and work experience required.  Prior product management, product development or related experience required.  Prior budgeting, forecasting, and/or strategic planning experience required.  Moderate knowledge of AAA products and operations highly desired.  Ability to think strategically and transform strategy into actionable plans required. The starting pay range for this position is: $111,200.00 - $148,200.00 Additionally, you will be eligible to participate in our incentive program based upon the achievement of organization, team and personal performance. . Remarkable benefits:Health coverage for medical, dental, vision401(K) saving plan with company match AND PensionTuition assistancePTO for community volunteer programsWellness programEmployee discounts The Automobile Club of Southern California is part of the largest federation of AAA clubs in the nation. We have 14,000 employees in 21 states helping 17 million members. The strength of our organization is our employees. Bringing together and supporting different cultures, backgrounds, personalities, and strengths creates a team capable of delivering legendary, lifetime service to our members. When we embrace our diversity – we win. All of Us! With our national brand recognition, long-standing reputation since 1902, and constantly growing membership, we are seeking career-minded, service-driven professionals to join our team.  “Through dedicated employees we proudly deliver legendary service and beneficial products that provide members peace of mind and value.”  AAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer  The Automobile Club of Southern California will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable federal, state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

About Eleos   Eleos creates SaaS/mobile products that make truck drivers happier and transportation companies more efficient.  Founded in 2011, and headquartered in Greenville, SC, we began life as a bootstrapped startup. Today, we're an independent subsidiary of the Knight-Swift family of companies. Together with Knight-Swift, we share a solid commitment to building world-class software products for the transportation industry.  Eleos is a growing, profitable company with a diverse mix of customers - from small mom and pop shops to many of North America’s largest trucking fleets.  About the Eleos Team We’re geographically distributed and while we enjoy some flexibility in work time, we understand that our ability to collaborate and successfully execute is enhanced when we’re all working at the same time.  The product team is small, but mighty! The rhythm of our work week is one of relaxed intensity.    We’re proud of our products and aspire to be known for our innovation, reliability, and ability to make a difference in the lives of our customers and their drivers.  About this Role In this role, you will work very closely with stakeholders to guide the enhancement of the Eleos-powered mobile applications. You will work with a dedicated full-stack development team, guiding the work for that team.  You will represent stakeholders’ feature needs and prioritization within the broader Eleos organization and work with fellow product managers and other Eleos team members to ensure that roadmap features align strategically with the Eleos Platform. will engage with fellow product managers and other Eleos team members, stakeholders, resellers and other Eleos customers to identify and define solutions that maintain the technical integrity of the Eleos Platform.  This role reports directly to Eleos’s Vice President of Product.  Duties & Responsibilities Be the recognized expert on the product, relevant technology, the market and the competition Contribute to the creation and maintenance of user and buyer personas Business case development and requirements specification, including functional, UI/UX, performance, operational, KPI measurement, documentation needs, legal and billing considerations, etc. Work closely with Engineering, QA, Support, Sales and Marketing team mates to deliver new and enhanced features If applicable, pricing analysis and recommendations Launch plans / release milestones About You You have excellent interpersonal skills and a desire to collaborate with team members to build trust, confidence and influence You feel genuine empathy for the customer and a commitment to understanding their evolving challenges You’re intellectually curious and thorough in your attention to detail You have a strong technical background You have excellent written and verbal communication skills You’re organized and a good planner You have 2 years’ experience as a product manager in software development, mobile and/or web technologies You’re able to travel up to 15% within the United States Preference will be given to candidates who reside in Phoenix, AZ Perks A company that wins with unique, compelling products An organization that consistently delivers new product features No large-company politics Work-life balance is a reality Competitive salary and benefits Employment Type Full-time Industry Trucking and Transportation Information Technology & Services Computer Software Job Functions Product Management, Business Analyst, Mobile SaaS   Remote work is not available to applicants in California, Colorado, Oregon or Washington.

Overview:     The Product Owner plays a key role in improving value for one to three products. This position works closely with Stakeholders across the organization to help define products, understand users, and plan new features that improve the value our technology products provide. Successful Product Owners achieve this by building strong relationships with Stakeholders and others within the organization, clearly articulating what the product is and how it provides value, and using empirical data to improve the value from the product. This role will be focused on supporting an internal Platform team that includes infrastructure, operations, and networking requests.  Responsibilities:   Define the Product (30%) Collaborate with Stakeholders to create a product vision that identifies who our users are and how the product serves them. Partner with leaders within both IT and the Business areas to create a complete view of the product costs and any revenue/efficiency gains it generates. Track how new features and/or technology changes impact the product value. Planning (40%) Collaborate with Stakeholders to create and maintain a roadmap for the designated product. Partner with the Scrum Team and Stakeholders to create story maps quarterly for the planned features, ensuring the work is achievable and the customer value is clear. Collaborate with Stakeholders to adjust the roadmap and features based on learning including user feedback, business impacts, and changes in market conditions. Platform Improvement (20%) Identify core processes, baseline current state, and prioritize opportunities to improve. Monitor and reduce technical debt to levels that minimize impact to organizational goals. Utilize DevOps practices to help ensure fast, secure, and high-quality releases. Support the improvement of Product Ownership at NGL (10%) Actively contribute with the Planning and Delivery team to improve PO techniques, processes, and tools. Train and educate others within the organization to better understand products. Mentor Associate Product Owners as needed to help improve product performance. Continuously improve Planning and Delivery by investing in personal growth and training. Qualifications:  Excellent written and verbal communication skills Highly organized and detailed-oriented Ability to conduct thorough research Self-driven and motivated Demonstrated ability to thrive in ambiguity and adjust in a fluid business environment Make complex concepts accessible Ability to influence others without authority Ability to utilize data to drive decisions Bachelor of Business degree or relevant work experience can be substituted A minimum of three to seven years of Product Ownership experience User experience/research background preferred Life insurance/financial services background desirable

Product Manager: CAMPUS: Global Product Strategy & Development Summer Associate (2024)
column7: “I can succeed as a Global Product Strategy & Development (GPSD) Summer Associate at Capital Group.”  As a summer associate, you will assist the GPSD team in a variety of ways to help support the design and development of Capital’s product roadmaps. You will partner with more experienced analysts and specialists in conducting quantitative and qualitative research related to product design activities. This includes industry scans, competitor analysis and marketplace flows.    As a GPSD Summer Associate, you will perform one or more of the following tasks:      Long-Term Strategy Development          Gathers research and data required to develop long-term strategy and roadmaps            Supports the development and rollout of new capabilities          Product Development          Supports Product Leads in the creation, analysis and development of product plans and business cases            Serves as a resource in developing launch plans          Initiative/Project Management          Supports projects impacting a product line            Works closely with manager and senior specialists            Requires day-to-day guidance          Product Knowledge          Learning CG products and services            Awareness of competitive landscape and trends          Stakeholder Management          Serves as a resource to various internal groups          External Industry Interaction          Learning the industry          Additional responsibilities as assigned    “I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”      You are currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree, in junior standing, graduating in 2025        You have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above        You have effective written and oral communication skills with team members and managers.        You have the ability to identify, assess, respond to, and escalate risks or potential risks encountered through day-to-day activities.        You demonstrate intellectual curiosity and analytical skills in areas of moderate complexity.        You collaborate and work effectively as part of a team.        Demonstrates ability to prioritize assigned work and complete in a timely manner.        Excel and PowerPoint proficiency (e.g. advanced formulas and functions, pivot tables and complex charts) and desire to continuously grow skills      Base Hourly Rate: $30 / hour    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎  In addition to a highly competitive base salary, per plan guidelines, restrictions and vesting requirements, you also will be eligible for an individual annual performance bonus, plus Capital’s annual profitability bonus plus a retirement plan where Capital contributes 15% of your eligible earnings. You can learn more about our compensation and benefits here. We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Overview:   Company Summary   If you are searching for a fulfilling place to develop your career and an opportunity to make a difference in helping others, then keep reading on. Here at AAC, we have a progressive culture; we listen to your ideas, value a work/life balance, invest in education, and we foster trust and respect for all individuals. Our exceptional comp and strong benefits include, medical, dental, vision and life insurance. We are looking for our future leaders, who are not only going to fill the qualifications for this job description, but who are going to exceed expectations. Be a part of a team whose mission is to provide quality, compassionate, and innovative care to adults struggling with addiction and co-occurring mental health disorders. Our purpose and passion are to empower patients, their families, and our communities by helping individuals achieve recovery and optimal wellness of the mind, body, and spirit.  **REMOTE APPLICANTS Description:   Position Overview: The Assistant Product Manager is responsible for managing products as assigned by the Director of Product Management. This includes managing the product throughout the product lifecycle, gathering product and customer requirements, defining the product objectives, and working closely with the factories to deliver new products. The Assistant Product Manager also will be working with sales, marketing, and the factory to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met. The Assistant Product Manager must be a subject matter expert on their products including competitors, technical requirements and market activity. Responsibilities: Perform product line research and project management for market demand pricing and the competitive environment Be an expert with respect to the competition for assigned product lines and the subject matter expert for assigned products Contributes to the development of sales tools and collateral materials to support the product Recommend new product additions to product lines with supporting research Assist in training sales and marketing organization on new and existing products Work with the factory to reduce/eliminate product quality issues and identify cost reduction and value improvement opportunities Contribute to and participate in trade show support and representation when needed Initiate the setup of new parts with the Catalog and Data Specialist and Supply Chain Department Help coordinate product launch; including technical support to marketing for promotional material and packaging requirements Interact with sales force and customers as necessary to accomplish responsibilities Utilize tools such as AllData to research OEM information and data for date range expansion opportunities Analyze product line sales and develop relevant reports and analysis for management Recommend marketing actions to accelerate product sales Review slow movers recommending actions to improve sales and recommend products to phase out Supervise first sample quality approvals Support marketing with new product and now in stock announcements Assist in development of sales and profit goals for assigned product lines Assist the Product Management team in developing accurate and efficient SOP for the department. Assists the Catalog and Data Administrator in maintaining samples in the sample room and keep Sage 100 sample location data accurate. Develop and maintain relationships with customer, supplier, and industry trade association partners to facilitate the collection and dissemination of high-quality product data and promote assigned product lines Assist the Director of Product Management with product quality issues, quality improvement efforts, and management of the product quarantine process. Requirements:   Qualifications: Mechanical aptitude and general understanding of automotive parts Successful experience working with a project team Excellent project management, organization and analytical skills Excellent communication and people skills Analytical ability Customer service skills and orientation Decision Making Initiative Interpersonal – People skills Inventory Control Knowledge Project & People Management Skills Mathematical Aptitude Ability to negotiate successfully Education: Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science or marketing Automotive experience preferred but not necessary Other: Incumbent work hours/schedule and/or shift are subject to change based on business needs and Management discretion Other duties may be assigned as business necessitates Company has a “Zero Tolerance” policy regarding insubordination and/or refusal to carry out work as directed. This can result in immediate separation of employment Complies with Dress Code of Business Casual Attire Language Skills: Ability to read and write in English. Ability to effectively articulate and present information and respond to questions from Management in a professional manner.

CAMP’s Product Owners work daily with a team of product managers, application developers, QA testers, and a Scrum Master to deliver business value through innovative software solutions. The Product Owner is the primary product specialist for the development scrum team, manages the team’s backlog, participates actively in all phases of development, and is a key stakeholder in product related decisions and release planning. Our Product Owners possess an in-depth knowledge of product functionality and use cases. Responsibilities:Understand the vision for products and features and evaluate various approaches to implement effective solutionsCollaborate with product managers and other stakeholders to drive product specifications, product design, and overall product directionTranslate ideas and strategies into tangible product requirements in the form of themes, epics, and user storiesPrioritize development backlog items based on product strategy, business value to the customer, implementation cost, and resource availabilityContinuously groom the development backlog by recurring iterations of user story development and prioritizationSet specific objectives for each sprintAct as the one person in the scrum team who fully understands the vision and business value associated with all user stories, and communicate that knowledge to the team to ensure that implemented solutions achieve intended goalsMake the final acceptance decision on all implemented user stories based on whether the intended business value has been achievedReview and demonstrate product functionality with customers and internal stakeholdersEvaluate and articulate scrum team results, and identify opportunities for further product and feature improvements.Requirements:Demonstrated success in managing the responsibilities described aboveBachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, business, or marketing0-5 years of software product related experienceWelcomes solving problems with a positive attitude, teamwork, and innovationAn effective and persuasive communicator (written, verbal, presentation, e-mail, etc.), who is skilled at leading meetings and making presentationsProven ability to work in a collaborative environment - consulting frequently with team members to understand all issues, ideas, and suggestionsExperience with agile and scrum processes and methods is highly desirableExperience writing formal business/functional requirements and user stories, creating mock-ups, etc.Strong customer and user intuitionMust be able to grasp the big picture vision and have the drive to make that vision a realityComfortable working in a fast-paced environment with many moving parts where information, resources, and priorities can change quickly, and where information must be readily digested, and decisions made expeditiouslyMust be a proactive problem solver, innovator and able to handle multiple complex product features and tasksComfortable with managing large set of data. SQL Server, Oracle experience is a plus. Interest in learning about it is mandatory. We can provide the training and mentorship as required.Travel as needed both domestically and internationally.CAMP Systems is the leading provider of aircraft compliance and health management services to the global business aviation industry. CAMP is the pre-eminent brand in its industry and is the exclusive recommended service provider for nearly all business aircraft manufacturers in the world. Our services are delivered through a “SaaS plus” model and we support over 20,000 aircraft on our maintenance tracking platform and over 31,000 engines on our engine health monitoring platform. Additionally, CAMP provides shop floor management ERP systems to over 1,300 aircraft maintenance facilities and parts suppliers around the world. CAMP has grown from a single location company in 2001, to over 1,000 employees in 13 locations around the world. CAMP’s relationships with business aircraft manufacturers, aircraft maintenance facilities, and parts suppliers place it in a unique position to understand how current offline information flows in the business aviation industry to introduce friction to the global market for business aviation parts and services. CAMP is building a digital business that will streamline the exchange of parts and services and create substantial value for both CAMP and the aviation industry at large. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status EOE

Job Title: Assistant Product Manager Department: Product Development Reporting To:Product Manager Location: Newtown, PA Company Overview:   Just Play is a passionate and trend driven leader in the children’s consumer goods industry. Our products are an impressive mix of promotional and everyday items for the whole family. We work with the world’s leading children’s entertainment brands to manufacture and distribute exceptional products to every major mass retailer throughout North America and around the world.  Job Summary:    Industry leading children’s consumer goods company is seeking an Entry Level Assistant to the Brand Team to support several brands, managers, and categories in a fast-paced and exciting environment. This individual will work with key internal and external teams to facilitate product development and marketing. The ideal candidate will be an organized team player that can manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously while maintaining the highest level of organization.  Principal Responsibilities:  Support the brand team to manage and track day-to-day communication & development of product lines with both internal cross-functional team (incl. product development, Far East team, marketing, packaging, sales, and design) and external partners to deliver against key milestones and business needs. Maintain key development documents and systems including product line lists, product presentations, financial documents, and approvals. Ability to multi-task while staying organized with strong attention to detail and superior communication skills. Proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PPT, Outlook)

expires on: November 30, 2023 LOCATION: Golden Vallery,MN-hybrid JOB #: 102167 JOB TYPE: Consulting CATEGORY: Business Analysis DURATION: 12+ months CLIENT: Insurance   Project overview: We are in the process of building out and delivering on a backlog comprised of features for the Inforce Annuity operations teams. The work spans across multiple areas and requires coordination across delivery teams (product configuration, integrations, digital for example). Inforce is defined as everything occurring post-issue on an annuity contract; policy administrations, benefit payout, death claim, accounting, tax forms and feeds, and customer communications.  Examples of work include: Correspondence and other customer communication output Changes to the system User Interface (business or production configuration requires partnership and coordination with other delivery teams and external vendor) Production support triage and fixes for defects and production incidents Tax features – tax testing, tax form build out and test (requires partnership and coordination with other delivery teams) Feature delivery – partial Roth conversion solution, UI (User Interface,) role changes for AML (Anti Money Laundering), Secure Act changes, Inherited IRA solution for example Business-related enhancements – could require product or business configuration or changes to base code Finance and accounting related configuration and validations BPM tool updates for task routing Team Methodology: Agile / Scrum Team Makeup: Product Manager, Product Owner, Scrum Master, Enterprise Architects, Developers across multiple capabilities, Quality Assurance, Business Analysts, Business Process Analysts, Product Calculation Analysts, and external vendor partners.  Product Owner: The Product Owner is a member of the Agile team who serves as the customer proxy responsible for working with the delivery team, Product Management, and other stakeholders - including other POs (Product Owner) - to ensure stories are defined and prioritized in the team backlog. You will articulate and determine the vision, benefits, and roadmap for the Inforce Annuity product. You will oversee and approve the work throughout the entire development life cycle including design of the product life cycle. You will collaborate with prospective users, and across multiple delivery teams to understand needs and translate them into product requirements, user stories, and sprint/iteration plans. You will be a leader and liaison between the product team and end-users for risks, issues, feedback, and improvement. Accountable for overall project delivery.  Team Delivery: Empowers the team to determine flow of work in alignment with team level priorities Creates and verifies stories are in line with the program vision and scope; accepts or rejects completed stories in partnership with the team Ensures the team is aligned to the Program Increment Objectives, and Iteration goals are clearly defined and communicated Helps remove or escalate obstacles to Product Management (tactical) Meets regularly with Product Management to keep stakeholders informed on how much incremental value has been generated Works closely with Product Management to plan and manage Program Increments Collaborates with Product Owners across other Agile/Scrum teams to ensure system integrations, configuration, and testing across multiple teams is considered and validated Works across teams to identify and understand dependencies and ensures tight sequencing of work Engages appropriate business partners to ensure the team has direct understanding for story development Works closely with external vendor to manage timelines and deliverables Refines team features and user stories in the backlog, ensuring estimates and story points are understood and accurate ahead of PI planning Understands impacts and trade-offs related to dynamic and ever-changing priorities Customer Voice & Product Expertise: Works closely with teams to refine stories and acceptance criteria to ensure they deliver a complete product to market Answers the team’s questions during development and testing, serving as a proxy for the customer Responsible for involving appropriate partners to ensure acceptance criteria has been met Provides deep product expertise and ensures the product is built in alignment with the product vision Critical Skills and Experience: Strong soft skills, can communicate effectively at all levels Proactive Negotiation skills Stakeholder management Decision making Able to influence without authority Self-motivator / driver Self-organizer Maintains a solution focus, facilitating “here’s how we can” versus “here’s why we can’t” mindset

Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.   At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We’re not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.   As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.   Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities. The Role  We are looking for a Product Manager to join an energized product management team who will be in charge of implementing the NA Product strategy for the data offering in North America.   You will actively collaborate in the identification, analysis, and selection of available data sources and implementation of the needed quality and monitoring procedures according to the company-identified standards. The Product Manager will interact at various levels with customer success, services, data operation, sales teams, marketing & the research center to ensure that all processes reflect local market specificities and deliver use value. You shall engage with clients and/or specific events at the local level if requested.   If you have a passion for data and quality – this is a great opportunity for you! Your role will be remote with team meeting trips to our Veeva Office in Fort Washington, PA. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range above or below, depending on experience and location. We look at compensation for each individual and base our offer on your unique qualifications, experience, and expected contributions. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation in addition to base salary, such as variable bonus and/or stock bonus.   #LI-RemoteUS     Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. As our Associate Enterprise Product Owner (Guidewire), you will be responsible for supporting the product vision and high-level priorities and communicating the product vision, strategy, and direction to the product development team. In addition, you will champion the interests of our insurance stakeholders to support our ACE initiatives for service quality, growth, product expansion, and innovation.  What You’ll Do  You’ll participate in team stand-ups and retrospective meetings. Facilitate iteration planning meetings.  You’ll understand the product vision, high-level priorities, and business goals from the Product Owner. And as a dedicated, co-located member of the product team, communicate product vision, strategy, and direction to the product development team.  You’ll facilitate collaboration between stakeholders to define the business needs, then work with the product teams to identify solutions that drive business value.  You’ll convert high-level business priorities into the product backlog and user stories. Create acceptance criteria for user stories in the backlog.  You’ll work with the product development team to understand flow and rules in order to provide application design. Collaborate with the product development team to document requirements and formulate usability and acceptance tests.  You’ll convert insights from user and usability tests into backlog items and user stories.  You’ll determine the next build to release. Write release notes. Monitor defect reporting and convert defects into product backlog.  Cultivate relationships with external vendors, partners, and development team members in the development of technology products. Produce and deliver executive and stakeholder presentations.  Facilitate change management with internal employees impacted by new deliverables to ensure adoption of new technologies.  Maintain a high level of skill and current knowledge of product line and apply knowledge in creation of flow and rules that help guide the development of product initiatives.  What You’ll Need  To have developed detailed user stories, which may include some or all of the following supplemental information: business process flows, data flows, sequence diagrams, and activity diagrams. Prioritize the product backlog.  Product management, product development, Agile product owner or related experience for enterprise products or programs preferred.  Clear understanding of user interface (UI) and the basic principles and design qualities that have been shown to make web applications easier to use.  Experience with Insurance (Guidewire products and operations highly desired.  Experience managing business stakeholders that have competing priorities.  Experience leading qualitative and quantitative consumer research preferred.  Experience converting high-level priorities into product backlog.  Experience creating acceptance criteria for user stories.  Experience creating business process flows, data flows, sequence diagrams, and activity diagrams.  User-centric /customer-centric focused, embrace Agile practices, and possess a learning mindset.  Budgeting, forecasting, and/or strategic planning experience required.  #LI-RA1 The starting pay range for this position is: $111,200.00 - $148,200.00 Additionally, you will be eligible to participate in our incentive program based upon the achievement of organization, team and personal performance. . We have 14,000 employees in 21 states helping 17 million members. The strength of our organization is our employees. Bringing together and supporting different cultures, backgrounds, personalities, and strengths creates a team capable of delivering legendary, lifetime service to our members. When we embrace our diversity – we win. All of Us! With our national brand recognition, long-standing reputation since 1902, and constantly growing membership, we are seeking career-minded, service-driven professionals to join our team.  “Through dedicated employees we proudly deliver legendary service and beneficial products that provide members peace of mind and value.”  AAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer  The Automobile Club of Southern California will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable federal, state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Job Summary:  You will be a key member of the product team that is responsible for setting and executing your product’s business strategy and addressing your market's key problems. You will leverage your business acumen, industry expertise and market data to execute product strategies that delight customers and sustain revenue growth for the future. You will discover, analyze and solve transit market problems through frequent engagement and observation of your customers. Using verified market data, you will produce a product vision, communicate and evangelize that vision to your customer and stakeholders, and execute the strategies to make that vision a reality.    Job Description:    What You’ll Do:  Aggressively identify market opportunities by conducting market research supported by on-going visits to customers Conduct competitive analysis and develop a strong understanding of stakeholders to drive product decisions Synthesize information gathered to develop a go-to-market product strategy and manage its execution Develop, communicate and execute a multi-year product strategy that goes far beyond today’s technology portfolio that is responsive to industry needs and surpasses competitors Work collaboratively with other departments to drive bookings and revenue by ensuring solutions are responsive to clients’ needs and able to be launched, deployed and supported successfully and efficiently Manage the product life cycle from strategic planning to tactical execution Act as product evangelist both internally and externally Balance long-term investments in enabling technology and vision with short-term product requirements; including when to build vs. buy vs partner, or change from one technology to another Identify, analyze and manage technical debt with your product Measure and manage product quality Analyze key performance metrics to measure effectiveness and drive improvements Deliver compelling presentations to stakeholders of all levels of an organization Facilitate objective Win/Loss Analysis of deals Analyzing potential partner relationships for the product Analyze and keep abreast of trends in technology and your market REQUIREMENTS  Previous experience working in a B2B product management role for a SaaS business that delivers enterprise solutions Bachelors/Masters in Computer Science, Business, Marketing or Engineering or equivalent experience Effective presentation ability to influencers, senior executives, and industry audiences Decisive and concise - making strategy, product features, pricing and other important product messages clear and unambiguous for internal and external stakeholders Excellent customer rapport and proven ability to defuse tense situations and help customers see solutions to problems with our products. Experience in waterfall, agile and hybrid delivery methodologies Ability to travel up to 25% within North America PREFERRED EXPERIENCE  Experience working in a customer-facing role within the transit technology industry or other public sector markets Practical experience with Pragmatic Marketing and its application   Worker Type:  Regular

About Eleos   Eleos creates SaaS/mobile products that make truck drivers happier and transportation companies more efficient.  Founded in 2011, and headquartered in Greenville, SC, we began life as a bootstrapped startup. Today, we're an independent subsidiary of the Knight-Swift family of companies. Together with Knight-Swift, we share a solid commitment to building world-class software products for the transportation industry.  Eleos is a growing, profitable company with a diverse mix of customers - from small mom and pop shops to many of North America’s largest trucking fleets.  About the Eleos Team We’re geographically distributed and while we enjoy some flexibility in work time, we understand that our ability to collaborate and successfully execute is enhanced when we’re all working at the same time.  The product team is small, but mighty! The rhythm of our work week is one of relaxed intensity.    We’re proud of our products and aspire to be known for our innovation, reliability, and ability to make a difference in the lives of our customers and their drivers.  About this Role In this role, you will work very closely with stakeholders to guide the enhancement of the Eleos-powered mobile applications. You will work with a dedicated full-stack development team, guiding the work for that team.  You will represent stakeholders’ feature needs and prioritization within the broader Eleos organization and work with fellow product managers and other Eleos team members to ensure that roadmap features align strategically with the Eleos Platform. will engage with fellow product managers and other Eleos team members, stakeholders, resellers and other Eleos customers to identify and define solutions that maintain the technical integrity of the Eleos Platform.  This role reports directly to Eleos’s Vice President of Product.  Duties & Responsibilities Be the recognized expert on the product, relevant technology, the market and the competition Contribute to the creation and maintenance of user and buyer personas Business case development and requirements specification, including functional, UI/UX, performance, operational, KPI measurement, documentation needs, legal and billing considerations, etc. Work closely with Engineering, QA, Support, Sales and Marketing team mates to deliver new and enhanced features If applicable, pricing analysis and recommendations Launch plans / release milestones About You You have excellent interpersonal skills and a desire to collaborate with team members to build trust, confidence and influence You feel genuine empathy for the customer and a commitment to understanding their evolving challenges You’re intellectually curious and thorough in your attention to detail You have a strong technical background You have excellent written and verbal communication skills You’re organized and a good planner You have 2 years’ experience as a product manager in software development, mobile and/or web technologies You’re able to travel up to 15% within the United States Preference will be given to candidates who reside in Phoenix, AZ Perks A company that wins with unique, compelling products An organization that consistently delivers new product features No large-company politics Work-life balance is a reality Competitive salary and benefits Employment Type Full-time Industry Trucking and Transportation Information Technology & Services Computer Software Job Functions Product Management, Business Analyst, Mobile SaaS   Remote work is not available to applicants in California, Colorado, Oregon or Washington.

Company Overview: HomeServe USA Corp. is a Great Place to Work, and while we’re biased, we’re not just saying that. We’re proud to have been certified as a Great place to Work the last four years. For the 5 million Customers we serve, that means being there when they have an emergency home repair need, such as getting their a/c working, clearing their clogged pipes, or fixing broken electrical systems. At HomeServe USA Corp., everyone is welcome. We know that having diverse teams has a positive impact on our work and ultimately helps us better serve our customers. Product Manager: Product Owner: CSAT Squad (Providing Care Unit)
column7: Focus Area - EDIS, OR management, tracking board    Travel: Up to 50%    CPSI's EHR Acute care business is undergoing an Agile transformation. We are looking for a Product Owner who can maximizing the value delivered by the team and ensuring that the Team Backlog is aligned with customer and stakeholder needs. The Product squad is here to build awesome products & features that deliver on the roadmap quickly for our customers!    Product Owners are accountable for defining the why, who, and what — why it is worthwhile to develop a product, who the product is for, and what features the product should contain. Product owners own a product in its entirety; they have the final word on strategic and tactical product decisions. You are responsible for maintaining the product backlog and maximizing the value the product creates for the users, customers and business. This includes championing a vision, meeting with stakeholders and customers and knowing when to say no.  POs who are empowered, knowledgeable, empathetic, available and   decisive will be successful at their role.    Who you are:  Customer Delighter: As a product owner, you have to listen to what your stakeholders want, as well as anticipate customer needs. Storyteller: Be able to articulate what will transform that story into a product feature to delight the end user. Delegator: Create safety and accountability by delegating task/ceremony facilitation when possible. Knowledge Broker: Enable collaboration and empower the developers by finding the right people for them to talk to. Conflict Resolver: You have to have the courage and the capability to engage when things get difficult and be able to mediate to get to a solution. Effective Escalator: Be able to calmly and effectively provide feedback to Product Strategy and General Managers if you see goals that could fit together or not fit together, inside or outside of your unit. Willingness to travel as needed The skills you bring:    Define the overall vision in partnership with Product Strategy and General Manager and take the vision of the product strategy and translate the work into user stories.    Work to implement those work items, which includes:  Managing and prioritizing the backlog to ensure the product backlog is stocked with clearly expressed items that help reach the product goal Regularly updating and refining the backlog together with the squad Be a liaison between product and development, where needed – they help to explain and translate the how and why Collect feedback from users, customers, and stakeholders on the product increments Manage interdependencies between squad/team Enable collaboration, removing impediments to empower the squad to find solutions to move the work forward Take ownership of the work product and how it’s delivered. This includes being brave enough to have hard conversations, creating trust in the squad, calmly explaining impediments and being able to pivot at a moment’s notice   Why Join Our Team?    If you join us, you will receive:  Work remotely with a work/life balance approach Robust benefits offering, including 401(k) Generous time off allotments 10 paid holidays annually Employer-paid short term disability and life insurance Paid Parental Leave

“I can succeed as a Wealth Management Product Specialist at Capital Group.”    The Wealth Management (WM) Product Management team exists to grow and scale our WM product business by advocating for the client through the ongoing management and continuous improvement of our suite of WM products and services.    A WM Product Specialist is an integral member of Capital Group’s Product Management effort. The Product Specialist will help to build and maintain a comprehensive product strategy and deliver on business plan commitments.    “I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”  You will provide input to internal partners regarding product portfolio and enhancement requests. You can identify trends in feedback /questions received from internal and external business partners You stay connect to industry trends and competitive knowledge; participates in regular forums to understand customer and market feedback You will participate in impact assessments, including consideration of product construction and fees/pricing, operational policies, service model and sales and marketing approach You will participate on assigned projects and business initiatives impacting the product line and in support of business priorities: You will interact with cross-functional teams and provide input to project timeline and resources to drive enhancements to existing offerings You will be a resource with cross functional partners to provide input on product rollout plans and sales force training You will provide your input to the development and participates in the execution of go-to-market strategies You will be responsible for monitoring and escalating changes to project plan based on current impediments, gathers data for manager or senior manager to assess all risk areas and scale of impact   ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎  Los Angeles Base Salary Range: $80,020-$128,032    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎    ‎  In addition to a highly competitive base salary, per plan guidelines, restrictions and vesting requirements, you also will be eligible for an individual annual performance bonus, plus Capital’s annual profitability bonus plus a retirement plan where Capital contributes 15% of your eligible earnings.
