Product Manager: Product Owner, CPB Platform and Aggregator
column7: Discover. A brighter future. With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.  Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover. Job Description: Join a fantastic product team passionate about enabling customer journeys with frictionless, defect-free credit card capabilities.  As the Product Owner for the Card Posting & Billing (CPB) Platform and Aggregator team, you will work closely with Business and Technology to drive priority initiatives across Discover Card. This product team owns several foundational, business-critical aggregator APIs. You will be responsible for driving and delivering the product vision and modernization roadmap.  Strong technical understanding, communication and collaboration across stakeholders, and the ability to multi-task across multiple initiatives will be key for success. What You’ll Do Ensure an outcome for a product is delivered that meets the requests from stakeholders and customers. This requires a fundamental understanding of the business and its constraints (financial, marketing, compliance, legal, service, the customer environment, the technical capabilities, the user experience, etc.) in order to provide a solution that satisfies all stakeholders and customers. How You’ll Do It Interacts and collaborates with stakeholders on key product considerations and aligns with product vision, features and roadmap. Leverages customer insights, feedback, financials, compliance and risk data to define product features and roadmap in partnership with other SMEs. Establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) for the product team and ensure alignment with senior leadership (e.g., SPO, Dir, etc.). Creates and/or maintains key product documentation (e.g., customer journey map, technical specs, process mapping, etc.). Identifies and defines key non-functional requirements (e.g., security, availability, performance, etc.) to achieve necessary product metrics. Owns definition of Minimum Viable Product (MVP) and features/user stories for delivery product roadmap; in-line with the OKRs of the greater product vision outlined by SPO and/or Business Director is the final decision maker for product scope. Builds product backlog, prioritize its items to achieve OKRs and continuously keep it up to date. Holds meetings with the product team to continuously update product backlog. Ensures product features and processes align with applicable Discover compliance and risk management standards. Ensures product adheres to the highest quality standards, including releasing security patches not linked to customers. Defines functional and non-functional product requirements; ensure completeness; integral and consistent; source of requirements for product team. Creates and validates user story acceptance criteria. Defines and ensures appropriate testing frameworks for product features (e.g., market testing, functional performance, etc.). Works with Data stewards in their respective LOBs to ensure required data quality controls are identified and implemented. Inspect and evaluate product progress through each iteration. Partners with business technology to create technical features that are required to continuously optimize system components and underline infrastructure maintenance. Builds a culture of accountability and ownership by empowering the product team to make decisions as close to the work as possible. Manages dependencies with other team's functions while identifying, building, and managing strategic partnership across different product teams.  Qualifications You’ll Need The Basics Bachelor’s Degree in Business 4+years’ experience with Product, Business, Technical, or related In lieu of a degree, 6+ years’ experience with Product, Business, Technical, or related  Bonus Points If You Have Understanding of the agile mindset and experience with scrum delivery framework Experience using agile management tools such as Jira Experience using process management tools such as IBM Blueworks Live  At Discover , be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. We are all about people, and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career. Compensation: The base pay for this position generally ranges between $97,500.00 to $136,300.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. Benefits: We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:  Paid Parental Leave  Paid Time Off  401(k) Plan  Medical, Dental, Vision, & Health Savings Account  STD, Life, LTD and AD&D  Recognition Program  Education Assistance  Commuter Benefits  Family Support Programs  Employee Stock Purchase Plan  Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com .  What are you waiting for? Apply today!  All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.  Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

Overview:   Company Summary   If you are searching for a fulfilling place to develop your career and an opportunity to make a difference in helping others, then keep reading on. Here at AAC, we have a progressive culture; we listen to your ideas, value a work/life balance, invest in education, and we foster trust and respect for all individuals. Our exceptional comp and strong benefits include, medical, dental, vision and life insurance. We are looking for our future leaders, who are not only going to fill the qualifications for this job description, but who are going to exceed expectations. Be a part of a team whose mission is to provide quality, compassionate, and innovative care to adults struggling with addiction and co-occurring mental health disorders. Our purpose and passion are to empower patients, their families, and our communities by helping individuals achieve recovery and optimal wellness of the mind, body, and spirit.  **REMOTE APPLICANTS ENCOURAGED TO APPLY**  Responsibilities:   Duties and Responsibilities: Be a leader - orchestrate the work of a cross-functional team of developers, designers, SEO, optimization, content and brand development team members to build the best-in-class experience for driving traffic, engagement and revenue Partner with SEO / Content team to drive domain authority and derive high intent traffic acquisition actions for portfolio of sites Work with the PPMO to ensure resources are assigned and allocated, day to day activities are done in a timely manner, and proper reports are provided Leverage insights to highlight product gaps, identify growth opportunities, and drive execution of growth initiatives Incubate new initiatives to expand our ability to reach and bring people into our recovery programs Ensure that new ideas are prototyped and done in an iterative approach Work with all groups to find efficiencies to better grow revenue Make bottom line contributions for all sites under purview Make sure all growth efforts are documented and available to the entire staff Communicate to Senior Leadership and Technology Leads learnings and how they translate to project performance, and acquisition and conversion rate improvement opportunities Manage an idea generation program within the organization to collect ideas for site / portfolio enhancements from all teams (Tech, Design, UX, QA, Marketing, Call Center and others) Identify cross-role/cross-functional collaboration opportunities to expand knowledge across the team and the organization Find gaps in our existing portfolio and suggest methods to improve our product offerings and reach Qualifications:   Education/Experience: Entrepreneurial spirit and passion for learning Problem solving and analysis skills with ability to solve business problems, individually or in a group setting Experience growing new or existing products to record numbers Understanding of organizational dynamics, and operating experience with cross-functional organizations Well accustomed to data-driven, experimentation approaches in a fast paced, agile environment People and team leadership skills coupled with project management experience Ability to learn and shift priorities while maintaining organization and control Solid understanding of web and mobile technologies, integrating with other applications and products and scaling user growth Demonstrated growth in Product Management Physical Requirements   AAC is committed to principles of equal opportunities for all employees. Upwork ($UPWK) is the world's work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to large, Fortune 100 enterprises with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential. Last year, more than $3.8 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a Product Manager to join our Enterprise product team, reporting to Enterprise R&D leadership. The role involves working with top global companies in a dynamic and expanding field, addressing complex challenges as large companies explore new approaches to working with freelance talent. ______________________________________________________________________________________________ Your Responsibilities:Strive to build enterprise-grade capabilities with a user-friendly, consumer-level simplicity.Manage and own specific parts of the Enterprise roadmap, initially focusing on expansion areas but being adaptable to shifting priorities.Lead initiatives aimed at increasing the scale and capabilities of the Enterprise platform, including the release of new features and functionalities.Collaborate with internal teams, external stakeholders, and customers to create a product roadmap, emphasizing the achievement of desired outcomes.What it takes to catch our eye:Prior experience in product management within the B2B SaaS industry is preferred. HR Tech is a plus.Proven track record handling complex products or features at an Enterprise-grade level.Ability to convey complex concepts in a clear and understandable manner.Effective communication skills are crucial for aligning stakeholders and teams.Possess a strong understanding of product operations and how they relate to product management.Have a good grasp of technical concepts relevant to the product.Focus on driving foundational improvements and long-term strategies.The annual base salary for this position in California and Washington ranges from $124,000 - $185,000. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum salary for this position in California and Washington, and individual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Additionally, this position is eligible for the annual bonus plan or sales incentive plan and eligibility to participate in our long term equity incentive program. Come change how the world works. At Upwork, you'll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also hire full-time employees in 19 states in the United States. Our vibrant culture is built on shared values and our mission to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster amazing teams, put our community first, and have a bias toward action. We encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work and grow together through development opportunities, mentorship, and employee resource groups. And oh yeah, we've also got amazing benefits - including medical insurance for you and your family, unlimited PTO, 401(k) with matching, 12 weeks of paid parental leave, and a generous Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about our benefits and the employee experience. Check out our Careers page to learn more about the employee experience. Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. Partner with management to support the delivery of a product vision In alignment with the product vision, create and maintain a product backlog and continuously re-prioritize user stories that will provide the most customer or end user value Continuously align with senior management on the product delivery roadmap, defined Minimum Marketable Features or Minimum Viable Products and release cadence Review performance analytics; recommend and champion strategies to enhance the customer or end user product experience Participate in scrum or Kanban events (e.g. stand-ups, retrospectives), express new ideas for improving product value or delivery efficiency, sharing with leadership as appropriate Proactively engage established business process partners to ensure customers or end users are prepared for application changes and establish Day 2 processes Create a value-focused product backlog and continuously iterate, ensuring there are user stories scoped and prioritized Provide user story design, development and completion oversight; accepting / rejecting user stories based on the agreed upon Definition of Done and Acceptance Criteria Manage delivery initiatives and oversee development team (pod) backlogs Proactively raise issues that impede the efficient delivery of customer-focused increments Responsible for defect management and prioritization

PURPOSE: The Product Manager plans, develops, and manages retail and hospitality industry products to meet the needs of apg customers. The product manager must lead its execution from conceptualization through product release and ongoing lifecycle management. This position will manage assigned product portfolio growth and articulate value propositions for all the managed products. The high-level objective is to optimize product sales and gross margins to meet financial and corporate growth objectives. This role directly influences apg’s strategic direction. The successful candidate must develop tactical plans and complete complex assignments with minimal supervision. End results are evaluated against achieving goals and objectives. RESPONSIBILITIES: Own the success and profitability of assigned product lines, from initial product requirements through project management, market release, ongoing pricing, and end of life. Demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit and motivation to grow the business. Create and present business cases for new products, including financial justifications. Identify new and emerging markets for apg products. Identify product extensions that help differentiate product lines. Identify tangential products that complement apg core offerings. Develop product life cycle plans and road maps to ensure the profitable growth and expansion of company products and/or services, and to assist in the appropriate materials planning requirement. Lead cross-functional release teams through phase/gate product release cycles for new products. Strategize product positioning, pricing, and market messaging. Conduct market and competitor research to assess impact on apg products, including both competitor’s product plans and company strategies. Identify and track market trends in the retail and hospitality technology marketplace. Work with engineering, manufacturing, and supply chain teams to cost reduce products and enhance product line profitability. Create and manage cost down product roadmaps. Team with marketing to deliver product launch materials with correct messaging (brochures, websites, social media, presentations, sales training). Help create product support and RMA processes for assigned products. Provide technical expertise and training to other departments to support market penetration and acceptance of new and existing apg products. Participate in key sales situations for products, as requested or required by sales, including customer presentations and appropriate trade shows. Build relationships with the highest-level audiences at strategic and senior levels within both customer organizations and within apg. Own product responses for Request for Proposal (RFP), Request for Quotation (RFQ), and/or Request for Information (RFI) processes for assigned product lines. Manage the intellectual property for products in the specific area of product responsibility. Propose and direct apg product line simplification and standardization to maximize earnings and determine if unprofitable items should be eliminated. Develop and recommend pricing strategies for apg products sold to our customers to result in the greatest share of market penetration and EBITDA contribution. Participate in annual strategic planning, capital and expense budgeting, and objective-setting activities. Perform other duties as assigned.

Product Manager: Product Owner: CSAT Squad (Providing Care Unit)
column7: Focus Area - EDIS, OR management, tracking board    Travel: Up to 50%    CPSI's EHR Acute care business is undergoing an Agile transformation. We are looking for a Product Owner who can maximizing the value delivered by the team and ensuring that the Team Backlog is aligned with customer and stakeholder needs. The Product squad is here to build awesome products & features that deliver on the roadmap quickly for our customers!    Product Owners are accountable for defining the why, who, and what — why it is worthwhile to develop a product, who the product is for, and what features the product should contain. Product owners own a product in its entirety; they have the final word on strategic and tactical product decisions. You are responsible for maintaining the product backlog and maximizing the value the product creates for the users, customers and business. This includes championing a vision, meeting with stakeholders and customers and knowing when to say no.  POs who are empowered, knowledgeable, empathetic, available and   decisive will be successful at their role.    Who you are:  Customer Delighter: As a product owner, you have to listen to what your stakeholders want, as well as anticipate customer needs. Storyteller: Be able to articulate what will transform that story into a product feature to delight the end user. Delegator: Create safety and accountability by delegating task/ceremony facilitation when possible. Knowledge Broker: Enable collaboration and empower the developers by finding the right people for them to talk to. Conflict Resolver: You have to have the courage and the capability to engage when things get difficult and be able to mediate to get to a solution. Effective Escalator: Be able to calmly and effectively provide feedback to Product Strategy and General Managers if you see goals that could fit together or not fit together, inside or outside of your unit. Willingness to travel as needed The skills you bring:    Define the overall vision in partnership with Product Strategy and General Manager and take the vision of the product strategy and translate the work into user stories.    Work to implement those work items, which includes:  Managing and prioritizing the backlog to ensure the product backlog is stocked with clearly expressed items that help reach the product goal Regularly updating and refining the backlog together with the squad Be a liaison between product and development, where needed – they help to explain and translate the how and why Collect feedback from users, customers, and stakeholders on the product increments Manage interdependencies between squad/team Enable collaboration, removing impediments to empower the squad to find solutions to move the work forward Take ownership of the work product and how it’s delivered. This includes being brave enough to have hard conversations, creating trust in the squad, calmly explaining impediments and being able to pivot at a moment’s notice   Why Join Our Team?    If you join us, you will receive:  Work remotely with a work/life balance approach Robust benefits offering, including 401(k) Generous time off allotments 10 paid holidays annually Employer-paid short term disability and life insurance Paid Parental Leave

About VComply TechnologiesVComply is an agile cloud (software as a service) GRC platform with capabilities to manage GRC in an easy-to-use and intuitive environment that delivers business value, brings a contextual understanding of GRC to enable an organization to reliably achieve objectives while addressing uncertainty and acting with integrity. VComply was founded in 2019 with a focus to deliver a SaaS Cloud GRC solution that is highly configurable and adaptable to a range of industries with a particular focus in the mid-market. VComply enables organizations with out-of-the-box GRC applications that can be configured to exact needs of an organization with zero coding and zero infrastructure. Our cloud platform for GRC enables organizations to strengthen risk and compliance management.Organizations across industry verticals benefit from VComply’s simple and modular approach to GRC that transforms GRC management in an increasingly mobile, social, global, and virtual business environment. VComply is an innovative, intuitive platform that modernizes how people work and interact with GRC processes across the enterprise. It is used to collect, organize, link, report, and analyze GRC data with increased control, collaboration, transparency, and accountability.Company HighlightsWell-funded: $8.5M raised through Series A from top-tier investors including Accel & CounterPart VenturesTeam of 30+ and doubling in 2022Headquartered in Palo Alto, with offices in San Jose, Hyderabad, and Kolkata

Technical Product Manager Who we are We’re doxy.me (doc-see-me), the world's most loved telemedicine solution, and we're on a mission to connect the world to the future of healthcare. We believe that cost and complexity should NEVER be a barrier to telemedicine. That’s why we have designed our platform to be simple and accessible. Since 2013, we’ve grown to more than 1 million users from 180+ countries and have clocked over 7 billion minutes of telemedicine sessions to date. Our goal is to deliver a world-class healthcare experience to every patient and healthcare professional on earth. You can help us get there by joining our team of innovators, dreamers, and doers. Who you are We’re seeking a Technical Product Manager to drive product projects from concept to launch and bring high standards to developing product requirements that are informed by a combination of research, data and product intuition. Part of our mission is to always offer a free version of our product. We are looking for a product manager to manage our free offering as well as manage integrations with third-party vendors by maturing our SDK. What you’ll do Work autonomously and be able to take ownership of product prioritization decisions Identify, define, build, launch, and iterate on features that add value for our customers Be detail oriented and have excellent problem-solving abilities Work closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to take product ideas from concept to launch Translate a larger strategic vision into a concrete, prioritized plan that can be executed to deliver an MVP and iterative improvements Apply a combination of qualitative and quantitative research, customer understanding, and product intuition to inform decisions and prioritization Facilitate clear communication and collaboration across all teams and stakeholders Integrate with third-party vendors to offer more options to our users Your skills and qualifications Comfortable with ambiguity and an innate ability to break down complex problems Capable of synthesising unstructured data and inputs to inform prioritisation decisions Experience conducting interviews with customers to uncover product opportunities Drive to understand underlying problems, test assumptions and iterate on solutions Strong written and in-person communication skills, and are comfortable presenting in large groups Diligent with documenting and building shared understanding with all team members Takes initiative to drive projects forward within a fast-paced environment Experience with managing large cross-functional projects with technical depth Experience integrating with third-party vendors and making buy vs. build decisions What we can offer you We are committed to giving you the tools you need to do your best work. We will take care of the little things so you can do what you do best without having to worry about all of that other stuff. Here is a taste of what you can expect: A fun, flexible work environment (work from home or on location at one of our regional hubs) Competitive Salary Paid trainings and certifications Advancement opportunities in a growing company, Medical, Vision, and Dental insurance 401k match Unlimited PTO Our employees give us a 4.7 on Glassdoor. Logistics (Interview Process) 1st Stage - Screen with our internal recruiter 2nd Stage - Video call with our Head of Product 3rd Stage - Meet the team 4th Stage - Meet the CPO and VP of Engineering Additional information Doxy.me tech stack Frontend: React, TypeScript, Playwright, WebRTC, Next.js, Nx.dev Backend: Nodejs, TypeScript, Jest, NestJS, Nx.dev Cloud: AWS 3rd party: Vonage, Pubnub, Segment, Twilio, Stripe Our products: Doxy.me: The simple, free, and secure telemedicine solution currently used by over 1,000,000 doctors worldwide and helping over 350,000 patients/day. dokbot.io: Patient-focused data collection for healthcare. adhere.ly: Providing healthcare practitioners with the tools to ensure patients complete their course of treatment Our team: technologists, academics, researchers, and innovators from all over the world. English is the language used in all internal communication. To ensure HIPAA compliance we perform background checks after extending a job offer

Date: Nov 10, 2023 Location: Naples, FL, US, 34108 Company: Arthrex Requisition ID:       58795      Title:       Summer Associate - Product Management      Division:       Arthrex, Inc. (US01)      Location:       Naples, FL      Arthrex is a global medical device company and leader in orthopedics medical education. With a corporate mission of Helping Surgeons Treat Their Patients Better™. Arthrex has pioneered the field of arthroscopy and develops more than 1,000 innovative products and procedures each year that support all aspects of orthopedics. The Product Management team in Naples, FL is seeking graduate students for our Summer Associate Program. Students will be selected to work for one of the following product areas: Extremity & Trauma, Shoulder/Elbow, Imaging & Resection, Orthobiologics or Arthroplasty. This is an exciting opportunity for the high energy individual that would like to explore an opportunity in the orthopedics industry. Students will use their excellent communications, business and/or science background to experience the medical device business at its highest level. During the Summer Associate program, candidates will interact with all key departments that impact product development. The Summer Associate will possess an internal sense of urgency, passion and detail that is necessary when interacting with our primary customer, the orthopedic surgeon. Apply on-line now to be a part of this growing industry!This position will run from May 2024 – August 2024. The ideal candidate will have the availability to work 40 hours per week at our Naples, FL facility.Main Objective:To support product management team with primary and secondary research on key product development tasks, brand management support and the ability to use interpersonal skills with key surgeon customers and business stakeholders.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Research/Analyst:Conduct market research on existing and future product lines through secondary research sources.Conduct surveys, analyze findings, identify trends and format data for the product management team. Utilize Hospital Supply Index Database to gather competitor sales data and provide analysis on those competitive findings and trends and opportunities in the marketplace.Create and deliver PowerPoint presentations for internal teams to synthesize information, draw conclusions and describe recommendations for market development activities.Ability to verbally communicate and interact with engineering, product management, medical education, surgeon consultants and surgeon customers. Present a capstone project relating to one specific area of research or project management to senior product management team members. Successful completion could lead to consideration for the Product Management Development Program (PMDP) including one year sales rotation. Field travel when necessary (less than 5%). Marketing:Work at the direction of Product Management/Product Marketing with Marketing Communications to produce and post marketing collateral.Ability to build PowerPoint presentations communicating data gathered during research.Help develop product demonstration models and training materials utilized for national industry meetings, and onsite surgeon and sales rep trainings.Product Development:Participate in the product development process which may include interacting with all stakeholders in the product management process, either individually or with product manager. Work with product managers, engineers and consultant surgeons to help define product needs.Support labs utilizing cadaveric specimens in the evaluation and testing of surgical implants and instruments.Interact with business partners to complement product development needs and activities.Education and Experience:Master’s degree or PhD candidate required; MBA candidates preferred. (Students who have recently graduated are only eligible to work as a Summer Associate up to six months from their graduation date.)Experience in Medical Device Sales or Orthopedics highly preferred.An interest in brand management and gaining experience with surgical devices is critical to advancement in this program. Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:Intermediate to Expert computer skills. Be able to follow written and verbal direction. PowerPoint applications proficiency a plus.Machine, Tools, and/or Equipment Skills:PC; High proficiency with Microsoft Outlook; PowerPoint; Word and Excel. Fax; Scanner. Arthrex 2023 Benefits are:Medical Insurance (if 25 or more hours per week)Free Onsite Medical ClinicsFree Onsite LunchVolunteer PTOAccess to the Wellness Center (For South Florida positions only)All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Boise Cascade Company has been in the business of manufacturing wood products and distributing building materials for over half a century. We are one of the largest producers of engineered wood products and plywood in North America and a leading U.S. wholesale distributor of building materials. Because our business is built on relationships, our associates are critical to our success. We are committed to investing in them and that is why we offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to have a positive impact on all areas on your life – from health and well-being, career, and community, to financial security and personal safety, with many benefits beginning on your first day of employment. Please review the responsibilities and needed qualifications below and apply today! ResponsibilitiesManage and direct all overseas purchasing activities within the Global Sourcing branch.Determine appropriate product lines, screen and select overseas vendors, monitor vendor performance.Negotiate favorable payment terms, pricing and provide logistics support for inbound product.Provide BMD locations with product quotes, issue Global Sourcing purchase orders / sales orders.Monitor changes and milestone dates of Global Sourcing orders.Ensure all Global Sourcing activities are in full compliance with US Customs and international law.Monitor trade cases and rulings (Antidumping & Countervailing Duties) pertaining to products sourced through Global Sourcing branch from overseas manufacturers.Work closely with BMD location sales team and management to develop custom programs, block and special buys, promotions and product support.Monitor receipt of rebates and special discounts to ensure vendor compliance.Identify new product opportunities and design sourcing strategies.Develop and grow new relationships with overseas vendors, maintain good working relationships with existing vendors.Provide guidance to BMD locations through market information updates and following industry news to collect market intelligence.Demonstrate strong commitment to safety, quality, environmental awareness, and continuous process improvement.Qualifications Qualifications Basic Qualifications: College Degree or equivalent work experience in related job function. Working conditions are an office environment with minimal physical exertion. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in international trade / purchasing. Knowledge of international logistics and trade lanes. Process knowledge around importer of record requirements. Fluent in English and Mandarin. Our BenefitsMedical + Dental + VisionFlexible Spending Accounts + HRA401(k) Retirement SavingsAnnual IncentivesPaid Time Off (20/yr) and holidays (10/yr)Paid Parental Leave Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Product Owner to join our dynamic digital commerce team. As a Product Owner for our commerce website, you will play a critical role in shaping the overall vision, strategy, and roadmap for our e-commerce platform. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including designers, developers, marketers, and stakeholders, to deliver exceptional digital experiences for our customers. Duties & Responsibilities: Feature Requirements and Prioritization: Collaborate with stakeholders and gather requirements to define product features and functionality. Understand and document user stories to be understood by the development team. Evaluate and prioritize product backlog items based on business value, customer impact, and technical feasibility. Agile Development Leadership: Act as the primary point of contact between Product Manager and the development team. Drive the agile development process by writing user stories, conducting sprint planning, and overseeing the product development lifecycle. User Experience Optimization: Continuously analyze user behavior, gather feedback, and conduct user research to identify opportunities for enhancing the user experience. Collaborate with designers and developers to translate user insights into actionable improvements. Stakeholder Management: Engage with internal and external stakeholders to gather feedback, communicate product updates, and manage expectations. Build strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure alignment and support for product initiatives. Performance Tracking and Analysis: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and track the success of product features and initiatives. Leverage data analytics and user insights to evaluate performance, identify areas for improvement, and make data-driven decisions. Competitive Analysis: Stay up-to-date with industry trends, competitor offerings, and emerging technologies related to e-commerce. Conduct regular competitive analysis to identify market gaps and opportunities. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and customer support, to ensure successful product delivery. Foster a collaborative environment that encourages teamwork and innovation. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, or a related field (Master's degree preferred) Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role in an e-commerce or digital product environment Strong understanding of agile development methodologies and tools (Scrum, Kanban, Jira, etc.) Demonstrated ability to understand functional requirements and document them in user stories Excellent analytical skills with a data-driven approach to decision making Strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate ideas and influence stakeholders Deep knowledge of e-commerce best practices, user experience design, and conversion optimization Familiarity with web analytics tools, A/B testing, and user tracking technologies Join our team and be part of an exciting journey to revolutionize the way our customers engage with our commerce website. If you have a passion for product development, a customer-centric mindset, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we would love to hear from you. Benefits: All job offers will be based on a candidate’s skills and prior relevant experience, applicable degrees/certifications, as well as internal equity and market data. Regular, full-time or part-time employees working 20 or more hours per week are eligible for comprehensive benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, STD/LTD, 401(K), ESPP, Paid time off (PTO) or Flexible time off (FTO), Commissions, and Company bonus where applicable. For more detailed information, please click here. column7: As a Product Manager, Internal Tools at iMentor, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and enhancing the integration between our platform and third-party systems, like Salesforce, Campaign Monitor, and our Redshift Data Warehouse. This role involves not only maintaining the current ecosystem by supporting users day-to-day, but also contributing to the development and transition towards a future iteration of the platform. You will be responsible for defining business requirements, communicating effectively with engineering teams, conducting internal user research, and driving the strategic vision for the integration of systems.  This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic team working on transformative changes to our platform, contributing to better systems that drive connection for students, mentors, and staff. Responsibilities Conduct research to gain a deep understanding of the current design, data schema, and data flow within systems, as well as the needs and pain points of internal users related to system integrations. Develop a strategic viewpoint on the future state of systems and their integration and support the transition from the current state to the future state of integrated systems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and execute a roadmap for integration improvements. Define and document clear and comprehensive business requirements for system integrations. Prioritize requirements based on programmatic impact and strategic objectives. Manage day-to-day internal user support for the platforms integrated into the current ecosystem. Act as a bridge between users, product, and engineering teams, ensuring clear and effective communication. Collaborate closely with engineering to deliver seamless system integrations. Use user feedback to inform and drive product improvements. Gain a comprehensive understanding of how data flows between different systems and ensure data integrity and security. Collaborate with team to support other product management responsibilities for other areas of the platform Qualifications Proven experience in product management, specifically in the integration of systems and platforms. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with engineering and cross-functional teams. Ability to think strategically and drive product vision. User-centric mindset with a focus on improving internal user experiences. Experience with data analysis and management a plus, Salesforce experience strongly preferred. Passion for contributing to the growth and transformation of systems for the benefit of students, mentors, and staff. Demonstrated alignment with iMentor's mission, values, and commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Views differences between individuals (race, gender, age, cultural heritage, physical ability, education, beliefs, and lifestyle) as an asset and demonstrates an appreciation of the diversity across the iMentor community. Our organization works in partnership with district public schools across the country. In doing so we must meet all compliance requirements of those districts including background checks. iMentor is committed to ensuring healthy and safe environments for our staff, mentors, and the students we serve. In order to fully comply with the NYC Vaccine mandate, all iMentor employees (regardless of role or region) are required to be fully vaccinated priority to their start date. Compensation & Benefits Salary range $110,000 - $120,000 commensurate with experience Up to 100% employer funded comprehensive medical and dental coverage 18 days paid annual vacation (increasing annually to 21, 23, 25), 13 paid holidays + your birthday + one floating holiday, iMentor closed between Christmas and New Year’s Day, plus 6-7 sick days annually 401K match up to 4% Flexible Home/Office/School working arrangement Pre-tax commuter benefits Dependent care and health care flexible spending plans 1 hour of wellness time off per week for wellness activities of your choosing Flexible personnel wellness budget for reimbursements or marketplace purchases Every staff member is eligible for organization-sponsored professional development annually 9 weeks of paid parental leave About iMentor iMentor believes that all students deserve an equitable chance to pursue their ambitions. Our program builds authentic mentoring relationships in order to bring greater equity to our students’ educational journeys. Through these long-term relationships, first-generation, students of color from underserved communities increase their access to the knowledge, experiences, and resources required to succeed in college or their post-secondary pathway of choice, and to pursue their career ambitions.  By partnering with public schools serving primarily first-generation college students and providing every student in the school with a mentor, iMentor supports students’ post-secondary journeys with a level of depth and personalization that cannot be matched by traditional advising models. iMentor’s students are 37% more likely to enroll in college and are graduating college at double the rates of their peers.  iMentor’s Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion We believe that people of all backgrounds deserve equal access to educational opportunities. Recognizing that our country’s history of racism and systemic oppression continues to drive educational disparities for students of color, we give special focus to addressing the economic and racial divides that impact the communities we serve. We are committed to the collective work and intentional investment necessary to consistently move in the direction of educational equity and inclusion. Learn more at www.iMentor.org.  How to Apply Visit www.imentor.org/jobs to submit a resume describing your interest in and qualifications for this position, as well as a sample of something you’ve built (please submit a public Github URI or portfolio link with snippets on your contribution to the project). Applications will be considered on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.  iMentor is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Company Description     Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.     So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, offer buy now, pay later functionality through Afterpay, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.     Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.    Job Description The Square Customer Engagement team is focused on building the tools that help Square sellers acquire and retain their customers and drive more sales. Consumers have more choice than ever before on where, when, and how to shop, and have come to expect convenience, choice and control. Sellers are hustling to differentiate themselves and compete for these customers, but don’t always have the time, tools, or know-how to deliver on this in a meaningful way. Every part of the customer experience deeply matters, and having the ability to deliver cohesive, personalized experiences across all channels and touchpoints is key to our sellers’ success. That’s where the Customer Engagement team comes in – we’ve launched popular products like Square Loyalty, Square Marketing, Square Gift Cards and Square House Accounts to help sellers of all types and sizes in this journey, and we’re just getting started. As a Product Manager for Square Marketing, you will build products that help businesses re-engage their customers and keep them coming back in to purchase again. By delivering best in class tools that help sellers create and send effective and seamless email and SMS marketing campaigns, you will help sellers build a thriving business. You will identify and deliver the projects, features, and products that can have the largest impact on our existing and potential customers. You'll work with a cross-functional team of engineers, designers, and data scientists to address high-impact seller problems, partnering with other teams within Square. You will leverage and deploy AI in the Marketing tools to reduce the time it takes for sellers to run their marketing programs and help them get better outcomes from these programs. You Will: Manage the roadmap for the Square Marketing product. Direct and utilize user research, data analysis, and qualitative feedback to identify high-priority seller and business opportunity areas to improve. Advocate for the right seller experience in areas that have an impact across multiple products and drive alignment on strategies with other stakeholder teams at Square. Lead the planning, scoping, and prioritization of projects, including leading the roadmap and goals for your area. Determine features, write product specs, and organize user studies. Guide the creation of platform capabilities that are delightful, scalable, reliable, and remarkable while anticipating non-obvious risks and resolving complex issues. Work with engineering, design, and data to foster positive team dynamics. Qualifications You have: 5-8 years of experience with directly building products as a Product Manager. Excitement and interest in serving small business owners by meeting their needs around managing their teams and improving their operations Experience developing product strategies and breaking them down into clearly scoped roadmaps and requirements. Ability to understand technical systems and how they operate, not necessarily in an engineering capacity, but enough to spot potential issues and make trade-off decisions. Experience testing and launching products at scale and have worked within complex systems with multiple stakeholders Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create clarity from ambiguity and distill complex issues into easy-to-understand narratives. Demonstrated excellence in using principled decision-making to manage diverse stakeholders, including peers and executive leadership. Bonus if you’ve worked on B2B SaaS products or marketplaces. Additional Information Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.  Zone A: USD $167,300 - USD $204,500 Zone B: USD $158,900 - USD $194,300 Zone C: USD $150,600 - USD $184,000 Zone D: USD $142,200 - USD $173,800 To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information. US and Canada EEOC Statement We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis. Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Experience in designing and implementing functional systems and data in a structured process. Ability to research data definition, usage and flow to gain expertise in existing systems. Ability to create new business processes and data usage to promote efficiency. Ability to multi-task and prioritize assigned tasks / projects with minimal assistance. Expert troubleshooting skills to investigate resolve and escalate problems. Identifies need for technical assistance to help in problem resolution. Expert knowledge of Microsoft Office tools to provide working system prototypes and scenario modeling. Expert to learn evolving firm reporting technology platforms (Tableau, BI tools). Proficient understanding of data warehouse concepts. Diagram highly complex business processes, data flow and architecture for new systems and data. Create highly complex business cases to provide cost effective solutions. Follow highly complex data flow to interpret source of information in support of new systems and data. Proactively drive change to systems based on business system impact analysis. Serve as functional lead in technical implementation of agreed upon solutions. Decisions made based on highly complex business system impact analysis and involve business process or data flow recommendations and may impact firm systems. Business process redesign decisions are generally made in collaboration with divisional stakeholders and have a high risk on Firm performance. While there are no direct people responsibilities, leading others across the firm to accomplish tasks and meet deadlines will be required. This position requires a deep understanding of how enterprise systems interact with one another and impact firm operations and initiatives. Ability to create project plans or execute pre-existing plans. Ability to summarize highly complex business cases, system information and concepts and clearly communicate to firm leadership.Job Type: ContractPay: From $55.00 per hourExperience:Agile: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: Remote

Product Manager: Product Manager - Digital Channels - Remote Opportunity
column7: Futures start here. Where first steps, new friendships, and confident learners are born. At KinderCare Learning Companies, the first and only early childhood education provider recognized with the Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award, we offer a variety of early education and child care options for families. We pave the way for their lifelong learning journey ahead. And we want you to join us in shaping a future we can all be proud to share—in neighborhoods, at work, and in schools nationwide. At KinderCare Learning Companies, you’ll use your skills and expertise to support the work (and fun) that happens in our sites and centers every day. From marketers and strategists to financial analysts and data engineers, and so much more, we’re all passionate about crafting a world where children, families, and organizations can thrive.  JOB SUMMARY: As Product Manager for our Digital Channels you will partner with Marketing, Operations, IT, Customer Insights, and fellow PMs to evolve our digital marketing capabilities and elevate the digital experience for KinderCare families. You'll define the team’s strategy and roadmap and guide the delivery of product goals.  RESPONSIBILITIES:Cultivate a deep understanding of customers, collaborators, and technology and business strategy to define the vision and multi-year roadmap for the Digital Channels team.Lead a team of three Product Owners to ensure they align their work with the overall product strategy and business goals and are able to deliver on product commitments. Help define and measure teams performance metrics to align feature delivery to the business.Collaborate with the Product Team to prioritize feature development, guiding them in making data-driven decisions that balance needs of our customers and partners. Allocate resources toward the right projects to increase value.Facilitate effective communication between Product Owners, Development Teams, and Business Stakeholders to ensure a shared understanding of goals and alignment on priorities.Mentor and guide our team of Product Owners, helping them develop the skills and knowledge needed to excel in their roles.Identify and mitigate risks affecting successful delivery. Work proactively with business and technical partners to identify areas of risk early and collaboratively develop solutions to mitigate those risks.Qualifications: Bachelor’s in technology, marketing, communications, business, or related field, or equivalent experience.Experience in digital marketing, analytics, web development and mobile app development.Strong understanding of the product development process and agile methodologies.Familiarity with Sitecore, Salesforce Sales Cloud, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, or similar platforms.Exceptional communication and collaboration.Skilled in customer research and market analysis. Able to employ various research methods, both quantitative and qualitative to gain insights into customer needs and behaviors.Ability and appetite to lead and engage diverse and equitable teams.Our benefits meet you where you are. We’re here to help our employees navigate the integration of work and life:Know your whole family is supported with discounted child care benefits.Breathe easy with medical, dental, and vision benefits for your family (and pets, too!).Feel supported in your mental health and personal growth with employee assistance programs.Feel great and thrive with access to health and wellness programs, unlimited paid time off and discounts for work necessities, such as cell phones.… and much more.We operate research-backed, accredited, and customizable programs in more than 2,000 sites and centers across 40 states and the District of Columbia. As we expand, we’re matching the needs of more and more families, dynamic work environments, and diverse communities from coast to coast. Because we believe every family deserves access to high-quality child care, no matter who they are or where they live. Every day, you’ll help bring this mission to life by building community and delivering exceptional experiences. And if you’re anything like us, you’ll come for the work, and stay for the people. KinderCare Learning Companies is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law. Primary Location : Portland, Oregon, United States Job : Corporate

Starting Date: As soon as possible Contract type: Full-time/Permanent Salary: $120,000/Year - $180,000/Year Location: Can be remote, with a preference for hybrid/New York or Coast timezone. WHAT WE DO: DILIGENCEVAULT is a fast-growing cloud-based digital diligence ecosystem (SaaS) designed to transform, streamline, and automate the investment management due diligence process and experience. The company’s growth is backed by Goldman Sachs, industry experts, and sustainable revenue from a strong client base. The DiligenceVault digital network connects allocators and asset owners across public and private markets with their portfolio of investments and external managers. The platform is growing rapidly with over 50,000 users today and a diverse global team of over 55 people. Come join us in digitizing and optimizing the investment management due diligence process with our data-driven diligence platform! Role Responsibilities: Work with the development and project management team to ensure requirements are achievable and in line with best practices and project scope. Building product FAQs, and videos and working with the engineering team for deliverables. Industry Research - on competitors/products and give weekly/bi-monthly presentations to the team. Define effective feedback mechanisms to drive continuous and iterative product development lifecycles. Validate requirements against deliverables. Deliver walk-through for clients and answer questions on requirements for internal development and QA team members. Take part in product ideation and provide feedback and recommendations to the client for new opportunities, features, or products. Serve as a product expert for any internal or external questions about the product. Take ownership of the quality of deliverables and validate requirements with clients in UAT. Analyze and map data from disparate sources and formats to guide design and development and empower experiences. Identify opportunity areas in discussions with sales/clients, own a product roadmap and design product features to address these areas. Requirements: B. Tech in IT/Computer Science or Masters (MBA/MS) preferred. Experience with product & API integration is a plus. Self-starter with a passion for independent, creative problem-solving, strong ownership, high commitment, and strong business judgment. Detailed Oriented, Adaptable, and taking ownership are key attributes we are looking for. Experience in building products involving CRM, VDR, Due diligence platforms, and investment management space is valuable (not mandatory). Other Skills/personality fit: Research/Detail-oriented, Hands-on, Strong focus on execution of tasks, High Energy, Team & amp; Client-focused. WHAT WE OFFER: All the latest tech you need to succeed Health, dental, and vision insurance Unlimited paid time off policy Discounted fitness benefits 401(k) matching Commuter benefits FSA + HSA options The company paid an international company off-site Employee donation matching Location can be remote, with a preference for hybrid/New York or east coast locations  CGrF2dzkDT

Discover. A brighter future. With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.  Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover. Job Description: Join our fast-growing Deposits business to help customers through their financial journey. This role would be responsible for supporting the strategy, development, and implementation of new Deposit initiatives, product enhancements, and customer experiences. This role would require using balance judgement to manage, escalate, and mitigate risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.  Responsibilities  Responsible for supporting the development, implementation, and management of initiatives.  Responsible for owning end-to-end processes including operational requirements.  Leads customer experience process evaluations and enhancements.  Partners with the team to identify ways to innovate product offerings.  Manages projects and initiatives. Leads work streams to support project launches.  Partners with the business to ensure projects are delivering on business strategies.  Conducts product maintenance activities, including product documentation updates and complaints tracking. Minimum Qualifications At a minimum, here’s what we need from you: Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, or related field  4+ years of experience in Marketing, Financial Services Marketing, Product Management  In lieu of a degree, 8+ years of experience in Marketing, Financial Services Marketing, Product Management Preferred Qualifications If we had our say, we’d also look for: 6+ years of experience in Marketing, Financial Services Marketing, Product Management  E xtensive background in compliance and related fields, coupled with a strong capacity to translate theoretical knowledge into practical applications. Compensation: The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. Benefits: We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:  Paid Parental Leave  Paid Time Off  401(k) Plan  Medical, Dental, Vision, & Health Savings Account  STD, Life, LTD and AD&D  Recognition Program  Education Assistance  Commuter Benefits  Family Support Programs  Employee Stock Purchase Plan  Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com .  What are you waiting for? Apply today!  All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.  Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

Technical Product Manager Who we are We’re doxy.me (doc-see-me), the world's most loved telemedicine solution, and we're on a mission to connect the world to the future of healthcare. We believe that cost and complexity should NEVER be a barrier to telemedicine. That’s why we have designed our platform to be simple and accessible. Since 2013, we’ve grown to more than 1 million users from 180+ countries and have clocked over 7 billion minutes of telemedicine sessions to date. Our goal is to deliver a world-class healthcare experience to every patient and healthcare professional on earth. You can help us get there by joining our team of innovators, dreamers, and doers. Who you are We’re seeking a Technical Product Manager to drive product projects from concept to launch and bring high standards to developing product requirements that are informed by a combination of research, data and product intuition. Part of our mission is to always offer a free version of our product. We are looking for a product manager to manage our free offering as well as manage integrations with third-party vendors by maturing our SDK. What you’ll do Work autonomously and be able to take ownership of product prioritization decisions Identify, define, build, launch, and iterate on features that add value for our customers Be detail oriented and have excellent problem-solving abilities Work closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to take product ideas from concept to launch Translate a larger strategic vision into a concrete, prioritized plan that can be executed to deliver an MVP and iterative improvements Apply a combination of qualitative and quantitative research, customer understanding, and product intuition to inform decisions and prioritization Facilitate clear communication and collaboration across all teams and stakeholders Integrate with third-party vendors to offer more options to our users Your skills and qualifications Comfortable with ambiguity and an innate ability to break down complex problems Capable of synthesising unstructured data and inputs to inform prioritisation decisions Experience conducting interviews with customers to uncover product opportunities Drive to understand underlying problems, test assumptions and iterate on solutions Strong written and in-person communication skills, and are comfortable presenting in large groups Diligent with documenting and building shared understanding with all team members Takes initiative to drive projects forward within a fast-paced environment Experience with managing large cross-functional projects with technical depth Experience integrating with third-party vendors and making buy vs. build decisions What we can offer you We are committed to giving you the tools you need to do your best work. We will take care of the little things so you can do what you do best without having to worry about all of that other stuff. Here is a taste of what you can expect: A fun, flexible work environment (work from home or on location at one of our regional hubs) Competitive Salary Paid trainings and certifications Advancement opportunities in a growing company, Medical, Vision, and Dental insurance 401k match Unlimited PTO Our employees give us a 4.7 on Glassdoor. Logistics (Interview Process) 1st Stage - Screen with our internal recruiter 2nd Stage - Video call with our Head of Product 3rd Stage - Meet the team 4th Stage - Meet the CPO and VP of Engineering Additional information Doxy.me tech stack Frontend: React, TypeScript, Playwright, WebRTC, Next.js, Nx.dev Backend: Nodejs, TypeScript, Jest, NestJS, Nx.dev Cloud: AWS 3rd party: Vonage, Pubnub, Segment, Twilio, Stripe Our products: Doxy.me: The simple, free, and secure telemedicine solution currently used by over 1,000,000 doctors worldwide and helping over 350,000 patients/day. dokbot.io: Patient-focused data collection for healthcare. adhere.ly: Providing healthcare practitioners with the tools to ensure patients complete their course of treatment Our team: technologists, academics, researchers, and innovators from all over the world. English is the language used in all internal communication. To ensure HIPAA compliance we perform background checks after extending a job offer

Alkami is a leading cloud-based digital banking solutions provider for financial institutions in the United States that helps clients to transform through retail and business banking, digital account opening and loan origination, payment fraud prevention, and data analytics and engagement solutions. Founded in 2009, we continue to be recognized for our intentional culture and tremendous growth (Best Place to Work in Fintech; Best & Brightest to Work For Nationally; and Comparably’s Best Company Culture, Best Career Growth, Best Engineering Team, and Best Places to Work in Dallas, among others). Through our bold investments in technology and people, we empower our clients to grow confidently, adapt quickly, and build thriving digital banking communities through tailored experiences for over 16.2M users. As a remote-first company, this position can sit in Plano, TX or remote in the US. Position Overview: Alkami is looking for a Manager, Product Management for our Platform Services product management team. Our development platform serves a growing ecosystem of internal and external developers to allow financial institutions to innovate, integrate, and evolve to serve over 15 million users effectively. This is your opportunity to make an impact on our clients while you contribute to inventing Alkami’s future. You will be responsible for managing a team of Product Managers who in turn direct the work of Alkami’s Mobile, API, SDK, and Notification & Events platform teams. Key Responsibilities & Duties:Proactively work within and/or across product teams to achieve successful outcomes for our developer platformsSpot trends in the marketplace and recommend strategy adjustments accordinglySet direct report individual and team goals as directedGuide and mentor reports to successfully meet business goalsMeet regularly with reports to monitor progressInput and/or conduct year end reviews as directedMaintain employee work schedules including assignments, job rotation, training, vacations, paid time off, telecommuting, cover for absenteeism, and overtime schedulingWork with Sales as needed to determine messaging and strategyMeet regularly with cross functional teams to identify and support the implementation of improved processesInput into product roadmap and ensure timely completion by removing barriersQualifications:Demonstrated ability to work independently and/or with little supervisionProven ability to effectively communicate with others to achieve desired resultsHistory of managing others with successful resultsAbility to quickly grasp complex technical concepts and make them easily understandableIndustry knowledge and experience in supervision and managementGood technical knowledgeHistory of successful collaboration on customer and business outcomesDay to day working knowledge of Atlassian products: Jira and ConfluenceDesired Skills:Experience with mobile app developmentExperience with APIs & SDKsCan write user stories that are actionable by development teamsCool Things to Know Not Just Any Company: Alkami has an awesome diverse and inclusive environment. We have a FUN culture and offer great benefits, including remote-first environment, unlimited paid time off, 401k with employer match, and more.  Work Authorization: We cannot offer employment sponsorship at this time. Candidates must be eligible to work in the US for full-time employment. Recruiters: We are not looking for outside recruiting firms to help us in this search. Thank you for understanding. Pay Transparency: As of January 1, 2023, new states and locales have enacted pay equity laws that require more pay transparency by employers in the following states: California, Colorado (effective January 1, 2021), Connecticut, Maryland, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Rhode Island and Washington. [$130,490.00 - $195,736.00] The Important Stuff Alkami Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Alkami is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Alkami are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Alkami will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Alkami encourages applicants of all ages. #LI-REMOTE

Boise Cascade Company has been in the business of manufacturing wood products and distributing building materials for over half a century. We are one of the largest producers of engineered wood products and plywood in North America and a leading U.S. wholesale distributor of building materials. Because our business is built on relationships, our associates are critical to our success. We are committed to investing in them and that is why we offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to have a positive impact on all areas on your life – from health and well-being, career, and community, to financial security and personal safety, with many benefits beginning on your first day of employment. Please review the responsibilities and needed qualifications below and apply today! ResponsibilitiesManage and direct all overseas purchasing activities within the Global Sourcing branch.Determine appropriate product lines, screen and select overseas vendors, monitor vendor performance.Negotiate favorable payment terms, pricing and provide logistics support for inbound product.Provide BMD locations with product quotes, issue Global Sourcing purchase orders / sales orders.Monitor changes and milestone dates of Global Sourcing orders.Ensure all Global Sourcing activities are in full compliance with US Customs and international law.Monitor trade cases and rulings (Antidumping & Countervailing Duties) pertaining to products sourced through Global Sourcing branch from overseas manufacturers.Work closely with BMD location sales team and management to develop custom programs, block and special buys, promotions and product support.Monitor receipt of rebates and special discounts to ensure vendor compliance.Identify new product opportunities and design sourcing strategies.Develop and grow new relationships with overseas vendors, maintain good working relationships with existing vendors.Provide guidance to BMD locations through market information updates and following industry news to collect market intelligence.Demonstrate strong commitment to safety, quality, environmental awareness, and continuous process improvement.Qualifications Qualifications Basic Qualifications: College Degree or equivalent work experience in related job function. Knowledge of international logistics and trade lanes. Process knowledge around importer of record requirements. Fluent in English and Mandarin.
