What Is MyBambu? MyBambu is a financial institution delivering the first all-in-one mobile digital banking solution targeting the Hispanic unbanked and underbanked population. The mission of MyBambu is to promote financial inclusion to the unbanked and underbanked by providing an array of financial solutions delivered via mobile devices. We give an overlooked audience a convenient, safe, and cost-effective way of managing their finances. MyBambu’s objective is to promote financial literacy and access to unbanked/underbanked individuals, who have previously been left behind. In 2020, we were honored to be recognized as FIS’s Impact Award winner for innovation in the next frontier of the Modern Banking Platform. We’ve fostered a company culture that empowers people to do the most defining work in their career offering an environment that’s made up of a passionate and goal-oriented team. MyBambu participates in E-verify and will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new hire’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. Find out more information: E-Verify Participation Poster or Right to Work Poster. Your Opportunity: The impact that you can have at MyBambu is powerful. We’re looking for someone who’s eager to take on a meaningful role in the success of MyBambu on a massive scale. Someone who takes work seriously, but also isn’t afraid to have some fun either. Someone who’s ready to take MyBambu—and their career—to the next level. This position is a full-time, in-person position reporting to the Chief Marketing and Operation Officer. As the Product Manager, you will be responsible for driving the ideation, development, and launch of innovative fintech products that address the evolving needs of our customers. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, analyze market trends, and leverage customer insights to deliver exceptional products that exceed expectations. Your contributions will be instrumental in shaping the future of our company and the fintech industry. Job Responsibilities:Lead the end-to-end product lifecycle, from concept to launch, for a portfolio of fintech products.Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and gather customer feedback to identify market opportunities and user needs.Collaborate with design, engineering, and other teams to define product features, user stories, and technical specifications.Develop and maintain detailed product roadmaps, prioritizing features and enhancements based on business goals, user value, and market trends.Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success, track user engagement, and drive continuous improvement.Manage the agile development process, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, and iteration reviews.Ensure products are delivered on time, within scope, and meet quality standards.Create and execute go-to-market strategies, collaborating with marketing, sales, and customer support teams to drive product adoption and growth.Foster strong relationships with key stakeholders and represent the voice of the customer MyBambuStay informed about industry trends, regulatory changes, and emerging technologies to inform product decisions.Skill and Abilities:Strong analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data to inform decisions and iterate on product strategies.Deep understanding of fintech trends, technologies, and customer behaviors.Demonstrated ability to transform customer insights into innovative product features and enhancements.Exceptional communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.Proven track record of successfully launching and growing fintech products.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.Job Requirements:Bilingual English & Spanish preferred Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance, Computer Science, or related fieldProven experience (1+ years) in technical engineering.Proven experience (1+ years) in product management within the fintech, financial services, or related industry.Knowledge of regulatory and compliance considerations in the fintech industry is a plus.Experience with agile development methodologies and product management tools.Physical Requirements:Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

How would you make an impact? When your part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will do challenging work, and join a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of more than $40 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and chances to create significant contributions to the world. What will you do? As a Global Product Manager you will be responsible for full business ownership associated with current and future products within a key strategic portfolio within Microbiology. The Global Product Manager, leads the product strategy for the assigned portfolio and is responsible for the product life-cycle management while acting as the liaison between Sales, Regional Marketing, R&D, Manufacturing, Regulatory Affairs, Quality Affairs, Technical/Customer Support and Supply Chain. In this role, you will also be responsible for driving product roadmaps from concept to commercialization including market analysis, product definition, positioning, pricing and help to build brand equity, by establishing customer loyalty through the establishment of a scientific community for microbiology products in clinical, food, and pharma industries. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: General management of defined product lines with accountability for delivering financial goals Robust business cases that drive the product portfolio, product roadmap, and New Product Initiatives in collaboration with the wider marketing team and R&D Total product lifecycle, setting organizational cadence for retirement, refresh or enhancement of existing products Develop pricing strategy to meet revenue and profitability goals Understand customer needs, perform voice of customer (VOC), and define regional or global product requirements with corresponding business or financial justification Provide strategic direction for the product portfolio cross functionally, with a key focus on aiding the global marketing team create go-to-market plans, campaigns etc. Prioritize initiatives to improve or sustain product portfolio, reduce risk and meet financial goals aligned with product health needs Analyze, interpret and report out market and channel trends and product sales activities Develop a thorough knowledge of customer segments, conduct market research, assess competitive landscapes and regulatory processes Visit and collaborate with KOLs and customers to understand their workflows and identify product opportunities Manage budgets and define key performance indicators in order to achieve a high return on investment Monitor product quality, availability, and customer satisfaction Manage forecast activity and support Supply Chain in the S&OP process Participate in and propose process and operation improvement opportunities (PPI) Comply with company quality management systems, policies, and procedures Provide indirect/collaborative leadership with professionals in a cross-functional matrix and international organization (e.g. Operational Marketing, Regional Marketing, R&D, Regulatory Affairs, Operations and Commercial teams) How will you get here? Education: Bachelor’s degree is required in life science, preferably microbiology, business or related discipline Experience: Previous experience in the microbiology industry preferred Experience specifically within Culture Media, Blood Culture, Identification and/or Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing would be a distinct advantage Experience in marketing, product management, sales, and/or operations, or equivalent combination of education and experience Experience working with commercial functions in a highly matrixed organization Knowledge, Skills, Abilities: Able to capture sharp customer insights and translate into business and product strategy and actions. Familiar with working in a global/international business environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Good listener with ability to influence across teams (without direct authority) Willing and able to travel internationally (25-35% per annum), including overnight stays Fluent in English, additional languages a plus *Please note that the successful candidate will need to be in a commutable distance from the East Grinstead or Basingstoke site* What’s in it for you: Excellent career progression opportunities with a large and growing global employer Competitive salary, plus annual incentive bonus Full benefits package (specifics depend on country of hire) About us As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life by enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to develop solutions for some of the world’s greatest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping fight global infectious diseases. Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivalled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.         Explore Location

In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!  When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.  Job Description: Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Product Manager to join our team! In this role you will get to interact with the mission partner daily to ensure that all requirements from stakeholders are met and shared at appropriate levels throughout the Joint Staff Directorates. Provides direction and management for small to medium-sized products and ensure on-schedule completion within or below the allotted time for delivery. What You'll Be Doing: Collaborate with data stewards, software engineers, and other stakeholders to understand the project requirements and objectives. Develop a deep understanding of data governance, security protocols, and other critical factors in the Pentagon environment. Define and prioritize product features, enhancements, and updates. Create and maintain a product roadmap that aligns with organizational goals. Lead cross-functional teams, ensuring timely and successful product development. Regularly communicate progress, updates, and challenges to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Monitor and evaluate product performance and recommend improvements as needed. Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies to drive innovation. What Required Skills You'll Bring: Bachelors degree in a related field Proven experience as a Product Manager in a high-security or government environment is highly desired. Strong understanding of data governance, cybersecurity, and compliance. Exceptional leadership and communication skills. Ability to work in a collaborative, cross-functional environment. Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies. Security clearance or eligibility to obtain one is required. Assignment Location: Position is located at the Pentagon J6 Chief Data Office (CDO)  What Desired Skills You'll Bring: Bachelors or Masters Degree in a related field. Extensive experience within the DoD mission space and data applications Microsoft 365 development and/or product delivered experience A dynamic and inclusive work environment by leading a team of diverse engineers and stewards. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Top Secret SCI  This position is part of our Federal Solutions team.  Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our diverse, intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.  Salary Range: $92,200.00 - $161,400.00  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Date: Nov 10, 2023 Location: Naples, FL, US, 34108 Company: Arthrex Requisition ID:       58795      Title:       Summer Associate - Product Management      Division:       Arthrex, Inc. (US01)      Location:       Naples, FL      Arthrex is a global medical device company and leader in orthopedics medical education. With a corporate mission of Helping Surgeons Treat Their Patients Better™. Arthrex has pioneered the field of arthroscopy and develops more than 1,000 innovative products and procedures each year that support all aspects of orthopedics. The Product Management team in Naples, FL is seeking graduate students for our Summer Associate Program. Students will be selected to work for one of the following product areas: Extremity & Trauma, Shoulder/Elbow, Imaging & Resection, Orthobiologics or Arthroplasty. This is an exciting opportunity for the high energy individual that would like to explore an opportunity in the orthopedics industry. Students will use their excellent communications, business and/or science background to experience the medical device business at its highest level. During the Summer Associate program, candidates will interact with all key departments that impact product development. The Summer Associate will possess an internal sense of urgency, passion and detail that is necessary when interacting with our primary customer, the orthopedic surgeon. Apply on-line now to be a part of this growing industry!This position will run from May 2024 – August 2024. The ideal candidate will have the availability to work 40 hours per week at our Naples, FL facility.Main Objective:To support product management team with primary and secondary research on key product development tasks, brand management support and the ability to use interpersonal skills with key surgeon customers and business stakeholders.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Research/Analyst:Conduct market research on existing and future product lines through secondary research sources.Conduct surveys, analyze findings, identify trends and format data for the product management team. Utilize Hospital Supply Index Database to gather competitor sales data and provide analysis on those competitive findings and trends and opportunities in the marketplace.Create and deliver PowerPoint presentations for internal teams to synthesize information, draw conclusions and describe recommendations for market development activities.Ability to verbally communicate and interact with engineering, product management, medical education, surgeon consultants and surgeon customers. Present a capstone project relating to one specific area of research or project management to senior product management team members. Successful completion could lead to consideration for the Product Management Development Program (PMDP) including one year sales rotation. Field travel when necessary (less than 5%). Marketing:Work at the direction of Product Management/Product Marketing with Marketing Communications to produce and post marketing collateral.Ability to build PowerPoint presentations communicating data gathered during research.Help develop product demonstration models and training materials utilized for national industry meetings, and onsite surgeon and sales rep trainings.Product Development:Participate in the product development process which may include interacting with all stakeholders in the product management process, either individually or with product manager. Work with product managers, engineers and consultant surgeons to help define product needs.Support labs utilizing cadaveric specimens in the evaluation and testing of surgical implants and instruments.Interact with business partners to complement product development needs and activities.Education and Experience:Master’s degree or PhD candidate required; MBA candidates preferred. (Students who have recently graduated are only eligible to work as a Summer Associate up to six months from their graduation date.)Experience in Medical Device Sales or Orthopedics highly preferred.An interest in brand management and gaining experience with surgical devices is critical to advancement in this program. Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:Intermediate to Expert computer skills. Be able to follow written and verbal direction. PowerPoint applications proficiency a plus.Machine, Tools, and/or Equipment Skills:PC; High proficiency with Microsoft Outlook; PowerPoint; Word and Excel. Fax; Scanner. Arthrex 2023 Benefits are:Medical Insurance (if 25 or more hours per week)Free Onsite Medical ClinicsFree Onsite LunchVolunteer PTOAccess to the Wellness Center (For South Florida positions only)All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Product Manager: Product Sales Manager, Fiber Process Parts (FPP)
column7: Are you an experienced Pulp & Paper Industry professional looking for a career change into sales?    Deciding on your next employer is not a decision to be made lightly. But if you want to work on the front lines of development, shaping the field as you go, keep reading to see what we have to offer! Our winning team is built by continuous investment in skills development, leadership and well-being. As a global company, we offer many career paths to suit individual needs and aspirations.    As a Product Sales Manager within our Sales organization, you will focus on Fiber Processing Parts. You will partner with customer services and application engineers to work directly with our customers to ensure the sales and servicing for consumable parts. Your knowledge and expertise will be put to good use to ensure that services, audits, sales and Customer Agreements are carried out to a high level of performance and to the customers satisfaction.    Responsibilities    With regular visits and communication, know the customer base, the key decision makers for Fiber Process Parts and assure that the customer is in best product and that Valmet is meeting all their needs. Develop a sales plan to grow market share and solidify existing share. When needed, understand the needs and wants of the customer and process conditions to provide a product that will meet their needs. Propose and monitor trials in order to prove Valmet can provide a better solution than the competitor.    Work closely with customers to deliver a higher level of service and responsiveness to their needs than the competition. Understand competitive threats and provide strategies to maintain the business. Provide key process data required for application engineers to propose recommendations for optimization as mill needs change.    Expectations    To be successful in this role, you should have a Technical degree, preferably in Paper Science, Chemical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering. You should also have experience in the Pulp & Paper Mill, and/or Mechanical Pulp Mill. Co-Op and Internships will be considered as experience. As you'll be working closely with our customers within a region, you'll spend part of your time traveling.    We Offer    We offer a challenging work environment that values innovation and suits development-minded people who enjoy working in a fast-paced and dynamic setting. Includes a generous wage and benefits package that includes a company-funded registered pension plan.    Please note that any offer of employment is contingent upon a background check and pre-employment physical and drug screen. Must be authorized to work in Canada including eligibility to travel throughout North America.    Additional Information    Delivering competitive technologies and services is what we do best. At Valmet, we continue to push forward and develop ourselves, concentrating on technology, services, sustainability, local presence, and our people. To be included in the recruiting process, please apply directly with us online.    Where everything works together    Valmet is where the best talent from a wide variety of backgrounds comes together. With 18,000 professionals around the world, we are the leading global developer and supplier of technologies, automation and services for the pulp, paper and energy industries. Our commitment to moving our customer's performance forward requires creativity, technological innovations, service know-how - and above all, teamwork.    Please note that Valmet will never ask for personal financial information during the interview process. If you feel you have been a victim of an online job posting scam, please notify the Federal Trade Commission.

Requirements: The Product Owner is a member of the Agile Team and is responsible for defining and prioritizing the teams backlog to effectively address identified product/program/project management objectives. Experience with product management, business analysis, relationship management or related experience. Process improvement experience. Proficiency with Agile Development processes Play a significant role in the oversight of delivered work, and is instrumental in preparation and delivery of system demos with experience working with intermediate portfolios. Expectations of a Product Engineer with the PGI Technology Trading Team: Collaborate with business to identify outcomes that will help them achieve their goals. Work with business and technical teams using business analysis, process management and product development techniques to identify needs and solutions. Maximize customer value while minimizing waste - identify true needs and roadmap to build the right product for our customer.

SynergenX is looking for an Product Owner to join our team! General Description: The Product Owner is responsible for defining and prioritizing the product backlog, articulating the business' needs, and maintaining the conceptual and technical integrity of the features or components the team is implementing. The PO works closely with stakeholders across all functions including business, product, and engineering teams to deliver an end product that meets patient and provider satisfaction PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES (others may be assigned): Define the product vision, strategy, and roadmap in collaboration with senior leadership, stakeholders, and the development team. Manage and prioritize the product backlog, ensuring that the team always has an adequate amount of prior prepared tasks to work on. Translate business objectives into technical requirements and actionable items for the development team. Act as the primary liaison between the stakeholders and the development team, ensuring clear communication and understanding of priorities and objectives. Lead backlog grooming sessions and ensure stories are clearly understood and are ready for development. Define user stories and acceptance criteria, and ensure that the product backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all stakeholders. Participate in meetings including stand-ups, retrospectives, and sprint planning, acting as a patient proxy. Evaluate product progress at each iteration and provide feedback to the team. Make decisions on the priority of deliverables, taking into consideration the input of stakeholders, and convey the decisions to the development team. Maintain a patient-focused approach by integrating stakeholder feedback into product development and iteration. Work closely with the development team to help manage scope and sprints efficiently. Act as an ambassador for the product internally and externally, and as the primary technical contact for queries related to the product. Develop metrics and KPIs to measure product performance and use this data to guide future product development decisions. Keep abreast of Agile/Scrum best practices and new trends. QUALIFICATIONS Proven experience as a Product Owner, Business Analyst, or in a similar role in product management preferred. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a high attention to detail. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in a team environment. Excellent stakeholder management skills. Ability to work with cross-functional teams to deliver on a common goal. Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage competing priorities. Excellent communication and leadership skills. Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO/PSPO) or similar Agile certification is preferred.

Partner with management to support the delivery of a product vision In alignment with the product vision, create and maintain a product backlog and continuously re-prioritize user stories that will provide the most customer or end user value Continuously align with senior management on the product delivery roadmap, defined Minimum Marketable Features or Minimum Viable Products and release cadence Review performance analytics; recommend and champion strategies to enhance the customer or end user product experience Participate in scrum or Kanban events (e.g. stand-ups, retrospectives), express new ideas for improving product value or delivery efficiency, sharing with leadership as appropriate Proactively engage established business process partners to ensure customers or end users are prepared for application changes and establish Day 2 processes Create a value-focused product backlog and continuously iterate, ensuring there are user stories scoped and prioritized Provide user story design, development and completion oversight; accepting / rejecting user stories based on the agreed upon Definition of Done and Acceptance Criteria Manage delivery initiatives and oversee development team (pod) backlogs Proactively raise issues that impede the efficient delivery of customer-focused increments Responsible for defect management and prioritization

Warner Bros. Discovery: Del Monte Fresh Produce Company NA Inc
column7: Purpose of Position Task & Responsibilities Customers Facing/Sales: Consolidate monthly demand plan from sales team and clients including expected delivery dates and lead times. Support sourcing strategies and opportunities according to demand plan to ensure competitive cost and fill rate Control category specifications, prices, loading locations, logistics and quality updated. Work closely with the team to ensure all processes and payments are done on time Tasks & Responsibilities Growers facing/ Sourcing: In addition, this position is also supporting the Grapes Sales, and Product Management group with their daily administrative responsibilities on the Berries Category. The associate will analyze, and review purchase orders, sales orders, and invoices related to sourcing, packing and delivering product to the different Del Monte Distribution Centers; manage inventory materials at the DC level and supplier location. Generate reports requested by the group to monitor costs/sales and status of each task to improve the operating income on the categories. Responsible for processing product and/or service invoices for payment based on the contract payment terms negotiated. Make sure all Food Safety audits and certificates are up to date with all grower/suppliers. Accountabilities: Sales- Assist Mgmt with updating forecast, weekly and Monthly demand plan Manage cost in the system for all location Sourcing- Manage cost in the system for all location / Other COO Inventory management, Allocation & Distribution. (At Consolidation point and DC’s) Ensure product quality and shelf life within our DC’s and other locations Send POs to the growers Manage Grower Contracts ending dates and renewals Ensure Food Safety Audits and certifications are up to date (Azzule system) Quality deductions based on pack outs and USDA Inspections (CCO other than Mexico) Process Invoices for payment for product purchase once product is received and cleared. Generate and follow thru on Advance payments and liquidations (All growers) Assist on setting up new vendors in the system Communication with Sales & Transportation to secure loads Communicate to the growers any quality issues. If protection granted make sure PO is on Hold with notes in the system Review quality inspections on inbound product to the DM DCs Set up transfers between facilities (Direct from grower facility to DM) Minimum Skills Required: Previous experience on coordination and inventory management. Excellent knowledge of supply chain processes and logistics Excellent computer skills (MS Office, Produce Pro,) Organizational and time-management skills. Strong communication skills Excellent organizational and project management skills Attention to detail Creative problem-solving with a strategic and analytical mind Replenishment activities and terms expertise Strong communication skills with a problem-solving attitude to support all departments Attention and focus on customer service Preferred: Education in Business Administration. Not required. Determination Teamwork Flexibility Honesty Creativity Embrace Collective values. Demonstrate A Strong rapport. Ability to focus on a Shared purpose. Ability to Track & Measure objectives. A desire for growth and development. Effective communication. DEL MONTE FRESH PRODUCE IS AN EEO/AA/V/H - ***Please note: This position does not qualify for relocation expenses. ***

Ikigai Labs is seeking a dynamic and passionate product manager with strong platform and customer service fundamentals to join a high-performing product team. We are looking for a team player who is a quick learner, performs in a rapid development cycle, has a drive to surpass expectations, and an eagerness to share their work and knowledge. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds and communities. We are committed to having a team that is made up of diverse skills, experiences, and abilities. Ikigai Product Org The Ikigai product org will be split into three ownership areas:Platform: the goal of this org is to build and instrument the Ikigai platform so that it can support all semi-technical builders to build powerful end-to-end AI apps and deploy them successfully within their enterprisesApps: the goal of this org is to build and instrument individual verticalized apps that can be sold in a B2B way into enterprisesAcademy: the goal of this org is to support the sales motion at the beginning and then support the platform in the future - to enable the next wave of Ikigai AI buildersML: the goal of this organization is to take foundation research from our own IP and other research groups and bring them into the Ikigai platformApps PM Role The PM role is responsible for working with customers and the internal team to:Talk to customersCollect requirementsDocument specs & make product decisionsTo participate in the building of the MVPTo launch the product with customersTo collect feedback on the productsThe goal here is to enable an enterprise B2B sales motion through “appification.” We have to enable and build these apps on the Ikigai platform, tool them to be enterprise ready, and then sell them as individual apps into enterprises. ResponsibilitiesInterface with customersCollect requirementsDocument specs & make product decisionsTo participate in the building of the MVPTo launch the product with customersTo collect feedback and iterate on the app

About Cheetah Mobile Cheetah Mobile is a leading mobile internet company. It aims to provide leading apps for mobile users worldwide and connect users with personalized content on the mobile platform. Cheetah Mobile's products, including its popular mission-critical utility applications Clean Master, CM Security, and Battery Doctor, help make users' mobile internet experience smarter, speedier, and safer. The Company has attracted 612 million global Mobile MAUs as of September 2016, of which approximately 80% are located outside of China. Leveraging the success of its mission-critical applications, Cheetah Mobile has launched its line of mobile content-driven applications, including News Republic and Live.me. Cheetah Mobile provides its advertising customers, which include direct advertisers and mobile advertising networks through which advertisers place their advertisements, with direct access to highly targeted mobile users and global promotional channels, which are capable of delivering targeted content to hundreds of millions of users. For more information about Cheetah Mobile and its products, please visit www.cmcm.com. What's in it for you? Opportunity to make a huge impact in a promising industry Work in a start-up environment with a profitable company Free lunches daily Excellent benefits Monthly team building events International travel opportunities 401(K) with match 12 weeks of full paid maternity leave and 6 weeks of full paid paternity leave

Overview:   We are CONNECTING HEALTH AND WEALTH. Come be part of remarkable. How you can make a difference   HealthEquity is seeking a talented and driven Product Manager to spearhead our APIs and Data Products division. As a key member of our team, you will play a crucial role in shaping the strategy, development, and optimization of our healthcare-focused APIs and data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will bring a deep understanding of healthcare technology, API architecture, and a successful track record in delivering impactful data products.  At HealthEquity, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where all individuals are valued and empowered to contribute their best. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for career growth and advancement. If you are a passionate, results-driven, and customer-focused individual who wants to make a positive impact in the healthcare industry, we invite you to join our dynamic team as a Product Manager. Help us shape the future of healthcare financial technology at HealthEquity!  What you’ll be doing Product Strategy and Roadmap: Develop and execute a comprehensive product strategy for APIs and Data Products, aligning with overall company goals and objectives. Define and prioritize features and enhancements based on market trends, customer feedback, and business requirements. Create a clear and compelling product roadmap that communicates the vision and direction for APIs and Data Products. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with engineering, design, marketing, sales, and other cross-functional teams to drive the successful development and launch of API and data products. Work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, understand market needs, and ensure product success. Gather and analyze customer feedback to continuously improve existing products and identify new opportunities. Product Positioning and Messaging: Develop clear and compelling product positioning and messaging to effectively communicate the value proposition of APIs and Data Products to both internal and external stakeholders. Collaborate with marketing teams to create marketing materials, documentation, and sales collateral. Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and regularly monitor the performance of APIs and Data Products. Identify opportunities for optimization, enhancements, and new feature development to improve product performance and user satisfaction. Job Title: Product Enablement Manager IV Location: Atlanta, GA THE OPPORTUNITY: While we're proud of our history, we're even more excited about the future. We aim to create a world-class culture and company that attracts, develops, engages, and retains elite talent. At Salesloft, our Product Enablement Manager IV plays a pivotal role in our company's success. You'll be a key member of our rapidly growing, high-performing company. As the Product Enablement Manager IV, you'll serve as the vital link between our Product Management and Revenue Enablement teams. This role is responsible for driving alignment between product development and the go-to-market (GTM) strategy. Your primary responsibility will be to bridge the gap between what our product teams are building and how our sales, marketing, and customer success teams are equipped to effectively bring these products to market. Your responsibilities include delivering engaging content through elearning and in-person channels. You will be a driving force behind our Product Enablement delivery, from start to finish. In order to be successful, this will require a deep understanding of our product roadmap, release timelines, and an actionable plan for successful GTM execution. On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for: Product Integration and Alignment:Developing close alignment with the Product organization, collaborating closely with Product Managers and Product Marketers.Gaining a deep understanding of our Product Roadmap to ensure that enablement initiatives are closely aligned with product development and releases.Drive Timely Product Launches:Architecting a forward-thinking roadmap that ensure on-time delivery of product launches and updates across the Go-to-Market (GTM) organization.Working closely with cross-functional teams, specifically Product Managers and Product Marketing to develop and deliver all relevant GTM messaging and initiatives.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Leading cross-functional collaboration to design and execute programs that address business gaps.Collaborate on the development and execution of go-to-market programs, including messaging, positioning, and product launch strategies in alignment with Marketing Programs, to drive awareness, education and engagement.Program Delivery and Execution:In this role you will be responsible for collaborating in the strategy creation and execution for what we talk about and how we position it in the marketDesign and deliver impactful programs tailored to diverse audiences across the Revenue organization.Handle end-to-end program management, including planning, execution, follow-up, and post-launch measurement of success.Content Delivery and Education:Deliver engaging elearning and in-person content, while also measuring the end-to-end success of our enablement initiatives throughout the client life cycle.Work closely with the Revenue Enablement Managers to seamlessly integrate new features into daily conversations.Ensure that sellers are equipped with the right foundational messaging and resources.In addition to working with amazing colleagues who exemplify our 'team over self' core value, you will also have the opportunity to develop and execute on a process-driven strategy to deliver repeatable scale across a global revenue organization. You will have an opportunity to make a difference. WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR: We are seeking a candidate for this role who embodies the values of Salesloft—someone who is exceptionally detail-oriented, supremely organized, and approaches their work with a genuine curiosity to delve deep into our products and processes. This individual should possess a strong desire to understand comprehensively what we do and how it works, bridging the technical aspects with the practical needs of our revenue-focused teams. The ideal candidate will have a background rich in either Sales or Product, bringing invaluable expertise to the table. They excel in translating complex technical information into easily digestible language, facilitating effective communication, and enabling our revenue roles to thrive in their functions. If you're looking for an opportunity to learn more, do more, and become more, then becoming a Product Enablement Manager IV is the career path for you! THE TEAM: Our Salesloft Revenue Enablement team is comprised of seasoned and up-and-coming Revenue Leaders who are all aligned on one vision and mission: Vision: Every seller is loved by the buyers they serve (#saleslove) Mission: Equip companies to maximize revenue by creating a fantastic buying experience Our organization is a dynamic team of self-starters who have a combined experience between technical and revenue roles. We are known for our world-class delivery rooted in innovation. Renowned for our unwavering commitment to continuous improvement, we are relentless in our pursuit to learn and elevate what we share with those we serve. They are also the epitome of our core values: Put Customers First. Team Over Self. Focus on Results. Bias Towards Action. Glass Half Full. THE SKILL SET:6+ years in building, managing, and delivering enablement or corporate programs.Prior experience in a quota-carrying role preferred.Experience in content creation and delivery to selling teams (sales, pre-sales, and/or post-sales).Desire to solve complex problems, learn from others, and step outside their comfort zone.Ability to build, analyze, and document processes across multiple teams/topics/parts of the business into actionable deliverables and tools for others.Proven track record of project management.Driven, energetic, proactive, collaborative, and accountable.Excellent listening and communication skills, (formal and informal (presentations), written and verbal, etc.).Comfortable managing up and/or speaking publicly/driving conversations with senior stakeholders.WITHIN ONE MONTH, YOU'LL:Attend Salesloft's New Hire Orientation, where you will learn our Salesloft story and understand what makes our "Lofters" unique.Join our 3-week Sales Bootcamp, where you will learn our software and all the skills necessary to set you up for success, allowing you to make an impact in your role quickly.Begin 1:1s cross the team, understand your 30-60-90 plan, meet & shadow current members of the Salesloft team, and delve into your territory.Meet key stakeholders across Product and Revenue.WITHIN THREE MONTHS, YOU'LL:Demonstrate In-Depth Product Knowledge: Develop a comprehensive understanding of our product, its capabilities, and how it addresses customer needs, enabling you to confidently explain and showcase our platform.Navigate Cross-Functional Collaboration: Gain insights into how various teams at Salesoft collaborate, understanding the interplay between Product Management, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success, and effectively engage with these teams to facilitate alignment and communication.Master Enablement Tools: Acquire a deep understanding of the tools and resources used in our enablement efforts, demonstrating proficiency in their utilization and showcasing how they enhance the productivity and effectiveness of our revenue teams.WITHIN SIX MONTHS, YOU'LL:Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to co-lead the planning and delivery of product launches, ensuring seamless coordination and alignment between Product Management and Revenue Enablement.Demonstrate your ability to equip GTM roles with the necessary training, messaging, and resources to effectively communicate and describe new product features. This includes facilitating comprehensive training programs and ensuring that messaging aligns with the evolving product landscape.WITHIN TWELVE MONTHS, YOU'LL:Lead the delivery of product launches.Offer strategic guidance by proactively developing and implementing advanced planning and scaling strategies for our next product launch.WHY YOU'LL LOVE SALESLOFT: At Salesloft, we're not just a company, we're a community built on shared values. We put our customers first, prioritize our team over ourselves, focus on results, have a bias toward taking action, and choose to see the glass as half full. These values have been at the heart of our growth in becoming the #1 leader in sales engagement software, and we're still just getting started. Salesloft helps sales teams drive more revenue with the only complete Sales Engagement platform available in the market. Salesloft is the one place for sellers and managers to go to execute all their digital selling tasks, communicate with buyers, understand what to do next, forecast with accuracy, and get the coaching and insights they need to win more deals. Thousands of the world's most successful sales teams, like those at Google, 3M, IBM, Shopify, Square, and Cisco, drive more revenue with Salesloft. Since our founding in 2011, we have grown into a global, award-winning organization with Lofters based all over the world. As a testament to our organizational health, we have been named by Forbes as one of America's Best Startup Employers in 2021, Atlanta Business Chronicle's 2022 Healthiest Employers, three times by Deloitte as a 'Fastest-Growing Technology Company in North America,' and have been recognized as a top workplace by Fortune, Glassdoor, Atlanta Journal-Constitution, and Inc Magazine. In addition to our stand-out organizational health, G2 recently ranked us #1 in Enterprise Sales Engagement and we were named a leader in the 2022 Forrester Wave for Sales Engagement. We received the highest possible score in 26 out of 30 criteria, more than any other vendor evaluated in our category. We're redefining an age-old industry. This is challenging work – but our team of driven innovators makes the journey thrilling. We're fast-paced, cutting-edge, and collaborative. We pursue excellence in everything we do and have a lot of fun along the way. Come join us! Check us out on Glassdoor and see what people LOVE about working for Salesloft! IS THIS ROLE NOT AN EXACT FIT? Keep an eye on our Careers Page for other positions! WHY SHOULD YOU WORK AT SALESLOFT:You will become part of an amazing culture with a supportive CEO and smart teammates who actually careYou will work with an amazing team you can learn from and teachYou will experience joining a high-growth/high-trajectory organizationYou will hear "Yes, let's do that!" and then have the opportunity to successfully execute on your ideasYou will build community with Lofters of many cultures and backgrounds through ERGs and DEI initiativesWe have a vibrant, open office that utilizes modern technologyYou will grow more here than you would anywhere else, that is a promiseSalesloft embraces diversity and invites applications from people of all walks of life. About us Founded in 2014, U Brands is a creative-minded organization shaped by designers, innovators, and trendsetters bringing fashion and design to home and office goods. Through thoughtfully designed products, including presentation boards, writing tools, and desk organization, we strive to offer something for every solution for your workspace in your office and home. Our exponential success and growth year over year led to a blossoming partnership and acquisition by Smead in 2017. Today, as a multi-brand company with distinct styles, our diverse product portfolio reaches more of our customer's needs. Through our continued growth and consolidation, we remain true to our core, driven to connect with our audiences, pursue our passion for designing products, and consistently deliver best-in-class office supplies for every home or office space. Some may call us a stationery company, but as a company of designers, innovators, and trendsetters — a team of individuals who greatly respect the process, we leave no details unturned and remain passionate about providing unique, well-designed products that will help you feel inspired. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Description:   365 Retail Markets is the global leader of self-service technology and convenience solutions for the food service industry. Through our combination of MicroMarket, vending, and dining technologies, we offer the best-in-class point-of-service platform for the workplace. For the last decade, 365 has been pioneering innovation and winning multiple awards for revolutionizing the market with superior technology, strategic partnerships and ultimate flexibility in customization and branding. At 365, we are committed to supporting our customers and employee’s success! This position is located within the Technology Department of 365 Retail Markets, and reports to the VP of Product Management. The Product Owner – Product Management will be an integral part of the product development lifecycle and ensure that the original vision of features, enhancements, etc. are carried through to delivery. Essential Functions Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders as the subject matter expert (SME) to extract functional requirements for complex development of new and/or existing products Incorporate feature requests into a Product Roadmap; groom and prioritize backlog, plan product releases & upgrades Meet with customers to understand their needs; develop business and user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing systems Translate user behavior into interactive experiences through the production of high-quality requirements solutions such as flow diagrams and storyboards using industry standard tools (ex. Visio, OmniGraffle, Overflow, Adobe XD, Sketch etc.) Develop user stories, test cases and acceptance criteria; evaluate progress thru each iteration in development Communicate ideas to developers with excellent interpersonal skills Serve as a liaison between development and product team &/or manager Conduct product owner reviews to identify, document, report, and track issues that arise during the development lifecycle Develop knowledge sharing materials for consultants, customers, and internal teams; this includes, but is not limited to, white papers, sample models, training content, and video tutorials Other duties as assigned by leadership Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree in management information systems, computer science, or related field Effective at facilitating focused requirements analysis discussion with internal and external customers Attention to detail and mastery of information design Organize large amounts of information to optimize user experience within a system Analytical mind with business acumen Advanced written and verbal skills; advanced presentation skills Ability to work independently and to work collaboratively within cross-functional Good Organizational and Communication skills Familiarity with Agile preferred Prior work experience as a Product Owner preferred Master’s degree a plus

Axcsys Technologies is currently seeking product manages that have experience with information technology products. The candidates must be well versed in product life cycle management, and product road map planning and execution. If you are looking for growth opportunities, increased earning opportunities, and the opportunity to expand your career send your resume and contact information to hrpmanager@axcsys.com

Position Title: Director, Product Management - Strategic Partnerships Department: Product  Reports To: Vice President Product Operations  Supervisory Responsibilities: Yes  FLSA Status: Exempt  Job Type: Full-time Location: US Remote One Inc is a rapidly growing InsurTech digitizing inbound and outbound payments for the Insurance space. It’s an exciting time to join a private equity backed, market leader experiencing significant year over year growth. Every employee, no matter what role receives equity and most of our roles are 100% remote. Our employees are shareholders and are core to our people first culture. Our core values are simple yet powerful - #risetogether, #woweveryone, #thinkbigworksmall and #ownit. Learn more about joining our team at www.oneinc.com. Overview: This role functions as the product expert for One Inc products and an insurance payments industry expert. Partnerships include both core insurance system providers and product vendors that provide enabling technology. You will interface with the entire One Inc product team, gaining deep technical knowledge on the products that can then be translated to partner roadmaps. You will act as a trusted advisor to the partners, advising them on best practices for product implementations. You will be responsible for leading a high performing team, providing a fun and growth-oriented workplace. Key Responsibilities: Drive the product vision and strategy within One Inc for product partnerships resulting in product future proofing and increased revenue opportunities. Communicate the product partnership vision and product strategy to the One Inc CEO, CPO, and other C-Level executives. Built relationships with C-level executives in each organization to establish vision and strategy for alignment with core product goals. Define a “3 release” product integration roadmap(s) in collaboration with Partner’s product teams and internal One Inc stakeholders (Product, Sales, Marketing, and Finance). Act as the internal partner advocate for best practices around platform migrations. Lead complex platform upgrade discussions with partners, explaining the benefits, timeline, and next steps for migration. Translate the One Inc feature releases into required/optional features for partner integrations. Partner with Product teams on beta programs and POCs. Gain a deep understanding of each core insurance system, providing recommendations to the partner around payments best practices leveraging One Inc functionality. Evaluate the market and competitive landscape to understand opportunities and potential value, and lead the ideation, planning and delivery of partners who offer new products and features. Drive cross-functional collaboration with sales and client account management uncovering optimization opportunities with existing partners. In partnership with engineering, document integration requirements for new partners or enhancement requirements for existing partners. Work closely with the partner and One Inc sales organization to agree upon priorities, roadmaps, and delivery timelines. Create a partner advisory board; distribute feedback internally; evolve product partner program based on this feedback. Lead commercial discussions with product vendors such as contract renewals and pricing negotiations, building relationships with C-Level executives at each organization. Manage, coach, and mentor a talented team who embody One, Inc’s values, have fun together, and take pride in building products with our partners. Provide growth opportunities for a team of product managers providing them avenues to level up their skills while sharing best practices for product management. Educate product team members on industry leading product management best practices including Roadmap management, PDLC, discovery, and voice of customer. Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in customer facing roles. Excellent presentation skills, with the ability to communicate information across both technical and business domains. Strong project management skills. Attention to detail comes naturally, working with the team to create a best-in-class product partnership organization. Ability to ask compelling/leading questions, uncover common customer themes, and create an overall vision for partner expansion. Desired Traits: Action Oriented, Growth Mindset, Positive Outlook, Problem Solver, Self-starter, Demonstrates Ethical Behavior, Strong Drive, Team Player, Supportive & Adaptable to Change, Exudes a commitment to Personal & Professional Development Physical Demands: The conditions herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. Environment: Standard indoor office setting; exposure to computer screens. Physical: Requires repetitive motion. Substantial movements/motions of the wrists hands, and/or fingers. Sufficient mobility to work in an office setting; stand or sit for prolonged periods of time; operate office equipment including use of a computer keyboard, mouse, scanner and other tools as needed. Vision: See in the normal vision range with or without correction; vision sufficient to read computer screens and printed documents. Hearing: Ability to hear in the normal audio range with or without corrections.   Company Profile: One Inc provides insurers with the capability to give their customers what they expect: choice, control, convenience, and continuity. That’s the strength derived from the Power of One™ - a cohesive and seamless experience for both inbound and outbound digital insurance payments. The One Inc Digital Payments Platform combines multi-channel digital communications with electronic payment processing and disbursement, creating a frictionless premiums and claims payments experience. As one of the fastest growing digital payments platforms in the insurance industry, One Inc manages billions of dollars per year in premiums and claims payments. Headquartered in Folsom, CA—One Inc offers a competitive salary, and benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) plan, a commitment to a solid work/life balance, and a policy of promoting from within whenever possible. One Inc is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all EEOC legislation in each jurisdiction it operates in.

Responsible for online and mobile banking products for the Consumer and Small Business Segment Work with business lines, technology, marketing, operations, legal, compliance and others to develop new or enhance current digital products Responsible for the overall product management, product lifecycle, product profitability and internal support This is potentially the next best step in your career. Call or email me today to learn more. Steve Andrasek - 908.362.1601 - steve@hardwick-group.com

Portland Webworks is seeking an experienced Product Owner to join our Project Management and Quality Assurance team. Portland Webworks operates using Agile principles, specifically Scrum and Kanban, so Product Owners can expect to work within self-organizing teams focused on efficiency, transparency and providing business value to our clients. Portland Webworks is known for bringing useful and elegant solutions to the public sector to help citizens learn about, apply for, and receive benefits. We help government agencies run more efficiently and ensure projects are run on time, budget and scope. As a Product Owner, you can expect to: Work with the business and subject matter experts on the product roadmap and product vision Understand the client’s business model and desired business benefits Build and groom the product backlog Act as business analyst and be able to elicit, describe and prioritize the client’s business requirements and product features (includes wireframing functionality associated with requirements and/or other usability and interaction design tactics) Collaborate closely with the project team to hone agile principles and continuously improve process and sprint outcomes Participate in Scrum events such as release planning, product backlog grooming, sprint planning, daily scrum and sprint reviews (including team demos), and sprint retrospectives As a Product Owner, you will bring the following skills: Leadership skills and ability to communicate in an effective manner (both written and verbal) Ability to influence and guide teams towards the product vision Experience leading software development teams towards building a product Experience gathering requirements and building consensus on product features Ability to work autonomously and without direction from senior staff members or the client Positive attitude and willingness to wear multiple hats as needed Experience working with external clients and stakeholders Knowledge of software development best practices and 508/ADA compliance Proficiency in using software to document requirements, backlogs, etc. (Jira, Confluence, etc) Agile certifications (Certified Scrum Product Owner desired) Experience working in the public sector (e.g. federal, state, and/or local government) Portland Webworks maintains one of the most progressive benefits programs in Maine. Our team culture, our respect for our personnel, and our generous compensation packages have earned our company recognition as one of the "Best Places to Work" in Maine in every year we participated. The benefits that we offer include: 100% paid health and dental benefits for employees Employer funded Health Reimbursement Arrangement (to minimize out of pocket costs) Flexible spending account and dependent care accounts available Company matching retirement plan (up to 3% of salary) Profit sharing Flexible scheduling Up to 25 days paid vacation Free Old Port garage parking (Custom House Garage) This position requires passing a criminal background check due to client contracting requirements. Learn More About Portland Webworks & GovWebworks LinkedIn | Facebook | Twitter | Instagram 5 Times Best Places to Work Winner Our Team | Our Clients SzfzUyuU7Y

Remote: San Francisco, CA 94105 (Financial District/South Beach area)
column7: About Gap Inc.Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials. This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our team is made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team. About the Role As an Analytics PdM II, you will play an integral role in shaping our product strategy, driving innovation, and delivering analytics solutions to support our iconic brands of Gap, Old Navy, Banana Republic, and Athleta. You will collaborate with business leaders, engineering, and data science to define and execute the product roadmap. With the goal of delivering product that enables the company to gain valuable insights, make data-driven decisions and drive business growth. What You'll Do Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, understand pain points, and identify opportunities to leverage analytics Team with data science and engineering teams to define data requirements, develop data models, and ensure data integrity and accuracy within the analytics products Define and prioritize product features, create robust user stories, and work closely with engineering and data science to ensure successful and timely delivery of product release Conduct market research and analysis to gain insights on market trends and emerging technologies in the analytics domain Identify, measure, and interpret results to validate product strategy; Provide research, analysis, and support for identifying, evaluating, and resolving strategic opportunities Build relationships with key business partners and other brand stakeholders; articulates product needs clearly and succinctly to different audiences and cross functional partners Develop and manage project plans and key stakeholder engagement strategy on all initiatives Who You Are Strong technical background and understanding of analytics concepts including data modeling, data visualization, machine learning, etc. Passionate about analytics, data driven decisions making, and driving business outcomes through innovative product solutions Ability to influence and debate solutions with technical team members, to understand technology solutions and potential tradeoffs and to represent technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders Experience in designing, developing, and implementing platforms, APIS, and/or complex customer capabilities Proven experience as a Product Manager or similar role, with an emphasis on analytics products and solutions Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams Ability to assess relatively complex situations and analyze data to make judgments and recommend solutions Preferred experience in the Retail industry with an emphasis on Merchandise Planning Benefits at Gap Inc.Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*See more of the benefits we offer.For eligible employees Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. In 2022, we were recognized by Forbes as one of the World's Best Employers and one of the Best Employers for Diversity.  Salary Range: $130,600 - $173,100 USD Employee pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level, competencies and work location. We will meet minimum wage or minimum of the pay range (whichever is higher) based on city, county and state requirements.  US Candidates Please note that effective, June 30, 2022, Gap Inc. will no longer require any of its employees to wear face masks or require proof of COVID vaccination, unless required by local or state/provincial mandates or as part of Gap Inc’s quarantine guidelines after being exposed to or testing positive for COVID. Therefore, please disregard any language in any job posting that refers to Gap Inc.’s face mask and proof of vaccination policy as said policy is no longer effective.

31 October 2023 Job ID: 1564  Cypress, CaliforniaGlobal Product DevelopmentPRODUCT DEVELOPMENT MANAGER – SPEEDO USA WE ARE SPEEDO The world's leading swimwear brand, Speedo is passionate about life in and around the water. The brand's heritage of innovation derives from its leadership in competitive swimming, where more Olympic Gold Medals have been won in Speedo than any other brand. Unmatched in performance, fit and feel, we are also America’s #1 goggle brand. From the first splash, to every stroke, the genuine love and excitement we have working with the water is what creates exciting and meaningful relationships. Speedo is not where we work, but is who we are. It’s watching a baby in the pool for the first time or our athletes make history. What we do is sacred to us and our connection to the rest of water lovers around the world. Driven by the challenge, not the glory. At Speedo, it is never enough to be good at what you do; you have to love what you do. Speedo is a part of the Pentland Brands Limited Family. We are Pentland Brands, a global family business bringing some of the most loved active and footwear brands to millions of people around the world. We own Speedo, Berghaus, Canterbury of New Zealand, Endura, Mitre, ellesse, SeaVees, Red or Dead and we’re the UK licensee for Kickers and have a joint venture partnership for Lacoste footwear. Our products are available in over 190 countries and are sold either directly by Group companies or are represented by licensees and distributors. All our brands have their own unique identities and every one of them is powered by Pentland. We have more than 1,200 employees worldwide and we’re always on the lookout for talented, enthusiastic people to help shape our future. We celebrate differences and give everyone the freedom to innovate and develop, be it through creative working environments or learning opportunities. Our brands are there in the moments that matter - being there for more people, in more of those moments, drives everything we do. At Pentland, we’re guided by four principles, we use these to make sure we’re not only doing a great job, but we’re doing it in the right way: Success is a team game With clarity and courage Better as standard In good conscience We believe in building brands for the world to love, generation after generation. Your potential is our potential and together we can build and grow brands that last. KEY PURPOSE: As Product Development Manager, you will be leading a team responsible for bringing innovative ideas to life to create a product line that stands out from the competition. You should have an excellent eye for detail, a passion for staying on top of the latest fashion trends, and the ability to collaborate effectively with other team members. You’ll also need strong analytical and problem-solving skills to be able to turn ideas into reality. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage a team responsible for product development across all product categories. Specialize in the development and delivery of our top level Elite suits and most innovative product innovation. Execute seasonal development, commercialization and pre production on time according to Critical Path and go to market strategies set forth by Brand HQ Partner with design on new concepts and techniques to support continuous product innovation Partner with University’s, Colleges, and athletes to perform scientific wear-testing studies to inform swim and product innovation Sourcing and developing raw materials Supervise negotiations, product development, adoption, sourcing, vendor allocation and production processes across multiple market and product development vendors Develop and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and vendors to ensure that materials and components are of the highest quality and delivered on time Partner with factories to ensure the highest quality production and develop new fabric, construction techniques, processes and samples needed to create innovative and technically sound product Execute best business processes and relationships in concert with Brand HQ and Pentland Asia Driving calendar discipline through critical path calendar; Measure product creation team progress, Identify and drive process improvement throughout the product creation process Hindsight wins and losses for season QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE: 5-7+ years professional experience in design or product development in hard goods Bachelor's Degree in related field Cloud-based management software (PLM and/or ERP) proficiency Attention to detail Process execution and follow-up Excellent interpersonal skills Able to influence and communicate with all levels Works both independently and collaboratively Ability to develop relationships within the department, with global partners and external contacts How to effectively manage a professional, geographically spread team Cost engineering a plus

Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.  Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us.  TikTok Core Product team's goal is to provide the best user experiences to create, consume and enjoy content on TikTok. We are looking for an accomplished product manager to expand the boundaries of TikTok by encouraging building meaningful social connections between users. This is an exciting opportunity for a product manager with passion and curiosity for Social direction to create great impacts. Responsibilities:Responsible for driving the growth of TikTok social products.Drive the social product vision and guide strategic direction of key investment areas.Develop comprehensive product roadmap, align with stakeholders, and work with the team to make product decisions.Lead and guide the team in identifying product opportunities, defining product problems and delivering product solutions throughout the product life cycle.Define and establish key success metrics and product impact, ensuring a data-driven approach to product management.Set up best practice in the way of working with cross-functional teams including Algo, DS, UX and RD, across different timezones, to ensure highly effective collaborations. Qualifications 1-3 years of experience in product management, data science, consulting, or equivalent roles.Experience working on B2C products and/or social products.Strong logical thinking, able to lead product planning and design with a clear view of how the product roadmap contributes to TikTok's overall goals.Strong leadership, outstanding collaboration and communication skills to build trusted relationships with cross functions.Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.Experience building 0-1 products. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.  TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at gprd.accommodations@tiktok.com Job Information The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $120650 - $223250 annually.  ​  Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.  ​  Our company benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support our employees to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees:  ​  We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care.  ​ Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off (PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability.  ​  We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.
