The Center is designed to be instrumental in supporting the diversification of our local economy by adding value to Mississippi’s agricultural and food sector industries. Thus, the Center will provide a learning environment where Alcorn’s students and small farmers/entrepreneurs will have an opportunity to gain hands-on experiences with value-added processing, production and business management, nutrition education, and retail. Currently the Center is used as a retail store to sell value-added products such as but not limited to hot sauce, spices, wing sauce, pickled products, fruit preserves, hair, skin, bath and body products to the public. This multi-faceted facility (Teaching, Research and Outreach) is housed in the School of Agriculture and Applied Sciences. The Associate Product Line Manager (APLM) on the JR286 Product team will support the Product Line Manager with all aspects of creating and managing a two to three year life-cycle matrix for Nike Accessories. As an APLM, you will work as part of a cross-functional team to maximize growth and profitability in the assigned product portfolio. The location of this role will be in the Los Angeles region, based out of the JR286 offices. What You’ll Do:Work cross functionally as part of a team with Design, Graphics, Sales, Planning and Operations on all issues related to products within Performance & Lifestyle assigned categoriesHelps to identify opportunities for expansion or rationalization of products by assisting in the creation of new product briefs and strategy. Clearly communicate the goals of new product introductions to design, development and salesConduct on-going market analysis to identify consumer, competition and product technology trends relevant to assigned productsConducts focus groups and wear testing sessions and provide detailed analysis to the teamsCreate and maintain seasonal Visual Line Plans for internal and external useTracking, collect and store of samples through various stages of developmentCreation of seasonal copy for catalogs and packaging on new and updated stylesWork with cross functional teams to ensure on-time delivery of SMSPartner with the Product Line Manager and Sales to select SMS, setup SKU information, distribute line list and track deliverySupport management of all collateral material pertaining to assigned product portfolio (i.e. catalog, tech sheets, presentations and visual needs)Merchandise assigned areas for product and sales presentationsAssist with all needs around seasonal Go-To-MarketOther duties as assignedWhat To Bring:1-3 years in a Product related role; Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) preferredBachelor's Degree in marketing or related field. Some industry experience in product or sporting goods is preferredPrevious experience with FLEX or similar PLM softwareComputer fluency - PC based windows applications including Word, PowerPoint and ExcelExcellent written, verbal, and presentation skillsExcellent time management skillsMust have a passion for productAdaptable and flexible to new environments, changing process and prioritiesHighly organized with ability to multi-task and prioritizeBe able to anticipate busy schedules and plan accordinglyWork in a team environment and be able to communicate with other members of the team to complete assignments on time and accuratelyPossess openness in their problem-solving and integrity in their dealing with vendors and internal team membersAdditionally:Ability to obtain a detailed understanding of consumer needs through market researchAbility to work under pressure in an environment of constant shifting priorities and changesPositive attitude, professional demeanor, and the ability to understand and support JR286 valuesKeen sense of urgencySome travel may be requiredThe location of this role can be in the greater Portland or Los Angeles region, based out of the Nike or JR286 officesWhat We Offer:Competitive salary (we leverage market data) + benefits (medical, dental, vision, 401k match, life insurance, pet insurance)Responsible Time Off (aka Unlimited)Paid Parental LeaveFree lunches Monday through FridayCompany gym with access to personal trainerSummer hours (Memorial Day through Labor Day)13 company holidaysProfessional development workshopsEmployee product discounts on selected brands

Overview At the heart of QIAGEN’s business is a vision to make improvements in life possible.  We are on an exciting mission to make a real difference in science and healthcare. We are still the entrepreneurial company we started out as and have today achieved a size where we can bring our full power to many initiatives and to our presence across the globe.  Our most valuable asset are our employees – more than 6000 in over 35 locations around the world. Our ambition is to ensure we have outstanding and passionate people working in the best teams and we are constantly looking for new talent to join us.  There are few players who have shaped the world of modern science and healthcare as much as QIAGEN, and we have only just started. If you are looking to advance your career, are seeking new challenges and opportunities, enjoy working in dynamic, international and diverse teams and want to make a real impact on people’s lives, then QIAGEN is where you need to be.  Join us. At QIAGEN, you make a difference every day. Position Description As the Product Owner – MDx, you willWork with our system and software teams to generate Control and Data Analysis software to drive our Instruments and convert Samples to Insights.Ensure to facilitate and document conversion of high-level stakeholder requirements into stories executable by the software teams.Coordinate teams to generate the best possible solution in a complex environment of Biology, Chemistry, Mechanics, Electronics and Software.Ensure regulatory compliance, so that patients all over the world benefit from our products. Position Requirements We expectA university degree in Computer Science, Biology, Chemistry, or a similar field (or comparable experience). Experience running projects in regulated environments (e.g Biotec, Medical, Automotive or Aerospace) using Agile Methodologies while maintaining regulatory compliance.Experience in networked solutions, cloud components, software for complex workflows or high availability a plus.Enjoying to work in international teams, using your fluent English skills, travelling occasionally (up to 20%) to connect our teams.A passionate mindset that strives to see the big picture, wants to understand what makes a difference for our customers and is not afraid to ask “why?”. What we offer At the heart of QIAGEN are our people who drive our success. We act with passion, always challenging the status quo to drive innovation and continuous improvement. We inspire with our leadership and make an impact with our actions. We create a collaborative, safe and engaging workplace which forms the basis for high performing individuals and teams. We drive accountability and entrepreneurial decision-making and want you to excel your growth and shape the future of QIAGEN.  QIAGEN is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, or disability. Job Reference: EMEA03881

Clearance: Public Trust Location: Remote - Washington DC Metro Area or Fort Collins/Denver Area Overview: IntelliBridge is an award-winning national security company looking for a Business Analyst / Development Product Owner to support our contract with the USDA Conservation Solution. This team member operates in a SAFe based Agile environment and is responsible for maximizing value delivered by the team. This role manages the team backlog and ensures it is in alignment with our Government partner’s needs. The Product owner advocates for the customer as a liaison to our Product Managers and Government partners to link business needs with technology strategy. Their work enables the team to balance needs of various government stake holders while progressing the whole solution. As a direct employee of IntelliBridge, you would receive a benefit package that includes health/dental/vision insurance coverage, 401K with company match, PTO & paid holidays, and annual tuition/training assistance. For more information, please visit our website. More information can be found at https://www.sss.gov/. Minimum 1 year of experience working in an agile environment to develop user stories, story points, and epics Strong communication skills Strong attention to detail Preferred Qualifications: Two plus years in software engineering with a focus on product ownership, product management or business analysis SAFe PO/PM certification or willingness to complete certification on hire Experience with Jira and Confluence About Us: IntelliBridge delivers IT strategy, cloud, cybersecurity, application, data and analytics, enterprise IT, intelligence analysis, and mission operation support services to accelerate technical performance and efficiency for Defense, Civilian, and National Security & Federal Law Enforcement clients.

Broan-NuTone leads the residential ventilation industry with innovative products such as auto sensing range hoods, germ killing ventilation fans, and fresh air systems, all supported by our award-winning customer excellence team. Broan-NuTone provides better quality of air for better quality of life. One of many companies within Madison Industries all doing our part to make the world safer, healthier, and more productive. Our employees are entrepreneurs who have a strong bias for driving bold action and trust each other to compete and win as a team. Business Job Title: Product Manager FAS Job Summary: The Product Manager has overall responsibility of leading the product strategy for the Fresh Air Systems (FAS) business segment. The FAS product categories are the growth engine of the Broan-NuTone™ company. Voice of Customer is critical in knowing what our target users need in providing solutions to the residential and commercial Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) for fresh, clean air. Broan-Nutone is the market leader in residential IAQ and our product categories must incorporate futuristic innovation and new market changing ventilation solutions to solve target user every day needs, while increasing their “comfort & convenience” to live a happier, healthier and safer life, with their families in their homes. Job Responsibilities:Lead business initiatives and product programs as assigned to help deliver business results for assigned category, monitor performance, recommend and implement course correction actions as needed.Build KPI’s, action plans, and associated measurement approaches to track performance.Maintain continual surveillance and evaluation of competitors’ products/programs, market and industry trends. Trends such as demand drivers, product, design, technology, and pricing. Develop data into business recommendations and strategies.Create product strategy incorporating the need for product changes based on user need cases - aligning to being better than the competition.Define and present for approval the marketing requirements and business case justification for new product development scopes incorporating market dynamics, performance features, pricing, voice of customer, forecast and cross-functional team input where needed.Provide product input for annual marketing strategies, budgets, and plans and overarching brand and channel strategies; approve product marketing components of plan.Provide clear prioritization of the market information (VOC, competitive products, Sales/customer feedback, profitability, etc.) and LCM or new products required to exceed competitors in the market.Interact with customers and consumers to fully understand opportunities for improvements to current products, marketing programs and for new products.Design and implement voice of customer systems to understand customer and consumer feedback, and track continuous improvement metrics to fuel ideation, validation, and verification of product strategy.Recommend the pricing structure for the assigned categories.Define product assortment and set planograms and displays for key customers.Ensure that the new products are successfully managed and launched within the stage-gate process on time, on budget, and in scope in conjunction with the assigned Project Manager. Lead or provide marketing representation to cross functional new product development teams as assigned.Job Requirements:Strong presentation skills.Effective communicator with excellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with cross functional teams. This will include gaining information and possible alignment for relative project needs.The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree in business, marketing, engineering or other technical discipline, MBA from a reputable business school is a plus.Intellectually curious with a firm understanding of general business and financial principles.Able to adapt to a fast pace ever changing environment.Physical Requirements:Ability to travel up to 25%, including overnight travel.

Overview:   We are CONNECTING HEALTH AND WEALTH. Come be part of remarkable. How you can make a difference   HealthEquity is seeking a talented and driven Product Manager to spearhead our APIs and Data Products division. As a key member of our team, you will play a crucial role in shaping the strategy, development, and optimization of our healthcare-focused APIs and data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will bring a deep understanding of healthcare technology, API architecture, and a successful track record in delivering impactful data products.  At HealthEquity, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where all individuals are valued and empowered to contribute their best. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for career growth and advancement. If you are a passionate, results-driven, and customer-focused individual who wants to make a positive impact in the healthcare industry, we invite you to join our dynamic team as a Product Manager. Help us shape the future of healthcare financial technology at HealthEquity!  What you’ll be doing Product Strategy and Roadmap: Develop and execute a comprehensive product strategy for APIs and Data Products, aligning with overall company goals and objectives. Define and prioritize features and enhancements based on market trends, customer feedback, and business requirements. Create a clear and compelling product roadmap that communicates the vision and direction for APIs and Data Products. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with engineering, design, marketing, sales, and other cross-functional teams to drive the successful development and launch of API and data products. Work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, understand market needs, and ensure product success. Product Development: Lead the end-to-end product development lifecycle, from concept to launch, ensuring high-quality and timely delivery. Work closely with engineering teams to define product requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria. Market Analysis and Customer Feedback: Conduct market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscape, and customer needs related to APIs and Data Products. Gather and analyze customer feedback to continuously improve existing products and identify new opportunities. Product Positioning and Messaging: Develop clear and compelling product positioning and messaging to effectively communicate the value proposition of APIs and Data Products to both internal and external stakeholders. Collaborate with marketing teams to create marketing materials, documentation, and sales collateral. Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and regularly monitor the performance of APIs and Data Products. Identify opportunities for optimization, enhancements, and new feature development to improve product performance and user satisfaction. What you will need to be successful Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, MBA or equivalent experience is a plus Proven experience as a Product Manager, preferably with a focus on APIs and Data Products Strong technical background with a good understanding of API architecture, data modeling, and data analytics Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams Demonstrated ability to develop and execute product strategies that drive business results Analytical mindset with the ability to use data to make informed decisions Familiarity with agile development methodologies #LI-Remote This is a remote position. Salary Range: $98500.00 To $157500.00 / year Benefits & Perks:     The compensation range describes the typical minimum or maximum base pay range for this position. The actual compensation offer is determined based on job-related knowledge, education, skills, experience, and work location. This position will be eligible for performance-based incentives and restricted stock units as part of the total compensation package, in addition to a full range in addition to a full range of benefits including:  Medical, dental, and vision HSA contribution and match Dependent care FSA match Uncapped paid time off Adventure accounts Paid parental leave 401(k) match Personal and healthcare financial literacy programs Ongoing education & tuition assistance Gym and fitness reimbursement Wellness program incentives Come be your authentic self:   Why work for HealthEquity   HealthEquity has a vision that   by 2030 we will make HSAs as wide-spread and popular as retirement accounts. We are passionate about providing a solution that allows American families to connect   health and wealth. Join us and discover a work experience where the person is valued more than the position. Click here to learn more.  Come be your authentic self   HealthEquity, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a qualified individual with a disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. HealthEquity is a drug-free workplace. For more information about our EEO policy, or about HealthEquity’s applicant disability accommodation, drug-free-workplace, background check, and E-Verify policies, please visit our Careers page.  HealthEquity is committed to your privacy as an applicant for employment. For information on our privacy policies and practices, please visit HealthEquity Privacy.

CLEARANCE REQUIRED: TS with SCI eligibilityThis job is located in: Tampa, FLQSL is looking for highly motivated individuals to support U.S. Special Operations Command in various locations.Qualifications and Job Summary:Product Owner/Project Manager/Task Lead (BS in CS, Information Systems or related): Works as part of a team providing product ownership for multiple agile teams collocated with the development team. This position will attend product management events and meetings as the development team requirements stakeholder and will have to effectively communicate these requirements back to the team. Designed for someone with a strong experience in agile development methodologies. Responsible for defining Stories and prioritizing Team Backlog based on extensive conversation and discovery with government customers. The product owner has a significant role in maximizing the value provided by our development teams and ensuring stories meet the user's needs. Product Owner will perform the following duties:Maintain the Team BacklogIteration PlanningJust-In-Time Story ElaborationApply Acceptance Test Driven DevelopmentUser Story Development and AcceptanceUnderstand Enabler WorkParticipate in Demos as part of an Agile Release TrainFirst Of A Kind (FOAK) solutionsAdditional requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related fieldPrevious working experience as a product ownerIn-depth knowledge of Agile methodologiesStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong communication skills, written and verbalStrong presentation skillsAbility to multi-task and work under pressureStrong knowledge of Jira and Atlassian toolsCurrent DoD Top Secret clearance and eligible for SCI accessWhy work for QSL?Our founders, Mel Wick and Bill Cronin, retired from storied careers in the Special Operations Forces (SOF) Community. Like many Americans and military veterans, they felt a strong desire to support the nation’s response to the 9/11/2001 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon in any way they could. They established QSL to do just that, Stay in the Fight! QSL is built on a SOF culture, emphasizing selfless-service and teamwork. Our employees work to ensure that warfighters have every possible resource and all necessary support to safely accomplish their missions in defense of our nation.QSL's Benefit PackageBecause we believe our employees are our most valuable asset, offering a competitive comprehensive compensation package is very important to us. It is the goal of QSL to attract and retain the highest level of experience and technical talent necessary for successful performance. In order to accomplish this, we feel that it is necessary to provide satisfying work, an excellent work environment, and we continually monitor the marketplace to ensure that our total compensation/benefit package remains competitive.Listed below are some of our standard benefits. We combine all traditional paid time off (Federal holidays, sick time, leave time personal days, jury duty, bereavement, etc.) into one category which allows employees flexibility in how they use their leave time and enables them to better balance their career with their personal needs.Combined Paid Time Off (PTO)Medical, Dental, Life InsuranceDisability (Short-Term and Long-Term)Vision Insurance (CONUS-based employees)Flexible Spending Account (FSA)401(k) Retirement PlanEmployee Referral Bonus ProgramEmployee Discount ProgramsCritical Illness and Accident InsuranceEmployee Assistance ProgramWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not and will not discriminate in employment and personnel practices based on race, sex, age, disability, veteran status, religion, national origin or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring, and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above listed items. EEO/AAP, M, F, V, D.

Your Job The Koch Capability Transformation Team at Koch Global Services is currently looking for a OneStream Product Owner to join our team. This position will primarily focus on the Record to Report capabilities, where you will play a crucial role in setting and communicating the overall vision and strategy. Your responsibilities will involve supporting the OneStream and Active Disclosure enterprise applications and related technologies for consolidations and financial reporting. The Product Owner position requires strategic thinking, strong relationship-building skills, effective communication abilities, and the capability to lead and develop the product team by delivering on transformation efforts within the consolidations and financial reporting domain that bring value to Koch Industries, Inc Our Team Koch Capability Transformation Team (KCTT) is a product centric organization that is aligned to Koch's key business areas (e.g., Finance, Compliance, Legal etc.). As a preferred partner, we focus on people, processes, technology, and data to drive transformation. Our team members are key contributors through the application of frameworks and principles with an emphasis on leveraging critical and economic thinking to drive value. What You Will Do  Provide direction and prioritization to the product team that aligns with the stakeholder's vision. Drive accountability with our product vendors for project or product deliverables Understand the market and leading practices within the marketplace for the product. Understand product costs and determine the cost recovery mechanism. Develop detailed knowledge and understanding of the business process. Collaborate with customers, vendors, and IT teams to appropriately implement technology solutions. Work with the business to develop training plans and training materials that will be used in the training of end users on new systems and enhancements. Collaborate with business stakeholders and technology vendors to understand their capabilities and strategic roadmaps. Manage project or product scope by thoroughly understanding the business culture, environment, and people. Identify opportunities to leverage applications across the organization to minimize duplicate systems within the organization. Engage in analysis and decision-making processes for new initiatives. Communicate with leadership and stakeholders on current initiatives. Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)  Experience working in large, complex platforms with business process workflow or leading IT projects implementations. Collaboration and influencing skills with peers and customers to influence and gain alignment on objectives across the globe. Experience working with product vendors, external customers and IT Teams for project deliverables. Experience developing training programs and materials for users of enhanced systems and products. Strong economic, analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving ability. What Will Put You Ahead  Experience implementing and/or supporting integrations and business processes in consolidations, financial reporting or OneStream application. Experience implementing projects using Agile methodologies. Experience determining product costs. At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. Hiring Philosophy All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here . Who We Are As a Koch company, Koch Global Services (KGS) creates solutions spanning technology, human resources, finance, project management and anything else our businesses need. With locations in India, Mexico, Poland and the United States, our employees have the opportunity to make a global impact. At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company. Our Benefits Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter. Equal Opportunities Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. The world loves Postgres. If you work with developers or data scientists or anyone wrangling data, you'll probably see a sticker with the tusks and trunk of the Postgres elephant on the lid of a nearby laptop. EDB has a lot to do with that. We've been major contributors to Postgres since the beginning, and we are proud to call thousands of boundary pushing customers our partners. Proud though we are, we are not resting on our laurels. There's plenty of work to do. The good news is that everything we do will impact Postgres, which is to say that it will impact the world. No pressure. **This position is 100% remote for candidates based in the US** We are looking for a great Product Manager who has experience driving forward complex technical products for enterprise-class, data intensive products, which will be essential to this role. Specific technical knowledge with Kubernetes will be key as well, and Database experience would be ideal. Your impact will be:Working cross-functionally within EDB, across engineering, marketing, sales, and other functions to take ideas through the entire lifecycle, from ideation to production.Working with customers to understand and incorporate their feedback into our product vision while also being an effective evangelist for EDB and our offerings.Collaborating with product and engineering peers to deliver your product's roadmap.Making sure our engineering team is always fed with a prioritized backlog of features with clear acceptance criteria.Supporting our Sales team. Collaborating with product marketing and enablement to ensure the field is prepared to support new releases.Bringing an inquisitive, innovative & collegiate attitude to problem solving.What you'll bring:Demonstrated success as a product manager for a complex, data-intensive offering with enterprise customers.Exceptional communication skills. Able to explain complex topics and provide audience-appropriate summarizations.Solid understanding of modern product management principles and product development processes.Solid understanding of database fundamentals (types, uses, and features of databases).Strong foundation of Kubernetes technical knowledge.What will give you an edge:MBA with a technical undergrad degree preferred, but not required.Understanding of the Postgres ecosystem, used/managed Postgres.Knowledge of OSS and OSS communities (not just Postgres, though that's a double plus!). EDB is committed to supporting our employees' overall well being by offering a range of benefits and resources to promote a healthy work-life balance and wellness. We provide access to Modern Health to aid employees in health and wellness tips and practices, as well as Wellness Fridays extending to the end of 2023! Check out our career site for more information on perks and benefits and reach out to our Talent Acquisition team for region specific benefits. We know it takes a unique mix of people and skills to help us in our mission to supercharge Postgres, and we understand that not everyone will check every box. We'd love to hear from you and we want you to apply! EDB is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Product Manager: Product Manager - Ecosystem Governance & Strategy (TikTok LIVE)
column7: Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.  Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. Job Description: 1. Build and improve the Eco-governance system and platform tools to ensure stability and efficiency. 2. Develop a rational user inform mechanism and education strategy to create a healthy community atmosphere, and to enhance the content quality. 3. Design identification and governance strategies, optimize ecology issues in main and sub-scenarios of livestream to support the healthy development of the LIVE business. 4. Collaborate with teams such as algorithms, strategies, and operations to optimize the ecology governance moderation process, to improve moderation efficiency and quality. Qualifications 1. Passionate about content products; experience in content moderation, ecological governance, audit backend, and similar governance product roles is a plus. 2. Possess excellent product design and business understanding capabilities; able to identify and address issues through data or processes and drive solutions. 3. Strong logical thinking ability; capable of establishing effective communication on critical issues during cross-team collaboration and driving implementation. 4. Strong project management and stress resistance capabilities; able to grasp various demands and integrate resources to achieve cross-departmental cooperation.  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.  TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at live.accommodations@tiktok.com Job Information The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $132696 - $215080 annually.  ​  Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.  ​  Our company benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support our employees to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees:  ​  We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care.  ​ Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off (PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability.  ​  We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv. Job Title Product Owner, Small Business Platform  What does a successful Product Owner do at Fiserv? The Product Owner is an integral part of a team of passionate Product experts within Fiserv who are focused on small business credit card management platform. As a Product Owner you will drive the product strategy to a successful product or feature and rally a team of user experience designers, architects, and developers to turn the vision into a reality. You will be expected to be work in-office at our world class Berkeley Heights, NJ Innovation Center and collaborate with fellow teammates at Berkeley Heights as well as offshore locations. What you will do: Help define the product vision and writing requirements. Prioritize product features and capabilities. Align stakeholders around the vision of the product. Understand user needs and translate them into the user experience. Work with scrum teams to deliver the features. Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of product. What you will need to have: 8+ years of prior product management or product owner experience. Effective presentation, written and verbal communication skills. Critical thinking/analytical leadership experience. Proven track record of successfully managing all aspects throughout the full product lifecycle. What would be great to have: Prior experience in the FinTech/Payments industry. Experience in Agile methodologies. Ability to work with cross-functional teams. This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, New York or Washington. Please note that salary ranges provided for this role on external job boards are salary estimates made by outside parties and may not be accurate. Thank you for considering employment with Fiserv. Please: Apply using your legal name Complete the step-by-step profile and attach your resume (either is acceptable, both are preferable). What you should know about us: Fiserv is a global fintech leader with 40,000-plus (and growing) associates proudly serving clients in more than 100 countries. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company, one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, and a top scorer on Bloomberg’s Gender-Equality Index, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce that reflects our world. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Warning about fake job posts: Please be aware of fraudulent job postings that are not affiliated with Fiserv. Fraudulent job postings may be used by cyber criminals to target your personally identifiable information and/or to steal money or financial information. Any communications from a Fiserv representative will come from a legitimate business email address. We will not hire through text message, social media, or email alone, and any interviews will be conducted in person or through a secure video call. We won’t ask you for sensitive information nor will we ask you to pay anything during the hiring process. We also won’t send you a check to cash on Fiserv’s behalf. If you see suspicious activity or believe that you have been the victim of a job posting scam, you should report it to your local FBI field office or to the FBI’s Internet Crime Complaint Center.
