Company Overview:   WHO ARE WE Lennox International(LII) is a leading global provider of innovative climate control solutions for heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVACR) markets.   Beginning over a century ago, Lennox International has built a strong heritage of Innovation and Responsibility. Our position as an innovation leader continually inspires us to promote more efficient energy use and a healthier environment through our product operations. Our engaged and diverse workforce is committed to providing climate control solutions that provide the most value and comfort for our customers.    We are proud to have instilled a shared sense of responsibility and commitment among our approximately 10,000 employees located throughout North America, South America, Europe, and Asia.  If you are passionate about shaping the future of commercial HVAC control systems and driving product innovation, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and contribute to creating sustainable, energy-efficient buildings that enhance occupant comfort and productivity.  Job Description:   WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  We are seeking a driven individual to join our dynamic Product Management team. As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for supporting the strategic planning, development, and management of our commercial HVAC controls products throughout their lifecycle. This role will also have exposure and responsibility for some unitary product lines such as unit heaters, split systems and/or smaller rooftop product lines. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, marketing, sales, and customer support, to ensure our product offerings meet market demands and drive customer satisfaction. We are looking to mold someone into a subject matter expert that will guide product development initiatives, analyze market trends, and champion product enhancements to maintain a competitive edge in the industry.  Product Strategy and Planning Support the development and execution of a comprehensive product strategy and roadmap aligned with our company objectives. Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and customer feedback analysis to identify product opportunities and drive innovation. Help define product requirements, features, and functionality based on market needs and collaborate with engineering teams for product development. Product Management and Development Support product development lifecycle, from concept to launch, ensuring on-time delivery, quality, and cost-effective solutions. Work closely with engineering teams to prioritize development of new features and products. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create compelling product documentation, including specifications, user manuals, and training materials. Commercialization Strategy and Support Collaborate with marketing teams to develop effective product positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategies. Support sales teams by providing technical expertise, training, and product knowledge to drive successful product adoption and revenue growth. Conduct product demonstrations, presentations, and customer training sessions to showcase product capabilities and benefits. Gather and analyze customer feedback, market trends, and sales data to make data-driven decisions for product enhancements and improvements. Industry Expertise and Market Awareness Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, technologies, and regulations in the commercial HVAC industry. Identify trends and communicate product line insights while developing action plans to drive business objectives. Attend industry conferences, trade shows, and networking events to build relationships, identify partnership opportunities, and stay ahead of competitors. WHAT WE OFFER Lennox offers employees a variety of flexible work options. This position is a hybrid role working Monday through Thursday in the office with the option to work on Friday at home.  Competitive base salary Excellent medical plans designed to support healthy lifestyles Mental and financial health programs Outstanding 401k with company matching Employee stock purchase program Community involvement opportunities Robust employee assistance program And much, much more! Qualifications:   WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Business, or a related field. At least 1 years in HVAC engineering, design, application, or related experience, preferably in the commercial HVAC or building controls industry. WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TEAM Proactive, self-motivated, and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Basic knowledge of commercial HVAC systems, controls, protocols, and industry standards related to technical understanding of products. Basic project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and deliver results in a fast-paced environment. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making. Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate technical terms to product features and customer value proposition.   The Compensation range for this position is approximately $64k - $85k and will be based on the candidate’s qualification, experience, and education.  WE VALUE DIVERSITY We believe that diversity and inclusion is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Our goal is to build workplaces that reflect the communities where we live and work, support the growth and development of each team member as they strive to reach their full potential, and empower them to be their authentic selves. Lennox is an equal opportunity employer.    #LI-Hybrid    #LI-JC1

Overview:   What We Do We calm the confusion of IT by guiding the connection between people and technology. If a customer is looking for a better way to manage their warehouse inventory, equip their workforce, or secure their data, we make it happen. All it takes is finding the right combination of tech hardware, software, cloud solutions, and support services. That’s what we do. We’re the IT Department’s IT Department. Who We Are Our team is made stronger by a multitude of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. It’s what makes Connection unique—what drives us to innovate and create technology solutions that stand apart from the crowd. We’d love for you to be a part of that fabric, to share your ideas and experiences with a team that thrives on fresh thinking, creativity, and helping others. Why You Should Join Us   You’ll find supportive teammates and a rewarding career at Connection—plus great benefits. We take pride in supporting employees with a total rewards package that provides financial, emotional, and physical resources for you and your family. Our compensation, 401k plans, medical insurance, and other benefits are progressive and competitive. We value the importance of our employees’ emotional wellbeing. To support employees, we provide free therapy visits, mental health coaching and tools, and meditation resources. You’ll also enjoy a generous paid time off package that includes not only vacation and sick time, but also Wellness and Volunteer Time Off days.  Responsibilities:       Working under general supervision of the Senior Director, Product Management, relying on experience and judgement to plan and accomplish goals, the Manager, Product Line, Workplace Transformation, markets computer products and/or develops/markets new IT services and solutions that deliver strong gross margins and increase total revenues for the company. The secondary responsibility of the Manager, Product Line is to develop working relationships with vendors, related 3rd party partners, and other departments within the company to aid the sales and marketing of the offering(s). The Manager develops and executes a market-driven product/IT Services strategy. Where appropriate, the Manager establishes effective inventory management techniques to maximize fill rates, turns and return on assets. The Manager develops and manages product/services forecasts for sales, vendor returns, gross margin dollars, gross profit percentage and rebate program optimization. The Manager develops sales growth strategies for a Partner and/or Segment. The Manager maintains and manages vendor funded headcount relationships directly or in a matrix model. The Manager manages and develops direct reports to meet or exceed company goals. The Manager manages the P&L of assigned product/service lines and service offerings. The Manager is the 1st line manager for Business Segment.    Job Duties:Develops market level strategy, business plans and forecasts. Expected End Result: Active maintenance and management to an actionable business plan that increases market share, sales and profits for the company.   Sets quarterly, monthly and annual qualitative and quantitative goals for individual teams. Sets priorities and manages the day to day interaction with the vendor’s channel account team(s).     Coaches, motivates and develops personnel.     Provides departmental balance, manages priorities and resolves conflicts     Insures that individual goals are harmonized with company and other departmental goals.     Provides and solicits frequent feedback.     Completes annual written performance reviews.     Expected End Result: An organization that is focused on top company, departmental and individual goals.    Manages the most effective merchandising of products in the catalogs and/or through various marketing programs. Works with Director of Purchasing to set targets for inventory position.     Directs the management of inventory levels, fill rate, backorders and turns.     Expected End Result: Maximum return on company assets.    Manages major vendors/suppliers via effective information flow, programs, promotions, meetings, and executive briefings. 1st pass at Negotiating terms and conditions for vendor contracts. Leads major product acquisitions, new product launches and new service offering launches. Manages trade show strategy and attend shows. Expected End Result: Rapid time to market, maximum gross profit and strong vendor relationships.    Drives process improvements across horizontal (cross-company) lines. Expected End Result: A more efficient, productive and profitable organization.    Performs all other duties or special projects as assigned including promotional merchandise inventory management (chotchkes). Min: USD $80,000.00/Yr. Max: USD $103,000.00/Yr. Qualifications:  Proficient use of Microsoft Excel and Word.Ability to learn relevant business systems tools (JDE, Product Wizard, Business Objects, etc.).Strong business analysis skills.Exceptional negotiating, selling, communications and organizational skills.Demonstrable product and marketing expertise.Knowledge of Inventory management.Proven leadership capabilities.Because of the possibility for fraudulent job postings on many popular job boards, please be advised that Connection will never offer a position of employment without a complete interview process and communication with a “live person".

For more than two decades, Telestream has been at the forefront of innovation in the digital video industry, pioneering file-based video transcoding and high-quality media exchange over IP networks. Telestream provides world-class live and on-demand digital video tools and workflow solutions that allow businesses and consumers to transform video on the desktop and across the enterprise. Many of the world's most demanding media and entertainment companies such as CBS, BBC, CNN, FOX, CBC, Comcast, Direct TV, Time Warner, MTV, Discovery and Lifetime, as well as a growing number of users in a broad range of business environments, rely on Telestream products to streamline operations, reach broader audiences, and generate more revenue from their media. If you're looking for an industry leader in the high growth area of video, Telestream is for you. Associate Product Marketing Manager Location: Remote, US Position Summary: We are seeking a talented Associate Product Marketing Manager to join our dynamic team. We are one of the media and entertainment industry's most established B2B Tech companies. As the Associate Product Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing the go-to-market strategy for our cloud messaging solutions. Your expertise in cloud messaging, will be instrumental in positioning our software as the premier solution for media companies worldwide. Responsibilities: 1.Develop and execute the go-to-market strategy for our cloud messaging solutions targeted at the media and entertainment industry, ensuring alignment with overall company goals and objectives. 2.Conduct market research and gather customer insights to identify key market segments, buyer personas, and their pain points in the media industry. 3.Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product management, sales, and marketing to define and refine product positioning, messaging, and value propositions. 4.Create compelling sales enablement tools and marketing collateral, including presentations, whitepapers, case studies, and solution briefs, to drive awareness and sales opportunities. 5.Work closely with the demand generation team to develop and execute effective marketing campaigns to generate leads and promote our cloud messaging solutions. 6.Provide guidance and support to the sales team by equipping them with the necessary training, product knowledge, and tools required to effectively sell the value of our solutions. 7.Monitor industry trends, competitive landscape, and customer feedback to continuously refine and enhance our messaging and positioning. 8. Collaborate with customers and industry partners to develop and showcase compelling success stories and testimonials that demonstrate the value of our cloud messaging solutions in the media industry. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. MBA is a plus. 2. Proven experience in product marketing in a B2B SaaS Company, with a strong focus on cloud messaging. Experience with companies that moved from perpetual to term subscription pricing is a plus. 3. Strong understanding of cloud messaging platforms, technologies, and best practices. 4. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to distill complex technical concepts into clear and compelling messaging. 5. Experience developing and executing successful go-to-market strategies for software solutions. 6. Can collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and positively influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. 7. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, start-up-like environment and adapt to changing priorities and opportunities. We wear many hats around here! 8.Self-motivated, proactive, and detail-oriented with exceptional project management and organizational abilities. 9.Intellectually curious! We are looking for passion for technology and willingness to stay updated on the latest industry trends and best practices in demand generation. We offer a competitive salary, benefits package, and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative environment. If you are a driven professional with a passion for demand generation and thrive in a start-up-like setting, we would love to hear from you!

Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here. Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of. Who We Are… When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next… From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive. About Warner Bros. Discovery Warner Bros. Discovery, a premier global media and entertainment company, offers audiences the world’s most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands, and franchises across television, film, streaming, and gaming. The new company combines premium entertainment, sports, and news assets with the leading non-fiction and international entertainment and sports businesses. Position Summary We are hiring a Senior Vice President of Advertising Product to lead the advertising experience and product capabilities of our streaming products, including Max, HBO Max, discovery+, our television everywhere products, and digital products across news, sports, and entertainment. This SVP will lead the advertising experience and advertising product capabilities of all digital experiences globally, including the ad-based customer experience, customer-facing ad product experience, and advertising capabilities, working closely with Ad Sales and Ad Technology leadership. This leader will lead advertising capabilities that accelerate and grow the business, while ensuring ad-based customers have a premium streaming and digital experiences on each ad-based product that fosters repeat and ongoing engagement. They will be a strategic partner to Warner Bros. Discovery Product, Engineering, Ad Sales, and Marketing teams, as well as the Streaming leadership, to build world class advertising experiences and capabilities for customers and advertisers globally. This role will lead the vision, strategy, planning, and execution of advertising product experience and capabilities to provide world class experiences that effectively monetize the business while achieving high customers satisfaction and engagement. They will lead an Advertising Product team that starts with the customer and builds from there, and advocate for customer and advertiser needs vigorously through the product development lifecycle. They will design innovative and intuitive advertising experiences, implement scalable solutions, and ensure a world class end-to-end advertising experience. They will work with product and engineering leaders to prioritize, build, and enhance all advertising experiences and capabilities. They will establish operating processes to drive systematic improvements based on customer and advertiser feedback, needs, and behavior. An ideal candidate will have a missionary zeal to increase access to WBDs products to millions of customers globally through customer-centric advertising experiences, and exceptional capabilities and opportunities for our advertisers. This person will combine bold and creative vision with data-driven decision making. They will have an insatiable curiosity, build for scale, and obsess about the both the customer and advertiser. They will persistently investigate poor customer experiences to identify the root causes and determine how to improve the experience. They are a leader that the team loves to work with because they inspire, develop, and care for their team members. They build trust with people from all areas of the business and have a proven track record. This leader takes end-to-end ownership and consistently delivers results in a fast-paced environment. What you will do Partner with senior Product, Ad Sales, Engineering, Content, and Marketing leaders to determine the strategic goals, plans, and operating practices needed to monetize WBD products through advertising, while delivered a world-class experience for Ad Supported customers. Establish a customer-centric vision for advertising on WBD streaming and digital products that gives access to our products and stories to millions of customers, while effectively monetizing product engagement through advertising and providing advertisers compelling opportunities to improve their brands. Lead the planning, creation, and execution of an end-to-end Advertising experience and Advertising capabilities for streaming and digital experiences, including entertainment, sports, and other innovative use cases. Partner with Ad Sales leaders and teams to grow and improve the advertising business through high quality customer and advertiser experiences, and effectively delivering and executing on our commitments to advertisers. Work closely with customer-centric product, design, and engineering teams to create advertising experiences that are intuitive, compelling, and memorable for customers. Identify root causes of defects in the customers’ and advertisers’ experiences and solve these root causes through product and platform enhancements. Develop systems that effectively leverage data in a trustworthy manner to improve how we monetize the business. Leverage data and insights to determine enhancements throughout the end-to-end advertising product experience. Partner closely with Research teams to validate experiences with customers and gather customer feedback and insights throughout the product development process. Build a scalable team to deliver compelling advertising experiences across platforms, including mobile apps, tablets, web, connected TVs, and set top boxes, and adaptable for all countries globally. Hire, manage, and develop product leaders and professionals, helping them enhance their skills and grow their careers. Build an innovative, creative, and disciplined Ad Product team that builds trust, encourages collaboration, fosters a diverse and inclusive culture, maintains strong accountability, delivers results, increases employee engagement, and has fun. What you will need to have Proven experience in product leadership in media, entertainment, technology, or relevant industries. Extensive experience in managing teams to deliver compelling product experiences, with responsibilities that include day-to-day management, professional development, hiring and retention, and coaching and mentoring. Extensive experience in developing compelling Advertising experiences for customers and advertisers, including products and capabilities that span multiple geographies and languages. Demonstrated ability to work with leaders and peers to evaluate new ideas, discuss advertising and product concepts, create compelling concepts, implement new experiences, and make tradeoffs to remove roadblocks. Compelling experience in Advertising, Ad Product and Technology, Ad Sales, and/or Ad Operations. Experience implementing Advertising Technology at scale across customer-facing experiences. Experience leading and driving systematic improvements across product and engineering teams. Experience building and leading diverse and inclusive teams across multiple work locations and functions. Excellent written, visual, and verbal communication skills. Can communicate the results of your (and your team’s) work clearly to your audience. Advanced degree in business or technology is a plus. How We Get Things Done… This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview. The Legal Bits… In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skillset, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $290,500.00 - $539,500.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).  Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.  If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

Product Manager: 2024 Campus Recruitment - Product Management Development Program
column7: Job Description    Cognex Corporation invests in talent. One way we do this is through our Product Management Development Program (aka Gradnoid program), a full-time paid opportunity for recent college undergraduates. This fast-paced rotational program is designed for early career engineers that are interested in a Product Management and Business Management track. Through 2-3 project-based assignments across the company, you will begin to bridge the gap between design engineering and business management. Rotations are designed to expose you to cutting-edge technology such as AI interacting with global manufacturing customers, and leadership skills needed to advance your career in the fast-paced world of technology.    The Gradnoid program seeks to cultivate highly skilled, productive and committed Cognoids who will help lead Cognex’s future success. Program participants will develop leadership skills, increase their technical competence and gain market knowledge by working on critical business projects. Each candidate hired into the program will be able to make immediate contributions to the business. Following the program, Gradnoids will secure a position within Cognex.    Gradnoid Qualifications:    Cognex is looking for well-rounded, intelligent, creative and motivated engineering candidates with a passion for getting results. Individuals with these characteristics will allow Cognex to develop a successful engineering team and continue to lead the machine vision marketplace.  High energy and motivated learner that aspires to be a leader Excellent presentation, communication, organizational and interpersonal skills Drives change with strong analytical and problem-solving skills Team player who can work effectively with cross functional teams and willing to take the initiative to address problems without hesitation   Education and Experience Required:  Only open to Undergraduate Seniors and Masters students graduating in May 2024 [Program start date: June 2024] Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical & Computer, or Robotics Engineering Ability to program in C++ or Python preferred   PROGRAM OVERVIEW    Engineering Assignments:    The Gradnoid program is a 18-month development program comprised of 2-3 project-based assignments that will each be 6-9 months in duration. The program targets the development of functional, technical, and leadership skills. These assignments help our college graduates and managers determine where Gradnoids will flourish in their full-time position at Cognex.  Assignments may span across several business units (e.g. Advanced Technology, Products & Platforms or Logistics) The number and length of assignments will fluctuate depending on business need Gradnoid Training:    Gradnoids are offered exclusive training throughout the program in many important developmental areas including, but not limited to:  Introduction to Cognex Corporation Cognex culture and leadership Technical instruction & product overviews Machine vision and ID technology industry overview Global business effectiveness Project management Communication skills Presentation skills Negotiating skills   Gradnoid Mentoring:    As a participant in the Gradnoid to Cognoid Engineering Development Program, Gradnoids have access to Cognoid mentors who will personally guide the incoming Gradnoid class, making themselves readily available to answers questions and provide guidance throughout their time in the program.    Continuing Education:    In addition to the extensive onsite training, Gradnoid members are encouraged to pursue advanced degrees by taking advantage of Cognex’s tuition reimbursement program.    Networking:    The Gradnoid program offers a unique opportunity to network with colleagues and executives from day one. Through formal introductions with executives, team building exercises with colleagues and hands on work experience, Gradnoids are immediately immersed in the corporate culture in order to hit the ground running!    Corporate Culture and Socialization:    Cognex embraces the need for camaraderie in the workplace understanding that it fosters collaboration and teamwork. Through exclusive outings and group events the Gradnoid program allows for members to quickly acclimate and form lasting relationships in the industry.    Additional Job Description  Equal Employment Opportunity Cognex is an equal opportunity employer. Cognex evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Product OwnerAs a Technical Product Owner, you will be responsible for translating the vision of our product roadmap into actionable tasks for the development team. You will bridge the gap between business goals and technical execution, ensuring that our products are delivered on time and with the highest quality standards. This role requires a deep understanding of both technical and business aspects, excellent communication skills, and a strong sense of ownership.Location(s): North Carolina Research Triangle or East Coast (preferred)Day-to-Day Responsibilities:Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and define the product vision and roadmap.Organize and maintain a prioritized backlog in Jira for a team of developers, ensuring it aligns with the strategic goals and customer needs.Work closely with customers, business analysts, and development teams to gather and refine product requirements.Actively participate in Sprint ceremonies and partner with Scrum Master in supporting agile frameworkPartner with the UX/UI designer in creation and reviewing concept designs and wireframes.Create and manage user stories, acceptance criteria, and specifications for the development team.Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and the development team, ensuring clear and effective communication.Define and validate product functionality, ensuring it meets the specified requirements and quality standards.Address issues and roadblocks promptly, making decisions that keep development on track and aligned with business objectives.Develop test plans, perform testing and post-production validation.Coordinate and review product documentation, including user guides, release notes, and technical documentation with the technical writing team.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in a related field (Computer Science, Engineering, Business, etc.).Proven experience as a Technical Product Owner or similar role in a technical environment.Strong understanding of software development methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum.Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.Technical background with the ability to understand and discuss technical concepts (experience with SQL databases and SaaS applications preferred).Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Highly organized with a keen attention to detail.Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.Certification in Product Ownership (e.g., CSPO) is a plus.Travel Required: None required

Ingersoll Cutting Tools Company is proud to be part of the IMC Group of Companies with 150 subsidiaries in 60 countries. Our US operations are housed on our state-of-the-art manufacturing and marketing campus in Rockford, Illinois. We are currently accepting applications for a Product Manager.The Product Manager role is a mix of technical support, marketing, and collaborating with customers and design engineering to evaluate current products and make recommendations for research and development. The Product Manager will utilize their expertise in the metal cutting industry as well as their strong communication skills to work closely with customers to help solve their technical problems, to complete technical writing, and make integral contributions to product innovation. A people-person with a high level of interest in the industry would be a great fit.Essential job duties and Responsibilities include:Providing technical expertise to customers in regard to cutting tool products and applicationsTechnical writing, development of marketing materials including new product announcementsAttending seminars, trade shows, and other industry eventsCollaborating with design and proposal engineering to assist with projects and new product developmentSkills/Qualifications:Expertise within the cutting tool industry and/or CNC machiningStrong communication skills, both verbal and writtenBachelors degree highly preferred, preferably in an engineering or manufacturing technology disciplineWillingness to travel up to 30%Ability to build rapport and relationships with customers, employees, and business partnersThis is a full-time position that may require intermittent overtime based on workflow demands (including potential for long shifts and/or weekend work).Why our people love working for Ingersoll Cutting Tools:Ingersoll Cuttings Tools offers a strong benefits package including affordable and robust health, vision, and dental insurance plans. Our employees also benefit from an excellent 401k match, wellness reimbursement policy, as well as vacation and sick time. Ingersoll Cutting Tools often promotes from within, offering employees the chance to grow their skill set and experience. What we pride ourselves most on is our culture – you can expect to find a collaborative, friendly, and inclusive environment here.If you would like to be considered for this position, please e-mail your resume with a brief cover letter highlighting your unique qualifications to careers@ingersoll-imc.com.For more information about us visit us at www.ingersoll-imc.com or our Facebook Page***No Phone Calls Please***Job Type: Full-time

The HORIBA Group of worldwide companies provides an extensive array of instruments and systems for applications ranging from automotive R&D, process and environmental monitoring, in-vitro medical diagnostics, semiconductor manufacturing and metrology, to a broad range of scientific R&D and QC measurements. Proven quality and trustworthy performance have established widespread confidence in the HORIBA Brand. Inspired by our With our unique motto, “JOY and FUN,” we focus on social responsibilities by building state-of-the-art products for scientific advancement; especially for protecting health, safety, and the environment. “HORIBARIANs,” the HORIBA employees all over the world, look forward to working with additional creative and entrepreneurial self-starters. To learn more about our unique culture, visit our culture page. The role of the Elemental Analyzer Area Product Manager is to drive the sales and marketing strategies for the Inductive Coupled Plasma Optical Emission Spectrometers [ICP-OES], C/S/N/O/H Analyzers, and Glow Discharge Optical Emission Spectrometers [GD-OES], of HORIBA, in North America. The right candidate will need to interface daily with Sales, Application, Service, Marketing, and Production functions Essential Job Functions:Develop and implement sales and Marketing StrategiesSupport the Sales team networkWork with Applications to assess application and market trends in North America.Responsible for monitoring the Profit and Loss statement and variancesStrongly Involved in order entry and order follow up with manufacturers [France, Japan]Support Service function with technical knowledge and customer relationship management Skills/Experience Required:Elemental Analyzers of materials,Strong technical backgroundBusiness developmentAbility to work independentlyProfessional, dynamic presence and the ability to communicate with people at all levelsExcellent written and verbal skills Compensation Package: HORIBA Instruments offers a competitive compensation package that includes a 401(k) plan with match; employee group dental, vision, life, and disability (short and long-term) paid for by the company; medical insurance, family dental and vision insurance, and supplemental life insurance available with reasonable employee contributions; employee assistance program; paid holidays, vacation, and sick time; flexible spending accounts; and educational reimbursement and commuter benefit programs. If you are an individual, with a disability and need an accommodation during the application or hiring process. process, please call (732)494-8660 for assistance. HORIBA will provide reasonable accommodations, upon request, to support individuals with disabilities to be able to participate in the hiring process. HORIBA is committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. EEO/Affirmative Action/Veteran Status/Disabilities.

The Role:   Product Management Team Lord Abbett’s Product Management team is responsible for leading the firm’s strategy and execution for growing our products across markets, focusing on four critical functions: Developing Strategic Product Plans Developing Effective Product Applications Training our Sales Force Engaging with Markets The team is aligned with the product lifecycle, with one group focused on earlier stage products that can grow into Market Ready and ultimately Market Leading products, and a group focused on overseeing the strategy for our current Market Leading products. This current opening is for a role focused on Market Ready products. The Product Specialist Role As a Product Specialist, you will play a key role in shaping how we bring our products to market and how we grow them throughout the product lifecycle. You will collaborate with Marketing leaders, Investments, and other stakeholders to develop and refine content, materials, and key messages for U.S. Retail, U.S. Institutional, and International markets. In line with the critical functions of Product Management, you will be responsible for: Developing Strategic Product Plans: Within your product specialty, you will work with the Co-Head of Product Management and others across the firm to develop strategic plans for how we will scale, grow, and/or defend our products. Developing Effective Product Applications: You will draw upon your capital markets knowledge and experience as well as your ability to shape clear messages to develop application narratives that help our clients understand how to implement our products into their investment portfolios. Training our Sales Force: You will play a central role in how we train our sales professionals on our product message and materials, and how we will win in each market. Engaging with Markets: As a key part of this role, creating and leveraging a constant feedback loop is essential to ensuring the effectiveness of our message. Depending on experience, engaging with the markets could be participating in client and prospect meetings, engaging with our sales leaders to understand the effectiveness of our narratives and applications, and competitive analytics. We’ll trust you to::  Build and refine product materials that best position us to engage with prospects and clients. . Develop product scaling plans that illustrate our strategy to grow in a specific market. Engage regularly with the Investment Strategist Group to continuously refine product positioning exhibits, marketing collateral, and embedded capital markets content in pitchbooks. Own how our products are represented across all mediums . Partner with Market Strategy, Investment Strategists, Digital, and Sales to execute scaling plans. Position our products through standard portfolio commentaries and questionnaire responses. Contribute to thought leadership initiatives Support Relationship Management and Sales with portfolio reviews and strategy updates via virtual meetings, conference calls, and some in-person meetings with financial advisors and partner firms. Lead sales trainings across all markets You'll need to have::  Fluency in capital markets/asset classes, economics, securities, investment strategies, and the asset management industry. Strong content creation skills in pitchbooks, bespoke materials, and multiple media formats, with the ability to distill complex ideas and topics effectively. Experience creating effective product and capital markets-related content. Project management and execution experience. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Strong presentation and client engagement skills. Proactive approach to work and learning. Strong analytical skills. Situational adaptability and organizational savvy. Why Lord Abbett?:        Lord Abbett is a leading global independent, privately held investment management company. We are active managers and invest where we believe we have a repeatable edge and can deliver alpha for our clients. Our vision is to be the most respected asset manager in the world, admired for our people, our performance, our relationships, and our organizational agility. This inspires the three pillars of our culture.     Principles-Led - We empower our leaders to create an environment of trust. Performance-Oriented - We inspire our people to embody our values, excellence, responsibility, transparency & collaboration. Purpose-Driven - Embraces our mission: Securing a sustainable future for our clients, people, and world.      We are honored to have earned recognition as one of the Best Places to Work in Money Management by Pensions & Investments and scored 100% on the Human Rights Campaign’s Corporate Equality Index, a measure of LGBTQ+ workplace equality.     Compensation Information: Annual base salary for this role is $105,000 - $120,000 (+ bonus). Salary is estimated for this role. Actual pay may be different.          Discretionary Bonus: Role may be eligible to receive an annual discretionary bonus. Discretionary bonuses are determined by several factors including, but not limited to, firm, team, and individual performance.          Benefits: Lord Abbett is committed to offering a competitive total rewards package to all eligible employees. Offerings include competitive total compensation, retirement plans, competitive health and well-being plans. To learn more about what we offer, please visit Careers | Lord Abbett     Lord Abbett is an equal employment opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to the following legally protected characteristics: race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, sexual identity, caregiver status, military/veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal law. All employment decisions at Lord Abbett are based solely on the applicant’s relevant experience, skills and qualifications.

CLEARANCE REQUIRED: TS with SCI eligibilityThis job is located in: Tampa, FLQSL is looking for highly motivated individuals to support U.S. Special Operations Command in various locations.Qualifications and Job Summary:Product Owner/Project Manager/Task Lead (BS in CS, Information Systems or related): Works as part of a team providing product ownership for multiple agile teams collocated with the development team. This position will attend product management events and meetings as the development team requirements stakeholder and will have to effectively communicate these requirements back to the team. Designed for someone with a strong experience in agile development methodologies. Responsible for defining Stories and prioritizing Team Backlog based on extensive conversation and discovery with government customers. The product owner has a significant role in maximizing the value provided by our development teams and ensuring stories meet the user's needs. Product Owner will perform the following duties:Maintain the Team BacklogIteration PlanningJust-In-Time Story ElaborationApply Acceptance Test Driven DevelopmentUser Story Development and AcceptanceUnderstand Enabler WorkParticipate in Demos as part of an Agile Release TrainFirst Of A Kind (FOAK) solutionsAdditional requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related fieldPrevious working experience as a product ownerIn-depth knowledge of Agile methodologiesStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong communication skills, written and verbalStrong presentation skillsAbility to multi-task and work under pressureStrong knowledge of Jira and Atlassian toolsCurrent DoD Top Secret clearance and eligible for SCI accessWhy work for QSL?Our founders, Mel Wick and Bill Cronin, retired from storied careers in the Special Operations Forces (SOF) Community. Like many Americans and military veterans, they felt a strong desire to support the nation’s response to the 9/11/2001 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon in any way they could. They established QSL to do just that, Stay in the Fight! QSL is built on a SOF culture, emphasizing selfless-service and teamwork. Our employees work to ensure that warfighters have every possible resource and all necessary support to safely accomplish their missions in defense of our nation.QSL's Benefit PackageBecause we believe our employees are our most valuable asset, offering a competitive comprehensive compensation package is very important to us. It is the goal of QSL to attract and retain the highest level of experience and technical talent necessary for successful performance. In order to accomplish this, we feel that it is necessary to provide satisfying work, an excellent work environment, and we continually monitor the marketplace to ensure that our total compensation/benefit package remains competitive.Listed below are some of our standard benefits. We combine all traditional paid time off (Federal holidays, sick time, leave time personal days, jury duty, bereavement, etc.) into one category which allows employees flexibility in how they use their leave time and enables them to better balance their career with their personal needs.Combined Paid Time Off (PTO)Medical, Dental, Life InsuranceDisability (Short-Term and Long-Term)Vision Insurance (CONUS-based employees)Flexible Spending Account (FSA)401(k) Retirement PlanEmployee Referral Bonus ProgramEmployee Discount ProgramsCritical Illness and Accident InsuranceEmployee Assistance ProgramWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not and will not discriminate in employment and personnel practices based on race, sex, age, disability, veteran status, religion, national origin or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Description/Job Summary Associate Product Manager Overview of the Role As the Associate Product Manager, you will be responsible for the tactical commercial execution of assigned products that include product launches, tradeshow execution, sales support and training, and business analytics. Who You'll Work With You will report to the Director of Marketing while working closely with Marketing, Business Development and Sales to support the assigned products. Major Accountabilities: Learn, help develop and execute the business and marketing plans for assigned product lines in the US market. Drive product marketing plans by assisting with the development of brand positioning, creative briefs, business objectives, strategies, tactics, profit and loss projections and short and long-term growth strategies. Monitors and develops analysis on forecasting, pricing strategies, literature/video/sales support materials, labeling revisions, clinical studies, manufacturing and customer service/operations support for existing product line(s). Duties and Responsibilities Monitors competition, market share and market trends; keeps others informed by maintaining and distributing competitive comparisons and evaluations. Develops product-oriented positioning documents, product profiles, competitive analysis, presentations, demos, white papers, product updates and content for corporate marketing vehicles such as web sites, brochures, and seminars. Maintains frequent and regular contact with strategic industry experts and trade organizations, field visits with key surgeons and sales consultants, participation in key meetings and conferences to ensure company and products are properly perceived relative to the competition. Collaborates with sales team to ensure a high quality of sales support in terms of new product/market introductions, sales training programs, key surgeon/key account field visits and regular communication, both responsive as well as proactive. Establishes and maintains key close professional relationships with internal and external constituents to stay abreast of new market opportunities. Monitors forecasts as necessary and works collaboratively with other departments to ensure product availability throughout the lifecycle of the product. Maintains up-to-date product and industry knowledge by regular review of the literature, co-traveling with field sales personnel, attending surgeries, etc. Supports the Company's medical education initiatives by assisting in the preparation and running of surgeon/customer training courses. Works collaboratively with outside vendor partners in creating impactful creative messaging and campaigns. Leads process and manages creative tactical budgets. Participates in strategic sales and marketing planning activities for assigned products to identify key targets, surgeons, and hospitals by specific product. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Marketing or a related field is desired. Minimum of 1 year of experience working in a Marketing role or marketing-related experience, Medical Device industry preferred. Who We Are & What We Do Boehringer Laboratories, LLC is a US based Medica Device Manufacturer with it's Corporate Headquarters located in Phoenixville, PA. We serve the Acute Care Hospital Market in the US and across the Globe. We have strong product lines in Minimally Invasive Surgery and the Medical Gas spaces. We have a continuous process to grow the company by finding novel devices that improve patient care.  We seek to make world-class products that improve patients' lives. We are dedicated to improving our skills to serve our customers, community, and each other. We are a team of professionals passionate in our work. Our Mission: Caring for Lives through Innovation, Quality, and Service. To learn more about our company, visit www.boehringerlabs.com . We provide an environment that fosters professional growth while offering an excellent wage and benefits package, including a 401(k) with employer match.

Job Description     Group Overview     The TP ICAP Group is a world leading provider of market infrastructure.  Our purpose is to provide clients with access to global financial and commodities markets, improving price discovery, liquidity, and distribution of data, through responsible and innovative solutions.  Through our people and technology, we connect clients to superior liquidity and data solutions.  The Group is home to a stable of premium brands. Collectively, TP ICAP is the largest interdealer broker in the world by revenue, the number one Energy & Commodities broker in the world, the world’s leading provider of OTC data, and an award winning all-to-all trading platform.  The Group operates from more than 60 offices in 27 countries. We are 5,300 people strong. We work as one to achieve our vision of being the world’s most trusted, innovative, liquidity and data solutions specialist.    Role Overview    This role will sit with TP ICAP’s Technology product team group in LOUISVILLE OR HOUSTON that is responsible for driving innovation and evolution within the business. The groups supports the Senior Managing Directors and Desk Heads in growing their business via design and delivery of new technologies and services, and driving adoption of these products and services with both new and existing clients.  The Product & Business Development Management team are at the leading edge of this process – each team is tasked with overseeing a particular asset class or product/service, championing it both internally and externally. They are responsible for the entire lifecycle of the product, from developing and validating the business case, through design, delivery and launch, its commercial viability (both front to back office) and long term growth strategy. They work closely with all the stakeholders – clients, brokers, IT and other teams internally to ensure the right product is delivered on time and within budget.    Role Responsibilities  Establish the goals for the product/service with the key stakeholders. Work with teams internally to establish a credible strategy to deliver those goals. Understand the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats within a particular asset class and work on credible commercial strategies to ensure long term growth and profitability. Communicate product vision and roadmap internally, ensuring these are aligned with the overall business and technology strategy. Own the producing, managing and delivering of the product roadmap. Input into the requirements process for IT projects including interaction with BA, Testers, Vendors & Data management teams. Provide internal training for new systems and functionality, where necessary. Provide creative input to product/system design for on-going work. Recommend product solutions to business users, technology management and business management providing support and guidance in the usage of the systems. Liaise with customers of TP ICAP regarding electronic platform implementations, help support and build relationships. Keep track of the overall structure of financial markets, and understand the micro structure of the markets relevant to particular asset classes.   Experience / Competences    Essential  Solid experience in a financial institution within a Product Manager/Owner, change management or equivalent role. Excellent communication skills at all levels (both written and oral) and strong presentation skills with an outgoing and engaging personality Excellent attention to detail and focus on quality Takes ownership of issues and works on their own initiative. Results oriented. Accountable for specific deliveries and goals, both team and individual.   Desired  Understanding of end to end processes within wholesale financial services Experience working within Agile projects. Experience working with UX teams to drive UI solutions. Strong understanding of the client profiles active in the energy and commodities market. Understanding of trading venues and execution protocols. Knowledge of the commodities market and products. Strong A’ levels and/or degree educated.   Not The Perfect Fit?    Concerned that you may not meet the criteria precisely? At TP ICAP, we wholeheartedly believe in fostering inclusivity and cultivating a work environment where everyone can flourish, regardless of your personal or professional background. If you are enthusiastic about this role but find that your experience doesn't align perfectly with every aspect of the job description, we strongly encourage you to apply. You may be the ideal candidate for this position or another opportunity within our organisation. Our dedicated Talent Acquisition team is here to assist you in recognising how your unique skills and abilities can be a valuable contribution. Don't hesitate to take the leap and explore the possibilities. Your potential is what truly matters to us.    Company Statement    We know that the best innovation happens when diverse people with different perspectives and skills work together in an inclusive atmosphere. That's why we're building a culture where everyone plays a part in making people feel welcome, ready and willing to contribute. TP ICAP Accord - our Employee Network - is a central to this. As well as representing specific groups, TP ICAP Accord helps increase awareness, collaboration, shares best practice, and holds our firm to account for driving continuous cultural improvement.    #houston # louisville #technology    Location  USA - 5177 Richmond Avenue - Houston, TX

Overview:     We are seeking a Data Analytics Product Manager, Technical Applications Specialist, who will be responsible for managing EHC’s portfolio of analytics products including   Power BI, R Studio, and other analytics tools and solutions. They are responsible for managing products throughout the product lifecycle where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors, gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision and working closely with technical team to deliver winning products.  Build and manage relationships with customers and stakeholders across the Emory Analytics community as well as within the Data Analytics team Act as a subject matter expert of assigned product who works to understand customer problems and desired outcomes and orchestrate the entire life cycle of the product including conceptualization, product development, launch, growth, maturity, and retirement Create and maintain a product roadmap for each analytics product for which they are responsible and work with the Data Analytics Program Manager to publish a program roadmap. Facilitate a quarterly Strategy Session to update the Analytics Product and Program roadmaps. Define and report key performance indicators (KPIs) for each analytics product and the overall product portfolio Collaborate with business stakeholders and the Data Analytics technical team on business requirements and delivery of data solutions Identify and communicate high-level acceptance criteria necessary to complete the application to development teams Collaborate with the Data Literacy Manager to prepare for and participate in BI Steering Committee meetings to prioritize data analytics requests Represent the Data Analytics team in the IS Project Prioritization process including collaborating with key stakeholders to develop a business case for projects Communicate with customers including regular product updates and launch communications Implement strategies to ensure a common user experience across analytics products and improve customer satisfaction Communicate with stakeholders, senior management, and project leaders to review progress, discuss issues and resolutions and to authorize scope changes Help digest business issues and identify use cases for analytic solutions across the landscape (Epic, PowerBI, RStudio, AWS, etc.) Description:     JOB DESCRIPTION:  Uses technical skills and provides guidance and direction in the development, implementation and maintenance of complex production information systems. Conducts research in automation techniques to improve application performance, efficiency, and testing. Determines and performs testing methodologies and techniques. Adheres to internal controls and standards established for department. Provides assistance in isolating and solving problems within application systems, interfaces, and middleware infrastructure. Plans and coordinates programming projects within a particular work group. Provides production support in a 7 X 24 Tier 1 environment. Assists and advises subordinate personnel in the solution of highly technical and complex problems and solutions. Functions as a senior programming consultant in advanced computer technology and architecture. Performs related responsibilities as required.   MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:  Seven years of application systems/administration experience OR One year of experience with a bachelor's degree. Must be proficient in at least three computer languages used currently in production. Must be able to lead, engage and mentor others to achieve a very high level of application systems availability and integration. Must have good business skills. Must be able to lead problem solving efforts when mission critical systems are interrupted.   PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS (MediumMax 25lbs): up to 25 lbs, 0-33% of the work day (occasionally); 11-25 lbs, 34-66% of the workday (frequently); 01-10 lbs, 67-100% of the workday (constantly); Lifting 25 lbs max; Carrying of objects up to 25 lbs; Occasional to frequent standing & walking, Occasional sitting, Close eye work (computers, typing, reading, writing), Physical demands may vary depending on assigned work area and work tasks.    ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS: Factors affecting environment conditions may vary depending on the assigned work area and tasks. Environmental exposures include, but are not limited to: Blood-borne pathogen exposure Bio-hazardous waste Chemicals/gases/fumes/vapors Communicable diseases Electrical shock, Floor Surfaces, Hot/Cold Temperatures, Indoor/Outdoor conditions, Latex, Lighting, Patient care/handling injuries, Radiation, Shift work, Travel may be required. Use of personal protective equipment, including respirators, environmental conditions may vary depending on assigned work area and work tasks.  Additional Details:     Technical Apps Specialist I-IV - $23.80 - $74.52/hr. The grade and salary of the position are based on specific criteria met within the qualifications of relevant experience, skills, performance and internal equity.

Your responsibilities will involve supporting the OneStream and Active Disclosure enterprise applications and related technologies for consolidations and financial reporting. The Product Owner position requires strategic thinking, strong relationship-building skills, effective communication abilities, and the capability to lead and develop the product team by delivering on transformation efforts within the consolidations and financial reporting domain that bring value to Koch Industries, Inc Our Team Koch Capability Transformation Team (KCTT) is a product centric organization that is aligned to Koch's key business areas (e.g., Finance, Compliance, Legal etc.). As a preferred partner, we focus on people, processes, technology, and data to drive transformation. Our team members are key contributors through the application of frameworks and principles with an emphasis on leveraging critical and economic thinking to drive value. What You Will Do  Provide direction and prioritization to the product team that aligns with the stakeholder's vision. Drive accountability with our product vendors for project or product deliverables Understand the market and leading practices within the marketplace for the product. Understand product costs and determine the cost recovery mechanism. Develop detailed knowledge and understanding of the business process. Collaborate with customers, vendors, and IT teams to appropriately implement technology solutions. Work with the business to develop training plans and training materials that will be used in the training of end users on new systems and enhancements. Collaborate with business stakeholders and technology vendors to understand their capabilities and strategic roadmaps. Manage project or product scope by thoroughly understanding the business culture, environment, and people. Identify opportunities to leverage applications across the organization to minimize duplicate systems within the organization. Engage in analysis and decision-making processes for new initiatives. Communicate with leadership and stakeholders on current initiatives. Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)  Experience working in large, complex platforms with business process workflow or leading IT projects implementations. Collaboration and influencing skills with peers and customers to influence and gain alignment on objectives across the globe. Experience working with product vendors, external customers and IT Teams for project deliverables. Experience developing training programs and materials for users of enhanced systems and products. Strong economic, analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving ability. What Will Put You Ahead  Experience implementing and/or supporting integrations and business processes in consolidations, financial reporting or OneStream application. Experience implementing projects using Agile methodologies. Experience determining product costs. At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. Our culture lifts you up—there is no ego in the way. Our common purpose? We all want to win for our customers. We aim to always be evolving, dynamic, and ambitious. We believe in the power of genuine connections. Each employee is a part of what makes us unique on the market: agile and dedicated.    Time Type:  Regular    Job Description :    About Our Company    Breezeline is a dynamic, innovative company providing the very best Internet, TV, and Voice service to the US markets we serve. We are ‘Above And Beyonders’, who consistently strive to surprise and delight our customers by doing the unexpected. We continually look for new and better ways to enrich our customers’ lives through connected and memorable experiences.    As the eighth-largest cable operator in the United States, Breezeline reaches more than 1.7 million homes and businesses in 13 states with Internet, TV, Voice and fiber services. Headquartered in Quincy, MA, Breezeline is a subsidiary of Cogeco Communications Inc. (TSX:CCA).    Why Work At Breezeline?    As one of the country’s fast-growing Internet service providers, Breezeline offers our colleagues a vibrant workplace culture and excellent career opportunities. As a proudly diverse and inclusive organization, we believe that every person’s unique individuality should be welcomed and celebrated, and their abilities and potential should be honored and recognized. It is a key part of our culture to actively promote opportunities internally to ensure that you are never static in your career with us.    Internal Values – How we act    We’re proud that Breezeline is unlike any other employer in the industry. We work hard, but we never lose sight of the big picture. We understand that our colleagues are looking for more than just a great job – they want an extraordinary life – and at Breezeline, we want to make that a reality.    And here is how we do it.    Fun: We laugh a lot. It makes every day brighter, and if you don’t love what you do, you’re not doing it right.    Job flexibility: We think everything you do matters – at work and home.    Discounted services: We offer our customers some fantastic services, and we think you deserve to enjoy them in your home, too.    Total Rewards: Let’s be honest, everyone wants to make a good salary. We offer attractive total rewards and a great culture to go along with it. We’ve got you and your family covered with one of the best packages in the business.    Career evolution: At Breezeline, you get more than just a job. You get all the tools you need to learn, grow, and achieve your career goals!  Cutting-edge technology: Do you have a passion for technology? Great, we do, too. At Breezeline, you will get the opportunity to manage, influence, play, create, fix, and re-shape the industry. column7: Duke is a 98 year old, family-owned, global company. As a family-owned business we take a long-term view, providing stable employment in a team-based environment. Our culture is centered on our Values such as Courage, Doing the Right Thing, Honesty, Dignity and Humility. Duke's innovative products and Your Solutions Partner brand promise to our customers create a collaborative, fast-paced work environment built on principles of strategic customer partnerships, agile product development, and lean manufacturing. Job Summary: Provide leadership and drive the business strategy for assigned product categories. Increase overall product health by driving new product development, increasing product profitability, and sustaining the value and relevance of existing product portfolio. Achieve this through deep understanding of markets, technology, and customer pains/gains. Support Enterprise and Value Stream business aims by providing business and competitive product analyses, market research, leadership of new product development and commercialization, life cycle management of our products, and hands-on product and project management work. PM will serve the Enterprise by aggregating value stream individual product needs where possible into product platforms that fulfill the greater good for Enterprise - striking compromises where needed and managing individual product lines for overall product category profitability. Essential Functions: Product Category Management - Provide product and category leadership and management, including prioritization of activities within the product lifecycle. Market and Customer Insights - Understand market, customer and technology trends including the competitive landscape. Lead voice of customer (VOC) and environment of customer (EOC) activities. NPD Commercialization - Be the customer advocate for needs/features/value, prioritizing to drive minimum viable product (MVP) thinking. Lead commercialization plans. Product Profitability - Drive strategic pricing and VA/VE activities. Collaborate with marketing and value stream to clearly articulate value propositions. Create Customer Value - Uncover consequential customer pains/gains through VOC & EOC activities. Expand/Leverage Product Platforms - Scale existing platforms to new customers, fold existing products into platforms and create platforms around new opportunities. Portfolio Management - Discover, develop, and filter attractive product/service/business model opportunities. Sales Enablement - Sustaining daily guidance and support - balancing customer and business needs. The above list of essential duties is not exhaustive. It only defines some of the main responsibilities. An employee may be required to perform additional tasks not listed above. Job Qualifications: Experience: 5-7 years' experience (business to business) in product management, product development, or product marketing. Capital goods experience preferred. Education: Masters degree / MBA preferred, or a Bachelor's degree and relevant on-the-job training and experience Skills:    Strong business acumen and insight. Uses knowledge of marketplace business drivers, strategies, and tactics to guide decisions. Utilizes quantitative and qualitative data analysis to drive decision-making. Strategic Mindset. Skilled at uncovering spoken and unspoken pain, linking trends to business implications, and working through ambiguity to identify gaps and test value propositions. High decision quality and judgement. Strong critical thinking skills - able to uncover root cause, evaluate tradeoff decisions, and pull information from multiple diverse sources to drive decision making, even in the absence of complete information. Self-motivated, takes initiative and drives results. Skilled at aligning organization, keeping an aggressive cadence, and setting priorities. Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills. Is effective in a variety of communication settings: one on one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels. Customer focus. Seeks engagement with customers and partners to learn, gain insights, and validate solutions. Technical Acumen. Ability to understand available and future technologies to drive product strategy. Travel/Location Requirements: Up to 25% travel may be required to customer locations, trade shows and conventions. This is a hybrid work-from-home position that requires the employee to be able to work in our St. Louis office up to three (3) days per week. See Job Description for full details. Duke is an equal opportunity employer.

Description: Serve as a voice to project the expectations of customers on new or already existing products Highlight product features in a manner clearly understandable to the development team Manage and develop product backlog, as well as user stories backlog for implementation Conduct backlog grooming meetings with a team of product owners Attend sprint planning and demo meetings to give feedback on sprint achievement, as well as to scrum team Monitor the progress of product development, as well as plan for product release Contact customers and end users to obtain information on expected product features Provide reports to update management and stakeholders on product development operations Analyze customer opinions and feedback to determine features or components that will add good value to a product Participate in agile conferences and study relevant scrum material to update job knowledge/skill Constantly exchange ideas with product owners within an organization Assess product value stream to identify areas that require improvements Measure product performance as well as value delivered to clients in order to make adjustments where necessary Develop and implement action plans for building and sustaining demand for a product Ensure implemented product features add value to end users and increase company returns.  Skills: Healthcare experience preferred Web application and/or salesforce.com experience preferred  Leadership Skill: Product owners are able to direct and motivate the product development team of an organization  Analytical Skill: They are able to conduct surveys to determine most appropriate feature to add to a new or existing product  Interpersonal Skill: They are adept to working with user groups and scrum team to obtain and analyze user stories.  Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Software engineering, business management or related disciplines. Training and certification as a professional scrum product owner (PSPO) or as a certified scrum product owner (CSPO) is also crucial for the position.

Hello,Greetings from ChabezTech LLC!!! MBA or advanced degree is a plus.Proven experience as a Product Owner, Product Manager, or similar role.Strong understanding of agile methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban.Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to prioritize and make data-driven decisions.Experience with product management tools and platforms (e.g., Jira, Trello, or similar).Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to changing priorities.Familiarity with design thinking and user experience principles is advantageous.Job Type: ContractSalary: $59,692.91 - $140,872.09 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftExperience:Product Owner: 1 year (Required)Scrum: 1 year (Required)Work Location: In person

Software Product Manager (JOB ID: 1012-221).Cincinnati Incorporated has been manufacturing machinery since the late 1890s. We pride ourselves on the performance and dependability of our metal fabrication products. Our quality is not only seen in our machines, but also in our team members. Our employees have shaped the reputation and culture of CI with their uncompromising integrity, focus, and innovation. The icing on top of the cake: CI offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package.   Are you ready for your career at CI?Position Summary and Purpose: The Software Product Manager will work closely with our Software Engineering, Marketing and Sales teams to ensure excellent product delivery. They must develop a wealth of knowledge about Cincinnati Incorporated’s software products and be able to identify opportunities, develop sales, understand price and profitability strategies, recommend improvements, and increase revenue. Strong customer service and analytical skills are a must, as their core focus is to translate business strategies and market opportunities into technical requirements while managing the product throughout each stage of its life. Product Manager responsibilities include:  We are looking for a Product Manager to lead the development of our Lean Agile, Kanban, and Project / Portfolio management tools.   Product Manager responsibilities include market analysis, competitive analysis, gathering feature needs, scheduling and coordinating product releases.   To be successful in this role, you should be able to identify market trends, user needs and work with cross-functional teams to complete product releases successfully. You should have played a Product Management role during the growth phase of a product.   Ultimately, you’ll help us roll-out products that deliver our company’s vision.
