Product Manager: Certified Scrum Master & Scrum Product Owner Part-Time Instructor
column7: Job ID: 13271 Location: Bellevue College Full/Part Time:Regular/Temporary: Temporary  Position Summary  The Certified Scrum Scrum Master & Product Owner Instructor is entrusted with delivering a top-tier educational experience aligned with the Scrum framework and the Scrum Alliance or Scrum.org standards and guidelines. Key duties encompass the regular updating of the curriculum, creation of dynamic courses, and provision of student support, both in group settings and one-on-one. Candidates must hold an associate degree, possess a Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification and a Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) or Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) certification, and a minimum total of 3 years of experience as a scrum master and a product owner in agile teams. Prior teaching or training experience is essential. Candidates with a bachelor's degree and 2 years of experience or more as a trainer or instructor in scrum or agile topics will be given preference.  Pay, Benefits & Work Schedule  Adjunct Professor is typically assigned as needed on a quarterly basis, with no expectation of continued employment beyond the current appointment.  Compensation is $40.41 - $80.00 per hour . Individuals newly hired to Adjunct Professor group at the college are placed at the minimum rate per union bargaining agreement. Certain positions may also be eligible for assignment/project-based additional compensation, including a High Demand Stipend up to $8,350 annually, prorated based on the discipline and duration of the assignment. All additional compensations are subject to change depending on funding and negotiated agreement.  Generous benefits package for eligible employees is offered through Washington State plans that includes multiple medical, dental, life and disability coverage choices for employees and dependents; choices of retirement and deferred compensation plans; paid personal leave plan; transit program, reduced tuition, employee discounts and memberships, etc. Eligible employees are faculty who work a combined load of at least 50% at Bellevue College and other Washington State public institutions of higher education for two consecutive quarters are eligible for health and dental insurance at the start of the second consecutive quarter.  In addition to teaching, faculty maintains office hours and may participate in department and college activities. This position is represented by the Bellevue College Association of Higher Education (BCAHE) union .  About The College  Bellevue College is a diverse student-centered, comprehensive and innovative college, committed to teaching excellence that advances the life-long educational development of its students while strengthening the economic, social and cultural life of its diverse community. Bellevue College is located just 10 miles east of Seattle where we serve a student population of over 54% students of color and over 1,300 international students. The college promotes student success by providing high-quality, flexible, accessible educational programs and services; advancing pluralism, inclusion and global awareness; and acting as a catalyst and collaborator for a vibrant region.  We strive to create a vibrant and inclusive campus community that supports a diverse student body, faculty and staff. As an essential part of our mission and goals , diversity, equity and pluralism are promoted and fostered in all aspects of college life. By enriching student life through leadership opportunities, personal learning and cultural experiences, we are committed to building an inclusive and diverse campus community that fosters creativity, innovation and student success.  For more information, visit BC Facts at a Glance @ Bellevue College .  About the Department  Tombolo Institute, located at Bellevue College, is a prominent technology education and training provider offering a wide range of industry-relevant programs and courses. With a focus on equipping learners with in-demand skills, the institute collaborates with leading industry professionals and experts to deliver high-quality instruction in various technology fields. Tombolo Institute stands out for its commitment to providing practical, hands-on training that aligns with current industry trends and requirements. As a part of Bellevue College, students benefit from state-of-the-art facilities, a supportive learning environment, and a strong network of industry connections. Whether learners are looking to launch their tech careers, upskill in their current roles, or stay ahead of industry trends, Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College is a premier destination for quality tech education and training.  Are you passionate about scrum and agile principles, practices, and values and have a knack for developing engaging and effective learning materials? Do you possess in-depth knowledge of the Scrum Alliance or Scrum.org standards and guidelines and proven experience as a product owner and a trainer? If so, we invite you to join our team as an Instructor for our Certified Scrum Master & Scrum Product Owner Course.  Essential Functions  Create, update, and maintain the curriculum aligned with the Scrum framework and the Scrum Alliance or Scrum.org standards and guidelines. Develop engaging courses, lesson plans, teaching aids, assessments, and hands-on exercises. Meet all scheduled classes promptly, with any deviation being filed promptly and accurately through the appropriate channels. Motivate students to participate in all aspects of the educational process actively. Provide one-on-one and group mentoring to support students in their learning journey. Address student questions and provide guidance on Scrum Master and Scrum Product Owner certification preparation. Stay updated with the latest developments in scrum and agile. Maintain expertise in the subject area and ensure curriculum content remains up-to-date and relevant. Participate in departmental and college meetings as prescribed by the supervisor.  Minimum Qualifications  Associate's degree. Demonstrated knowledge of the scrum framework, with all its artifacts, events, and roles. Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification and Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) or Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) certification. Minimum three (3) years of experience as a scrum master and a product owner in agile teams. Previous teaching or training experience. Demonstrated communication and presentation skills. Familiarity with instructional technology and e-learning platforms. Demonstrated ability to facilitate learning of students/colleagues from diverse backgrounds.  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor's degree. Minimum two (2) years of experience as a trainer or instructor in scrum or agile topics. Minimum one (1) year of experience in developing online course materials and curriculum design. Ability to coach, mentor, and inspire learners at different levels of experience.  Conditions of Employment  Bellevue College intends to provide a drug-free, healthy, safe, and secure work and educational environment. Each employee is expected to report to work in an appropriate mental and physical condition to perform her/his/their assigned duties.  Bellevue College employs only U.S. citizens and lawfully authorized non-U.S. citizens. All new employees must show employment eligibility verification as required by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.  Bellevue College requires all employees to be fully vaccinated and your vaccine status will be verified upon hire. Please reach out to the HR Office at jobs@bellevuecollege.edu if you need information on medical or religious accommodation. Sexual Misconduct and Background Check: Prior to start of employment, finalists(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check as a condition of employment. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment, but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position.  Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington State Law .  Check frequently in your inbox, spam, junk, clutter email folders for any communication regarding the next steps from Bellevue College and our background check partners. Reference Check: Reference checks may include, but are not limited to, contacting references and verification of work experience, and/or past job duties.  Other Information  This position is NOT eligible for relocation allowance. This position is NOT eligible for sponsorship for employment-based visa.  How To Apply  Applications received by 11/17/2023 will be given full consideration. Applications received after that date may be considered until the position is filled.  All individuals interested in this position are encouraged to apply. Your application must include a complete online application and all of the required documents below to be considered complete. Any application that does not provide all requested information will not be considered for the position (only submit required documents with the application, additional documents will not be reviewed.) Please review Application Tips before applying. Current Bellevue College employees should apply the position through Employee Self Service. Required application materials: Attach a Cover Letter (min 1 pg., max 2 pgs.) Attach a Resume/Curriculum Vitae Attach a Diversity Statement (min 1 pg., max 2 pgs.) that addresses the following: Describe and provide specific examples of how your educational and/or professional experiences, background or philosophy demonstrate your commitment to diversity and equity, and how these prepare you to contribute to Bellevue College Complete Job Questionnaires if applicable Contact: If you have questions with regards to the application or the hiring process, please contact Office of Human Resources at 425-564-2274 or email to jobs@bellevuecollege.edu .  EEO Statement  Bellevue College does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, language, ethnicity, religion, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, including gender identity or expression, disability, or age in its programs and activities. Please see policy 4150 at www.bellevuecollege.edu/policies/ . The following people have been designated to handle inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies: Title IX Coordinator, 425-564-2641, Office C227, and EEOC/504 Compliance Officer, 425-564-2178, Office B126.  Applicants with disabilities who require assistance with the recruitment process may contact hraccommodations@bellevuecollege.edu .

Position Summary:     Odyssey Systems has an exciting new opportunity for a   WPAC Project/Product Management Analyst supporting the   U.S. Army Medical Materiel Development Activity (USAMMDA), a subordinate command under United States Army Medical Research and Development Command (USAMRDC) in Frederick, MD. The Biology/Medical Project Management Analyst will provide full-time project management and acquisition support to the Warfighter Protection and Acute Care (WPAC) Project Management Organization (PMO).  ***Contingent upon contract award***  Responsibilities:     Duties include, but not limited to:  Provide project management directly to the project manager coordinating and consolidating all acquisition activities in the PMO acquisition dashboard. Track PMO Integrated Product Team (IPT) and Working Group (WG) annual reporting meetings to include scheduling meetings; coordinating with participants; preparing agendas, related documentation, and meeting minutes; and tracking action items. Coordinate and disperse Taskers to appropriate team members. Validating information and compiling responses to ensure full response has been gathered for review and submission approval of management. Exceptional communication skills and attention to detail are mandatory. Experience with personnel at various grades both military and civilian is helpful. Support numerous efforts and effectively prioritize and multi-task requirements that have a direct impact on the Products. Support all major initiatives to advance product capabilities. Assist with programmatic and technical document review, market research, and vendor site visits/demonstrations. Be aware of, and be sensitive to, information flows that contain items of interest to or that are the action or the responsibility of the Government Product Manager. Assist in Project Management Office (PMO)-related fiscal management by performing budget analysis and contract support in regards to deliverables and periods of performance. Maintain current knowledge of relevant technology and industry developments. Support the DoD Acquisition Lifecycle and document preparation; maintain general understanding of DoD 5000 acquisition guidelines and Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulatory processes. Prepare and review briefings, summaries, information papers, technical reports, acquisition documentation, and other correspondence. Manage and track numerous, diverse, simultaneous efforts and have the ability to effectively prioritize requirements for multiple on-going projects in support of project team. Qualifications:   Minimum Required Qualifications: Citizenship: Must be a US citizen  Clearance: NACI  Education: B.S. in biology, public health or medical/technical/science  Years’ experience: 16 years of experience in biology, public health or medical/technical/science field  Experience in managing multiple projects and deadlines. Experience in project management skills (cost, schedule, performance risk) required. Experience, knowledge and ability to execute the use of MS Office, including Word, Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook. Preferred Qualifications: Years’ experience: Sharepoint and MS Project experience desired.  At least 1-2 years of Federal contracting management, especially military, is preferred. Interest in medical research programs desired. Interpersonal Skills: Communication, teamwork, problem-solving, critical thinking, leadership, attention to detail, multitasking  Additional Information: Location: Onsite in Frederick, MD (local candidates only); Telework eligible  Travel: 10%  ***Contingent upon contract award*** #LI-AS1    #hybrid  Company Overview:   Odyssey Systems Consulting Group, is an innovative small business committed to providing world-class technical, management, and training support services to government and public sector clients. We focus on people, processes, and performance to deliver superior results. Since our inception in 1997, our commitment to mission success and customer satisfaction has been recognized with exponential growth and exceptional past performance ratings. We accept challenging assignments and drive projects from the planning stages, through implementation, and into operations and support.  Please note: Final compensation for this position will be determined by various factors such as the Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant work experience, specific skills and competencies, geographic location, education, and certifications.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Pay Rate Type Job Description: The Product Owner will interact both with cross functional Agile Release Train teams within the SAFe methodology and with other engineering and operations delivery teams, to ensure solutions are optimally designed, developed, and implemented to achieve strategic goals. They will serve as a liaison between the internal customers and dev teams for strategic roadmap content, own the team backlogs and manage its dependencies. They will write and provide acceptance criteria for user stories, and coordinate feature backlog for all planning increments. The product owner will participate in all agile sprint ceremonies for an agile development team. This role will report to the Software Product Manager, as part of the Strategic Initiatives Office (SIO). The SIO supports the vision and objectives of Flexential through the identification, alignment, and execution of critical strategic initiatives, business process improvement efforts, and programs / projects. This is a dynamic opportunity to work alongside leadership across the entire company, including Product, IT, Operations, Finance, Sales, and more. Key Responsibilities and Essential Job Functions Collect and prioritize current and future product feature requests by working with product managers, business stakeholders and external customers Work with internal customers to define, document and maintain business processes, functional and non-functional requirements for both agile and non-agile projects and features. Work with support group to identify and categorize customer product feedback into defects, issues, or enhancements Prepare and participate in Program Increment planning, backlog refinement and updating the team backlog and work queue accordingly Create user stories and development of story acceptance criteria. Able to provide the clarifications necessary to assist the team with their story estimates Act as the voice of the business during iteration planning, ensuring that engineering teams understand and deliver on business expectations Understand the scope of the upcoming enabler work and collaborate with Architects on decision-making and sequencing of the critical technological infrastructures which will enable new business functionality Present product features at sprint demonstrations to end users, managers, and executives Perform other duties as required and assigned. Required Qualifications 2+ years of agile development and business analysis or product owner experience Strong understanding of agile methodologies and software development lifecycle Strong work ethic, analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail Ability to prioritize tasks and deliverables Ability to influence and work with others to achieve results Strong communication skills – both written and verbal Approaches problems from different perspectives to suggest and implement solutions Takes accountability for delivering on commitments; owns mistakes and uses them as opportunities for learning and development Preferred Qualifications Experience within SCRUM or SAFe Experience working with tracking, testing, source control and collaboration tools like Azure DevOps, Jira, Wiki, SharePoint, and Teams Experience with user experience and interface design and best practices for usability for a customer portal and wireframing tools such as Axure or Figma Experience documenting as-is and to-be process flows using BPMN and narratives Previous experience within a Data Governance environment Strong knowledge of IT standards and best practices Possesses strong product/technology/industry knowledge Physical Requirements Ability to sit for extended periods of time Walk or Stand for _N/A__% of the time Moderate or advanced keyboard usage Lift __N/A_ lbs Travel on occasion; at most ~1-2 times a year At Flexential, we value diversity and believe that different perspectives and unique skills make us stronger as a team. While we've outlined the qualities and skills we generally look for in our job postings, we understand that there may be attributes and abilities that aren't explicitly listed but could be a perfect fit for our team. We want to emphasize that you shouldn't hesitate to apply if you don't meet every requirement. We're enthusiastic about assembling a diverse team of individuals who bring various talents to the table. Your unique perspective and abilities may be just what we need to drive innovation and success. If you believe you have what it takes to thrive in our environment, we encourage you to apply. Benefits of working at Flexential: Medical, Telehealth, Dental and Vision 401(k) Health Savings Accounts (HAS) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) Life and AD&D Short Term and Long-Term disability Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO) Leave of Absence Employee Assistance Program Wellness Program Rewards and Recognition Program Benefits are subject to change at the Company’s discretion. Base Pay Range: Annualized salary range offered for this position is estimated to be $92,700 - $112,800. However, the actual pay range depends on each candidate’s experience, location, and qualifications. Variable Pay: Discretionary annual bonus, based on personal and company performance. EEO Statement: Flexential is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. #LI-PS1

Product Manager Who we are We’re doxy.me (doc-see-me), the world's most loved telemedicine solution, and we're on a mission to connect the world to the future of healthcare. We believe that cost and complexity should NEVER be a barrier to telemedicine. That’s why we have designed our platform to be simple and accessible. Since 2013, we’ve grown to more than 1 million users from 180+ countries and have clocked over 7 billion minutes of telemedicine sessions to date. Our goal is to deliver a world-class healthcare experience to every patient and healthcare professional on earth. You can help us get there by joining our team of innovators, dreamers, and doers. Who you are We’re seeking a Product Manager who thrives in an environment that offers challenging problems to solve, can drive product projects from concept to launch and brings high standards to developing product requirements that are informed by a combination of research, data and product intuition. What you'll do Work autonomously and be able to take ownership of product prioritization decisions Identify, define, build, launch, and iterate on features that add value for our customers Be detail-driven and have excellent problem-solving abilities Work closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to take product ideas from concept to launch Translate a larger strategic vision into a concrete, prioritized plan that can be executed to deliver an MVP and iterative improvements Apply a combination of qualitative and quantitative research, customer understanding, and product intuition to inform decisions and prioritization Facilitate clear communication and collaboration across all teams and stakeholders Your skills and qualifications You've delivered multiple products end to end Comfortable with ambiguity and breaking down complex problems Capable of synthesizing unstructured data and inputs to inform prioritization decisions Experience conducting interviews with customers to uncover product opportunities You drive to understand underlying problems, test assumptions and iterate on solutions Strong written and in-person communication skills; comfortable presenting in large groups Diligent with documenting and building shared understanding with all team members Takes initiative to drive projects forward within a fast-paced environment Experience with managing large cross-functional projects with technical depth What we can offer you We are committed to giving you the tools you need to do your best work. We will take care of the little things so you can do what you do best without having to worry about all of that other stuff. Here is a taste of what you can expect: A fun, flexible work environment (work from home or on location at one of our regional hubs) Competitive Salary Paid trainings and certifications Advancement opportunities in a growing company, Medical, Vision, and Dental insurance 401k match Unlimited PTO Our employees give us a 4.6 on Glassdoor. Interview Process 1st Stage - Screen with our internal recruiter 2nd Stage - Video call with our Head of Product 3rd Stage - Meet the Team 4th Stage - Leadership Interview Additional information Doxy.me tech stack Frontend: React, TypeScript, Playwright, WebRTC, Next.js, Nx.dev Backend: Nodejs, TypeScript, Jest, NestJS, Nx.dev Cloud: AWS 3rd party: Vonage, Pubnub, Segment, Twilio, Stripe Our products: Doxy.me: The simple, free, and secure telemedicine solution currently used by over 1,000,000 doctors worldwide and helping over 350,000 patients/day. dokbot.io: Patient-focused data collection for healthcare. adhere.ly: Providing healthcare practitioners with the tools to ensure patients complete their course of treatment Our team: technologists, academics, researchers, and innovators from all over the world. English is the language used in all internal communication. To ensure HIPAA compliance we perform background checks after extending a job offer

The Product Analyst will support various product lines within the Consumer Products Business Team, assist in the development of business and product strategy, provide analytical support, and apply business sense and creativity to help identify issues, solve problems and generate ideas. Day-to-Day Role: Develop a thorough understanding of our customers and markets, and use these insights to develop, and then drive successful implementation of strategies. Obtain accurate and detailed information for development of analysis used in business planning. Accurately complete analysis by providing a clear and concise written summary of the situation with recommendations that incorporate logic and the company’s philosophies and strategies. Support his/her Manager and Business Team in managing a portfolio of products to plan and drive growth through revenue and profit building blocks. Assist his/her Manager and Business Team to develop and implement multi-year and annual strategies for the assigned product lines through close collaboration with other functions. Support his/her leadership in developing and implementing pricing strategy for the assigned product lines and recommend/participate in certain pricing decisions. Participate in and/or lead cross-functional efforts to discover and execute cost-reduction initiatives that do not negatively impact the customer/consumer experience. Lead and support all aspects of product life-cycle management for assigned products including the product portfolio strategy, product management, pricing guidelines, product development, product enhancements, and SKU optimization. May assume sponsor role. Collaborate with Marketing and Sales on product-line marketing including brand strategy, brand standards, channel marketing messaging, and brand activation to achieve desired customer outcomes and financial results. Collaborate closely with Sales and Supply Chain on demand planning and forecasting to achieve desired financial and customer outcomes (e.g. minimize excess inventory and maximize fill rates for key product lines). Assist Business Team leadership (VP/Director/PLM) in building a robust business case to support innovation and capacity expansion efforts within assigned product lines. Make recommendations and issue decisions for accounts on supplier agreements, quality, promotional funding request, and other customer needs. Make logical, data-driven recommendations incorporating company policies, procedures and philosophies. In collaboration with his/her Manager, partner with Sales to drive relationships with key customers and provide direction on product line focus areas to maximize sales and profitability. Model/promote a culture of accountability within the Business team and throughout the organization. Core Skills and Qualifications: The ideal candidate must possess all of the following: Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field of study Requires one of the following: One (1) year experience supporting decision making in marketing, product management or general business role, or Experience successfully meeting performance expectations consistently in all job responsibilities and functions in a Dart Associate Product Analyst position. Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills Ability to blend creative problem solving with data driven, analytical, financial (e.g. NPV, financial statements, DCF), and quantitative skills with a demonstrated ability to analyze complex problems with data, assumptions, and judgment using best practices and analysis to formulate solutions Ability to be assertive, show initiative, demonstrate personal accountability, take ownership of work, and apply learned concepts Ability to operate with sense of urgency and focus on providing exceptionally reliable customer service Organizational skills including the ability to prioritize workload to meet deadlines Strong knowledge of and experience working with financial concepts such as ROI, net present value, and other related analysis methods Ability to be composed, adapt, and effectively manage tasks and projects in a dynamic, fast-paced, customer-focused work environment characterized by rapid change, minimal lead times, and multiple competing priorities while meeting all assigned deadlines Excellent verbal and written communication skills in order to clearly communicate intricate job-related processes that ultimately affect decision making Excellent attention to detail and accuracy Experience using Microsoft Office, including the ability to create reports, documents, presentations and spreadsheets, in MS Word, MS Excel, and MS PowerPoint Ability to maintain confidentiality on sensitive issues Preferred Skills and Qualifications: SAP experience Experience in the foodservice packaging or consumer packaged goods industries Overview: Dart makes everyday products that give people the freedom to enjoy the food & drinks they love, wherever they are. From to-go containers and dinnerware to tamper-evident food packaging and even the red Solo cup, Dart products have been keeping people on the go and having fun for more than 50 years. Dart is a family-owned, family-focused company of 13,000 employees united by a shared set of values. Headquartered in Mason, MI, Dart has 30 locations in four countries. Benefits: Dart Container full-time employees enjoy great benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) with company matching contributions, paid vacation, paid holidays, short-term disability, tuition assistance, product discounts and more. Dart Container is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are subject to a drug test (excluding THC*/marijuana/cannabis) and background check at the time of offer.THC testing ONLY when such testing is required by law. Designed for someone with a strong experience in agile development methodologies. Responsible for defining Stories and prioritizing Team Backlog based on extensive conversation and discovery with government customers. The product owner has a significant role in maximizing the value provided by our development teams and ensuring stories meet the user's needs. About Purple CarrotPurple Carrot started with just a seed of an idea in 2014. Our vision is a world where plant-based eating is at the core of living well. Every day, on this mission, we’re breaking boundaries with plant-based eating. We value learning from customers, an ownership mindset, integrity, winning together, and being bold. We need your expertise on our team to make things happen!Purple Carrot’s irresistible, globally-inspired meal-kit recipes and prepared meals using fresh ingredients. We are a team of collaborative individuals who drive for results, strive for doing better, make good choices quickly, and embrace a growth mindset to win or learn. Here’s what you’re up for!DescriptionWe are looking for a Product Manager to join our mission-driven team. As an integral part of a Product department, you will join forces with the Director of Product, to whom you will also report, in our continued effort to help people eat more plants! We are looking for candidates passionate about solving customer problems and continuously improving products. This position will be important in shaping the Purple Carrot customer experience and driving the home delivery product forward. As a Product Manager, you will be focused on owning the software development backlog and continuously delivering new features to customersWe greatly thank all applicants; however, only those under serious consideration will be contacted.Location: Purple Carrot HQ is in Needham, MA, and prefers local candidates to work in a hybrid model. East Coast working hours are critical. This role has limited travel (<10%) to partner sites or other business-related meetingsOn the PlateEnvision, articulate and size new product enhancements designed to achieve a remarkable experience for usersValidate opportunities through research, data analysis, A/B testing, competitive research, and other relevant tools.Own the product development process from inception through launch and iteration cycles. Manage product backlog. Ensure that it aligns with the overall product and company vision. Collaborate across teams. Play a critical role in creating alignment between engineering teams and business stakeholders across the company, including marketing, operations, and customer experience. A collaborative approach is essential to the job.Write clear and concise user stories and requirements, prioritizing development items to align with the product roadmapMonitor product performance and proactively identify opportunities for product improvementsPursue product and industry knowledge, identify trends and opportunities, and become a subject matter expert on designated productsMain Ingredients for the Role1-2 years of experience owning a product backlog in an agile environmentBachelor's degree or equivalent experience.Extra Special SauceEvaluating and overseeing the implementation/integration of third-party software vendorsExperience working with a colocated development teamExperience working in eCommerce or other industries with a software and physical product component, ideally start-up scaling experienceProven ability to drive and own outcomes - results-orientedOne to two years of experience as a Product Manager preferred Garnish We love our staff, and show it with benefits (including but not limited to medical, dental, vision, FSA, and life insurance), matching retirement plan, unlimited paid time off, Purple Carrot box allowance, professional development, and the opportunity to work in collaboration with teammates who are passionate about food!Final Touches Purple Carrot’s top priority is protecting the health and wellbeing of our team and candidates. The majority of our interviews and assessments occur virtually. If there is a need to interview onsite, we follow COVID-19 guidance from the CDC, WHO, and any state guidelines .We are committed to a safe and inclusive work environment, free of discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, national origin, ancestry, age, medical condition, mental or physical disability, handicap, veteran status, or marital status.

column7: **This position is a temporary summer internship assignment from May 2024-December 2024. Only students currently attending college or university will be considered. ** AS A PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER DVx CO-OP, YOU WILL … Assist in developing market studies to determine minimum requirements of new products. Investigate methods of data collection and transfer from customer field device. Define the predictive and prescriptive analytics priorities based on world area marketing, sales channel and customer requirements while maintaining market differentiation by working closely with the Instrument Business Unit and Advanced Technology teams. Evaluate wireless technologies for use in an industrial environment. Take responsibility in creating value for our customers and keeping Fisher Control Valves the first choice in the mind of the end user. Closely track and provide definitions needed to accelerate the readiness of new technologies. Work closely with engineering teams, world area marketing and sales teams to ensure global needs are considered. Provide input and support to new product development teams. Work closely with Marketing Communications to effectively develop and deliver the Fisher brand message. Interact proactively with other Emerson divisions on all issues that impact Fisher Digital Valve experience. REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS: Required Major(s): Marketing, Computer Science, Software Engineer, Sales Engineer or Engineering Management GPA: minimum 2.5 Minimum Year in School: Sophomore PREFFERED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS: Sales or Marketing Minor experience preferred Understand business and technical concepts. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively both written and verbal. Ability to maintain a keen attention to detail and manage multiple projects or tasks concurrently. Experience with AI tools or wireless technologies a plus. Programming experience a plus. Additional Information: At Emerson’s Marshalltown location we offer GREAT benefits to our co-ops: Competitive salaries FULL Holiday pay Corporate apartment options 401(k) Insurance options A formal co-op program focused on growing students’ experience in organizational knowledge and diversity, teamwork & leadership development, professional development, and corporate citizenship. AND MUCH MORE!WHY EMERSON Our Commitment to Our People At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1(including those with OPT or CPT) , H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. Join Grayce and Ignite Change in Gaithersburg, Maryland! Are you a recent graduate ready to take your career to the next level? Grayce is here with immediate opportunities that could be the perfect fit for you! Job Position: Product Manager Location: Gaithersburg, Maryland Starting Salary: $52,500  We are Grayce, a well-established hire, train, deploy organization, and we are on a mission to drive change and transformation. Founded in 2012, our goal is to accelerate, support, and develop emerging talent, and we're currently seeking graduates who are eager to kickstart their careers. We're on the lookout for graduates with exceptional communication skills, a passion for proactivity, and a natural curiosity. We highly value resourceful problem solvers who embrace challenges head-on and consistently bring fresh perspectives to the table.  Why Grayce? Be part of our mission to nurture bright minds and shape them into future leaders and innovators in business change and transformation. As a Product Manager, you'll play a crucial role in our client's success by driving innovation and managing product development. Exciting Opportunities: Immerse yourself in the world of business transformation by working directly with our impressive client portfolio. You'll gain exposure to challenging projects, build a network of trusted contacts, and acquire the skills to thrive in change and transformation. Continuous Learning: Your journey begins with a comprehensive training program, but it doesn't stop there. You'll embark on a path of continuous learning, earning industry-accredited qualifications tailored to your skillset, including Agile Project Management and more. Mentoring and Coaching: Thrive under the guidance of experienced coaches and mentors. You'll be paired with a Grayce buddy who understands the ropes, offering support, insights, and sharing experiences to help you succeed. Inclusive Community: At Grayce, we value diversity and inclusion. Our community is built on an environment that respects your unique perspective. Top Clients: You'll have the opportunity to work with one of our prestigious customers across various industries, such as Financial Services, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Healthcare, Insurance, and Legal.  What makes a great Grayce Product Manager? 3.3/4 GPA or higher: A Scientific or Medical focused pathway would be beneficial, but we're totally open to graduates from all subjects. Right to Work in the US: Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor visas, so please make sure you have everything sorted before applying! Effective communication: Communication is key in change and transformation. We value those who can express themselves clearly, whether it's chatting with the team, updating stakeholders, or putting thoughts on paper. Being precise and persuasive with your words is one of your greatest tools. Excellent organizational and planning skills: Time management, task prioritization, and structured working are your bread and butter. You'll be the project-focused expert who keeps timelines and resources in check, ensuring everything runs like clockwork. Proactivity and Creativity: Creativity is essential for driving innovation. Product managers need to come up with new ideas and solutions to meet customer needs and stay ahead of the competition. Creativity enables them to think outside the box and develop novel features, products, and strategies. Adaptability: Markets, technologies, and customer preferences are constantly evolving. Creative product managers are better equipped to adapt to change, pivot when necessary, and seize new opportunities.  Why Work for Us? Starting Salary: $52,500, and it gets even better after your first year! PTO: You start off with 12 days, and it goes up by one day every year you're with us. Medical, Vision & Dental: We've got you covered. Grayce covers 75% of the Medical Bronze package and 50% of the Vision and Dental Silver Package. 401(k) Personal Pension: For every 1% you contribute, Grayce chips in 0.5% (with a max 7% employee contribution).  Join us and together, we'll shape a brighter future in Gaithersburg, Washington DC! Grayce: Igniting Careers, Transforming Futures! We are Human and we Care | We are Trusted and we Deliver Excellence | We are Changemakers and we Succeed Together  Please note that Grayce is unable to sponsor work visas for International applicants.

Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.   At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We’re not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.   As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.   Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities. The Role  We are looking for a product manager for Veeva Labs. Veeva Labs builds innovative applications for Veeva’s own use and for Veeva’s customers. When Veeva has a strategic need for an application better or different than what we see on the market, we work with Veeva’s executive leadership to build it. It’s a special opportunity to build products to the highest standards, with the rewards of building applications that are loved by their users. We also frequently pioneer new technologies and architectures, later used across Veeva. This role has a preference for candidates based in the Pacific or Mountain Time Zones. What You’ll DoDesign innovative product features across domains and business processesAuthor high-quality design specifications within an agile methodologyPrioritize feature development based on strategic initiatives, customer requirements, and internal technical needsInteract with customers, services, market owners, and sales to understand business needsInteract with engineering and QA teams to drive high-quality product feature implementationRequirements5+ years in a business analyst or product management roleAbility to work independently in a dynamic environment with little direct supervisionStrong analytic skills: able to develop and test hypotheses from user behavior and other dataStrong communication skills: written, verbal, and formal presentationTechnical skills to translate business requirements into terms that developers can understandPerks & BenefitsMedical, dental, vision, and basic life insuranceFlexible PTO and company paid holidaysRetirement programs1% charitable giving programCompensationBase pay: $100,000 – $150,000The salary range listed here has been provided to comply with local regulations and represents a potential base salary range for this role. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range above or below, depending on experience and location. We look at compensation for each individual and base our offer on your unique qualifications, experience, and expected contributions. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation in addition to base salary, such as variable bonus and/or stock bonus.   #LI-Remote     Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.     Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

Seeking a Motivated Seller (Entry Level)Looking for a Product Specialist and Account Manager (Inside Sales)Bloomington, MNAbout the Position:At NA Trading and Technology, we want to coach you to greatness if you’re willing to learn. Your responsibilities begin by learning the features and benefits of our products as well as how to engage on the phone with intelligent business professionals in this 100+ year old industry. The goal is to become their supplier of choice for their most-used parts and supplies and have a continuous business relationship that grows your revenue and results in continuously increasing income.About Us:NA Trading and Technology provides high quality parts and supplies to businesses within the Office Automation and Office Technologies industries across the country. We’ve established relationships going back nearly 40 years because our customers find us to be the most reliable source of compatible parts and supplies in the industry. Unlike our competition, we focus only on the best value and are independently owned, which gives us a competitive advantage.Culture:We’re a small, independently owned, business so everyone’s roles are diverse. When help is needed, we’re here for you. We all work hard and take pride in our work so that we can enjoy the rewards that a successful business brings. We’re one of the smallest companies in MN to offer both profit sharing and a 401K, for example. We also enjoy the benefits of the occasional catered lunch or cookout (we have some excellent cooks here!), happy hours, free coffee and tea, and more.Career Development:The Product Specialist will initially focus on training and establishing their sales territory. We find that Product Specialists can double or triple sales by meeting in-person, therefore in the second year you will have the opportunity to grow your business with face-to-face meetings with targeted customers. If you enjoy travel you may also be invited to represent the company at industry events located at fun destinations (you may want to add a couple extra days for yourself.) As you become familiar with the industry, your input on new potential products will be requested by the Research and Development department so we can continue to support your customers for years to come.Required Skills:Self- Confidence when speaking on the phone and a clear and audible voiceIntermediate knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, and ExcelHigh School Diploma/ GEDPositive attitudeResilience in facing objectionsDesired Skills:4-year college degree (GPA 3.0 or higher) or relevant work experience (we recognize military training as work experience)Ability to work independentlyDetail-OrientedBenefits Basics:The sales territories all offer Base Pay + Commission + Bonuses (based on revenue goals). We offer health and dental insurance and life insurance plans, and after your first anniversary you will be enrolled in our 401K and profit-sharing plans. We offer paid time off and paid holidays.Current and past employees frequently comment:They feel supported by their coworkers and managersThey learn a lot about communications that they can use in both their professional and personal livesThey enjoy the relationships they form with their customersThey feel empowered to help their customersThey are better and stronger people because of their life experiences at NA Trading NA Trading and Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we recognize military service, so veterans are encouraged to apply.To apply please send your resume/cover letter to Amy Dills, Sales Manager at adills@natrading.com.

Job Summary/ Scope: The Product Manager is responsible for actively managing the end-to-end product strategy from product ideation (“sunrise”) through go to market and, when necessary, product discontinuation (“sunset”). In this role, you will use all available information and data to identify opportunities, create product strategies and proactively manage and update the 3 year innovation roadmap. The Product Manager will be tasked with analyzing and interpreting market trends and portfolio performance to inform future product development and improve productivity and inventory turns. You will take a leadership role in the optimization of the portfolio mix to balance topline and bottom-line goals for the brand.t This role is cross functional in nature requiring collaboration with multiple departments including, but not limited to: Sales, Product Development, Planning and Finance. Essential Job Duties:Proactively create new product strategies, manage and update the 3 year innovation roadmap based on consumer insights, industry trends, proprietary innovative technology, and competitive sales data to drive revenue and profitability.Understanding the Product specifications and options to influence the product development decisions.Uploads and manages product identity/specifications in Salsify and ensures brand price positioning guidelines are followed Collaborate with Product Development & Factories to ensure alignment and execution to innovation roadmap.Support the HOB in overseeing the S&OP process, ensuring tight collaboration between Sales, Marketing, and Supply Chain to ensure healthy inventory and delivery scorecards.Monthly review of all salsify data for updates.Manages the product ideation, feasibility, and development stages of the innovation process with minimal support from HOB.Manages consumer research projects with the Consumer Insights/Research team to identify and quantify white space opportunities and uncover unmet consumer needs to inform product development.Leverages Circana, CMI, and other data to provide informed direction to Product Development for the creation of new products and product linesManage new product timeline to ensure successful and timely launches iWork with global affiliates to support global product strategy as needed.Performs market analysis, competitive research, is aware of the latest market/industry trends, and conducts quarterly retail store visits across all channels of distribution to uncover and present business opportunities to the HOB and Product Org.Analyze monthly shipping reports and weekly POS data to understand the health of the business and provide actionable strategic recommendations to HOB.Track year 1 POS performance for all new innovation, providing insights to key stakeholders. With limited involvement of HOB, builds an action plan to ensure the long-term success of the product.Proactively analyzes the health of the overall business through a monthly shipping & POS tracker to provide strategic marketing recommendations (4Ps) based on observations.With limited support from the HOB, builds the recommendation for gross wholesale (inclusive of all delivery methods), retail and promotional pricing to deliver increased profitable sales that are competitively positioned with high perceived consumer value.Be the lead communicator in new item releases and running changes via Salsify.Be the lead in managing, acquiring and providing product samples for retailer meetings on programs that are in development.Partner with Sales and Supply Chain for inventory and forecasting needs to meet brand and retailer revenue projections.Monitor the portfolio’s health to provide recommendations to HOB on which items to discontinue and ideate liquidation strategies.Other duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in business or related field is required.4-7 years’ experience in product development/category management is ideal.At least 1-3 years supervisory experience is preferred.Must possess strong critical thinking and analytical problem-solving skills.Must possess a high degree of integrity, credibility, sense of urgency and common senseStrong negotiating skills.Must possess strong interpersonal skills and the ability to deliver oral presentations.Proficiency in using Microsoft Suite, Google Suite, and the Internet is required.Must possess strong time management skills and the ability to multitask.Strong organizational and project management skills to meet deadlines is essential. Working Conditions: Work is performed primarily indoors, although some outdoor tasks are required. Lighting is artificial. Equipment used includes standard office equipment i.e. computer, telephone, copy machine. Physical demands include standing, walking, sitting, use of both hands. Hours and days are primarily Monday through Friday with some evenings and weekends. Position requires close contact with Meyer employees and vendors. $92k to $100k DOE

(no homeowners). We are known in our local markets as having quality service, long term quality people, and only representing the top manufacturers in the industry. Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.  Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us.  As a PM on the Connected TV team, you will be challenged to drive TikTok Connected TV product strategy, value proposition and growth. You will be responsible for cross-functional project planning, prioritization, execution and communication with key stakeholders. Meanwhile, you will learn and grow in a fast paced environment alongside talented teammates.  Responsibilities Responsible for the content distribution on TikTok TV, ensuring content quality and distribution efficiency.Dive deep into user usage scenarios, identify user needs and pain points, and design strategies for content introduction, review, and distribution, aiming to maximize content distribution efficiency.Through data analysis and user feedback, uncover users' fundamental needs and be able to systematically solve them.Establish good cross-functional cooperation relationships, work closely with engineers, designers, and data scientists to jointly drive product growth. Qualifications More than 1 year of experience in content-side product, with a good ability to discern content quality, familiar with the complete content distribution chain, and have a certain understanding of the recommendation system;Strong logic, able to dig into the essence of things, have independent thinking ability and good judgment, have a business overall view, good at actively finding and solving problems;Possess independent data analysis ability, good at finding key factors from data;Excellent cross-functional communication and coordination ability, strong drive and sense of ownership, passionate about product work; TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.  TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at gprd.accommodations@tiktok.com Job Information The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $120650 - $223250 annually.  ​  Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.  ​  Our company benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support our employees to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees:  ​  We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care.  ​ Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off (PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability.  ​  We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

Overview:   What We Do We calm the confusion of IT by guiding the connection between people and technology. If a customer is looking for a better way to manage their warehouse inventory, equip their workforce, or secure their data, we make it happen. All it takes is finding the right combination of tech hardware, software, cloud solutions, and support services. That’s what we do. We’re the IT Department’s IT Department. Who We Are Our team is made stronger by a multitude of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. It’s what makes Connection unique—what drives us to innovate and create technology solutions that stand apart from the crowd. We’d love for you to be a part of that fabric, to share your ideas and experiences with a team that thrives on fresh thinking, creativity, and helping others. Why You Should Join Us   You’ll find supportive teammates and a rewarding career at Connection—plus great benefits. We take pride in supporting employees with a total rewards package that provides financial, emotional, and physical resources for you and your family. Our compensation, 401k plans, medical insurance, and other benefits are progressive and competitive. We value the importance of our employees’ emotional wellbeing. To support employees, we provide free therapy visits, mental health coaching and tools, and meditation resources. You’ll also enjoy a generous paid time off package that includes not only vacation and sick time, but also Wellness and Volunteer Time Off days.  Responsibilities:     Working under general supervision of the Alliance Manager or Product Line Manager, selecting from a variety of established procedures to accomplish assigned duties and responsibilities, the Product Management Coordinator works with the Product Management (PM) team to support the programmatic processes associated with the execution of Connection's partner program and/ or product category initiatives.Coordinate schedule, cross-department action items, partner/ product category assets, collateral, signage and promotional items required for co-branded partner/ Connection events, weekly solution showcase events and customer events.  Verify, manage and process monthly invoices, check requests and purchase orders for all partner program/ assigned product category elements.Support sales incentive programs to drive strategic partner program/ product category initiatives.Collect, archive and communicate applicable proof of performance elements to ensure they are in accordance with rate card criteria, audit standards and partner requirements.Assist PM with the evaluation of program objectives by gathering sales and marketing data sets to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaign strategies.Source relevant partner/ product category content to create organic posts designed to support partner/ product category program growth objectives. Post content on internal collaboration platforms and company website category pages, brand stores, solution/ service centers and segment showcase pages/ modules. Min: USD $21.63/Hr. Max: USD $27.04/Hr. Qualifications:     Because of the possibility for fraudulent job postings on many popular job boards, please be advised that Connection will never offer a position of employment without a complete interview process and communication with a “live person.”  Functional understanding of marketing to include marketing strategies employed to highlight company recognition and product/ service awarenessCustomer oriented with ability to listen to and anticipate needs of the customerAnalytical with ability to draw conclusions from data, systematic and rationalOrganized state of mind with ability to document activities, anticipate problems, plan schedules and monitor performance according to priorities and deadlinesArticulate with ability to express oneself clearly and professionally in written and oral communicationInterpersonal skills with ability to work well with all levels of the organizationDetail oriented with item by item focus, meticulous attention to detail with ability to proofread for accuracyInterpersonal skills with ability to work well with all levels of the organizationJudgment with ability to formulate opinions, compare and decide with good senseGood listening skills with ability to receive information completely and understand what is being said

Being a Product Support Specialist revolves around the creation and implementation of innovative support strategies to increase utilization of software product. Work with Clients to assist in resolving Customer Complaints by facilitating communications between clients and organization.Deliver Product Adoption support in terms of onboarding tools, training tools, and engagement monitoring. Develop use cases for new features and provides analysis of data that is useful for managing customer expectations. Ensure data analysis is accurate, complete and provides the story that is useful to managers using the system. Monitoring feedback loop in order to discern additional training requirements, or new features or defect resolutions are needed. This role is key in supporting product management and utilization of the software. The Product Support Specialist will develop strong relationships with Product managers, development team, and end users of the product. A Product Support Specialist will monitor client feedback daily to ensure issues are triaged and brought to resolution timely. The Product Support Specialist will understand metrics so that issues can be identified proactively based upon objective dashboard data. Coordinate with cross-functional internal teams, such as the Operations and client’s assigned Reimbursement Success Manager to optimize system resources for managing clients. The purpose of your role is to ensure product features are utilized and provide maximum efficiency. The Product Support Specialist will ensure that data presented to internal and external users are accurate and complete. RequirementsCreate and/or maintain training assets such as quick start guides, FAQ’s, Job aids and tool tips.Provide training on new features for a train the trainer approach.Proofread and audit training material generated.Monitor utilization of new features, and build out use cases for optimal utilization.End-to-end business - Improve and maintain individual KPIs to the best of standards and client issue tracker, CIT to least impact, to maintain overall client health score, CHS at the green (> 90), and super green per Prochant standards. Provide thought leadership and consulting to drive business and reengineering goalsDrive service delivery efficiency through Prochant Tools & platforms. Conduit opportunities to use/better our product, automation, featuresReview all feedback tickets to ensure the information is complete and concise. Reproduce as appropriate. This triage will ensure that appropriate resources are working on the issue. Issues could be training, feature enhancement or defect, all of which may be routed to different people.Leverage product, tools, automation, and next practices to recommend efficiency, FTEs savings, cost to collect, and rev yield Use data, visualization, insights, research, analogies, best practices, storyboard, and cultural sensitization to communicate opportunities and solutions.Drive collaboration in tasks, projects, response times, & outcomes that are critical to the relationship. Escalate proactively on non-performing KPIsBuild a trusting relationship by being available, delivering on promises, and transparent communication such as product feature adoption, without drifting away from established scope, principles & standards Support the global team in deploying changes through training, competency building, FAQ’s, Job Aids, & QA monitoring Be a revenue augmenter for our clients, a person through which Prochant services are perceived. Learn to exhibit awareness of our line of services, products, and solutions to upsell whenever pain-opportunity fitment is sensed Build systems (people, process and technology, and ecosystem) to drive scale Ability to connect with internal & stakeholders through socialization Ability to travel up to 25%  Benefits Prochant offers some of the best benefits in the industry! We take great care of our employees. Prochant’s Fortune 500 level benefits package includes:Health InsuranceGap InsuranceDental InsuranceVision InsuranceShort Term / Long Term Disability (company paid)Term Life Insurance (company paid, employee can elect additional)Full suite of supplemental insurance plans, including: Disability Income, Level Term Life, Accident Insurance, & Critical Illness InsuranceFloating holidays and paid time off401K with company match

The Product Owner will help create and deliver a best-in-class business systems and operational processes. This individual will be dedicated to the Agile Work Team to interface between the operations team and the delivery of new technology and code. The role is responsible to be constantly thinking through the processes and needs of the business to support an efficient and error free process for the member and provider. The Product Owner represents the business team in prioritizing the features for development, approving user stories, and ensuring clear communication flows back and forth. The individual will help shape and execute the product strategy that meets the department goals, engage in business case development, and ensure adherence to the Agile Scrum process. Job Description & Responsibilities: Define & communicate the overall vision, objectives, and goals of the business. Articulate the minimum viable product needs. Create, refine, socialize, and prioritize the Product backlog. Enable delivery of Product Backlog by presenting backlog to team; creating, owning, and refining well-formed user stories and artifacts that describe and detail new products, features and services based on feedback from team, creating acceptance criteria with the team, and accepting stories as they’re completed. Contribute to the maturity, performance, and growth of the Agile team. Work daily with scrum teams to refine, groom, and accept stories and bugs for implementation Create UAT test cases, organize and facilitate UAT testing, track test results, and work with the scrum master and agile team to resolve issues. Represents the team, when needed, to external stakeholders, leaders, and other teams to ensure alignment and understanding progress of the team. Support the Agile Program and ensure the team follows enterprise Agile standards. Provide feedback to program on enhancements for the Agile process. Champions change and effectively manages the implementation of new ideas. Align and motivate the team to achieve objectives. Identify opportunities for process optimization and redesign that will allow us to accomplish objectives more quickly and at a higher level of probability. Work one on one with each team member to ensure their growth and accountability to the team is achieved. -Effectively communicates relevant information to all levels of the organization. Partner with cross-functional teams to build, prioritize and define workflows and requirements Reinforces team approach throughout organization both on client projects and internal initiatives. Supports and solicits input from team members at all levels within the organization Create dynamic and a spirit of teamwork and collaboration. Communicates effectively with internal stakeholders to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions and strategies. Continually defines ways to increase customer satisfaction and deepen business relationships Additional duties as assigned. Minimum Requirements: Experience working in an Agile environment as a Product Owner Experience and track record of success directing the efforts of developers as a project manager or product owner in a deadline-driven and fast-paced environment Ability to juggle multiple projects and tasks. Demonstrated knowledge of project management concepts (preferably Agile/SCRUM) Hands on experience in leading process improvement initiatives Excellent influencing and negotiation skills High School Diploma or GED from an accredited institution Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree or higher from an accredited institution with a preferred area of study in technology, business, project management or other associated field Healthcare experience preferred Experience working with version one Experience working in an enterprise environment dealing with care management Experience working with TrueCare or CaseNet product  WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Applicants and employees are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other protected Federal, State/Province or Local status unrelated to the performance of the work involved.  If you have a disability under the Americans with Disability Act or a similar law and want a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to careers@Healthfirst.org or calling 212-519-1798 . In your email please include a description of the accommodation you are requesting and a description of the position for which you are applying. Only reasonable accommodation requests related to applying for a position within Healthfirst Management Services will be reviewed at the e-mail address and phone number supplied. Thank you for considering a career with Healthfirst Management Services.  EEO Law Poster and Supplement  All hiring and recruitment at Healthfirst is transacted with a valid “@healthfirst.org” email address only or from a recruitment firm representing our Company. Any recruitment firm representing Healthfirst will readily provide you with the name and contact information of the recruiting professional representing the opportunity you are inquiring about. If you receive a communication from a sender whose domain is not @healthfirst.org, or not one of our recruitment partners, please be aware that those communications are not coming from or authorized by Healthfirst. Healthfirst will never ask you for money during the recruitment or onboarding process. Hiring Range*:Greater New York City Area (NY, NJ, CT residents): $108,300 - $156,485 All Other Locations (within approved locations): $95,300 - $141,780  As a candidate for this position, your salary and related elements of compensation will be contingent upon your work experience, education, licenses and certifications, and any other factors Healthfirst deems pertinent to the hiring decision.  In addition to your salary, Healthfirst offers employees a full range of benefits such as, medical, dental and vision coverage, incentive and recognition programs, life insurance, and 401k contributions (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Healthfirst believes in providing a competitive compensation and benefits package wherever its employees work and live. The hiring range is defined as the lowest and highest salaries that Healthfirst in “good faith” would pay to a new hire, or for a job promotion, or transfer into this role.

Company Overview: Horizon Tool is a leading automotive specialty tool company dedicated to providing high-quality products and services to our customers. We are seeking a motivated Assistant Product Manager to join our team and contribute to the development and growth of our high-quality product offerings. Job Description: This role will be responsible for supporting the development and management of new and existing tools and products for the automotive aftermarket. This role will collaborate closely with our Product Development, Manufacturing, Sales, and Marketing teams to ensure product designs meet customer requirements, market demands, and company objectives.
