Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

About the role As an Associate Product Manager you will work join our Product team to help ensure that we are able to continuously build world-class products. Your duties will include analyzing consumer behavior and industry trends, evaluating consumer feedback on our products, and finding solutions for product defects. Location Remote (based in India) What you will do You will closely work with one or more product managers and support them in a variety of product initiatives ranging from market and customer research to product launch and testing You will help prepare project status and risk management reports You will also work on training internal departments on new product features and providing support to customers when needed Prior experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, business management, marketing, or a related field 1-2 years of experience in a similar role would be advantageous Experience in gathering and interpreting qualitative product data and consumer feedback An understanding of product sprints, PRDs and basic technology frameworks Background in Data Analytics is a strong plus Experience designing prototypes in HTML CSS or using platforms such as Figma Qualities that we look for Strong communication skills - including the ability to listen to the needs of others and comprehend complex matters, articulate issues in a clear and concise manner, and present effectively in both oral and written presentations to all levels in the organization. You get stuff done. You have a strong bias to action and will roll your sleeves up and get things done when needed Excellent attention to detail; you believe anything worth doing must be done right Willingness and ability to work independently, think creatively, and ability to pivot depending on changing priorities and deadlines Affinity for a high-performance, fast-paced, and project-oriented work environment You are a self-starter who excels at learning new processes and business functions You are highly analytical and are comfortable working with data

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

The Product Owner is a crucial role on an application development team helping to transform a high-level vision into detailed functional requirements, create product user stories, and accept the completed deliver within a given iteration. That person is the primary contact responsible for ensuring the development team works on the tasks intended to address specific product scope and capabilities. The ideal candidate will have past or current Scrum Master responsibilities and experience with CCaaS; Amazon Connect, Twilio, or others. This is a remote position, must live in the United States.

CentralReach is the #1 provider of SaaS software solutions for autism and IDD care. Trusted by more than 150,000 users, we enable therapy providers, educators, and employers scale the way they deliver Applied Behavior Analysis and related therapies with innovative technology, market-leading industry expertise, and world-class customer satisfaction. To be successful as a CentralReach Product Owner, you must be data driven, proactive, positive and humble. While you will have many creative ideas for improving the product, you see yourself as a “synthesizer” of the ideas of your teammates and clients, focusing on soliciting, synthesizing, and prioritizing those ideas to create a great product. You display a passion for our products, compassion for the stakeholders of our products (clients as well as support, success, sales, QA and engineering teams) and a willingness to operate within the framework, structure, and processes utilized by the company in a positive, can do way. Key Accountabilities: Collaboration with engineers, client-facing teams and customers to deliver valuable insights to help our users on solving their most important challenge Lead iteratives on building analytic dashboards and data set development and managing their lifecycle Become a subject matter expert on the CR Enterprise product and manage internal customer inquiries Collaborate with Product Manager to prioritize roadmap Plan and prioritize product development and product feature backlog to support each sprint and release Partner with Engineering team on sprint planning and management Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of sprint and release goals Manage and refine epic/user stories, requirements, sketches, workflows, and risk factors including edge cases, and other potentially impacted functions Communicate progress to key stakeholders throughout the sprint and release Validate and accept user stories upon completion of Engineering and Quality Assurance Author release notes and educate internal teams on latest enhancements for each release Desired Skills & Experience: 5+ years of related work experience Experience working with data analytics product, preferably healthcare related Proficiency in BI reporting and visualization tools (e.g., Sisense, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) Experience working with Agile/Scrum/Kanban process Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to work closely with non-technical partners and clients to understand their needs Expert in understanding business needs, gather appropriate information, analyze data to identify root cause Outstanding problem solving skills and being flexible and creative in finding solutions for hard problems Being a self-starter, who takes the initiative to exceed goals, uses analytical abilities, and possesses the adaptability to change Excellent organizational and time management skills Strongly empathetic to customer needs and workflows Ability to troubleshoot technical issues Attention to detail      CentralReach was developed for Clinicians by Clinicians. The story of CentralReach begins in 2012 when the company’s founder, a practicing Board Certified Behavioral Analyst, decided there had to be a better way to manage her operations so she could spend more time on what mattered most — working with her clients and patients. To help ABA practices focus on what they do best, CentralReach launched the first iteration of its EMR and practice management platform.     Today, under the leadership of Chris Sullens, an award-winning CEO in the technology space, CentralReach is committed to their mission of providing cutting-edge technology and services to help clinicians and educators produce superior client and patient outcomes. Already a market leader, CentralReach is expected to grow exponentially through its four core tenets: hire and develop great people; build industry-leading products; provide exceptional service to customers and continuously invest in systems, processes and infrastructure.     We value our employees and offer a robust benefits package including health and dental, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage and a 401(k) matching. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, ongoing training, mentoring and career pathing to help you develop your career. We pride ourselves on our fun and energetic environment that also provides our employees with a meaningful way to make a difference by helping clinicians produce superior outcomes for children and adults with disabilities.     CentralReach will not contact you or schedule interviews via Facebook. Please note social media is a current sourcing tool for talent acquisition via LinkedIn, Instagram, FB and for our recent job fair through CR company marketing, but we have a direct link to our website where all viable jobs are listed and directly tracked to our company page.     #LI-REMOTE

IT Product Owner       Apply      IT Product Owner Agency: TAXI & LIMOUSINE COMMISSION        Posted on: 08/21/2023       Job type: Full-time Location NYC-ALL BOROSTitle Classification: No exam required DepartmentManagement Information Systems      Salary range: $92,301.00 – $105,000.00      Job Description      The New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission (TLC) is the biggest and boldest for-hire transportation agency in the nation, taking on the challenge of licensing and regulating the city's iconic yellow and green taxis, Uber and Lyft vehicles, commuter vans, and luxury limousines. As a member of our team, you'll be n the driver's seat of revolutionizing taxi licensing and enforcement systems in the city that never sleeps. Every day, we make sure over one million riders arrive at their destination safely and comfortably, and we're just getting started. We're not afraid to embrace new technologies and ideas, and we're constantly pushing the limits of what's possible. You'll collaborate and streamline our operations to keep up with the rapid pace of change. We're a dedicated partner of the Mayor's Vision Zero initiative, working hard to make city streets safer for everyone. We're also a champion of open data and accessibility, leading the charge to make the city's transportation options more inclusive. So, buckle up and join us on this wild ride!       NYC TLC provides public data (NYC OpenData) for for-hire vehicles that include various preset views. These datasets are utilized by the public, TLC personnel, enforcement agents, and other agencies. IT is seeking a Product Owner who, under the supervision of the Chief Product Officer, will work closely with IT to analyze trip data, gather and document requirements for IT requests, and collaborate closely with various stakeholders on a project to streamline and accelerate the upload process of trip data in real time.        The successful candidate is an analytical leader who thrives in a highly collaborative workplace and actively engages with teams throughout the software development lifecycle. S/he will be smart, self-motivated, detailed, and comfortable working in a fast-paced and continuously changing environment. This role requires a strong technical background.       Responsibilities:      Analyze internal and external data sources to generate reports and present results to agency management, senior staff, and other stakeholders.Design and build interactive dashboards and data visualizationsIdentify gaps, trends, and inconsistencies with data and propose solutions to address issuesCollaborate with database developers to fix potential data problemsAnalyze and document requirements for bugs, enhancements, and projects and clearly communicate with IT teams, business stakeholders, and executive management throughout the implementation of IT requestsEvaluate requests from stakeholders for enhancements and projects, perform research and analysis to understand the full scope of the request, potential impacts, solutions, and prioritiesMeet regularly with business stakeholders to understand and document requirements for IT enhancements and projects, including but not limited to security projects and enhancements Minimum Qualifications      1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.  To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:  1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or  2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or  3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.   NOTE:  Probationary Period  Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills      The preferred candidate should possess the following: - 4+ years of business analysis, data analysis, and/or project management experience on information technology projects, including but not limited to software development, network, security, and/or information systems projects. - Experience documenting business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria - Excellent interpersonal skills including, collaborating, team building, facilitation skills, negotiation skills, and conflict resolution skills - Exceptionally curious and detail-oriented able to analyze requirements and think outside the box to develop innovative solutions to meet business needs - Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills - Excellent oral and written communication skills when interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels - Knowledge of Agile principles and values and experience participating in or leading agile/scrum projects - Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Project, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word), SharePoint - Professional/Certified Scrum Master or Certified Scrum Product Owner certification desired - Understanding of cyber security concepts, processes, and strategies a plus - Knowledge of TLC operations and processes preferred            Public Service Loan Forgiveness      As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/            Residency Requirement      New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview. Job Description:In this role, candidate will empower experiences to reach users in a safe, secure, and reliable way, and help users find notifications valuable for meaningful everyday communication across Messenger and Instagram. Candidate will have an unparalleled opportunity to drive engagement by unlocking the three dimensions: what do we prioritize notifying users about, when do we notify them, and how does this deliver value to them. You will be working closely with a fully funded engineering team with dedicated support from XFNs. Top 3 must-have hard skills:Defining vision and strategy for a productExperience going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution.Experience leading a cross-functional team across Engineering, Design, Data Science, and User ResearchGood to have skills:Experience in analyzing complex, large-scale data sets and making decisions based on dataExperience in gathering requirements across diverse areas and users, and converting and developing them into a product solutionStory Behind the Need – Business Group and Key Projects:Notifications of platforms and experience for FB and IG messagingCompelling Story and Candidate Value Proposition:Every day, ~4 Billion thread opens are from notifications. Imagine improving the experience for users and growing engagement by improving relevance and reducing notification sends - huge opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes for users worldwide.Typical Day in the Role:Working on product strategy to align with leadership on new ideasPartnering with Engineering, design and data science to test new hypothesis + solutions, and evaluate outcomesReporting outcomes on experimentsBuilding understand of user expectations through researchHow will performance be measured:Notification platform reliability improves across platformsMore users are open to receiving notifications / users do not turn notifications offUsers find notifications valuable and we see engagement wins based on our iterationsNote:Onsite in Menlo Park, CA - hybrid scheduleThis role is not Marketing related.Are you interested in working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment in one of the most critical products used by billions of people? If this sounds intriguing, then we’d like to talk to you.Messenger and Instagram Messaging are one of the fastest growing apps in the world with billions of people using it every month. Users choose Messenger and Instagram messaging for universal reach and rich ways that users can express themselves. What questions will you ask and solve for?Improve signal from noise: How do we deliver the right notifications at the right time such that users find them valuable and are willing to engage? Can we leverage ML to personalize these for different user segments?PRE 101: How do we win users’ trust by delivering each notification reliability to the device and has consistent and accurate badging?Platform first: How do we scale for 100s of partners to leverage our platform, policies, and governance models to build consistent messaging notification experiences across the family of apps?This team has an amazing track record - they have delivered notifs for Community Messaging which are driving joins to new communities and chats, as well as delivered message routing capabilities enabling us to explore fully featured messaging in Facebook.If this sounds interesting, please DM me to learn more!Pay Range: $90+ hourly  The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.  #LI-AP3

This game changing career will give you the opportunity to be challenged with pricing and actively managing our Medicare Supplement line of business for Physicians Mutual. You will get to initiate, organize, direct and analyze actuarial work. In this role you will develop actuarial assumptions as well as direct, develop and maintain product pricing, profit studies, reserves, rate filings and related procedures. Must be able to compile and evaluate statistical data. Must have advanced understanding of actuarial concepts and insurance knowledge and the ability to apply these concepts to the work. Continues to actively pursue actuarial exams, unless otherwise approved.Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or related discipline. Completion of ASA is required.Ability to apply standard mathematical computations to a variety of assigned work projectsStrong Excel experience for mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, etc.Ability to logically present voluminous data in a concise, understandable formatAbility to perform several projects while maintaining rigid deadlinesAbility to prepare basic financial and statistical reportsDemonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to build, maintain, and upgrade financial models utilizing complex actuarial conceptsFamiliarity and/or comfort with coding required Preferred: Medicare Supplement pricing experienceExperience with running SQL queries.Insurance Industry ExperienceALFA experience.About us:Since our start in 1902, Physicians Mutual Insurance Company has held to our founder’s promise — to provide protection to families when they need it most. In 1970, Physicians Life Insurance Company was founded and became a member of the Physicians Mutual family.  Today, we offer health, life and retirement products to millions of people from all walks of life. We’ve been here for them. Listening. Answering questions. Empowering them with the specialized guidance they need to make confident decisions about their insurance.  Over the years, our dedication to delivering on our promise has helped make us one of the nation’s leading health and life insurance providers. In fact, we are rated in the top 1% of insurance companies. We consistently maintain some of the highest financial strength ratings in the nation from independent insurance analysts, including A.M. Best Company and Weiss Ratings, ensuring we’ll be there for our policyowners and our employees far into the future.But the achievement we’re most proud of? We have a 95% customer approval rating – a true sign of a company dedicated to embodying its vision.     Job Requirements          Category          Corporate Actuarial / Finance          Job Type          Full-time          Travel

Product Manager: Associate Manager, New Verticals - Product Strategy & Operations
column7: About the Team New Verticals is an exciting team at DoorDash that is building and scaling new ways to delight our customers, leveraging the DoorDash platform. New Verticals include the DashMart, Convenience, Alcohol, Grocery, and Retail businesses. These categories bring about new challenges and opportunities to build something at DoorDash from the ground up. About the Role You will sit in the Fulfillment, Logistics & Catalog group within our New Verticals Strategy & Operations organization. We are hiring two positions on this team, so you’ll have the opportunity to be considered for both roles at once! You will help shape DoorDash's future inventory and selection strategy across our convenience, grocery, alcohol, and retail businesses as we transition the team to become a Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence-first platform. Your work will impact how merchants think about integrating their inventory to our platform and how consumers explore our inventory selection. You will partner with teams across DoorDash and beyond to build a world-class inventory system that works for all 3 sides of the marketplace (Merchants, Dashers and Customers) and our emerging 4th side (Advertisers). Your work will enable merchants and advertisers to onboard quickly and merchandise effectively, customers to make informed buying decisions with rich merchandising, and Dashers to know exactly what to shop, and where. You’re excited about this opportunity because you will…Build the Future: You will help develop the strategy for groceries/perishables and general retail operations. You will create quarterly and annual plans that push our business forward and are aligned with our product capabilities. You will help these teams identify opportunities for enhancing our existing product offering and methods to improve delivery quality.Collaborate & Influence: Become the voice of innovation! Champion solutions to enhance the user experience. Where a product or operations solution is needed to unlock growth and reduce cost, you will advocate for those resources with your central partners.Analyze: You love working with data and using data to drive business decision-makingLearn: You will be deeply Immersed in our US and International grocery and retail operations, forming a POV on the best path forward on in-store operations and product roadmaps alongside a dynamic high performing team.We’re excited about you because…You solve problems from first principles. You’re excited to think innovatively, and you resist “this is how it’s always been done” thinking.You’re equally comfortable operating at 10,000 feet and 1 foot. You don’t hesitate to get in the weeds and operate at the lowest level of detail, but you’re just as comfortable thinking long-term and inspiring a team.You’re analytical. You’re comfortable building complex SQL queries across multiple data sources and have experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools.You have 4-6+ years of experience. You’ve succeeded in fast-paced cultures (tech, operations, strategy, consulting, banking, or a related experience), and you’ve led teams to achieve audacious goals.About DoorDash At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.   DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more. Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel. Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation. If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection. Compensation The location-specific base salary range for this position is listed below. Compensation in other geographies may vary. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, base salary is localized according to employee work location. Please discuss your intended work location with your recruiter for more information. DoorDash cares about you and your overall well-being, and that’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package, for full-time employees, that includes healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan including an employer match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellbeing benefits, paid time off, paid parental leave, and several paid holidays, among others. In addition to base salary, the compensation package for this role also includes opportunities for equity grants. Product Manager: HVAC Systems Product Management Engineer Development Program
column7: At Trane TechnologiesTM and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King®, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.   This role is designated as hybrid with preference to be located in La Crosse, WI.  Position Summary: HVAC Systems Product Management Engineer role is a leadership development opportunity providing a variety of experiences through a structured rotational program to prepare for leadership opportunities in Product Management. Effective product management requires a diversity of experiences including customer facing, sales process, pricing analysis, system design/modeling, and development of future product requirements which this role is designed to provide. This role begins in our industry leading graduate training program (GTP) and then rotates between Product Management, Product Support, Systems Engineering, and Building Performance Modeling assignments leading to a broad view of Trane’s chiller business and the HVAC industry. Core Job Responsibilities (others may be added):Provide in-depth technical product, systems, applications and strategic sales support for Trane’s industry-leading chiller product and systems offeringAuthor technical materials and customer presentations for use by the sales organization to aid in sales effectiveness.Develop and deliver training to customers and sales engineers on the use of TRACE 3D Plus and other Trane system evaluation tools.Execute marketing communication that promotes sustainability, efficiency, and reliability in large applied HVAC systemsAdvise how Trane leads the industry in the electrification/decarbonization of HVAC systems to improve customers energy efficiency levelsTravel to sales offices, corporate events, and customer sites in support of Trane chillers and HVAC systems, including formal presentations, sales discussions, and supporting tradeshows.Understanding competitors' products and strategies and effectively communicate this information with the field, department, and other functional areas.Participate and eventually lead price analysis on projects and assist in bid strategies.Perform technical analysis including building energy studies which leads to strategic insight for sales material and/or product or system design and application.Participate/lead in projects that relate to new product development, developing product and systems ready marketing/promotional/technical content, and improving sales toolsSupport a professional field and customer focused environment, with measurements in place to track performance and improve the process.Position requires up to 20% travel. Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Engineering Essential Skills or Knowledge:Inquisitive about technical issueStrategic mindsetTactfulness and assertiveness; must be effective and clear decision-maker under pressure situations; able to communicate effectively with field (customers, sales assistants and sales engineers) and internal customers.Success-oriented, self-starter and able to manage time and priorities in order to meet specific goals and objectives.Highly developed and demonstrated interpersonal and communication skills and team-player skills required.Excellent oral and written communication skills.PC and end user computer use (Excel, Word, Power Point, Cloud-based Selection Software).We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs. We are an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, pregnancy, age, marital status, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any legally protected status.

Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

About the role As an Associate Product Manager you will work join our Product team to help ensure that we are able to continuously build world-class products. Your duties will include analyzing consumer behavior and industry trends, evaluating consumer feedback on our products, and finding solutions for product defects. Location Remote (based in India) What you will do You will closely work with one or more product managers and support them in a variety of product initiatives ranging from market and customer research to product launch and testing You will help prepare project status and risk management reports You will also work on training internal departments on new product features and providing support to customers when needed Prior experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, business management, marketing, or a related field 1-2 years of experience in a similar role would be advantageous Experience in gathering and interpreting qualitative product data and consumer feedback An understanding of product sprints, PRDs and basic technology frameworks Background in Data Analytics is a strong plus Experience designing prototypes in HTML CSS or using platforms such as Figma Qualities that we look for Strong communication skills - including the ability to listen to the needs of others and comprehend complex matters, articulate issues in a clear and concise manner, and present effectively in both oral and written presentations to all levels in the organization. You get stuff done. You have a strong bias to action and will roll your sleeves up and get things done when needed Excellent attention to detail; you believe anything worth doing must be done right Willingness and ability to work independently, think creatively, and ability to pivot depending on changing priorities and deadlines Affinity for a high-performance, fast-paced, and project-oriented work environment You are a self-starter who excels at learning new processes and business functions You are highly analytical and are comfortable working with data

The Product Owner is a crucial role on an application development team helping to transform a high-level vision into detailed functional requirements, create product user stories, and accept the completed deliver within a given iteration. That person is the primary contact responsible for ensuring the development team works on the tasks intended to address specific product scope and capabilities. The ideal candidate will have past or current Scrum Master responsibilities and experience with CCaaS; Amazon Connect, Twilio, or others. This is a remote position, must live in the United States.

CentralReach is the #1 provider of SaaS software solutions for autism and IDD care. Trusted by more than 150,000 users, we enable therapy providers, educators, and employers scale the way they deliver Applied Behavior Analysis and related therapies with innovative technology, market-leading industry expertise, and world-class customer satisfaction. To be successful as a CentralReach Product Owner, you must be data driven, proactive, positive and humble. While you will have many creative ideas for improving the product, you see yourself as a “synthesizer” of the ideas of your teammates and clients, focusing on soliciting, synthesizing, and prioritizing those ideas to create a great product. You display a passion for our products, compassion for the stakeholders of our products (clients as well as support, success, sales, QA and engineering teams) and a willingness to operate within the framework, structure, and processes utilized by the company in a positive, can do way. Key Accountabilities: Collaboration with engineers, client-facing teams and customers to deliver valuable insights to help our users on solving their most important challenge Lead iteratives on building analytic dashboards and data set development and managing their lifecycle Become a subject matter expert on the CR Enterprise product and manage internal customer inquiries Collaborate with Product Manager to prioritize roadmap Plan and prioritize product development and product feature backlog to support each sprint and release Partner with Engineering team on sprint planning and management Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of sprint and release goals Manage and refine epic/user stories, requirements, sketches, workflows, and risk factors including edge cases, and other potentially impacted functions Communicate progress to key stakeholders throughout the sprint and release Validate and accept user stories upon completion of Engineering and Quality Assurance Author release notes and educate internal teams on latest enhancements for each release Desired Skills & Experience: 5+ years of related work experience Experience working with data analytics product, preferably healthcare related Proficiency in BI reporting and visualization tools (e.g., Sisense, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) Experience working with Agile/Scrum/Kanban process Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to work closely with non-technical partners and clients to understand their needs Expert in understanding business needs, gather appropriate information, analyze data to identify root cause Outstanding problem solving skills and being flexible and creative in finding solutions for hard problems Being a self-starter, who takes the initiative to exceed goals, uses analytical abilities, and possesses the adaptability to change Excellent organizational and time management skills Strongly empathetic to customer needs and workflows Ability to troubleshoot technical issues Attention to detail      CentralReach was developed for Clinicians by Clinicians. The story of CentralReach begins in 2012 when the company’s founder, a practicing Board Certified Behavioral Analyst, decided there had to be a better way to manage her operations so she could spend more time on what mattered most — working with her clients and patients. To help ABA practices focus on what they do best, CentralReach launched the first iteration of its EMR and practice management platform.     Today, under the leadership of Chris Sullens, an award-winning CEO in the technology space, CentralReach is committed to their mission of providing cutting-edge technology and services to help clinicians and educators produce superior client and patient outcomes. Already a market leader, CentralReach is expected to grow exponentially through its four core tenets: hire and develop great people; build industry-leading products; provide exceptional service to customers and continuously invest in systems, processes and infrastructure.     We value our employees and offer a robust benefits package including health and dental, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage and a 401(k) matching. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, ongoing training, mentoring and career pathing to help you develop your career. We pride ourselves on our fun and energetic environment that also provides our employees with a meaningful way to make a difference by helping clinicians produce superior outcomes for children and adults with disabilities.     CentralReach will not contact you or schedule interviews via Facebook. Please note social media is a current sourcing tool for talent acquisition via LinkedIn, Instagram, FB and for our recent job fair through CR company marketing, but we have a direct link to our website where all viable jobs are listed and directly tracked to our company page.     #LI-REMOTE

column7: The Product Strategy Analyst is passionate and motivated by Healthfirst’s mission and wants to make a lasting impact in healthcare. This individual will create significant impact by providing the analytical support to the Integrated Products Strategy team to develop, assist in execution, and continuously improve upon a strategy that supports a profitable growth across the Integrated Products market portfolio including Medicaid Advantage Plus and Managed Long-Term Care Job Description Duties/Responsibilities: Work collaboratively with finance analysis, sales, marketing, Intake & Enrollment, and other departments as necessary to support market growth plans to achieve market growth and profitability objectives Compile information from multiple sources to prepare and distribute time-sensitive and accurate reporting for internal and external audiences Support team in analysis of the financial performance of e Integrated Products, identify favorable and unfavorable trends, develop recommendations to improve trends, communicate recommendations to management through a P&L focused mindset Design, create, modify, support and maintain monthly competitive reports and dashboards Prepare ad-hoc reporting as required by senior management and external partners Support team in creation of models to forecast growth performance and financial outcomes Effectively manage projects by setting clear project milestones and deliverables; clearly communicating goals, objectives and responsibilities. Participate in meetings to gather and specify departmental requirements for such projects Develop applications and reports using SQL ,Microsoft Excel, Tableau and pertinent databases  WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Applicants and employees are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other protected Federal, State/Province or Local status unrelated to the performance of the work involved.  If you have a disability under the Americans with Disability Act or a similar law and want a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to careers@Healthfirst.org or calling 212-519-1798 . In your email please include a description of the accommodation you are requesting and a description of the position for which you are applying. Only reasonable accommodation requests related to applying for a position within Healthfirst Management Services will be reviewed at the e-mail address and phone number supplied. Thank you for considering a career with Healthfirst Management Services.  EEO Law Poster and Supplement  All hiring and recruitment at Healthfirst is transacted with a valid “@healthfirst.org” email address only or from a recruitment firm representing our Company. Any recruitment firm representing Healthfirst will readily provide you with the name and contact information of the recruiting professional representing the opportunity you are inquiring about. If you receive a communication from a sender whose domain is not @healthfirst.org, or not one of our recruitment partners, please be aware that those communications are not coming from or authorized by Healthfirst. Healthfirst will never ask you for money during the recruitment or onboarding process. Hiring Range*:Greater New York City Area (NY, NJ, CT residents): $65,600 - $94,775 All Other Locations (within approved locations): $58,300 - $86,700  As a candidate for this position, your salary and related elements of compensation will be contingent upon your work experience, education, licenses and certifications, and any other factors Healthfirst deems pertinent to the hiring decision.  In addition to your salary, Healthfirst offers employees a full range of benefits such as, medical, dental and vision coverage, incentive and recognition programs, life insurance, and 401k contributions (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Healthfirst believes in providing a competitive compensation and benefits package wherever its employees work and live. The hiring range is defined as the lowest and highest salaries that Healthfirst in “good faith” would pay to a new hire, or for a job promotion, or transfer into this role.

Job Description:In this role, candidate will empower experiences to reach users in a safe, secure, and reliable way, and help users find notifications valuable for meaningful everyday communication across Messenger and Instagram. Candidate will have an unparalleled opportunity to drive engagement by unlocking the three dimensions: what do we prioritize notifying users about, when do we notify them, and how does this deliver value to them. You will be working closely with a fully funded engineering team with dedicated support from XFNs. Top 3 must-have hard skills:Defining vision and strategy for a productExperience going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution.Experience leading a cross-functional team across Engineering, Design, Data Science, and User ResearchGood to have skills:Experience in analyzing complex, large-scale data sets and making decisions based on dataExperience in gathering requirements across diverse areas and users, and converting and developing them into a product solutionStory Behind the Need – Business Group and Key Projects:Notifications of platforms and experience for FB and IG messagingCompelling Story and Candidate Value Proposition:Every day, ~4 Billion thread opens are from notifications. Imagine improving the experience for users and growing engagement by improving relevance and reducing notification sends - huge opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes for users worldwide.Typical Day in the Role:Working on product strategy to align with leadership on new ideasPartnering with Engineering, design and data science to test new hypothesis + solutions, and evaluate outcomesReporting outcomes on experimentsBuilding understand of user expectations through researchHow will performance be measured:Notification platform reliability improves across platformsMore users are open to receiving notifications / users do not turn notifications offUsers find notifications valuable and we see engagement wins based on our iterationsNote:Onsite in Menlo Park, CA - hybrid scheduleThis role is not Marketing related.Are you interested in working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment in one of the most critical products used by billions of people? If this sounds intriguing, then we’d like to talk to you.Messenger and Instagram Messaging are one of the fastest growing apps in the world with billions of people using it every month. Users choose Messenger and Instagram messaging for universal reach and rich ways that users can express themselves. What questions will you ask and solve for?Improve signal from noise: How do we deliver the right notifications at the right time such that users find them valuable and are willing to engage? Can we leverage ML to personalize these for different user segments?PRE 101: How do we win users’ trust by delivering each notification reliability to the device and has consistent and accurate badging?Platform first: How do we scale for 100s of partners to leverage our platform, policies, and governance models to build consistent messaging notification experiences across the family of apps?This team has an amazing track record - they have delivered notifs for Community Messaging which are driving joins to new communities and chats, as well as delivered message routing capabilities enabling us to explore fully featured messaging in Facebook.If this sounds interesting, please DM me to learn more!Pay Range: $90+ hourly  The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.  #LI-AP3

IT Product Owner       Apply      IT Product Owner Agency: TAXI & LIMOUSINE COMMISSION        Posted on: 08/21/2023       Job type: Full-time Location NYC-ALL BOROSTitle Classification: No exam required DepartmentManagement Information Systems      Salary range: $92,301.00 – $105,000.00      Job Description      The New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission (TLC) is the biggest and boldest for-hire transportation agency in the nation, taking on the challenge of licensing and regulating the city's iconic yellow and green taxis, Uber and Lyft vehicles, commuter vans, and luxury limousines. As a member of our team, you'll be n the driver's seat of revolutionizing taxi licensing and enforcement systems in the city that never sleeps. Every day, we make sure over one million riders arrive at their destination safely and comfortably, and we're just getting started. We're not afraid to embrace new technologies and ideas, and we're constantly pushing the limits of what's possible. You'll collaborate and streamline our operations to keep up with the rapid pace of change. We're a dedicated partner of the Mayor's Vision Zero initiative, working hard to make city streets safer for everyone. We're also a champion of open data and accessibility, leading the charge to make the city's transportation options more inclusive. So, buckle up and join us on this wild ride!       NYC TLC provides public data (NYC OpenData) for for-hire vehicles that include various preset views. These datasets are utilized by the public, TLC personnel, enforcement agents, and other agencies. IT is seeking a Product Owner who, under the supervision of the Chief Product Officer, will work closely with IT to analyze trip data, gather and document requirements for IT requests, and collaborate closely with various stakeholders on a project to streamline and accelerate the upload process of trip data in real time.        The successful candidate is an analytical leader who thrives in a highly collaborative workplace and actively engages with teams throughout the software development lifecycle. S/he will be smart, self-motivated, detailed, and comfortable working in a fast-paced and continuously changing environment. This role requires a strong technical background.       Responsibilities:      Analyze internal and external data sources to generate reports and present results to agency management, senior staff, and other stakeholders.Design and build interactive dashboards and data visualizationsIdentify gaps, trends, and inconsistencies with data and propose solutions to address issuesCollaborate with database developers to fix potential data problemsAnalyze and document requirements for bugs, enhancements, and projects and clearly communicate with IT teams, business stakeholders, and executive management throughout the implementation of IT requestsEvaluate requests from stakeholders for enhancements and projects, perform research and analysis to understand the full scope of the request, potential impacts, solutions, and prioritiesMeet regularly with business stakeholders to understand and document requirements for IT enhancements and projects, including but not limited to security projects and enhancements Minimum Qualifications      1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.  To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:  1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or  2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or  3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.   NOTE:  Probationary Period  Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills      The preferred candidate should possess the following: - 4+ years of business analysis, data analysis, and/or project management experience on information technology projects, including but not limited to software development, network, security, and/or information systems projects. - Experience documenting business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria - Excellent interpersonal skills including, collaborating, team building, facilitation skills, negotiation skills, and conflict resolution skills - Exceptionally curious and detail-oriented able to analyze requirements and think outside the box to develop innovative solutions to meet business needs - Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills - Excellent oral and written communication skills when interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels - Knowledge of Agile principles and values and experience participating in or leading agile/scrum projects - Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Project, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word), SharePoint - Professional/Certified Scrum Master or Certified Scrum Product Owner certification desired - Understanding of cyber security concepts, processes, and strategies a plus - Knowledge of TLC operations and processes preferred            Public Service Loan Forgiveness      As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/            Residency Requirement      New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.            Additional Information      The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.
