Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

Bellese Technologies is looking for someone with a passion for solving big problems in healthcare. We foster a learning environment that thrives on curiosity, innovation, and passion about improving healthcare in America. Our remote-first team is spread across 20+ states and leverages exceptional collaboration to amplify our strengths. We provide an environment focused around helping you achieve your goals. Because when you succeed, we all succeed.  This position is contingent upon contract award Responsibilities Sitting in the customer’s and user’s shoes: you seek to understand and empathize with the users and their goals – their problems are your problems Working with the development team to clarify requirements and help them understand the business side of the product Succinctly communicating or demonstrating issues to your team, and leading the thought process of your team to drive toward feasible, viable, and highly-usable solutions Creating user stories and acceptance criteria that clearly articulate requirements for each feature Translating ideas into actionable, testable solutions, and working with engineering teams to define and implement those solutions Verifying that the finished product meets the requirements and the needs of customers by conducting usability tests or reviewing customer feedback Prioritizing product backlog items based on business value, time needed to complete, and order in which they were created Communicating with stakeholders to ensure that everyone is on the same page regarding features, functionality, and deadlines Engaging and communicating with both technical and non-technical folks Communicating project status and roadblocks to other team members Working as part of an agile software development team - you’re a creative thinker and skilled communicator who thrives in cross-functional teams Facilitating meetings and preparing presentations to share ideas and findings Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports Measuring results: you define success through clear metrics so the customer can see what works and what doesn’t Qualifications Learning about and applying product and design thinking frameworks to problem-solving and managing the software development lifecycle Working with user research to identify current user experience issues, and driving measurable improvements Translating the HCD research findings and user needs into technical solutions, requirements, and user stories Managing a product backlog (Epics, Features, User Stories) in support of a strategic Product Roadmap Releasing and supporting software systems to healthcare providers All stages of the product development lifecycle - from research through design inception through implementation Organizing/obtaining feedback from stakeholders on completed work Bellese offers Three weeks paid leave Flexible Schedule and Remote-First culture $3000 annual education stipend Work from home setup including Macbook (possibly used/refurbished) Collaborative, learning environment Health insurance 401K Plan with Safe Harbor contribution   Other:  Executive Order requiring COVID safety protocols Bellese employees are Federal Workers and are subject to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, dated September 9, 2021 (published in the Federal Register on September 14, 2021, 86 FR 50985). As condition of employment, employees will need to provide either: a: proof of completed COVID vaccinations OR b: have an approved medical or religious exemption and proof of weekly COVID testing.  U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. The Product Owner is a crucial role on an application development team helping to transform a high-level vision into detailed functional requirements, create product user stories, and accept the completed deliver within a given iteration. That person is the primary contact responsible for ensuring the development team works on the tasks intended to address specific product scope and capabilities. The ideal candidate will have past or current Scrum Master responsibilities and experience with CCaaS; Amazon Connect, Twilio, or others. This is a remote position, must live in the United States.

About the role As an Associate Product Manager you will work join our Product team to help ensure that we are able to continuously build world-class products. Your duties will include analyzing consumer behavior and industry trends, evaluating consumer feedback on our products, and finding solutions for product defects. Location Remote (based in India) What you will do You will closely work with one or more product managers and support them in a variety of product initiatives ranging from market and customer research to product launch and testing You will help prepare project status and risk management reports You will also work on training internal departments on new product features and providing support to customers when needed Prior experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, business management, marketing, or a related field 1-2 years of experience in a similar role would be advantageous Experience in gathering and interpreting qualitative product data and consumer feedback An understanding of product sprints, PRDs and basic technology frameworks Background in Data Analytics is a strong plus Experience designing prototypes in HTML CSS or using platforms such as Figma Qualities that we look for Strong communication skills - including the ability to listen to the needs of others and comprehend complex matters, articulate issues in a clear and concise manner, and present effectively in both oral and written presentations to all levels in the organization. You get stuff done. You have a strong bias to action and will roll your sleeves up and get things done when needed Excellent attention to detail; you believe anything worth doing must be done right Willingness and ability to work independently, think creatively, and ability to pivot depending on changing priorities and deadlines Affinity for a high-performance, fast-paced, and project-oriented work environment You are a self-starter who excels at learning new processes and business functions You are highly analytical and are comfortable working with data

Job Description:In this role, candidate will empower experiences to reach users in a safe, secure, and reliable way, and help users find notifications valuable for meaningful everyday communication across Messenger and Instagram. Candidate will have an unparalleled opportunity to drive engagement by unlocking the three dimensions: what do we prioritize notifying users about, when do we notify them, and how does this deliver value to them. You will be working closely with a fully funded engineering team with dedicated support from XFNs. Top 3 must-have hard skills:Defining vision and strategy for a productExperience going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution.Experience leading a cross-functional team across Engineering, Design, Data Science, and User ResearchGood to have skills:Experience in analyzing complex, large-scale data sets and making decisions based on dataExperience in gathering requirements across diverse areas and users, and converting and developing them into a product solutionStory Behind the Need – Business Group and Key Projects:Notifications of platforms and experience for FB and IG messagingCompelling Story and Candidate Value Proposition:Every day, ~4 Billion thread opens are from notifications. Imagine improving the experience for users and growing engagement by improving relevance and reducing notification sends - huge opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes for users worldwide.Typical Day in the Role:Working on product strategy to align with leadership on new ideasPartnering with Engineering, design and data science to test new hypothesis + solutions, and evaluate outcomesReporting outcomes on experimentsBuilding understand of user expectations through researchHow will performance be measured:Notification platform reliability improves across platformsMore users are open to receiving notifications / users do not turn notifications offUsers find notifications valuable and we see engagement wins based on our iterationsNote:Onsite in Menlo Park, CA - hybrid scheduleThis role is not Marketing related.Are you interested in working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment in one of the most critical products used by billions of people? If this sounds intriguing, then we’d like to talk to you.Messenger and Instagram Messaging are one of the fastest growing apps in the world with billions of people using it every month. Users choose Messenger and Instagram messaging for universal reach and rich ways that users can express themselves. What questions will you ask and solve for?Improve signal from noise: How do we deliver the right notifications at the right time such that users find them valuable and are willing to engage? Can we leverage ML to personalize these for different user segments?PRE 101: How do we win users’ trust by delivering each notification reliability to the device and has consistent and accurate badging?Platform first: How do we scale for 100s of partners to leverage our platform, policies, and governance models to build consistent messaging notification experiences across the family of apps?This team has an amazing track record - they have delivered notifs for Community Messaging which are driving joins to new communities and chats, as well as delivered message routing capabilities enabling us to explore fully featured messaging in Facebook.If this sounds interesting, please DM me to learn more!Pay Range: $90+ hourly  The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.  #LI-AP3

Position Summary:     Odyssey Systems has an exciting new opportunity for a   WPAC Project/Product Management Analyst supporting the   U.S. Army Medical Materiel Development Activity (USAMMDA), a subordinate command under United States Army Medical Research and Development Command (USAMRDC) in Frederick, MD. The Biology/Medical Project Management Analyst will provide full-time project management and acquisition support to the Warfighter Protection and Acute Care (WPAC) Project Management Organization (PMO).  ***Contingent upon contract award***  Responsibilities:     Duties include, but not limited to:  Provide project management directly to the project manager coordinating and consolidating all acquisition activities in the PMO acquisition dashboard. Track PMO Integrated Product Team (IPT) and Working Group (WG) annual reporting meetings to include scheduling meetings; coordinating with participants; preparing agendas, related documentation, and meeting minutes; and tracking action items. Coordinate and disperse Taskers to appropriate team members. Validating information and compiling responses to ensure full response has been gathered for review and submission approval of management. Exceptional communication skills and attention to detail are mandatory. Experience with personnel at various grades both military and civilian is helpful. Support numerous efforts and effectively prioritize and multi-task requirements that have a direct impact on the Products. Support all major initiatives to advance product capabilities. Assist with programmatic and technical document review, market research, and vendor site visits/demonstrations. Be aware of, and be sensitive to, information flows that contain items of interest to or that are the action or the responsibility of the Government Product Manager. Assist in Project Management Office (PMO)-related fiscal management by performing budget analysis and contract support in regards to deliverables and periods of performance. Maintain current knowledge of relevant technology and industry developments. Support the DoD Acquisition Lifecycle and document preparation; maintain general understanding of DoD 5000 acquisition guidelines and Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulatory processes. Prepare and review briefings, summaries, information papers, technical reports, acquisition documentation, and other correspondence. Manage and track numerous, diverse, simultaneous efforts and have the ability to effectively prioritize requirements for multiple on-going projects in support of project team. Qualifications:   Minimum Required Qualifications: Citizenship: Must be a US citizen  Clearance: NACI  Education: B.S. in biology, public health or medical/technical/science  Years’ experience: 16 years of experience in biology, public health or medical/technical/science field  Experience in managing multiple projects and deadlines. Experience in project management skills (cost, schedule, performance risk) required. Experience, knowledge and ability to execute the use of MS Office, including Word, Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook. Preferred Qualifications: Years’ experience: Sharepoint and MS Project experience desired.  At least 1-2 years of Federal contracting management, especially military, is preferred. Interest in medical research programs desired. Interpersonal Skills: Communication, teamwork, problem-solving, critical thinking, leadership, attention to detail, multitasking  Additional Information: Location: Onsite in Frederick, MD (local candidates only); Telework eligible  Travel: 10%  ***Contingent upon contract award*** #LI-AS1    #hybrid  Company Overview:   Odyssey Systems Consulting Group, is an innovative small business committed to providing world-class technical, management, and training support services to government and public sector clients. We focus on people, processes, and performance to deliver superior results. Since our inception in 1997, our commitment to mission success and customer satisfaction has been recognized with exponential growth and exceptional past performance ratings. We accept challenging assignments and drive projects from the planning stages, through implementation, and into operations and support.  Please note: Final compensation for this position will be determined by various factors such as the Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant work experience, specific skills and competencies, geographic location, education, and certifications.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

We run so life can leap forward. Mit rund 3.000 Beschäftigten ist das Werk Mannheim Deutschlands größter Hersteller und Exporteur landwirtschaftlicher Traktoren. Das Produktionsprogramm für den weltweiten Markt umfasst 27 verschiedene Grundmodelle (von 66 bis 184 kW (90 bis 250 PS)) in unterschiedlichen Versionen und zahlreichen Ausrüstungsvarianten. Die Abteilung Aftermarket Product Management sucht ab dem 1. Februar 2024 wissbegierige Unterstützung. Praktikum Aftermarket Product Management (m/w/d) Du bist Teil des kleinen schlagfertigen Aftermarket Team für Traktoren der Serie 6 und arbeitest eng mit Kollegen aus den Bereichen Marketing, Entwicklung und Konfiguration zusammen. Mit deiner Arbeit trägst du persönlich dazu bei unseren Kunden über den gesamten Lebenszyklus des Traktors hinweg Nachrüst-, Reparatur- und Servicelösungen zur Verfügung zu stellen. Darauf kannst Du Dich freuen: Einblick in die Tätigkeit einer global agierenden Organisation sowie ein internationales Arbeitsumfeld attraktives Vergütungspaket flexibles und modernes Arbeiten sowie Entwicklungs- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten 35 Stunden/ Woche kreative Freiräume bei der Durchführung von Projekten und eine gute Betreuung Vergünstigtes Mittagsessen in der Cafeteria Diese Aufgaben erwarten Dich: Identifikation und Dokumentation von technischen Abhänigkeiten bei existierenden Nachrüstlösungen der 6M Serie Erstellen von Nutzen-/ Verkaufsargumentationen für Nachrüstungen und Ersatzteile Mitarbeit bei der Weiterentwicklung unseres Nachrüstkonfigurators Mitarbeit in verschiedenen Projekten im abwechslungsreichen Tagesgeschäft Identifikation von Optimierungspotential des existierenden Aftermarket Portfolios Das bringst Du mit: Immatrikulation der Fachrichtung Agrarwissenschaft, Agrartechnik, Ingenieurswissenschaften, (Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Marketing) oder vergleichbar Interesse an landwirtschaftlichen Maschinen und technischen Details Sicherer Umgang mit MS-Office (Word / Excel) Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse und sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse Nicht jeder kann von sich behaupten, dass die eigene Arbeit zur Grundversorgung der wachsenden Weltbevölkerung beiträgt. Bei John Deere kannst Du das! Als führender Landtechnikhersteller fertigen wir moderne Land-, Forst-, und Baumaschinen sowie Maschinen für Rasen- und Grundstückspflege. In den letzten Jahren haben wir das Unternehmen zu einem Technologiekonzern entwickelt. Teile mit uns, unsere Vision einer Farm der Zukunft, basierend auf künstlicher Intelligenz, Automatisierung und Konnektivität, um unsere wachsende Welt nachhaltig zu versorgen. #leapforward Egal wer Du bist – bei John Deere bist Du herzlich willkommen! Wir sind der festen Überzeugung, dass Vielfalt und Einbeziehung uns noch stärker machen. Bei Fragen zu deiner Bewerbung wende dich gerne an: Praktikantenmanagement@JohnDeere.com

This game changing career will give you the opportunity to be challenged with pricing and actively managing our Medicare Supplement line of business for Physicians Mutual. You will get to initiate, organize, direct and analyze actuarial work. In this role you will develop actuarial assumptions as well as direct, develop and maintain product pricing, profit studies, reserves, rate filings and related procedures. Must be able to compile and evaluate statistical data. Must have advanced understanding of actuarial concepts and insurance knowledge and the ability to apply these concepts to the work. Continues to actively pursue actuarial exams, unless otherwise approved.Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or related discipline. Completion of ASA is required.Ability to apply standard mathematical computations to a variety of assigned work projectsStrong Excel experience for mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, etc.Ability to logically present voluminous data in a concise, understandable formatAbility to perform several projects while maintaining rigid deadlinesAbility to prepare basic financial and statistical reportsDemonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to build, maintain, and upgrade financial models utilizing complex actuarial conceptsFamiliarity and/or comfort with coding required Preferred: Medicare Supplement pricing experienceExperience with running SQL queries.Insurance Industry ExperienceALFA experience.About us:Since our start in 1902, Physicians Mutual Insurance Company has held to our founder’s promise — to provide protection to families when they need it most. In 1970, Physicians Life Insurance Company was founded and became a member of the Physicians Mutual family.  Today, we offer health, life and retirement products to millions of people from all walks of life. We’ve been here for them. Listening. Answering questions. Empowering them with the specialized guidance they need to make confident decisions about their insurance.  Over the years, our dedication to delivering on our promise has helped make us one of the nation’s leading health and life insurance providers. In fact, we are rated in the top 1% of insurance companies. We consistently maintain some of the highest financial strength ratings in the nation from independent insurance analysts, including A.M. Best Company and Weiss Ratings, ensuring we’ll be there for our policyowners and our employees far into the future.But the achievement we’re most proud of? We have a 95% customer approval rating – a true sign of a company dedicated to embodying its vision.     Job Requirements          Category          Corporate Actuarial / Finance          Job Type          Full-time          Travel

Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

Bellese Technologies is looking for someone with a passion for solving big problems in healthcare. We foster a learning environment that thrives on curiosity, innovation, and passion about improving healthcare in America. Our remote-first team is spread across 20+ states and leverages exceptional collaboration to amplify our strengths. We provide an environment focused around helping you achieve your goals. Because when you succeed, we all succeed.  This position is contingent upon contract award Responsibilities Sitting in the customer’s and user’s shoes: you seek to understand and empathize with the users and their goals – their problems are your problems Working with the development team to clarify requirements and help them understand the business side of the product Succinctly communicating or demonstrating issues to your team, and leading the thought process of your team to drive toward feasible, viable, and highly-usable solutions Creating user stories and acceptance criteria that clearly articulate requirements for each feature Translating ideas into actionable, testable solutions, and working with engineering teams to define and implement those solutions Verifying that the finished product meets the requirements and the needs of customers by conducting usability tests or reviewing customer feedback Prioritizing product backlog items based on business value, time needed to complete, and order in which they were created Communicating with stakeholders to ensure that everyone is on the same page regarding features, functionality, and deadlines Engaging and communicating with both technical and non-technical folks Communicating project status and roadblocks to other team members Working as part of an agile software development team - you’re a creative thinker and skilled communicator who thrives in cross-functional teams Facilitating meetings and preparing presentations to share ideas and findings Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports Measuring results: you define success through clear metrics so the customer can see what works and what doesn’t Qualifications Learning about and applying product and design thinking frameworks to problem-solving and managing the software development lifecycle Working with user research to identify current user experience issues, and driving measurable improvements Translating the HCD research findings and user needs into technical solutions, requirements, and user stories Managing a product backlog (Epics, Features, User Stories) in support of a strategic Product Roadmap Releasing and supporting software systems to healthcare providers All stages of the product development lifecycle - from research through design inception through implementation Organizing/obtaining feedback from stakeholders on completed work Bellese offers Three weeks paid leave Flexible Schedule and Remote-First culture $3000 annual education stipend Work from home setup including Macbook (possibly used/refurbished) Collaborative, learning environment Health insurance 401K Plan with Safe Harbor contribution   Other:  Executive Order requiring COVID safety protocols Bellese employees are Federal Workers and are subject to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, dated September 9, 2021 (published in the Federal Register on September 14, 2021, 86 FR 50985). As condition of employment, employees will need to provide either: a: proof of completed COVID vaccinations OR b: have an approved medical or religious exemption and proof of weekly COVID testing. The Product Owner is a crucial role on an application development team helping to transform a high-level vision into detailed functional requirements, create product user stories, and accept the completed deliver within a given iteration. That person is the primary contact responsible for ensuring the development team works on the tasks intended to address specific product scope and capabilities. The ideal candidate will have past or current Scrum Master responsibilities and experience with CCaaS; Amazon Connect, Twilio, or others. This is a remote position, must live in the United States.

About the role As an Associate Product Manager you will work join our Product team to help ensure that we are able to continuously build world-class products. Your duties will include analyzing consumer behavior and industry trends, evaluating consumer feedback on our products, and finding solutions for product defects. Location Remote (based in India) What you will do You will closely work with one or more product managers and support them in a variety of product initiatives ranging from market and customer research to product launch and testing You will help prepare project status and risk management reports You will also work on training internal departments on new product features and providing support to customers when needed Prior experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, business management, marketing, or a related field 1-2 years of experience in a similar role would be advantageous Experience in gathering and interpreting qualitative product data and consumer feedback An understanding of product sprints, PRDs and basic technology frameworks Background in Data Analytics is a strong plus Experience designing prototypes in HTML CSS or using platforms such as Figma Qualities that we look for Strong communication skills - including the ability to listen to the needs of others and comprehend complex matters, articulate issues in a clear and concise manner, and present effectively in both oral and written presentations to all levels in the organization. You get stuff done. You have a strong bias to action and will roll your sleeves up and get things done when needed Excellent attention to detail; you believe anything worth doing must be done right Willingness and ability to work independently, think creatively, and ability to pivot depending on changing priorities and deadlines Affinity for a high-performance, fast-paced, and project-oriented work environment You are a self-starter who excels at learning new processes and business functions You are highly analytical and are comfortable working with data

Product Manager: Associate Manager, New Verticals - Product Strategy & Operations
2024 Campus Full Time: Product Management Associate Business Analyst
column7: At UL, we know why we come to work. Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely! As our global footprint continues to spread across the world, we are looking for a Product Management Associate Business Analyst to join our team in Northbrook, IL.What you’ll learn & achieve: As a Product Management Associate Business Analyst, you will work within one of the following operating units: Built Environment (BE) Built Environment provides the highest level of technical knowledge, expertise and testing, inspection and certification, advisory and commissioning services to support our customers globally throughout the entire life cycle of their products and buildings. UL plays a critical role and acts as a trusted partner to various stakeholders in the built environment and building products industry by knowing everything about every building, building regulation and requirement, fire equipment services and personal protective equipment by providing proactive insights on safe, secure and sustainable buildings, risk management solutions and tenant wellness and safety validations. Building Materials, Suppression Systems and Building Envelope Life Safety, Detection and Security Systems Personal Protective Equipment Energy and Industrial Automation (EIA) In Energy and Industrial Automation (EIA), we provide solutions for safety, security, and performance throughout the value chains for a diversity of cutting-edge industries, such as: Power and Automation, Renewable Energy, Field Evaluation Services and Industrial Functional Safety. The impact of our work spreads through many business areas on a global scale yet focused locally through our collaborative team members. Below are areas where UL is building and expanding services, and examples of what you may work on during your internship. Electric Vehicle (EV) Charging Systems and Equipment Batteries and Energy Storage Systems (ESS) Renewable Energy: Solar & Wind Industrial Robotics Power and Control Equipment Industrial Machinery Oil & Gas and Hazardous Locations Equipment Global Market Access Requirements for Products & Components Industrial EcosystemsWhat makes you a great fit: Be completing your final year of your undergraduate degree in: Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, Product Management or related major Hold a Bachelor’s degree prior to the intended full time start date Demonstrated ability to work in a results-oriented, challenging environment Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Ambitious and highly motivated self-starter who works well independently and collaboratively Ability to remain driven and focused in a remote work environment Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. What you’ll experience working at UL: Mission : For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do. People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best. Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world. Grow & achieve: We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles. Total Rewards: All employees at UL Solutions are eligible for annual bonus compensation. The target for this position is 5% of the base salary offered. Employees are eligible for health benefits such as medical, dental and vision; wellness benefits such as mental & financial health; and retirement savings (401K) commensurate with the standard rewards offered in each individual location or country, for the relevant position level. We also provide employees with paid time off including vacation (15 days), holiday including floating holidays (12 days) and sick time off (72 hours). Learn More: Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal. Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com Connect With Us! Not ready to apply, or can't find a relevant opportunity?  Connect with us to keep informed about the latest UL career opportunities, tailored to your interests.   If you wish to request reasonable accommodation at any time, please email our Talent Acquisition team at Talent.Acquisition@ul.com.

Product Manager: Solutions Architect for Conceptwave/Order Management/Product Catalog
column7: Location: Bellevue, WA No. of Positions: 4 Length of Contract: 6 months (to start) W2 Rate (all inclusive): $42.18 – $48.51/hr Only Candidates who are authorized to work in the US will be considered for this position. Key RequirementsDeep Knowledge of SID modelUnderstanding of workflow based software design/testingExperience with Product Catalog (commercial as well as technical catalog), understand product life cycle and business process.Understanding of client’s charging tariff data and rating structureExperience and understanding subscriber life cycle and business process.Skills Preferred:Experience with Ordering management system, CRM, billing system. Good Understanding of their data modelExperience with Charging/Rating solutionExperience with Billing solutionExperience with TMO middleware (TIBCO)Experience with Tier 1 operator service order/activation end-2-end flowExperience with Conceptwave Order Care platform.Other preferred skills:High-Availability solution (including Geo-redundancy)Weblogic, Java, XML/HTTP, JSON, RESTOracle Geo-redundant solution: Data Guard, GoldenGateSNMP, JMXHadoop, Cassandra, OracleUltimately, the candidate has a combination of the following work experiences:3 big migration executed with successData model PCOrder to Activation Processes Idea to Marketing Processes

```Duties```- Collaborate with stakeholders to define product vision, strategy, and roadmap- Gather and prioritize product requirements based on customer needs and market trends- Create and maintain product backlog, ensuring items are well-defined and properly prioritized- Work closely with development teams to ensure timely delivery of high-quality products- Conduct user acceptance testing to validate product functionality and usability- Monitor and analyze product performance, making data-driven decisions for improvements- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in software development```Qualifications```- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field- Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role in software development- Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and principles- Proficiency in AWS, Excel, SQL, and other relevant software tools- Familiarity with test cases, version control systems (e.g., VersionOne), and APIs- Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams- Ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously- Experience in mobile application development is a plusIf you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for driving product success through effective collaboration and strategic decision-making, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our dynamic team as a Product Owner.Job Type: ContractPay: $104,684.36 - $126,071.48 per yearExperience level:6 yearsSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: Hybrid remote in Washington, DC 20024

Job Description:In this role, candidate will empower experiences to reach users in a safe, secure, and reliable way, and help users find notifications valuable for meaningful everyday communication across Messenger and Instagram. Candidate will have an unparalleled opportunity to drive engagement by unlocking the three dimensions: what do we prioritize notifying users about, when do we notify them, and how does this deliver value to them. You will be working closely with a fully funded engineering team with dedicated support from XFNs. Top 3 must-have hard skills:Defining vision and strategy for a productExperience going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution.Experience leading a cross-functional team across Engineering, Design, Data Science, and User ResearchGood to have skills:Experience in analyzing complex, large-scale data sets and making decisions based on dataExperience in gathering requirements across diverse areas and users, and converting and developing them into a product solutionStory Behind the Need – Business Group and Key Projects:Notifications of platforms and experience for FB and IG messagingCompelling Story and Candidate Value Proposition:Every day, ~4 Billion thread opens are from notifications. Imagine improving the experience for users and growing engagement by improving relevance and reducing notification sends - huge opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes for users worldwide.Typical Day in the Role:Working on product strategy to align with leadership on new ideasPartnering with Engineering, design and data science to test new hypothesis + solutions, and evaluate outcomesReporting outcomes on experimentsBuilding understand of user expectations through researchHow will performance be measured:Notification platform reliability improves across platformsMore users are open to receiving notifications / users do not turn notifications offUsers find notifications valuable and we see engagement wins based on our iterationsNote:Onsite in Menlo Park, CA - hybrid scheduleThis role is not Marketing related.Are you interested in working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment in one of the most critical products used by billions of people? If this sounds intriguing, then we’d like to talk to you.Messenger and Instagram Messaging are one of the fastest growing apps in the world with billions of people using it every month. Users choose Messenger and Instagram messaging for universal reach and rich ways that users can express themselves. What questions will you ask and solve for?Improve signal from noise: How do we deliver the right notifications at the right time such that users find them valuable and are willing to engage? Can we leverage ML to personalize these for different user segments?PRE 101: How do we win users’ trust by delivering each notification reliability to the device and has consistent and accurate badging?Platform first: How do we scale for 100s of partners to leverage our platform, policies, and governance models to build consistent messaging notification experiences across the family of apps?This team has an amazing track record - they have delivered notifs for Community Messaging which are driving joins to new communities and chats, as well as delivered message routing capabilities enabling us to explore fully featured messaging in Facebook.If this sounds interesting, please DM me to learn more!Pay Range: $90+ hourly  The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.  #LI-AP3

This game changing career will give you the opportunity to be challenged with pricing and actively managing our Medicare Supplement line of business for Physicians Mutual. You will get to initiate, organize, direct and analyze actuarial work. In this role you will develop actuarial assumptions as well as direct, develop and maintain product pricing, profit studies, reserves, rate filings and related procedures. Must be able to compile and evaluate statistical data. Must have advanced understanding of actuarial concepts and insurance knowledge and the ability to apply these concepts to the work. Continues to actively pursue actuarial exams, unless otherwise approved.Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or related discipline. Completion of ASA is required.Ability to apply standard mathematical computations to a variety of assigned work projectsStrong Excel experience for mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, etc.Ability to logically present voluminous data in a concise, understandable formatAbility to perform several projects while maintaining rigid deadlinesAbility to prepare basic financial and statistical reportsDemonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to build, maintain, and upgrade financial models utilizing complex actuarial conceptsFamiliarity and/or comfort with coding required Preferred: Medicare Supplement pricing experienceExperience with running SQL queries.Insurance Industry ExperienceALFA experience.About us:Since our start in 1902, Physicians Mutual Insurance Company has held to our founder’s promise — to provide protection to families when they need it most. In 1970, Physicians Life Insurance Company was founded and became a member of the Physicians Mutual family.  Today, we offer health, life and retirement products to millions of people from all walks of life. We’ve been here for them. Listening. Answering questions. Empowering them with the specialized guidance they need to make confident decisions about their insurance.  Over the years, our dedication to delivering on our promise has helped make us one of the nation’s leading health and life insurance providers. In fact, we are rated in the top 1% of insurance companies. We consistently maintain some of the highest financial strength ratings in the nation from independent insurance analysts, including A.M. Best Company and Weiss Ratings, ensuring we’ll be there for our policyowners and our employees far into the future.But the achievement we’re most proud of? We have a 95% customer approval rating – a true sign of a company dedicated to embodying its vision.     Job Requirements          Category          Corporate Actuarial / Finance          Job Type          Full-time          Travel

Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

CentralReach is the #1 provider of SaaS software solutions for autism and IDD care. Trusted by more than 150,000 users, we enable therapy providers, educators, and employers scale the way they deliver Applied Behavior Analysis and related therapies with innovative technology, market-leading industry expertise, and world-class customer satisfaction. To be successful as a CentralReach Product Owner, you must be data driven, proactive, positive and humble. While you will have many creative ideas for improving the product, you see yourself as a “synthesizer” of the ideas of your teammates and clients, focusing on soliciting, synthesizing, and prioritizing those ideas to create a great product. You display a passion for our products, compassion for the stakeholders of our products (clients as well as support, success, sales, QA and engineering teams) and a willingness to operate within the framework, structure, and processes utilized by the company in a positive, can do way. Key Accountabilities: Collaboration with engineers, client-facing teams and customers to deliver valuable insights to help our users on solving their most important challenge Lead iteratives on building analytic dashboards and data set development and managing their lifecycle Become a subject matter expert on the CR Enterprise product and manage internal customer inquiries Collaborate with Product Manager to prioritize roadmap Plan and prioritize product development and product feature backlog to support each sprint and release Partner with Engineering team on sprint planning and management Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of sprint and release goals Manage and refine epic/user stories, requirements, sketches, workflows, and risk factors including edge cases, and other potentially impacted functions Communicate progress to key stakeholders throughout the sprint and release Validate and accept user stories upon completion of Engineering and Quality Assurance Author release notes and educate internal teams on latest enhancements for each release Desired Skills & Experience: 5+ years of related work experience Experience working with data analytics product, preferably healthcare related Proficiency in BI reporting and visualization tools (e.g., Sisense, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) Experience working with Agile/Scrum/Kanban process Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to work closely with non-technical partners and clients to understand their needs Expert in understanding business needs, gather appropriate information, analyze data to identify root cause Outstanding problem solving skills and being flexible and creative in finding solutions for hard problems Being a self-starter, who takes the initiative to exceed goals, uses analytical abilities, and possesses the adaptability to change Excellent organizational and time management skills Strongly empathetic to customer needs and workflows Ability to troubleshoot technical issues Attention to detail      CentralReach was developed for Clinicians by Clinicians. The story of CentralReach begins in 2012 when the company’s founder, a practicing Board Certified Behavioral Analyst, decided there had to be a better way to manage her operations so she could spend more time on what mattered most — working with her clients and patients. To help ABA practices focus on what they do best, CentralReach launched the first iteration of its EMR and practice management platform.     Today, under the leadership of Chris Sullens, an award-winning CEO in the technology space, CentralReach is committed to their mission of providing cutting-edge technology and services to help clinicians and educators produce superior client and patient outcomes. Already a market leader, CentralReach is expected to grow exponentially through its four core tenets: hire and develop great people; build industry-leading products; provide exceptional service to customers and continuously invest in systems, processes and infrastructure.     We value our employees and offer a robust benefits package including health and dental, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage and a 401(k) matching. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, ongoing training, mentoring and career pathing to help you develop your career. We pride ourselves on our fun and energetic environment that also provides our employees with a meaningful way to make a difference by helping clinicians produce superior outcomes for children and adults with disabilities.     CentralReach will not contact you or schedule interviews via Facebook. Please note social media is a current sourcing tool for talent acquisition via LinkedIn, Instagram, FB and for our recent job fair through CR company marketing, but we have a direct link to our website where all viable jobs are listed and directly tracked to our company page.     #LI-REMOTE

Product Manager: Medical Esthetician and Product Sales Manager

column7: This game changing career will give you the opportunity to be challenged with pricing and actively managing our Medicare Supplement line of business for Physicians Mutual. You will get to initiate, organize, direct and analyze actuarial work. In this role you will develop actuarial assumptions as well as direct, develop and maintain product pricing, profit studies, reserves, rate filings and related procedures. Must be able to compile and evaluate statistical data. Must have advanced understanding of actuarial concepts and insurance knowledge and the ability to apply these concepts to the work. Continues to actively pursue actuarial exams, unless otherwise approved.Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or related discipline. Completion of ASA is required.Ability to apply standard mathematical computations to a variety of assigned work projectsStrong Excel experience for mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, etc.Ability to logically present voluminous data in a concise, understandable formatAbility to perform several projects while maintaining rigid deadlinesAbility to prepare basic financial and statistical reportsDemonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to build, maintain, and upgrade financial models utilizing complex actuarial conceptsFamiliarity and/or comfort with coding required Preferred: Medicare Supplement pricing experienceExperience with running SQL queries.Insurance Industry ExperienceALFA experience.About us:Since our start in 1902, Physicians Mutual Insurance Company has held to our founder’s promise — to provide protection to families when they need it most. In 1970, Physicians Life Insurance Company was founded and became a member of the Physicians Mutual family.  Today, we offer health, life and retirement products to millions of people from all walks of life. We’ve been here for them. Listening. Answering questions. Empowering them with the specialized guidance they need to make confident decisions about their insurance.  Over the years, our dedication to delivering on our promise has helped make us one of the nation’s leading health and life insurance providers. In fact, we are rated in the top 1% of insurance companies. We consistently maintain some of the highest financial strength ratings in the nation from independent insurance analysts, including A.M. Best Company and Weiss Ratings, ensuring we’ll be there for our policyowners and our employees far into the future.But the achievement we’re most proud of? We have a 95% customer approval rating – a true sign of a company dedicated to embodying its vision.     Job Requirements          Category          Corporate Actuarial / Finance          Job Type          Full-time          Travel

Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.   At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We’re not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.   As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.   Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities. The Role  We are looking for a product manager for Veeva Labs. Veeva Labs builds innovative applications for Veeva’s own use and for Veeva’s customers. When Veeva has a strategic need for an application better or different than what we see on the market, we work with Veeva’s executive leadership to build it. It’s a special opportunity to build products to the highest standards, with the rewards of building applications that are loved by their users. We also frequently pioneer new technologies and architectures, later used across Veeva. This role has a preference for candidates based in the Pacific or Mountain Time Zones. What You’ll DoDesign innovative product features across domains and business processesAuthor high-quality design specifications within an agile methodologyPrioritize feature development based on strategic initiatives, customer requirements, and internal technical needsInteract with customers, services, market owners, and sales to understand business needsInteract with engineering and QA teams to drive high-quality product feature implementationRequirements5+ years in a business analyst or product management roleAbility to work independently in a dynamic environment with little direct supervisionStrong analytic skills: able to develop and test hypotheses from user behavior and other dataStrong communication skills: written, verbal, and formal presentationTechnical skills to translate business requirements into terms that developers can understandPerks & BenefitsMedical, dental, vision, and basic life insuranceFlexible PTO and company paid holidaysRetirement programs1% charitable giving programCompensationBase pay: $100,000 – $150,000The salary range listed here has been provided to comply with local regulations and represents a potential base salary range for this role. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range above or below, depending on experience and location. We look at compensation for each individual and base our offer on your unique qualifications, experience, and expected contributions. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation in addition to base salary, such as variable bonus and/or stock bonus.   #LI-Remote     Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.     Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

Product Manager Who we are We’re doxy.me (doc-see-me), the world's most loved telemedicine solution, and we're on a mission to connect the world to the future of healthcare. We believe that cost and complexity should NEVER be a barrier to telemedicine. That’s why we have designed our platform to be simple and accessible. Since 2013, we’ve grown to more than 1 million users from 180+ countries and have clocked over 7 billion minutes of telemedicine sessions to date. Our goal is to deliver a world-class healthcare experience to every patient and healthcare professional on earth. You can help us get there by joining our team of innovators, dreamers, and doers. Who you are We’re seeking a Product Manager who thrives in an environment that offers challenging problems to solve, can drive product projects from concept to launch and brings high standards to developing product requirements that are informed by a combination of research, data and product intuition. What you'll do Work autonomously and be able to take ownership of product prioritization decisions Identify, define, build, launch, and iterate on features that add value for our customers Be detail-driven and have excellent problem-solving abilities Work closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to take product ideas from concept to launch Translate a larger strategic vision into a concrete, prioritized plan that can be executed to deliver an MVP and iterative improvements Apply a combination of qualitative and quantitative research, customer understanding, and product intuition to inform decisions and prioritization Facilitate clear communication and collaboration across all teams and stakeholders Your skills and qualifications You've delivered multiple products end to end Comfortable with ambiguity and breaking down complex problems Capable of synthesizing unstructured data and inputs to inform prioritization decisions Experience conducting interviews with customers to uncover product opportunities You drive to understand underlying problems, test assumptions and iterate on solutions Strong written and in-person communication skills; comfortable presenting in large groups Diligent with documenting and building shared understanding with all team members Takes initiative to drive projects forward within a fast-paced environment Experience with managing large cross-functional projects with technical depth What we can offer you We are committed to giving you the tools you need to do your best work. We will take care of the little things so you can do what you do best without having to worry about all of that other stuff. Here is a taste of what you can expect: A fun, flexible work environment (work from home or on location at one of our regional hubs) Competitive Salary Paid trainings and certifications Advancement opportunities in a growing company, Medical, Vision, and Dental insurance 401k match Unlimited PTO Our employees give us a 4.6 on Glassdoor. Interview Process 1st Stage - Screen with our internal recruiter 2nd Stage - Video call with our Head of Product 3rd Stage - Meet the Team 4th Stage - Leadership Interview Additional information Doxy.me tech stack Frontend: React, TypeScript, Playwright, WebRTC, Next.js, Nx.dev Backend: Nodejs, TypeScript, Jest, NestJS, Nx.dev Cloud: AWS 3rd party: Vonage, Pubnub, Segment, Twilio, Stripe Our products: Doxy.me: The simple, free, and secure telemedicine solution currently used by over 1,000,000 doctors worldwide and helping over 350,000 patients/day. dokbot.io: Patient-focused data collection for healthcare. adhere.ly: Providing healthcare practitioners with the tools to ensure patients complete their course of treatment Our team: technologists, academics, researchers, and innovators from all over the world. English is the language used in all internal communication. To ensure HIPAA compliance we perform background checks after extending a job offer

Seeking a Motivated Seller (Entry Level)Looking for a Product Specialist and Account Manager (Inside Sales)Bloomington, MNAbout the Position:At NA Trading and Technology, we want to coach you to greatness if you’re willing to learn. Your responsibilities begin by learning the features and benefits of our products as well as how to engage on the phone with intelligent business professionals in this 100+ year old industry. The goal is to become their supplier of choice for their most-used parts and supplies and have a continuous business relationship that grows your revenue and results in continuously increasing income.About Us:NA Trading and Technology provides high quality parts and supplies to businesses within the Office Automation and Office Technologies industries across the country. We’ve established relationships going back nearly 40 years because our customers find us to be the most reliable source of compatible parts and supplies in the industry. Unlike our competition, we focus only on the best value and are independently owned, which gives us a competitive advantage.Culture:We’re a small, independently owned, business so everyone’s roles are diverse. When help is needed, we’re here for you. We all work hard and take pride in our work so that we can enjoy the rewards that a successful business brings. We’re one of the smallest companies in MN to offer both profit sharing and a 401K, for example. We also enjoy the benefits of the occasional catered lunch or cookout (we have some excellent cooks here!), happy hours, free coffee and tea, and more.Career Development:The Product Specialist will initially focus on training and establishing their sales territory. We find that Product Specialists can double or triple sales by meeting in-person, therefore in the second year you will have the opportunity to grow your business with face-to-face meetings with targeted customers. If you enjoy travel you may also be invited to represent the company at industry events located at fun destinations (you may want to add a couple extra days for yourself.) As you become familiar with the industry, your input on new potential products will be requested by the Research and Development department so we can continue to support your customers for years to come.Required Skills:Self- Confidence when speaking on the phone and a clear and audible voiceIntermediate knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, and ExcelHigh School Diploma/ GEDPositive attitudeResilience in facing objectionsDesired Skills:4-year college degree (GPA 3.0 or higher) or relevant work experience (we recognize military training as work experience)Ability to work independentlyDetail-OrientedBenefits Basics:The sales territories all offer Base Pay + Commission + Bonuses (based on revenue goals). We offer health and dental insurance and life insurance plans, and after your first anniversary you will be enrolled in our 401K and profit-sharing plans. We offer paid time off and paid holidays.Current and past employees frequently comment:They feel supported by their coworkers and managersThey learn a lot about communications that they can use in both their professional and personal livesThey enjoy the relationships they form with their customersThey feel empowered to help their customersThey are better and stronger people because of their life experiences at NA Trading NA Trading and Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we recognize military service, so veterans are encouraged to apply.To apply please send your resume/cover letter to Amy Dills, Sales Manager at adills@natrading.com.
