Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Join Grayce and Ignite Change in Gaithersburg, Maryland! Are you a recent graduate ready to take your career to the next level? Grayce is here with immediate opportunities that could be the perfect fit for you! Job Position: Product Manager Location: Gaithersburg, Maryland Starting Salary: $52,500  We are Grayce, a well-established hire, train, deploy organization, and we are on a mission to drive change and transformation. Founded in 2012, our goal is to accelerate, support, and develop emerging talent, and we're currently seeking graduates who are eager to kickstart their careers. We're on the lookout for graduates with exceptional communication skills, a passion for proactivity, and a natural curiosity. We highly value resourceful problem solvers who embrace challenges head-on and consistently bring fresh perspectives to the table.  Why Grayce? Be part of our mission to nurture bright minds and shape them into future leaders and innovators in business change and transformation. As a Product Manager, you'll play a crucial role in our client's success by driving innovation and managing product development. Exciting Opportunities: Immerse yourself in the world of business transformation by working directly with our impressive client portfolio. You'll gain exposure to challenging projects, build a network of trusted contacts, and acquire the skills to thrive in change and transformation. Continuous Learning: Your journey begins with a comprehensive training program, but it doesn't stop there. You'll embark on a path of continuous learning, earning industry-accredited qualifications tailored to your skillset, including Agile Project Management and more. Mentoring and Coaching: Thrive under the guidance of experienced coaches and mentors. You'll be paired with a Grayce buddy who understands the ropes, offering support, insights, and sharing experiences to help you succeed. Inclusive Community: At Grayce, we value diversity and inclusion. Our community is built on an environment that respects your unique perspective. Top Clients: You'll have the opportunity to work with one of our prestigious customers across various industries, such as Financial Services, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Healthcare, Insurance, and Legal.  What makes a great Grayce Product Manager? 3.3/4 GPA or higher: A Scientific or Medical focused pathway would be beneficial, but we're totally open to graduates from all subjects. Right to Work in the US: Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor visas, so please make sure you have everything sorted before applying! Effective communication: Communication is key in change and transformation. We value those who can express themselves clearly, whether it's chatting with the team, updating stakeholders, or putting thoughts on paper. Being precise and persuasive with your words is one of your greatest tools. Excellent organizational and planning skills: Time management, task prioritization, and structured working are your bread and butter. You'll be the project-focused expert who keeps timelines and resources in check, ensuring everything runs like clockwork. Proactivity and Creativity: Creativity is essential for driving innovation. Product managers need to come up with new ideas and solutions to meet customer needs and stay ahead of the competition. Creativity enables them to think outside the box and develop novel features, products, and strategies. Adaptability: Markets, technologies, and customer preferences are constantly evolving. Creative product managers are better equipped to adapt to change, pivot when necessary, and seize new opportunities.  Why Work for Us? Starting Salary: $52,500, and it gets even better after your first year! PTO: You start off with 12 days, and it goes up by one day every year you're with us. Medical, Vision & Dental: We've got you covered. Grayce covers 75% of the Medical Bronze package and 50% of the Vision and Dental Silver Package. 401(k) Personal Pension: For every 1% you contribute, Grayce chips in 0.5% (with a max 7% employee contribution).  Join us and together, we'll shape a brighter future in Gaithersburg, Washington DC! Grayce: Igniting Careers, Transforming Futures! We are Human and we Care | We are Trusted and we Deliver Excellence | We are Changemakers and we Succeed Together  Please note that Grayce is unable to sponsor work visas for International applicants.

Job Summary/ Scope: The Product Manager is responsible for actively managing the end-to-end product strategy from product ideation (“sunrise”) through go to market and, when necessary, product discontinuation (“sunset”). In this role, you will use all available information and data to identify opportunities, create product strategies and proactively manage and update the 3 year innovation roadmap. The Product Manager will be tasked with analyzing and interpreting market trends and portfolio performance to inform future product development and improve productivity and inventory turns. You will take a leadership role in the optimization of the portfolio mix to balance topline and bottom-line goals for the brand.t This role is cross functional in nature requiring collaboration with multiple departments including, but not limited to: Sales, Product Development, Planning and Finance. Essential Job Duties:Proactively create new product strategies, manage and update the 3 year innovation roadmap based on consumer insights, industry trends, proprietary innovative technology, and competitive sales data to drive revenue and profitability.Understanding the Product specifications and options to influence the product development decisions.Uploads and manages product identity/specifications in Salsify and ensures brand price positioning guidelines are followed Collaborate with Product Development & Factories to ensure alignment and execution to innovation roadmap.Support the HOB in overseeing the S&OP process, ensuring tight collaboration between Sales, Marketing, and Supply Chain to ensure healthy inventory and delivery scorecards.Monthly review of all salsify data for updates.Manages the product ideation, feasibility, and development stages of the innovation process with minimal support from HOB.Manages consumer research projects with the Consumer Insights/Research team to identify and quantify white space opportunities and uncover unmet consumer needs to inform product development.Leverages Circana, CMI, and other data to provide informed direction to Product Development for the creation of new products and product linesManage new product timeline to ensure successful and timely launches iWork with global affiliates to support global product strategy as needed.Performs market analysis, competitive research, is aware of the latest market/industry trends, and conducts quarterly retail store visits across all channels of distribution to uncover and present business opportunities to the HOB and Product Org.Analyze monthly shipping reports and weekly POS data to understand the health of the business and provide actionable strategic recommendations to HOB.Track year 1 POS performance for all new innovation, providing insights to key stakeholders. With limited involvement of HOB, builds an action plan to ensure the long-term success of the product.Proactively analyzes the health of the overall business through a monthly shipping & POS tracker to provide strategic marketing recommendations (4Ps) based on observations.With limited support from the HOB, builds the recommendation for gross wholesale (inclusive of all delivery methods), retail and promotional pricing to deliver increased profitable sales that are competitively positioned with high perceived consumer value.Be the lead communicator in new item releases and running changes via Salsify.Be the lead in managing, acquiring and providing product samples for retailer meetings on programs that are in development.Partner with Sales and Supply Chain for inventory and forecasting needs to meet brand and retailer revenue projections.Monitor the portfolio’s health to provide recommendations to HOB on which items to discontinue and ideate liquidation strategies.Other duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in business or related field is required.4-7 years’ experience in product development/category management is ideal.At least 1-3 years supervisory experience is preferred.Must possess strong critical thinking and analytical problem-solving skills.Must possess a high degree of integrity, credibility, sense of urgency and common senseStrong negotiating skills.Must possess strong interpersonal skills and the ability to deliver oral presentations.Proficiency in using Microsoft Suite, Google Suite, and the Internet is required.Must possess strong time management skills and the ability to multitask.Strong organizational and project management skills to meet deadlines is essential. Working Conditions: Work is performed primarily indoors, although some outdoor tasks are required. Lighting is artificial. Equipment used includes standard office equipment i.e. computer, telephone, copy machine. Physical demands include standing, walking, sitting, use of both hands. Hours and days are primarily Monday through Friday with some evenings and weekends. Position requires close contact with Meyer employees and vendors. $92k to $100k DOE

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

Bellese Technologies is looking for someone with a passion for solving big problems in healthcare. We foster a learning environment that thrives on curiosity, innovation, and passion about improving healthcare in America. Our remote-first team is spread across 20+ states and leverages exceptional collaboration to amplify our strengths. We provide an environment focused around helping you achieve your goals. Because when you succeed, we all succeed.  This position is contingent upon contract award Responsibilities Sitting in the customer’s and user’s shoes: you seek to understand and empathize with the users and their goals – their problems are your problems Working with the development team to clarify requirements and help them understand the business side of the product Succinctly communicating or demonstrating issues to your team, and leading the thought process of your team to drive toward feasible, viable, and highly-usable solutions Creating user stories and acceptance criteria that clearly articulate requirements for each feature Translating ideas into actionable, testable solutions, and working with engineering teams to define and implement those solutions Verifying that the finished product meets the requirements and the needs of customers by conducting usability tests or reviewing customer feedback Prioritizing product backlog items based on business value, time needed to complete, and order in which they were created Communicating with stakeholders to ensure that everyone is on the same page regarding features, functionality, and deadlines Engaging and communicating with both technical and non-technical folks Communicating project status and roadblocks to other team members Working as part of an agile software development team - you’re a creative thinker and skilled communicator who thrives in cross-functional teams Facilitating meetings and preparing presentations to share ideas and findings Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports Measuring results: you define success through clear metrics so the customer can see what works and what doesn’t Qualifications Learning about and applying product and design thinking frameworks to problem-solving and managing the software development lifecycle Working with user research to identify current user experience issues, and driving measurable improvements Translating the HCD research findings and user needs into technical solutions, requirements, and user stories Managing a product backlog (Epics, Features, User Stories) in support of a strategic Product Roadmap Releasing and supporting software systems to healthcare providers All stages of the product development lifecycle - from research through design inception through implementation Organizing/obtaining feedback from stakeholders on completed work Bellese offers Three weeks paid leave Flexible Schedule and Remote-First culture $3000 annual education stipend Work from home setup including Macbook (possibly used/refurbished) Collaborative, learning environment Health insurance 401K Plan with Safe Harbor contribution   Other:  Executive Order requiring COVID safety protocols Bellese employees are Federal Workers and are subject to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, dated September 9, 2021 (published in the Federal Register on September 14, 2021, 86 FR 50985). The Product Owner is a crucial role on an application development team helping to transform a high-level vision into detailed functional requirements, create product user stories, and accept the completed deliver within a given iteration. That person is the primary contact responsible for ensuring the development team works on the tasks intended to address specific product scope and capabilities. The ideal candidate will have past or current Scrum Master responsibilities and experience with CCaaS; Amazon Connect, Twilio, or others. This is a remote position, must live in the United States.

CentralReach is the #1 provider of SaaS software solutions for autism and IDD care. Trusted by more than 150,000 users, we enable therapy providers, educators, and employers scale the way they deliver Applied Behavior Analysis and related therapies with innovative technology, market-leading industry expertise, and world-class customer satisfaction. To be successful as a CentralReach Product Owner, you must be data driven, proactive, positive and humble. While you will have many creative ideas for improving the product, you see yourself as a “synthesizer” of the ideas of your teammates and clients, focusing on soliciting, synthesizing, and prioritizing those ideas to create a great product. You display a passion for our products, compassion for the stakeholders of our products (clients as well as support, success, sales, QA and engineering teams) and a willingness to operate within the framework, structure, and processes utilized by the company in a positive, can do way. Key Accountabilities: Collaboration with engineers, client-facing teams and customers to deliver valuable insights to help our users on solving their most important challenge Lead iteratives on building analytic dashboards and data set development and managing their lifecycle Become a subject matter expert on the CR Enterprise product and manage internal customer inquiries Collaborate with Product Manager to prioritize roadmap Plan and prioritize product development and product feature backlog to support each sprint and release Partner with Engineering team on sprint planning and management Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of sprint and release goals Manage and refine epic/user stories, requirements, sketches, workflows, and risk factors including edge cases, and other potentially impacted functions Communicate progress to key stakeholders throughout the sprint and release Validate and accept user stories upon completion of Engineering and Quality Assurance Author release notes and educate internal teams on latest enhancements for each release Desired Skills & Experience: 5+ years of related work experience Experience working with data analytics product, preferably healthcare related Proficiency in BI reporting and visualization tools (e.g., Sisense, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) Experience working with Agile/Scrum/Kanban process Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to work closely with non-technical partners and clients to understand their needs Expert in understanding business needs, gather appropriate information, analyze data to identify root cause Outstanding problem solving skills and being flexible and creative in finding solutions for hard problems Being a self-starter, who takes the initiative to exceed goals, uses analytical abilities, and possesses the adaptability to change Excellent organizational and time management skills Strongly empathetic to customer needs and workflows Ability to troubleshoot technical issues Attention to detail      CentralReach was developed for Clinicians by Clinicians. The story of CentralReach begins in 2012 when the company’s founder, a practicing Board Certified Behavioral Analyst, decided there had to be a better way to manage her operations so she could spend more time on what mattered most — working with her clients and patients. To help ABA practices focus on what they do best, CentralReach launched the first iteration of its EMR and practice management platform.     Today, under the leadership of Chris Sullens, an award-winning CEO in the technology space, CentralReach is committed to their mission of providing cutting-edge technology and services to help clinicians and educators produce superior client and patient outcomes. Already a market leader, CentralReach is expected to grow exponentially through its four core tenets: hire and develop great people; build industry-leading products; provide exceptional service to customers and continuously invest in systems, processes and infrastructure.     We value our employees and offer a robust benefits package including health and dental, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage and a 401(k) matching. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, ongoing training, mentoring and career pathing to help you develop your career. We pride ourselves on our fun and energetic environment that also provides our employees with a meaningful way to make a difference by helping clinicians produce superior outcomes for children and adults with disabilities.     CentralReach will not contact you or schedule interviews via Facebook. Please note social media is a current sourcing tool for talent acquisition via LinkedIn, Instagram, FB and for our recent job fair through CR company marketing, but we have a direct link to our website where all viable jobs are listed and directly tracked to our company page.     #LI-REMOTE

Being a Product Support Specialist revolves around the creation and implementation of innovative support strategies to increase utilization of software product. Work with Clients to assist in resolving Customer Complaints by facilitating communications between clients and organization.Deliver Product Adoption support in terms of onboarding tools, training tools, and engagement monitoring. Develop use cases for new features and provides analysis of data that is useful for managing customer expectations. Ensure data analysis is accurate, complete and provides the story that is useful to managers using the system. Monitoring feedback loop in order to discern additional training requirements, or new features or defect resolutions are needed. This role is key in supporting product management and utilization of the software. The Product Support Specialist will develop strong relationships with Product managers, development team, and end users of the product. A Product Support Specialist will monitor client feedback daily to ensure issues are triaged and brought to resolution timely. The Product Support Specialist will understand metrics so that issues can be identified proactively based upon objective dashboard data. Coordinate with cross-functional internal teams, such as the Operations and client’s assigned Reimbursement Success Manager to optimize system resources for managing clients. The purpose of your role is to ensure product features are utilized and provide maximum efficiency. The Product Support Specialist will ensure that data presented to internal and external users are accurate and complete. RequirementsCreate and/or maintain training assets such as quick start guides, FAQ’s, Job aids and tool tips.Provide training on new features for a train the trainer approach.Proofread and audit training material generated.Monitor utilization of new features, and build out use cases for optimal utilization.End-to-end business - Improve and maintain individual KPIs to the best of standards and client issue tracker, CIT to least impact, to maintain overall client health score, CHS at the green (> 90), and super green per Prochant standards. Provide thought leadership and consulting to drive business and reengineering goalsDrive service delivery efficiency through Prochant Tools & platforms. Conduit opportunities to use/better our product, automation, featuresReview all feedback tickets to ensure the information is complete and concise. Reproduce as appropriate. This triage will ensure that appropriate resources are working on the issue. Issues could be training, feature enhancement or defect, all of which may be routed to different people.Leverage product, tools, automation, and next practices to recommend efficiency, FTEs savings, cost to collect, and rev yield Use data, visualization, insights, research, analogies, best practices, storyboard, and cultural sensitization to communicate opportunities and solutions.Drive collaboration in tasks, projects, response times, & outcomes that are critical to the relationship. Escalate proactively on non-performing KPIsBuild a trusting relationship by being available, delivering on promises, and transparent communication such as product feature adoption, without drifting away from established scope, principles & standards Support the global team in deploying changes through training, competency building, FAQ’s, Job Aids, & QA monitoring Be a revenue augmenter for our clients, a person through which Prochant services are perceived. Learn to exhibit awareness of our line of services, products, and solutions to upsell whenever pain-opportunity fitment is sensed Build systems (people, process and technology, and ecosystem) to drive scale Ability to connect with internal & stakeholders through socialization Ability to travel up to 25%  Benefits Prochant offers some of the best benefits in the industry! We take great care of our employees. Prochant’s Fortune 500 level benefits package includes:Health InsuranceGap InsuranceDental InsuranceVision InsuranceShort Term / Long Term Disability (company paid)Term Life Insurance (company paid, employee can elect additional)Full suite of supplemental insurance plans, including: Disability Income, Level Term Life, Accident Insurance, & Critical Illness InsuranceFloating holidays and paid time off401K with company match

Role and Responsibilities Verifies in route; quantities, quality, condition and placement of the delivered newspaper, fill records and reports. Sort data into predetermined sequence and groups. Keep daily and weekly records of routes verified. The verifier will receive daily instructions on route(s) to check and / or special assignments i.e.; hot Stop checks, special paper deliveries, and paper pickup on trouble area(s) The verifier will complete the daily verifier’s report form and will enter the proper information by providing an end of day summary. The verifier will be responsible for the equipment or materials furnished by the company as GPS radios and route lists or other entrusted items. Qualifications and Education Requirements High school diploma or equivalent Basic computer skills (email, sending attachments, Microsoft Office including Word and Excel) Reliable vehicle with your own auto insurance (proof required) Proof of employment eligibility to work in the United States Pass a criminal background check Valid driver license with a copy of your DMV report Must be punctual, well groomed and professional conduct are all preferred

Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Product Manager: General Line Product Manager specializing in Construction Metal Sales 1-3 years experience required
column7: Boise Cascade Company has been in the business of manufacturing wood products and distributing building materials for over half a century. We are one of the largest producers of engineered wood products and plywood in North America and a leading U.S. wholesale distributor of building materials. Because our business is built on relationships, our associates are critical to our success. We are committed to investing in them and that is why we offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to have a positive impact on all areas on your life – from health and well-being, career, and community, to financial security and personal safety, with many benefits beginning on your first day of employment. Please review the responsibilities and needed qualifications below and apply today! Boise Cascade has an exciting opening for a General Line Product Manager! Please review the responsibilities and needed qualifications below and apply today! Responsibilities General Line Product Manager of Construction Metals will purchase, price, and market a group of general line products for warehouse and customer sales. General Line Product Manager develops and implements sales strategies, new products, promotions, and conducts sales presentations on assigned general line products. General Line Product Manager will monitor and maintain acceptable inventory levels, turnover, and margins to maximize branch profitability. Solicits direct and warehouse sales on all general line products. Work closely with location manager or location sales manager in promotion of assigned and new products. Maintain direct control over replenishment, pricing and inventory of assigned products. General Line Product Managers change prices as necessary and maintain catalogue price pages. Develop annual marketing plan incorporating vendor, division and product promotions. Maintain technical product knowledge. General Line Product Managers determine product market potential. Identify and evaluate competitive products, new markets, new product opportunities, and competitors. Work closely with division merchandising in selection of suppliers. Maintain customer relationships, quote prices, sell additional products. Assist operations manager in warehousing assigned products. Make presentations at dealers’ meetings, sales meetings, builder shows, etc. Demonstrate strong commitment to safety, quality, environmental awareness, and continuous process improvement. Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: College Degree or equivalent work experience in related job function. Working conditions are an office environment with minimal physical exertion. Preferred Qualifications: Construction Metal Sales and Effective communication skills. Requires proficiency in utilizing computer software applications necessary for performing job responsibilities. Typically more than seven (7) years in building products industry or general line sales. Our BenefitsMedical + Dental + VisionFlexible Spending Accounts + HRA401(k) Retirement SavingsAnnual IncentivesPaid Time Off (20/yr) and holidays (10/yr)Paid Parental Leave Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

There will be other duties including handling incoming phone calls and occasional retail.Employer expectations in staff:Outcome-oriented -- results-focusedPeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeResponsibilitiesproduce high quality consistent imagesupload photos to the site and provide product descriptions as neededability to create lifestyle photos to showcase high end productsQualificationsphoto editing experienceProficiency in digital photography softwareA keen eye for composition, color and detailstrong typing skillsWe are looking forward to hearing from you.Job Types: Part-time, Full-timePay: $15.00 - $17.00 per hourBenefits:Employee discountFlexible schedulePaid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftSupplemental pay types:Bonus opportunitiesCOVID-19 considerations:We require all customers to wear masks and ask that employees not come to work if showing any symptoms potentially COVID relatedEducation:High school or equivalent (Required)Experience:Photography: 1 year (Preferred)Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: In person

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

About the role As an Associate Product Manager you will work join our Product team to help ensure that we are able to continuously build world-class products. Your duties will include analyzing consumer behavior and industry trends, evaluating consumer feedback on our products, and finding solutions for product defects. Location Remote (based in India) What you will do You will closely work with one or more product managers and support them in a variety of product initiatives ranging from market and customer research to product launch and testing You will help prepare project status and risk management reports You will also work on training internal departments on new product features and providing support to customers when needed Prior experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, business management, marketing, or a related field 1-2 years of experience in a similar role would be advantageous Experience in gathering and interpreting qualitative product data and consumer feedback An understanding of product sprints, PRDs and basic technology frameworks Background in Data Analytics is a strong plus Experience designing prototypes in HTML CSS or using platforms such as Figma Qualities that we look for Strong communication skills - including the ability to listen to the needs of others and comprehend complex matters, articulate issues in a clear and concise manner, and present effectively in both oral and written presentations to all levels in the organization. You get stuff done. You have a strong bias to action and will roll your sleeves up and get things done when needed Excellent attention to detail; you believe anything worth doing must be done right Willingness and ability to work independently, think creatively, and ability to pivot depending on changing priorities and deadlines Affinity for a high-performance, fast-paced, and project-oriented work environment You are a self-starter who excels at learning new processes and business functions You are highly analytical and are comfortable working with data

LOCATION: Columbus, Ohio POSITION TYPE: 1 year contract POSITION TERM: Work remotely, but have availability for hybrid work depending on the needs of the Client  Candidate local to Columbus, Ohio area preferred  The primary responsibility of the Project Manager/Product Owner is to lead the delivery and implementation of a software application, coordinating the project activities with diverse groups, including business users, external users, project stakeholders, and external vendors. The Project Manager must have a Product Owner mindset to ensure that the project is completed on schedule and that the final product meets the business, technical, and established quality requirements.  Manages, coordinates, and establishes priorities over the complete lifecycle of the project, including the planning, design, programming, testing, and implementation of the business solutions designed to meet requirements of the business users and stakeholders. Coordinates the project plan to define major tasks and milestones, based on scope, resources, budget, and personnel. Develop estimates for enhancement or new development efforts in planning, analysis, design, construction, testing, and implementation. Identify, manage, and report program risk, and develop risk mitigation strategies. SKILLS: Experience as a Project Manager, Program Manager or Product Owner, including using project management and agile development tools Required 8  Experience with full lifecycle implementation projects from requirements definition through implementation Required 4  Documented experience in vendor management and the implementation of third-party applications Required  Demonstrated leadership ability in leading teams of stakeholders, business analysts, developers, etc. Required

Overview:   What We Do We calm the confusion of IT by guiding the connection between people and technology. If a customer is looking for a better way to manage their warehouse inventory, equip their workforce, or secure their data, we make it happen. All it takes is finding the right combination of tech hardware, software, cloud solutions, and support services. That’s what we do. We’re the IT Department’s IT Department. Who We Are Our team is made stronger by a multitude of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. It’s what makes Connection unique—what drives us to innovate and create technology solutions that stand apart from the crowd. We’d love for you to be a part of that fabric, to share your ideas and experiences with a team that thrives on fresh thinking, creativity, and helping others. Why You Should Join Us   You’ll find supportive teammates and a rewarding career at Connection—plus great benefits. We take pride in supporting employees with a total rewards package that provides financial, emotional, and physical resources for you and your family. Our compensation, 401k plans, medical insurance, and other benefits are progressive and competitive. We value the importance of our employees’ emotional wellbeing. To support employees, we provide free therapy visits, mental health coaching and tools, and meditation resources. You’ll also enjoy a generous paid time off package that includes not only vacation and sick time, but also Wellness and Volunteer Time Off days.  Responsibilities:     Working under general supervision of the Alliance Manager or Product Line Manager, selecting from a variety of established procedures to accomplish assigned duties and responsibilities, the Product Management Coordinator works with the Product Management (PM) team to support the programmatic processes associated with the execution of Connection's partner program and/ or product category initiatives.Coordinate schedule, cross-department action items, partner/ product category assets, collateral, signage and promotional items required for co-branded partner/ Connection events, weekly solution showcase events and customer events.  Verify, manage and process monthly invoices, check requests and purchase orders for all partner program/ assigned product category elements.Support sales incentive programs to drive strategic partner program/ product category initiatives.Collect, archive and communicate applicable proof of performance elements to ensure they are in accordance with rate card criteria, audit standards and partner requirements.Assist PM with the evaluation of program objectives by gathering sales and marketing data sets to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaign strategies.Source relevant partner/ product category content to create organic posts designed to support partner/ product category program growth objectives. Post content on internal collaboration platforms and company website category pages, brand stores, solution/ service centers and segment showcase pages/ modules. Min: USD $21.63/Hr. Max: USD $27.04/Hr. Qualifications:     Because of the possibility for fraudulent job postings on many popular job boards, please be advised that Connection will never offer a position of employment without a complete interview process and communication with a “live person.”  Functional understanding of marketing to include marketing strategies employed to highlight company recognition and product/ service awarenessCustomer oriented with ability to listen to and anticipate needs of the customerAnalytical with ability to draw conclusions from data, systematic and rationalOrganized state of mind with ability to document activities, anticipate problems, plan schedules and monitor performance according to priorities and deadlinesArticulate with ability to express oneself clearly and professionally in written and oral communicationInterpersonal skills with ability to work well with all levels of the organizationDetail oriented with item by item focus, meticulous attention to detail with ability to proofread for accuracyInterpersonal skills with ability to work well with all levels of the organizationJudgment with ability to formulate opinions, compare and decide with good senseGood listening skills with ability to receive information completely and understand what is being said

Overview:   ST Engineering iDirect is a global leader in satellite communications (satcom) providing technology and solutions that enable its customers to expand their business, differentiate their services and optimize their satcom networks. Our business provides innovation focused on solving satellite’s most critical economic and technology challenges, and expands a shared commitment to shaping the future of how the world connects. With your talent and energy paired with our vision and technical leadership, the most fulfilling work of your career is waiting for you at ST Engineering iDirect…the sky is truly the limit! We are seeking a highly motivate Product Owner with a strong background in Product Development Process who loves to collaborates with different teams to define the sprints and ensure timely-complete-quality delivery of the product. Responsibilities:  Work with Product Manager(s) and customers to understand and transforms the strategic vision of the product into deliverable iterations for their respective product teams. Prioritize work based on stakeholder needs Maintain the conceptual and technical integrity of the product’s features Develop subject matter expertise related to the products. Play a pivotal part in articulating the value of products to engineers and analysts Develop deep understanding of the industry’s megatrends and current technical situation to drive strategic roadmaps and measurable value creation Serve as sole interface with scrum/project team(s) by working with key project stakeholders and consolidating, validating and filtering requests for new requirements Identify, manage and escalate issues/obstacles to the delivery the defined product Responsible for delivering finished product (including documentation, adequate testing, appropriate functional and performance capabilities) Building a relationship with the teams based on trust and mutual respect Being able to listen, to show empathy, but also be decisive and be able to communicate clear and concise Qualifications:   Education: • Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience in a related career field.  Travel Requirements: 10% or less required  Required Qualifications: Experience in networking and telecommunications.- 1-3 years ideally Product or service development process/management experience . - 2+ years Ability to lead teams and drive projects to successful outcomes. Ideal candidate will be either –   A product owner who understands the principals of data generation and transfer, with background in wifi/telecoms (is a plus). Or    A business analyst - with IT background, or understanding of networking principals, Or    A business analyst with engineering background, Or    A solutions architect who would like to explore a new career path, Or    A scrum Master.  Preferred Qualifications:  Experience within software engineering, especially developing with infrastructure as code. Must be able to understand the technical aspect of the product. Experience in satellite communication is a plus Demonstrates excellent collaboration and communication skills across a broad set of users or stakeholders  Previous experience as a product owner  Proven experience in setting direction for technology teams, prioritizing development activities, and driving new product development investments in an organization using Agile methodologies. Agile certification is a plus.   #LI-PS1

Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

This game changing career will give you the opportunity to be challenged with pricing and actively managing our Medicare Supplement line of business for Physicians Mutual. You will get to initiate, organize, direct and analyze actuarial work. In this role you will develop actuarial assumptions as well as direct, develop and maintain product pricing, profit studies, reserves, rate filings and related procedures. Must be able to compile and evaluate statistical data. Must have advanced understanding of actuarial concepts and insurance knowledge and the ability to apply these concepts to the work. Continues to actively pursue actuarial exams, unless otherwise approved.Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or related discipline. Completion of ASA is required.Ability to apply standard mathematical computations to a variety of assigned work projectsStrong Excel experience for mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, etc.Ability to logically present voluminous data in a concise, understandable formatAbility to perform several projects while maintaining rigid deadlinesAbility to prepare basic financial and statistical reportsDemonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to build, maintain, and upgrade financial models utilizing complex actuarial conceptsFamiliarity and/or comfort with coding required Preferred: Medicare Supplement pricing experienceExperience with running SQL queries.Insurance Industry ExperienceALFA experience.About us:Since our start in 1902, Physicians Mutual Insurance Company has held to our founder’s promise — to provide protection to families when they need it most. In 1970, Physicians Life Insurance Company was founded and became a member of the Physicians Mutual family.  Today, we offer health, life and retirement products to millions of people from all walks of life. We’ve been here for them. Listening. Answering questions. Empowering them with the specialized guidance they need to make confident decisions about their insurance.  Over the years, our dedication to delivering on our promise has helped make us one of the nation’s leading health and life insurance providers. In fact, we are rated in the top 1% of insurance companies. We consistently maintain some of the highest financial strength ratings in the nation from independent insurance analysts, including A.M. Best Company and Weiss Ratings, ensuring we’ll be there for our policyowners and our employees far into the future.But the achievement we’re most proud of? We have a 95% customer approval rating – a true sign of a company dedicated to embodying its vision.     Job Requirements          Category          Corporate Actuarial / Finance          Job Type          Full-time          Travel

Rapsodo Inc. is a sports analytics company that uses computer vision and machine learning to help all athletes maximize their performance. Our proprietary technology applications range from helping PGA Tour golfers optimize their launch conditions to allowing MLB pitchers to increase the efficiency of their breaking balls. Current partners include all 30 MLB teams, MLB, USA Baseball, Golf Digest, PGA of America, and over 1000 NCAA athletic departments. Rapsodo is seeking an Associate Product Manager to continue driving growth and innovation within its successful line of baseball and softball technology products. This role is a key contributor within the Diamond Sports team and requires a strong focus on identifying critical customer needs, translating those into product requirements and partnering cross-functionally to make those products a reality. The Associate Product Manager will be highly focused on the customer experience and will assist in the complete product life cycle to ensure ongoing customer engagement, satisfaction and attainment of business goals. Duties and Responsibilities: Assist the Product Manager within the various components of the product lifecycle processes for the assigned category; Including product research, market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development, requirements development, and product/feature launch Based on deep understanding of customer needs, translate product strategy into detailed requirements for concepting and final product development by engineering teams Work closely with PM to help build product strategy documents that describe business cases, high-level use cases, technical requirements, revenue, and ROI Collaborate closely with engineering, production, marketing, and sales teams on the development, QA, and release of products and balance of resources to ensure success for the entire organization Provide subject matter expertise and support as necessary to key internal partners (Marketing, Sales/Account Management, Customer Care) Develop a deep understanding of key business metrics to offer data-driven insights about what new products or features have a meaningful impact on customer engagement and lifetime value Partner internally in developing strategies to positively impact customer retention and engagement Champion product quality and customer satisfaction for product lines under management Requirements Skills & QualificationsA bachelor’s degree 1-2 years of work experience in a product management role Strong project and timeline management skills Prior experience with technology products and software as a service (SaaS) business models preferred Passionate about the customer experience and satisfaction Excellent written and verbal communication skills Self-starter who can prioritize work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision Great interpersonal, problem-solving, analytical, and research skills Strong time-management skills and ability to adhere to schedules Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and all current MS operating systems Experience with Jira/Confluence or similar project management tools preferred Passion and prior involvement with baseball and/or softball is a bonus For additional information about Rapsodo Inc., please visit our website at www.rapsodo.com.

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

Bellese Technologies is looking for someone with a passion for solving big problems in healthcare. We foster a learning environment that thrives on curiosity, innovation, and passion about improving healthcare in America. Our remote-first team is spread across 20+ states and leverages exceptional collaboration to amplify our strengths. We provide an environment focused around helping you achieve your goals. Because when you succeed, we all succeed.  This position is contingent upon contract award Responsibilities Sitting in the customer’s and user’s shoes: you seek to understand and empathize with the users and their goals – their problems are your problems Working with the development team to clarify requirements and help them understand the business side of the product Succinctly communicating or demonstrating issues to your team, and leading the thought process of your team to drive toward feasible, viable, and highly-usable solutions Creating user stories and acceptance criteria that clearly articulate requirements for each feature Translating ideas into actionable, testable solutions, and working with engineering teams to define and implement those solutions Verifying that the finished product meets the requirements and the needs of customers by conducting usability tests or reviewing customer feedback Prioritizing product backlog items based on business value, time needed to complete, and order in which they were created Communicating with stakeholders to ensure that everyone is on the same page regarding features, functionality, and deadlines Engaging and communicating with both technical and non-technical folks Communicating project status and roadblocks to other team members Working as part of an agile software development team - you’re a creative thinker and skilled communicator who thrives in cross-functional teams Facilitating meetings and preparing presentations to share ideas and findings Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports Measuring results: you define success through clear metrics so the customer can see what works and what doesn’t Qualifications Learning about and applying product and design thinking frameworks to problem-solving and managing the software development lifecycle Working with user research to identify current user experience issues, and driving measurable improvements Translating the HCD research findings and user needs into technical solutions, requirements, and user stories Managing a product backlog (Epics, Features, User Stories) in support of a strategic Product Roadmap Releasing and supporting software systems to healthcare providers All stages of the product development lifecycle - from research through design inception through implementation Organizing/obtaining feedback from stakeholders on completed work Bellese offers Three weeks paid leave Flexible Schedule and Remote-First culture $3000 annual education stipend Work from home setup including Macbook (possibly used/refurbished) Collaborative, learning environment Health insurance 401K Plan with Safe Harbor contribution   Other:  Executive Order requiring COVID safety protocols Bellese employees are Federal Workers and are subject to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, dated September 9, 2021 (published in the Federal Register on September 14, 2021, 86 FR 50985). As condition of employment, employees will need to provide either: a: proof of completed COVID vaccinations OR b: have an approved medical or religious exemption and proof of weekly COVID testing.  U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Over the years, our dedication to delivering on our promise has helped make us one of the nation’s leading health and life insurance providers. In fact, we are rated in the top 1% of insurance companies. We consistently maintain some of the highest financial strength ratings in the nation from independent insurance analysts, including A.M. Best Company and Weiss Ratings, ensuring we’ll be there for our policyowners and our employees far into the future.But the achievement we’re most proud of? We have a 95% customer approval rating – a true sign of a company dedicated to embodying its vision.     Job Requirements          Category          Corporate Actuarial / Finance          Job Type          Full-time          Travel
