Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Overview:   WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.  AMD together we advance_  Responsibilities:   The Role:   This is an engineering management position responsible for a product test team. Manages and controls activities in multi-functional areas of the team. Team activities ensure overall compatibility, compliance, and test coverage of AMD microprocessors from pre-silicon planning through high volume manufacturing by designing, developing, and modifying product specific test hardware, software and diagnostics. Team correlates the test solution to lab/manufacturing/customer platforms to validate product design, fabrication process, packaging technology, and manufacturing robustness to product specifications. Acts as liaison with internal customers/partners and vendors.  The Person:  Progressive experience in product development, preferably in semiconductors. Extensive experience managing projects. Experience managing a team. Experience with developing tests, patterns/vectors, timing, and diagnostics on Automated Test Equipment Experience in XP, AGILE, Scrum, or Kanban as Scrum Master or Product Owner. Statistical analysis experience to determine population mean and outliers. Pareto analysis experience to drive a debug process. Good communication skills and the ability to work with geographically distributed product engineering teams. Experience presenting to Director level management internally. Key Responsibilities: Receives assignments in the form of objectives with goals and the process by which to meet those goals. Recommends changes to unit or sub-unit policies. Communicate status to management or executive staff. Influences technical decisions that have an impact on final product. Champions important technical decisions. Management reviews work to measure meeting of objectives. Provides direct supervision to professional individual contributors and/or skilled support individual contributors (i.e. technicians, support personnel). Provides direction to individual contributors according to established policies and management guidance. Administers company policies that directly affect subordinate employees. Runs weekly 1:1 with individual contributors providing feedback and coaching. Sets clear team goals and responsibilities. Acts as advisor to a unit or sub-units and may become actively involved as required to meet schedules and resolve problems. Identifies talent gaps, recruiting diverse candidates internally and externally. Develop and maintain effective working relationship with other departments. Collaborate on or assume responsibility for a specific project, or a definable portion of a larger project or process. Other duties as necessary. Preferred Skills: Courses or certifications in project management (PMI, LSS, AGILE) Experience with revision control (GIT, SVN, CVS, RCS or similar). Debug experience in hardware, software, device, and/or manufacturing domains. Experience with C++, Java, C, or C#. Experience with a scripting language (Perl, Ruby, shell script, or similar). Experience with logic analyzers, voltmeters, oscilloscopes, and other debug tools. Experience with Linux or Unix Operating Systems. Experience with Microsoft standard apps (i.e. Office), Microsoft Windows Operating Systems. Academic Credentials:   Candidates will have a B.S. or M.S. degree in Electric Engineering, Computer Science, or similar field.  Location:    Austin, TX  #LI-AP3  #LI-HYBRID  Qualifications:     At AMD, your base pay is one part of your total rewards package. Your base pay will depend on where your skills, qualifications, experience, and location fit into the hiring range for the position. You may be eligible for incentives based upon your role such as either an annual bonus or sales incentive. Many AMD employees have the opportunity to own shares of AMD stock, as well as a discount when purchasing AMD stock if voluntarily participating in AMD’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also be eligible for competitive benefits described in more detail here.  AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

Product Manager: Small Form Factor Product Line Affordability Operations Program Manager 1
column7: Job Description  Because of the need for consistent, in-person collaboration and/or the requirement to perform all work onsite due to the nature of this particular role, it will be performed full-time on site. This means work will be conducted on location at a BAE Systems facility 100% of the time.  You don’t see it, but it’s there. Our employees work on the world’s most advanced electronics – from saving emissions in the City of Lights to powering the Mars Rover to protecting the F-35 fighter jet. At Electronic Systems, you’ll be among the brightest minds, working on the aerospace and defense industry’s most difficult problems. Drawing strength from our differences, we’re innovating for the future. And you can, too.  Our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first – exemplified by our missions: “We Protect Those Who Protect Us®” and “We Innovate For Those Who Move The WorldTM.” Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with us.  The SFFS Product Line Operations Program Manager 1 will support the SFFS Product Line comprised of a portfolio of production, developmental and sustainment programs focusing on a coordinated material strategy.  Multiple Production Programs working towards higher monthly production rates.  Programs with content (Engineering & Manufacturing) in Wayne NJ, Merrimack NH, and Nashua NH. Coordination of material in support of factory builds with Supply Chain. Coordination of Manufacturing non-recurring Engineering (NRE) by factories as required. Forecasting Manufacturing and Material requirements with Supply Chain and Factories. Defect/Cost/Cycle Time analysis and reduction. Support the Program Affordability effort. Cost Account Management (CAM); likely Material CAM working in collaboration with the SFFS Program Material Manager and Subcontract Program Manager. Seeking applicant with advanced Manufacturing management, Program or project management, Affordability, CAM, and/or supply chain experience. Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires US citizenship status Required Education, Experience, & Skills Technical background preferred Excellent communications skills (verbal & written). Supply Chain experience/knowledge. Cost Account Management (CAM) experience. Manufacturing and Supply defect data mining and analysis experience. Leadership experience; Factory facing and Program facing Experience Supporting Bid and Proposal Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills Current Secret Security clearance preferred. Technical background preferred (Engineering, Manufacturing, etc.) PMP and advanced degrees available. Supply Chain/Material Procurement experience/background. Pay Information Full-Time Salary Range: $89650 - $152460  Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.   Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. About BAE Systems Electronic Systems  BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.  Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:  At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

AMD together we advance_  Responsibilities:   THE ROLE:   The FTO Product Owner is responsible for the Product Process Plan of Record, engineering wafer delivery and Product optimization from a Power/Performance/Device, Area, Yield and Reliability prospective. The Engineer acts has a focal point in interacting with foundry technical teams, both internally and externally, to identify, root cause, and implement corrective action opportunities. The Product Owner serves as technical interface to internal cross functional teams (Product Engineering, Business, Units, Design, Supply Chain…),  THE PERSON:   Technology expertise, data analysis, leadership and project management are key qualities to be able to influence both Foundries and AMD internal/external customers, making sure the product plan supports customer requirements.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Set expectations for Foundry capability and drive the Foundry to meet the product requirements Optimize process/targeting and monitor process targeting for yield/performance Run models to find optimum wafer layout and identify cost saving opportunities Provide inputs for accurate Yield forecast Define sample wafer plan to support sample planning and track wafers for on time to support product milestones Feedback reliability observations to the Foundry and drive process improvements as needed End to end development for Semi-Custom product from pre silicon to high volume sustaining Technical interface with internal functional teams /external customers Accountable for managing the Foundry technology through the different phases of the product technologyPREFERRED EXPERIENCE: Requires demonstrated technical expertise in the productization of advanced technologies. Strong technical program management skills. Excellent written/verbal communication and presentations skills. Strong attention to details and an ability to learn on the job. Data analysis skills is an asset ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS: A technology related Master's degree plus related experience preferred (process technology and/or product development), or equivalent combination of training and experience. An advanced degree may reduce the preferred experience requirement. LOCATION: Austin, TX #LI-TW2 #HYBRID Qualifications:     At AMD, your base pay is one part of your total rewards package. Your Blood. Your Hospital. Your Neighbors.Have you been looking for purposeful work that contributes to a lifesaving mission? Pack with a purpose at LifeServe. We are currently looking for a Product Management Technician to join our team.PRODUCT MANAGEMENT TECHNICIANThrough the selfless giving of volunteer blood donors, LifeServe Blood Center is able to serve more than 120 hospitals across Iowa, Nebraska and South Dakota by providing access to a safe, quality blood supply for hospital patients in their critical time of need. LifeServe strives to provide the right product to the right patient at the right time by maintaining a stable, quality blood supply for the community. This is where YOU come in - We're looking for a Product Management Technician to join our amazing lifesaving team.As a Product Management Technician, you will be responsible for accurately packing orders in a timely manner. You will provide superior customer service primarily through phone work to other blood centers and hospitals. Product Management Technicians are responsible for blood inventory management, and ensuring minimum waste occurs. One of the most important duties of a Product Management Technician is to act as the final checkpoint for quality control, ensuring blood products are accurately and safely packaged before being sent to our hospital partners to be used in lifesaving blood transfusions and other medical procedures.SHIFT2p-10:30p Monday through FridayCOMPENSATIONWages starting around $16-$17/hour. Time worked after 6p qualifies for shift differential.WHO WE’RE LOOKING FORYou enjoy performing a wide variety of detailed and sequential tasks, according to standard operating procedures, resulting in the right products getting to the right place at the right time. You thrive in a highly regulated and process-driven environment. You love to stay busy and are seeking a high-volume, fast-paced work environment. You are able to pivot when needed, yet still manage to see all tasks through to completion. You are someone who embraces doing it right the first time and making positive connections with other people. You want to use your creativity to problem-solve and work through logistic issues that arise from distributing products all over the U.S.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESPerform distribution procedures according to established policy and standard operating procedures.            Labeling of product.Running quality control reports.Packing and shipping of red blood cells and platelet products.Irradiation of products.Documentation review.Initiating returns.Identify, troubleshoot and document problems that may influence the quality or completion of shipping and component manufacturing.Perform data entry and navigation within multiple computer programs.Maintain a safe and clean workplace that meets regulatory and LifeServe expectations.Maintain confidentiality of LifeServe Blood Center donor, team member, financial and proprietary records and information at all times.WHAT YOU NEED TO BE CONSIDEREDHigh school diploma or equivalent is required.Associate degree or higher preferred.WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER BEING A LIFESAVERWe are an industry leader and just celebrated our 75th year of operation.We are the 12th largest supplier of blood in the nation.We are a growth-oriented organization and added three new facilities in 2022.We were a 2023 Des Moines CityView Best Non-Profit runner-up.HOW LIFESERVE WILL SERVE YOUElected benefits: coverage starts the first of the month after your start date. Choose from competitively priced healthcare, dental, and vision plans. Enroll in supplemental accident or critical illness insurance.Peace of mind: on day 1, life insurance (1.5x annual salary), short-term disability (wait time only 7 days), and long-term disability are provided at no additional cost to you!Additional coverage: elect additional life insurance for yourself, spouse, or dependent child (up to age 26)Work-life balance: full-time team members accrue around 27 days of PTO per year. Part-time team members can earn PTO too!Involvement: additional chances to earn PTO through hosting blood drives, or recruiting a first-time or lapsed donor to give bloodWellness: holistic program to earn points, and win prizes on a monthly/quarterly basisOur current East Village location puts you within walking distance to great restaurants and coffee, and community spaces.A brand-new sustainably built facility in Johnston, coming in early 2024, with employee and community spaces, and easy interstate access. Offers of employment are contingent on the successful completion of pre-employment, post-offer drug testing and background checks.LifeServe Blood Center is fully committed to equal employment opportunity. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation due to a disability at any stage of the employment application process should contact us at careers@lifeservebloodcenter.org. Location: LifeServe Blood Center · Distribution  Schedule: Full Time, Evening Shift, 2:00p-10:30p Mon-Fri

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

Bellese Technologies is looking for someone with a passion for solving big problems in healthcare. We foster a learning environment that thrives on curiosity, innovation, and passion about improving healthcare in America. Our remote-first team is spread across 20+ states and leverages exceptional collaboration to amplify our strengths. We provide an environment focused around helping you achieve your goals. Because when you succeed, we all succeed.  This position is contingent upon contract award Responsibilities Sitting in the customer’s and user’s shoes: you seek to understand and empathize with the users and their goals – their problems are your problems Working with the development team to clarify requirements and help them understand the business side of the product Succinctly communicating or demonstrating issues to your team, and leading the thought process of your team to drive toward feasible, viable, and highly-usable solutions Creating user stories and acceptance criteria that clearly articulate requirements for each feature Translating ideas into actionable, testable solutions, and working with engineering teams to define and implement those solutions Verifying that the finished product meets the requirements and the needs of customers by conducting usability tests or reviewing customer feedback Prioritizing product backlog items based on business value, time needed to complete, and order in which they were created Communicating with stakeholders to ensure that everyone is on the same page regarding features, functionality, and deadlines Engaging and communicating with both technical and non-technical folks Communicating project status and roadblocks to other team members Working as part of an agile software development team - you’re a creative thinker and skilled communicator who thrives in cross-functional teams Facilitating meetings and preparing presentations to share ideas and findings Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports Measuring results: you define success through clear metrics so the customer can see what works and what doesn’t Qualifications Learning about and applying product and design thinking frameworks to problem-solving and managing the software development lifecycle Working with user research to identify current user experience issues, and driving measurable improvements Translating the HCD research findings and user needs into technical solutions, requirements, and user stories Managing a product backlog (Epics, Features, User Stories) in support of a strategic Product Roadmap Releasing and supporting software systems to healthcare providers All stages of the product development lifecycle - from research through design inception through implementation Organizing/obtaining feedback from stakeholders on completed work Bellese offers Three weeks paid leave Flexible Schedule and Remote-First culture $3000 annual education stipend Work from home setup including Macbook (possibly used/refurbished) Collaborative, learning environment Health insurance 401K Plan with Safe Harbor contribution   Other:  Executive Order requiring COVID safety protocols Bellese employees are Federal Workers and are subject to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, dated September 9, 2021 (published in the Federal Register on September 14, 2021, 86 FR 50985). As condition of employment, employees will need to provide either: a: proof of completed COVID vaccinations OR b: have an approved medical or religious exemption and proof of weekly COVID testing.  U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. The Product Owner is a crucial role on an application development team helping to transform a high-level vision into detailed functional requirements, create product user stories, and accept the completed deliver within a given iteration. That person is the primary contact responsible for ensuring the development team works on the tasks intended to address specific product scope and capabilities. The ideal candidate will have past or current Scrum Master responsibilities and experience with CCaaS; Amazon Connect, Twilio, or others. This is a remote position, must live in the United States.

About the role As an Associate Product Manager you will work join our Product team to help ensure that we are able to continuously build world-class products. Your duties will include analyzing consumer behavior and industry trends, evaluating consumer feedback on our products, and finding solutions for product defects. Location Remote (based in India) What you will do You will closely work with one or more product managers and support them in a variety of product initiatives ranging from market and customer research to product launch and testing You will help prepare project status and risk management reports You will also work on training internal departments on new product features and providing support to customers when needed Prior experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, business management, marketing, or a related field 1-2 years of experience in a similar role would be advantageous Experience in gathering and interpreting qualitative product data and consumer feedback An understanding of product sprints, PRDs and basic technology frameworks Background in Data Analytics is a strong plus Experience designing prototypes in HTML CSS or using platforms such as Figma Qualities that we look for Strong communication skills - including the ability to listen to the needs of others and comprehend complex matters, articulate issues in a clear and concise manner, and present effectively in both oral and written presentations to all levels in the organization. You get stuff done. You have a strong bias to action and will roll your sleeves up and get things done when needed Excellent attention to detail; you believe anything worth doing must be done right Willingness and ability to work independently, think creatively, and ability to pivot depending on changing priorities and deadlines Affinity for a high-performance, fast-paced, and project-oriented work environment You are a self-starter who excels at learning new processes and business functions You are highly analytical and are comfortable working with data

Job Description:In this role, candidate will empower experiences to reach users in a safe, secure, and reliable way, and help users find notifications valuable for meaningful everyday communication across Messenger and Instagram. Candidate will have an unparalleled opportunity to drive engagement by unlocking the three dimensions: what do we prioritize notifying users about, when do we notify them, and how does this deliver value to them. You will be working closely with a fully funded engineering team with dedicated support from XFNs. Top 3 must-have hard skills:Defining vision and strategy for a productExperience going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution.Experience leading a cross-functional team across Engineering, Design, Data Science, and User ResearchGood to have skills:Experience in analyzing complex, large-scale data sets and making decisions based on dataExperience in gathering requirements across diverse areas and users, and converting and developing them into a product solutionStory Behind the Need – Business Group and Key Projects:Notifications of platforms and experience for FB and IG messagingCompelling Story and Candidate Value Proposition:Every day, ~4 Billion thread opens are from notifications. Imagine improving the experience for users and growing engagement by improving relevance and reducing notification sends - huge opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes for users worldwide.Typical Day in the Role:Working on product strategy to align with leadership on new ideasPartnering with Engineering, design and data science to test new hypothesis + solutions, and evaluate outcomesReporting outcomes on experimentsBuilding understand of user expectations through researchHow will performance be measured:Notification platform reliability improves across platformsMore users are open to receiving notifications / users do not turn notifications offUsers find notifications valuable and we see engagement wins based on our iterationsNote:Onsite in Menlo Park, CA - hybrid scheduleThis role is not Marketing related.Are you interested in working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment in one of the most critical products used by billions of people? If this sounds intriguing, then we’d like to talk to you.Messenger and Instagram Messaging are one of the fastest growing apps in the world with billions of people using it every month. Users choose Messenger and Instagram messaging for universal reach and rich ways that users can express themselves. What questions will you ask and solve for?Improve signal from noise: How do we deliver the right notifications at the right time such that users find them valuable and are willing to engage? Can we leverage ML to personalize these for different user segments?PRE 101: How do we win users’ trust by delivering each notification reliability to the device and has consistent and accurate badging?Platform first: How do we scale for 100s of partners to leverage our platform, policies, and governance models to build consistent messaging notification experiences across the family of apps?This team has an amazing track record - they have delivered notifs for Community Messaging which are driving joins to new communities and chats, as well as delivered message routing capabilities enabling us to explore fully featured messaging in Facebook.If this sounds interesting, please DM me to learn more!Pay Range: $90+ hourly  The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.  #LI-AP3

Position Title: Product Management Instructor  Position Type: Contract (January 2024 - May 2024)  Contract Rate: $3,600 per cohort (1 cohort available)  Location: Los Angeles (Hybrid)  Deadline to apply: Friday, December 1, 2023 but will be reviewing apps on a rolling basis!  About America On Tech:   America On Tech is an award-winning, early pipeline technology talent accelerator on a mission to decrease the racial wealth gap by creating pathways for underestimated students to thrive in technology and innovation. To date, we have worked with 3,500+ students by leveraging the time, talent and expertise of software engineers and technology professionals to teach our tuition-free courses and help provide work-based internship and learning programs to promote the advancement of underrepresented students into technology pathways. Founded in 2014, AOT’s work has been featured in Forbes, CNN, The Huffington Post, TechCrunch, BET and other leading publications. AOT has also been awarded by Forbes 30 Under 30, Wells Fargo and the Brooklyn Borough President’s Office.  Who We Are Looking For:   We are currently looking for exciting and engaging   Product Management Instructors to deliver the Product Management sessions of our Tech Flex Leaders program using the AOT Product Management curriculum. The Tech Flex Leaders (TFL) Program is an immersive out-of-school time program for juniors and seniors enrolled in a New York City, Los Angeles, or Miami high school. This program engages students interested in technology through weekly technical training sessions taught by industry experts, intersectional professional development sessions designed to prepare students to confidently pursue degrees and careers in technology, and career days and mentorship opportunities with representatives from leading technology companies.  Technical sessions are held virtually over Zoom and in-person. This is a great opportunity for a career technologist looking to inspire the next generation of technology leaders. Successful candidates are solutions-oriented, data loving, entrepreneurial and passionate about education.  TFL Instructors will report to the Program Director and work closely with the Program Team to ensure high-quality instruction.  Instructor Responsibilities: Attend a 1-hour onboarding session on January 10th from 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM PST Commit to 5 hours/week, including instructional time, optional student office hours, and prep/planning time    1 cohort available      Instruct all sessions of the AOT Product Management curriculum on Thursdays from 4:00 PM - 7:00 PM PST. NOTE: Students are in the session from 4:30 PM - 6:30 PM; The additional time before and after session will be spent syncing with the Program Manager and prepping for the session Student office hour and prep/planning time schedule would be determined with Program Director upon hire Support Program Manager with assessment of student projects and assignments Work with Program Manager and Program Director to discuss curriculum adjustments, as needed Plan engaging activities that complement AOT curriculum and respond to student need Session Dates: All session dates are virtual, unless otherwise noted. Thursday, January 18, 2024 [In-Person] Thursday, January 25, 2024 Thursday, February 1, 2024 Thursday, February 8, 2024 Thursday, February 15, 2024 Thursday, February 22, 2024 Thursday, March 7, 2024 Thursday, March 14, 2024 Thursday, April 4, 2024 Thursday, April 11, 2024 Thursday, April 18, 2024 Thursday, April 25, 2024 Thursday, May 2, 2024 Thursday, May 9, 2024 Thursday, May 16, 2024 Thursday, May 23, 2024 [In-Person] Tuesday, May 28, 2024 [In-Person Graduation] Qualifications: Expertise and/or experience in Product Management Ability to explain Product Management concepts in multiple ways Ability to pivot while facilitating a session Strong communication and facilitation skills with an eye for cultural competency Ability to collaborate and work effectively in a fast-paced team environment Proficiency in Google Suite (especially Google Docs, Google Slides, Google Sheets and Google Classroom) Experience teaching in front of a class of high school students is a PLUS! Education: Relevant Bachelor's Degree All applicants will be considered. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. AOT is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, handicap, age, religion, sexual orientation, or national or ethnic origin.

Product Manager: Associate Manager, New Verticals - Product Strategy & Operations
column7: About the Team New Verticals is an exciting team at DoorDash that is building and scaling new ways to delight our customers, leveraging the DoorDash platform. New Verticals include the DashMart, Convenience, Alcohol, Grocery, and Retail businesses. These categories bring about new challenges and opportunities to build something at DoorDash from the ground up. About the Role You will sit in the Fulfillment, Logistics & Catalog group within our New Verticals Strategy & Operations organization. We are hiring two positions on this team, so you’ll have the opportunity to be considered for both roles at once! You will help shape DoorDash's future inventory and selection strategy across our convenience, grocery, alcohol, and retail businesses as we transition the team to become a Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence-first platform. Your work will impact how merchants think about integrating their inventory to our platform and how consumers explore our inventory selection. You will partner with teams across DoorDash and beyond to build a world-class inventory system that works for all 3 sides of the marketplace (Merchants, Dashers and Customers) and our emerging 4th side (Advertisers). Your work will enable merchants and advertisers to onboard quickly and merchandise effectively, customers to make informed buying decisions with rich merchandising, and Dashers to know exactly what to shop, and where. You’re excited about this opportunity because you will…Build the Future: You will help develop the strategy for groceries/perishables and general retail operations. You will create quarterly and annual plans that push our business forward and are aligned with our product capabilities. You will help these teams identify opportunities for enhancing our existing product offering and methods to improve delivery quality.Collaborate & Influence: Become the voice of innovation! Champion solutions to enhance the user experience. Where a product or operations solution is needed to unlock growth and reduce cost, you will advocate for those resources with your central partners.Analyze: You love working with data and using data to drive business decision-makingLearn: You will be deeply Immersed in our US and International grocery and retail operations, forming a POV on the best path forward on in-store operations and product roadmaps alongside a dynamic high performing team.We’re excited about you because…You solve problems from first principles. You’re excited to think innovatively, and you resist “this is how it’s always been done” thinking.You’re equally comfortable operating at 10,000 feet and 1 foot. You don’t hesitate to get in the weeds and operate at the lowest level of detail, but you’re just as comfortable thinking long-term and inspiring a team.You’re analytical. You’re comfortable building complex SQL queries across multiple data sources and have experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools.You have 4-6+ years of experience. You’ve succeeded in fast-paced cultures (tech, operations, strategy, consulting, banking, or a related experience), and you’ve led teams to achieve audacious goals.About DoorDash At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.   DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more. Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel. Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation. If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection. Compensation The location-specific base salary range for this position is listed below. Compensation in other geographies may vary. Actual compensation within the pay range will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, skills, prior relevant experience, and specific work location. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, base salary is localized according to employee work location. Please discuss your intended work location with your recruiter for more information. DoorDash cares about you and your overall well-being, and that’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package, for full-time employees, that includes healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan including an employer match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellbeing benefits, paid time off, paid parental leave, and several paid holidays, among others. In addition to base salary, the compensation package for this role also includes opportunities for equity grants.     California Pay Range:        $115,000—$155,000 USD        Colorado Pay Range:        $103,500—$139,500 USD        Hawaii Pay Range:        $115,000—$155,000 USD        New Jersey Pay Range:        $115,000—$155,000 USD        New York Pay Range:        $109,000—$148,000 USD

This game changing career will give you the opportunity to be challenged with pricing and actively managing our Medicare Supplement line of business for Physicians Mutual. You will get to initiate, organize, direct and analyze actuarial work. In this role you will develop actuarial assumptions as well as direct, develop and maintain product pricing, profit studies, reserves, rate filings and related procedures. Must be able to compile and evaluate statistical data. Must have advanced understanding of actuarial concepts and insurance knowledge and the ability to apply these concepts to the work. Continues to actively pursue actuarial exams, unless otherwise approved.Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or related discipline. Completion of ASA is required.Ability to apply standard mathematical computations to a variety of assigned work projectsStrong Excel experience for mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, etc.Ability to logically present voluminous data in a concise, understandable formatAbility to perform several projects while maintaining rigid deadlinesAbility to prepare basic financial and statistical reportsDemonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to build, maintain, and upgrade financial models utilizing complex actuarial conceptsFamiliarity and/or comfort with coding required Preferred: Medicare Supplement pricing experienceExperience with running SQL queries.Insurance Industry ExperienceALFA experience.About us:Since our start in 1902, Physicians Mutual Insurance Company has held to our founder’s promise — to provide protection to families when they need it most. In 1970, Physicians Life Insurance Company was founded and became a member of the Physicians Mutual family.  Today, we offer health, life and retirement products to millions of people from all walks of life. We’ve been here for them. Listening. Answering questions. Empowering them with the specialized guidance they need to make confident decisions about their insurance.  Over the years, our dedication to delivering on our promise has helped make us one of the nation’s leading health and life insurance providers. In fact, we are rated in the top 1% of insurance companies. We consistently maintain some of the highest financial strength ratings in the nation from independent insurance analysts, including A.M. Best Company and Weiss Ratings, ensuring we’ll be there for our policyowners and our employees far into the future.But the achievement we’re most proud of? We have a 95% customer approval rating – a true sign of a company dedicated to embodying its vision.     Job Requirements          Category          Corporate Actuarial / Finance          Job Type          Full-time          Travel

Product Manager: HRIS Product Owner - Workday HCM Core/Security
column7: JOB The HRIS Product Owner is fully responsible for the Workday HCM Core/Security module. This position will maximize value addition of the Workday HCM Core/Security module at the City of Dallas. This role is the primary point of contact on behalf of the HRIS Functional Area to identify the Workday product requirements and best practices to align with the City’s needs and requirements as outlined in the City’s Personnel Rules and Administrative Directives.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Serves as the product owner for the assigned areas including, production changes, new Workday feature evaluation and configuration, business process issue resolution, security settings, Workday configuration optimization, and segregation of duties. Manages future road mapping for their functional area in coordination with Workday for the assigned module. Coordinates all aspects of Release testing for their functional area including test case development, release review, release issues resolution, and verification of test results. Supports root cause analysis for functional area issues as well as cross functional and interfacing issues where applicable.Manages ServiceNow Workday tickets as needed.Coordinates Workday functional area changes through Workday Change Control Process and provide approvals as needed.Identifies all business process changes that impact End Users and provide support and guidance to HRIS Management. Coordinates and directs technical staff responsible for configuration management and issue resolution within their Workday functional area.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Knowledge of configuration, management, and support of the HCM Core/Security module.Knowledge of the State of Texas employment laws and City of Dallas local ordinances, laws, and Personnel Rules.Ability to manage multiple high priority projects and tasks.Ability to use sound judgment to make decisions.Ability to interpret and understand the City’s Personnel Rules, Administrative Directives, and other related practices procedures and apply them to the management of the HCM Core/Security module.Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business users in non-technical terms.Ability to translate common business requirement into technical specifications for the HRIS team and/or Workday technical Consultants.Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both verbally and in writing.Ability to analyze problems, identify alternative solutions or propose actions, and implement recommendations.Ability to understand how to measure and drive business value.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Product Manager: Principal Product Marketing Manager, Oracle University and Customer Success Services Digital Office
column7: The individual who fills this role at Oracle will be responsible for creating marketing content for digital learning solutions across the Oracle MyLearn platform, Oracle Guided Learning (Oracle’s Digital Adoption Platform), and other offerings within the Digital Office of Oracle Customer Success Services. Notably, this role includes developing content and collaborating on communications for a new digital success platform to automate our customer and partner cloud journeys. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Communications and Programs, this individual contributor role will develop content for our new innovative services for customer and partner learning and success. Content generation is the core focus of this role, and the individual must be able to create compelling content for each area of the business that resonates with external and internal audiences. Content assets include customer presentations, web pages, marketing campaign assets, customer reference assets, competitive analyses, technical and marketing blog posts, social media posts, white papers, datasheets, and related documents. This individual will support the key marketing priorities for a given time period, effectively providing extensive content development expertise to the next new product introduction or initiative; and be on point to identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. The individual will collaborate across Customer Success Services, Corporate Marketing, Product Management, Delivery, and Executive Management on the development of these global content assets. Strong knowledge of Oracle Services, the Oracle Partner Ecosystem, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Cloud Applications, combined with the ability to generate high impact content assets, are critical for success in this role. This individual must be able to think strategically and execute with extreme attention to detail. A creative, energetic, and enthusiastic person who is self-motivated and can prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment will do well in this role.Development of compelling product marketing content for both new product introductions and existing products and services, which supports sales and marketing campaigns and internal communications Close collaboration with marketing communications, to drive impactful programs that align to business goals Ensuring that product marketing content effectively communicates business and technical value propositions to target personas such as Chief Learning Officers, Change Management Leaders, Chief Digital Officers, Chief Technology Officers, Line of Business Leaders, Partners and more The ability to translate complex, technical materials into dynamic product marketing content that will resonate with organizations and partners worldwide across a multitude of industries Understanding the competitive landscape and incorporating relevant updates into content assets intended for use by both external and internal audiences. Management of content inventory and repositories, keeping assets up to date, retiring content and introducing new content to support new use cases.

If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on. Oracle Database Cloud Services is one of the most popular database cloud services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, with broad adoption across the globe. We seek a dynamic and creative world-class Product Manager with expertise and passion in delivering best-in-class Database Cloud Services, including Exadata Database Service in OCI public cloud and Cloud@Customer, and Base Database Service on VM. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in an area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. You will be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products and services to be released in the future. If you can deliver and lead on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career.Work with customers directly, as well as Oracle Customer Support, Sales and Sales Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns, help deployment of Oracle’s innovative technologies and cloud services by working with customers’ architecture teams, and improve the adoption of best practices Plan and execute product announcements Create product assets using PPT, Word, and video editing software Assists in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations Demonstrate leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, data sheets, brochures, best practices and product presentations Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center Track the PaaS / Database Cloud market landscape, as well as competitive products and features Be creative in solutioning customer problems/requirements. Customer references and stories Evangelize product both internally and externally

Bellese Technologies is looking for someone with a passion for solving big problems in healthcare. We foster a learning environment that thrives on curiosity, innovation, and passion about improving healthcare in America. Our remote-first team is spread across 20+ states and leverages exceptional collaboration to amplify our strengths. We provide an environment focused around helping you achieve your goals. Because when you succeed, we all succeed.  This position is contingent upon contract award Responsibilities Sitting in the customer’s and user’s shoes: you seek to understand and empathize with the users and their goals – their problems are your problems Working with the development team to clarify requirements and help them understand the business side of the product Succinctly communicating or demonstrating issues to your team, and leading the thought process of your team to drive toward feasible, viable, and highly-usable solutions Creating user stories and acceptance criteria that clearly articulate requirements for each feature Translating ideas into actionable, testable solutions, and working with engineering teams to define and implement those solutions Verifying that the finished product meets the requirements and the needs of customers by conducting usability tests or reviewing customer feedback Prioritizing product backlog items based on business value, time needed to complete, and order in which they were created Communicating with stakeholders to ensure that everyone is on the same page regarding features, functionality, and deadlines Engaging and communicating with both technical and non-technical folks Communicating project status and roadblocks to other team members Working as part of an agile software development team - you’re a creative thinker and skilled communicator who thrives in cross-functional teams Facilitating meetings and preparing presentations to share ideas and findings Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports Measuring results: you define success through clear metrics so the customer can see what works and what doesn’t Qualifications Learning about and applying product and design thinking frameworks to problem-solving and managing the software development lifecycle Working with user research to identify current user experience issues, and driving measurable improvements Translating the HCD research findings and user needs into technical solutions, requirements, and user stories Managing a product backlog (Epics, Features, User Stories) in support of a strategic Product Roadmap Releasing and supporting software systems to healthcare providers All stages of the product development lifecycle - from research through design inception through implementation Organizing/obtaining feedback from stakeholders on completed work Bellese offers Three weeks paid leave Flexible Schedule and Remote-First culture $3000 annual education stipend Work from home setup including Macbook (possibly used/refurbished) Collaborative, learning environment Health insurance 401K Plan with Safe Harbor contribution   Other:  Executive Order requiring COVID safety protocols Bellese employees are Federal Workers and are subject to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, dated September 9, 2021 (published in the Federal Register on September 14, 2021, 86 FR 50985). As condition of employment, employees will need to provide either: a: proof of completed COVID vaccinations OR b: have an approved medical or religious exemption and proof of weekly COVID testing.  U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. column7: Connect Assistance es una compañía de tecnología líder en la industria de Asistencia en Carretera y Hogar con presencia en Puerto Rico, Costa Rica, Panamá, Colombia y México. Nuestra misión es resolver problemas ordinarios con soluciones extraordinarias.  Buscamos, para que forme parte de nuestro equipo de trabajo, un(a) profesional que gestione equipos relacionados con el desarrollo del producto, desde su creación hasta que llega a las manos del usuario final. Capaz de crear estrategias para construir productos, supervisar la ejecución de estos productos, y, dar seguimiento a la reacción de los usuarios ante el producto. Principales funciones Encontrar soluciones a los problemas de los usuarios y ejecutar. Influye en ingenieros, diseñadores y otros miembros directos del equipo. Es un colaborador individual, Scrum Product Owner. Gestionar un ciclo de vida completo de lanzamiento y desarrollo de productos por sí mismo. Probablemente recibe supervisión de un Sr. PM o Director PM. Comprender las necesidades del cliente y recopilar los requisitos comerciales para mejorar y desarrollar productos tecnológicos. Gestionar los equipos de trabajo relacionados con el desarrollo del producto, desde su creación hasta que llega a las manos del usuario final. Crear estrategias para construir productos, supervisar la ejecución de estos productos, y, dar seguimiento a la reacción de los usuarios ante el producto. Entre otras funciones del puesto. Conocimientos y experiencia Deseable con conocimientos en la administración de proyectos Deseable conocimientos en programación web Diseño de experiencia de usuario, análisis de datos Al menos 2 años en el puesto, principalmente trabajando con productos de tecnología Educación Grado universitario en Administración de empresas o Ingeniería en Computación, Informática o afín. Habilidades requeridas Liderazgo Capacidad analítica Resolución de problemas Investigación y aprendizaje Enfoque al detalle Capacidad de organización Excelente comunicación verbal y escrita Desarrollo de competencias digitales   Si reúnes los requisitos aplica con nosotros.

Job Description:In this role, candidate will empower experiences to reach users in a safe, secure, and reliable way, and help users find notifications valuable for meaningful everyday communication across Messenger and Instagram. Candidate will have an unparalleled opportunity to drive engagement by unlocking the three dimensions: what do we prioritize notifying users about, when do we notify them, and how does this deliver value to them. You will be working closely with a fully funded engineering team with dedicated support from XFNs. Top 3 must-have hard skills:Defining vision and strategy for a productExperience going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution.Experience leading a cross-functional team across Engineering, Design, Data Science, and User ResearchGood to have skills:Experience in analyzing complex, large-scale data sets and making decisions based on dataExperience in gathering requirements across diverse areas and users, and converting and developing them into a product solutionStory Behind the Need – Business Group and Key Projects:Notifications of platforms and experience for FB and IG messagingCompelling Story and Candidate Value Proposition:Every day, ~4 Billion thread opens are from notifications. Imagine improving the experience for users and growing engagement by improving relevance and reducing notification sends - huge opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes for users worldwide.Typical Day in the Role:Working on product strategy to align with leadership on new ideasPartnering with Engineering, design and data science to test new hypothesis + solutions, and evaluate outcomesReporting outcomes on experimentsBuilding understand of user expectations through researchHow will performance be measured:Notification platform reliability improves across platformsMore users are open to receiving notifications / users do not turn notifications offUsers find notifications valuable and we see engagement wins based on our iterationsNote:Onsite in Menlo Park, CA - hybrid scheduleThis role is not Marketing related.Are you interested in working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment in one of the most critical products used by billions of people? If this sounds intriguing, then we’d like to talk to you.Messenger and Instagram Messaging are one of the fastest growing apps in the world with billions of people using it every month. Users choose Messenger and Instagram messaging for universal reach and rich ways that users can express themselves. What questions will you ask and solve for?Improve signal from noise: How do we deliver the right notifications at the right time such that users find them valuable and are willing to engage? Can we leverage ML to personalize these for different user segments?PRE 101: How do we win users’ trust by delivering each notification reliability to the device and has consistent and accurate badging?Platform first: How do we scale for 100s of partners to leverage our platform, policies, and governance models to build consistent messaging notification experiences across the family of apps?This team has an amazing track record - they have delivered notifs for Community Messaging which are driving joins to new communities and chats, as well as delivered message routing capabilities enabling us to explore fully featured messaging in Facebook.If this sounds interesting, please DM me to learn more!Pay Range: $90+ hourly  The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.  #LI-AP3

Blake Equipment is part of the largest national wholesaler (a division of Headwater Companies www.headwaterco.com ) in the United States, specializing in water equipment components for the residential, commercial, and irrigation systems installed by our customer, the professional contractor. (no homeowners). We are known in our local markets as having quality service, long term quality people, and only representing the top manufacturers in the industry. Headwater Companies is a Division of Franklin Electric, a publicly-traded company on the NASDAQ stock market under the symbol FELE.GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONResponsible for managing the life cycle of water treatment products by overseeing the marketing mix (price, place, promotion, and product). Coordinates pricing strategies to offer a competitive advantage at a profitable margin and meets company sales objectives within the sales category. Implements processes and projects to develop the products and their applications within the market segment.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESWorks with sales representatives and distributors to size products for specific applications, provide product specifications, and develop/assist with custom quotationsWorks with internal and external customers to ensure that products work properly after installation/implementationHelp identify and manage new customer and/or market opportunities by branch to meet local sales growth objectivesAssists internal customers with product information and external customers with application and pricing informationEnsures that promotional programs and tradeshows have the appropriate marketing material and products in order to sell the productAttends and helps to manage other employees attendance for industry trade showsDevelops and manages product-pricing strategies, including special promotionsAnalyzes product costs and profitability and recommends or creates action to improve product marginsRecommends improvements and additions to the existing product lineAssists in preparing catalogs, instruction manuals, and marketing/promotional literatureProviding training for Branches/SalesmenRiding with salesmen to target accountsTravel to locations in need of trainingAssist new customers with installs/ start upsPerforms other related duties as required or assignedJob Type: Full-timePay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceExperience level:3 yearsSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Water treatment: 1 year (Preferred)Engineering: 1 year (Preferred)Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)License/Certification:Driver's License (Required)Willingness to travel:75% (Required)Work Location: On the road

Overview:  Want to "Embody Your True Colors®”? Palm Beach Tan, the industry leader in Sunbed and Sunless Tanning, is looking for you! Starting pay $16 plus commission! Are you passionate about skin care?    Do you thrive off helping people achieve their goals?  If you answered yes, come join our team!  Here are some of the perks we offer:  Flexible Work Schedule (minimum of 16 hours a week) Hourly Base Rate plus Commission Free Tanning, Product and Service Discounts! Employee Rewards & Recognition Program 5 Week Sales, Equipment, Product and Management Training Program Constant Product and Equipment Development Benefits Package Room to Grow! Responsibilities:  This position has a required 5-week manager-training course with performance metrics Maintain store staff by interviewing, hiring, and developing employees Create a positive, respectful environment Meet self-performance metrics and help develop employees to meet their metrics Analyze daily sales information to maximize sales Meet banking, safety, operations and legal requirements Control expenses: labor, inventory and maintenance Assign, manage, and follow up on daily tasks to keep store clean, stocked and organized Provide exceptional customer service and resolve customer issues Other duties as assigned Qualifications:  Preferred 1 year supervisory experience Ability to effectively motivate others Must be able to stand, bend, walk for long periods of time Must be able to lift 25 pounds without assistance Reliable transportation High school diploma, or equivalent Palm Beach Tan is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
